review:
Classic high-fantasy roguelike (in the truest sense of the word: It is Like Rogue) with an immense world, tons of stuff to do, about a billion different builds to try out, and a massive amount of interesting, intricate worldbuilding.

If you enjoy games like Dungeon Crawl Stone Soup, Caves of Qud, and Cataclysm: Dark Days Ahead, you'll find a lot to love in ToME.

review:
Took me a while to get into the style of this game, because some things seem very obtuse. But with some research on guides (and parsing out which are still relevant), and even helpful chat, I began to really see what this game had to offer.
A ton of classes to play, a variety of challenges to choose from, unlocking new races and classes is interesting.

author: {'steamid': '76561198050012381', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1681, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 1253, 'playtime_at_review': 428, 'last_played': 1712006263}
review:
Любителям жанра ОБЯЗАТЕЛЬНО к ознакомлению (много предметов, классов, механик). Есть отличный русификатор. Это игра бесплатная на сайте разработчика (без дополнений, косметики и хранилища) - я решил купить так как зашло.
Рекомендую играть на максимальных доступных настройках сложности (многие говорят, что игра сложная, но если немного разобраться то можно сделать уверенный "имбо билд" хотя опасные моменты всё ещё будут). Однако многие классы и ветки навыков хоть и имеют необычные механики, но очень различны по силе и удобности использования (Но даже, так обычно есть выраженные "+" и "-" в удобности прохождения определённых локаций/квестов).

author: {'steamid': '76561198039708003', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 9455, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9455, 'last_played': 1710607779}
review:
This is the one of the best, if not the best, game of the traditional roguelike genre.

Each game starts with selecting a race and a class. Each race has different stats and racial skills and when you combine with the sheer number of classes, it makes a ton of combinations available for play. 

Furthermore, each class feels and plays unique with surprising amount of depth in variety of skills. 
If anyone wants to try a game of traditional genre, this is THE game.
A note of warning is that it's pretty easy to die and you can lose hours of play from a single mistake but that's in the spirit of roguelike games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198016710762', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 131843, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 1162, 'playtime_at_review': 129658, 'last_played': 1711982646}
review: This game is genius. Tough, not for everyone, that is for sure. You can lose a character, which you've spent nearly 20 hours on, in the blink of an eye, by a few turns of inattention, or simply bad luck. I have died countless times, at all stages of the game. However, the system is genius, there are plenty of satisfying classes, and the early game is very enjoyable. The learning curve of this game is massive, but the initial period of discovery is the best part of the game. ToME is a game which rewards serious attention, if that's your jam. I play it as an alternative to games such as WoW.

author: {'steamid': '76561198095086416', 'num_games_owned': 79, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 9264, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 1215, 'playtime_at_review': 5385, 'last_played': 1711372647}
review:
This is a hard game. It is unforgiving, and won't tell you why you failed. If you're cool with that, have fun. I don't recommend the game because the community follows that mindset, and anything other than "lol ez" will be met with "skill issue" as a response. Like most things in the world, people aren't interested in helping you understand what you're doing wrong, they are only involved in the community to gloat on what they are doing right. If you decide to go against all odds and do it on your own, I guess that's your playstyle and I won't knock it. Just know before you go in that the community is absolutely not there to help you.

Saving all that, I think the game is still enjoyable with mods, but I can't recommend the game. The community is wholly toxic, and the lack of information exchange is to the detriment of new players. In short, it's just textbook gatekeeping. People want to feel good about themselves and need to feel better then others, so they will just revel in your misery instead of help you. I guess it's not so much a problem with the game itself as much as it is that the game relies on exchange of information and ideas, and that is short-circuited by gatekeeping. Take my opinion with a grain of salt, though. If this is something you want to figure out on your own entirely, I'm sure you'll have a great time.

Otherwise, just post your obligatory clown emoji like a good bot and move on.

review:
Update:  This game simply must me run in Administrator mode under Win 11 for stability.

While I love the game I cannot recommend it as after reinstalling on a new system (win 11) the game is unplayable (even without addons) due to random corruptions in the save game file that cause it to not load.  This apparently happens randomly between character levels 8-19.  I used 4 different characters of 4 different race/class combos.  The file appears to corrupt only when you save in a town and not in any specific town.

author: {'steamid': '76561198005857252', 'num_games_owned': 165, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 25316, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 25316, 'last_played': 1698628176}
review: This game is amazing, TONS of classes. TONS of races. Tons of ways to play. Its open world, and you can progress in whatever manner you choose. But just on rails enough, to not get totally lost. Decently big talent trees. It plays like a tactical "Tile Movement", almost D&D dungeon runner. I have over 400 hours in this game, loved every second of it, and hated it. It IS a rogue-like, so you can play with the usual "When you die, lose your character" But you can turn the difficulty to casual, so your character isnt lost, on death. Old style graphics, dont expect some crazy, graphically advanced RPG. It gets addicting very quick. Give it a shot! P.S. The base game goes on sale for under $10. Sooooo worth it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198160715163', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 2226, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 916, 'last_played': 1710561550}
review: I haven't been this absorbed in a video game for a long time. It's got charming music and art, satisfying sound effects and combat, good challenges without being overwhelming, interested and weird creatures. The best things about it, though, are the loot and the race/class combinations and progression system. It's got very satisfying randomized loot with different qualities and fun skills. There's a shit ton of combination of races and classes to try and each class has multiple possible build options. Also you only have access to a handful of choices at the beginning but unlock more as your progress through the game. That creates a sense of anticipation, surprise, and curiosity as you explore and try different things to try to unlock more combinations. It's really a great game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198176964233', 'num_games_owned': 356, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 4538, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4492, 'last_played': 1708592794}
review:
Jamas lo logre pasar, pero por 80 pesos me dio 74 horas de diversión.

A pesar de ser un roguelike tradicional, este se enfoca mas en la construcción de tu personaje y distribuir adecuadamente las habilidades y equipamiento para sobrevivir a las batallas, algunas serán muy fácil, otras te harán pedirle ayuda a Dios para no morir y perder 3 horas de partida.

Lo bueno es que tiene diversas clases y diversas razas, cada una con pros y contras, y algunas muy balanceadas para iniciar.

Sin duda es muy recomendable (NO COMPRE LOS DLC ASI QUE NO TENGO OPINION AL RESPECTO)

author: {'steamid': '76561198113302348', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 53784, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 42, 'playtime_at_review': 47167, 'last_played': 1712065923}
review:
Tales of Maj'Eyal is not your typical Roguelike with a Fantasy setting. This is a game that has the balls to have the classic mage archtype as a locked class from the start to push for engagement with it's world building.
It's an early example of the idiosyncrasies that make this such an absolute gem.

Early on, the class and race combinations and options available are quite limited (although all well capable of achieving a victory), with more options being unlocked with various benchmarks reached, a real nod to the gameplay of the heydays of the 90's and early 00's.

It's not a game that will hold your hand whilst you learn the ropes, but nor is it unfair. Almost every character death a player will experience will be because of something that they could mitigate or have avoided entirely - and considering the genre we're talking about, that's refreshing design.

Finally, there's the sheer variety of options available, far beyond the standard Fantasy Roguelike fare. Yes, you can play a sturdy immovable Dwarf fighter, yes, you can play a stealthy Halfling Thief, but beyond that, there's a wealth of options. A time-travel oriented fighter/archer hybrid? There's a class for that. A freak with a sentient tentacle arm? There's a class for that. An Archmage from a race of giants who cannot use magic? There's an option for that too - and as a mark of how much freedom the game allows, there are recorded winners on the hardest "non unfair" difficulty with that exact class/race combination.

It's an absolute labor of love which still gets updates 12 years after release. It is absolutely worth the time of any fan of Roguelikes.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007379763', 'num_games_owned': 1453, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 90863, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 90399, 'last_played': 1710855196}
review:
テイルズオブ読めないことで有名(?)な名作ローグライク
中盤までは文句無しに面白いので持ってない人はとりあえず無料版をやるべし
個人的には東方から帰ってきた辺りがピーク、終盤は作業すぎてダレる

このゲームはある程度慣れてきたらAddon入れて遊ぶのが基本
他の人のダンプを覗いてみると大抵何かしらのAddonが入ってます
特にパトロールとエスコートはもはやただのの嫌がらせ要素でしかないので
F**k PatrolsやEscorts Enhancedは必須、というかバニラだとやってられません
他にも便利な機能やクラスなどを追加するものがたくさんあるので
スカイリムとかでMOD入れて起動確認してはニヤニヤしてる人種にもおすすめです

Steam版やDLCは一度クリアして物足りなくなったらセール時に購入するぐらいで良いと思います
ちなみに共有倉庫の枠はDLC購入でも増えるので活用したいならお布施推奨
Forbidden Cultsも巷で言われてるほど難易度上昇してる気はしなかったです（当社比）

author: {'steamid': '76561197991737307', 'num_games_owned': 174, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 3727, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2901, 'last_played': 1709601651}
review:
I play this on my steam deck. The combination of the steam deck's controller options and TOME's UI options make playing on the deck a nice experience. 

I got into rougelikes via Caves of Qud. Qud has great controller support. TOME is deep like Qud. I've spent 40hrs just on one character class combo and I still don't know squat but I'm having fun doing it. 

If you like Qud and you don't mind using the mousepad on the deck then I think you will like this game. 

Also getting used to using the mousepad as a major input device on the steam deck opens up a ton more games you can play!

author: {'steamid': '76561199001593148', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 25359, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 1941, 'playtime_at_review': 11674, 'last_played': 1711975621}
review:
今更自分が書くまでもない、まごう事なき名作。
とは言え以前自分はフリー版を1クラスノーマル難度で勝利して置いてたのを
何となくやりたくなり購入して再開。4クラスくらい勝利したかな？

装備やアイテムがザクザク出るので選ぶ楽しみ。
多様なクラスがあり、多様なスキルを習得してどのスキルを組み合わせて強くするかが楽しいビルド。
複数クラスで勝利して初めてプレイフィールが全然違う事を実感。
BGMも良い。グラはキャラアニメこそないもののスキルのグラエフェクトやSEが結構派手。
Zキーで探索楽々。
他の方も書いてるけどハクスラ風味が強いターンベースローグライクです。

種族にはそこまで思い入れないですが、ノーマルで全クラスクリアしてみたいのでまだまだ続けます。

author: {'steamid': '76561198018545343', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 70932, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 70932, 'last_played': 1705586331}
review:
Here is why this game is good:

1 1/2 cups all-purpose flour
3 1/2 teaspoons baking powder
1 teaspoon salt
1 tablespoon white sugar
1 1/4 cups milk
1 egg
3 tablespoons butter, melted

1. In a large bowl, sift together the flour, baking powder, salt and sugar. Make a well in the center and pour in the milk, egg and melted butter; mix until smooth.

2. Heat a lightly oiled griddle or frying pan over medium high heat. Pour or scoop the batter onto the griddle, using approximately 1/4 cup for each pancake. Brown on both sides and serve hot.

author: {'steamid': '76561197996020580', 'num_games_owned': 180, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 3057, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2779, 'last_played': 1705318304}
review:
No, I can't recommend this game. While I've played many roguelikes, RPGs, and Diablo clones, there's something fundamentally wrong with the balance in this game. I've tried different approaches on Nightmare and normal difficulty, encountering vaults and optional bosses that are essentially death traps. It raises the question: why include them at all?

I opted for a melee physical class, but it's frustrating when enemies boast 60% resist all and a whopping 80% resistance to physical damage, with elemental resistances hovering around 60-70%. In most games, resist all is a combined stat, not a unique one. In some cases, I can't even overcome their HP regeneration. The best items I found were only offering +15% ignore physical resistance, while elemental resistances were about 30% on same lv range. Why?. Additionally, why include both armor AND armor hardiness?

Gold doesn't have much utility, as there are no NPCs that can reroll stats on items or provide other useful services. The items available in shops are sparse like one floor loot, and the game could benefit from more variety. If the game finish after defeating the "Master" boss in Dreadfell, it might not be as bad, but the Far East section becomes a tedious slog as enemies scale significantly. While I'm able to take down some orc bosses in castles, random encounters on level 40 and above feel like a death sentence. Kinda kills atmoshpere. Or i manage to kill Corruptor boss in spellblaze. Hard for melee class. And then i touche some tree and this tree boss spawn use some speed abilities or something and kill me in one turn... lol... so who was boss on this level hahah.

The game should perhaps conclude in Dreadfell, and the Far East could be a separate campaign. A 20-30 hour single playthrough for a roguelike is overkill. Some may enjoy abusing game mechanics to lower enemy levels in instances going there on like lv 10, but I find it rather lame. Moreover, why do enemies scale when mobs don't respawn? 

On a positive note, the game offers a wide range of races and classes, and the inclusion of mods (called addons) can significantly enhance the overall experience.

author: {'steamid': '76561198118882505', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 172, 'playtime_forever': 592, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 204, 'last_played': 1705253522}
review: Я боюсь запускать эту игру. Она затягивает, она манит как наркотик, я уже полночи сижу и пытаюсь справится с притяжением. Что это, такое, работа ваще забыта! Я забыл как есть, потому что мне не надо есть в игре, и даже пить, мне надо имбовый лут, много лута и супер билд. Рандом тут пипец беспощадный бывает. Но на волосок от смерти ты пищишь из последних сил, ааа я сделал это и не надо начинать все с самого начала, мои способности спасли мне жизнь. Это как покер, где ты постоянно на волос все проиграть и остаться ни с чем. Ощущение классные. Собирать персонажа, очень приятно, как растишь монстрода на стероидах и приходит мега громила и щиплет тебя как дитя малое, мол хватит играть, зачем ты залез в этот сундук, твар и т.д. Эмоций куча.

review: Took me a few tries to get into it, but since forcing myself to give it a fair shake I think I've found my favorite roguelike since Sil. Though this is a very different game from Sil to put it mildly. I'm really loving the big adventure feel of the game coupled with the build variety thus far. I'm still very early in, but I'm learning a lot and I can't wait to see what else the game has to offer. Hopefully my current halfling shadowblade will be able to see said stuff but I doubt it! Such is the way of roguelikes...

author: {'steamid': '76561198030739027', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 6021, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6021, 'last_played': 1702655497}
review:
超良作
自分がレビューする必要あるのか？

ローグライクの皮をかぶっているが、本質的なゲーム性はハクスラ。
しかも無限に休憩できる関係で損耗の概念がなく、「すべての消費アイテムが揃い、HPMPその他のリソースは全開で、すべてのバフスキルのクールダウンが終わっている」状態で敵とぶつかることになる。シミュレーターかな？
クラスと種族の組み合わせが無限にあるので、ビルドを考えるのが好きな人なら何週も遊べると思う。
自分はビルドを考えるのが好きなタイプではないので一周したら飽きた

author: {'steamid': '76561198082922028', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 35950, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 29368, 'last_played': 1708934018}
review:
Honestly both the best and probably one of the hardest classic rogue-likes I've ever played, having only a few wins under my belt from both the main game and DLC even with almost 500 hours played.

The variety of class/race combos and the different builds and gear you can do/get really give a huge blast of customization that even some non rogue-like games can't match, you can be an ogre that's one of the shield classes that can tote around a two handed weapon along with a shield, a psionic anti-magic warrior that's almost unstoppable with their many elemental shields, a hardy dwarf mage that can turn into a ice elemental, the combinations are almost endless.

That being said it is still a very hard game, you will die dozens if not hundreds of times before your first win, the game takes some learning on what choices you should make, how to fight certain enemies/bosses, and what gear you should prioritize, but once you get a character that can blaze through the tougher stages of the game you really feel that sense of power, at least until you open a late game optional vault and get blasted by a randomized boss enemy 20 levels higher than you, that's always fun.

All in all if you enjoy lots of customization and gear choices, tough encounters, and satisfying progression you will have a great time with this game, just try not to get upset about the early deaths, keep learning from your mistakes and you'll become much smarter in the long run.

author: {'steamid': '76561198002156890', 'num_games_owned': 826, 'num_reviews': 311, 'playtime_forever': 60, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 60, 'last_played': 1704217017}
review:
I'm normally quite fond of roguelike games like this, heavy on the numbers/decisions and low on the graphics- but I think the almost instant death I faced after opening a wrong door after about 90 minutes of game-play with no real explanation of what I did wrong or how to avoid it in the future just put me off. Feels like I may as well flip a coin every 15 mins or so and if I get a heads just restart the game.

I like how you unlock classes/species by finishing quests or finding interesting things, and I do like the turn based combat.

The lore/story is "Deep" but not very interesting, its mostly a rehashed LOTR with a little original D&D stuff. You can't really talk to anyone outside of quest dialog.

I think the attempt at slightly more detailed visuals hurts it more than helps. When you have very low detail graphics like ASCII or low res pixels your imagination has to do a lot of the work with abstracting it, when you have clear but often very empty and un-interactable visuals like this everything just looks empty and may as well be a grid of squares on graph paper.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971236545', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 37623, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 37208, 'last_played': 1704299265}
review:
After 600 hours+ of playing at 100 hours per dollar spent, I can safely say this is one of the best games in my library, especially for the price. 

I'll try to keep it short and sweet:

It's both simple and immeasurably complex. It boils down the best parts of roguelikes, hack and slash RPGs, and dungeon crawlers into a deeply satisfying gameplay loop.
Tons of equipment and items, lots of races and classes to experiment with builds, and a large sprawling world to explore. 

For a game that is so simple looking, the world is also dripping with flavor if you feel like partaking. Either blaze through everything as a bloodthirsty murder hobo, or take your time and read the description of each monster you come across and read the lore pieces scattered around the lands.

If you enjoy roguelikes/lites, you WILL enjoy this one. It's the one I always end up coming back to

author: {'steamid': '76561198099044176', 'num_games_owned': 493, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 6820, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6820, 'last_played': 1676943328}
review:
One of my favorite all time dungeon crawlers, right up there with Stone Soup.

TOME is at it's basics, much less story focused than some other "traditional" rogue likes, and it more focused around combat and experimental builds. You have a plethora of ways to build your character, although there IS a right and wrong way unfortunately.

Once you know the general gist, and read the few story blurbs you'll never read them again but they're still nice touches. 

Overall, it's one of the classics and it's difficult enough you will find yourself coming back to it time and time again.

author: {'steamid': '76561197974740898', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 6404, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5662, 'last_played': 1703722354}
review:
[h2]Tales of Maj'Eyal (ToME) is an excellent roguelike with a significantly easier to use interface than many others in that it has full support for both keyboard and mouse input (and it is often easy to combine these in a way that feels fluid).[/h2]

[h3](Some) Key Features[/h3]
The classes each have sufficient depth to the point that changing classes feels like playing a different game entirely. The difference in available classes and builds means that it is very easy to spend several runs learning the intricacies of each class, gradually progressing further each run.

The interfaces are (mostly) easy to read and have helpful popups for explaining stats and features, though these are sometimes insufficient to fully explain the subtleties of the  mechanics. This is partially offset by one of my favorite features: the integrated chat where players can ask questions and talk about the game. 

The community of players is very helpful and are often willing to provide advice for builds and explanations of more complicated mechanics. This is helped by the ability to easily link stat blocks to the chat for others to see, and your current character can be viewed on the game's website by the other players.

The game is mostly bug free, and most of the bugs I have found are cosmetic (loading screens missing their art images for example) or are related to creating a new character without reloading the game (stats/effects from other characters sometimes seem to follow the new character, leading to things like enemies that were generated for the other character's level). During gameplay the interactions between abilities and the enemies/environments seemed to work without any problems.

[h3]Story[/h3]
The main storyline is decent, but the game's best writing is in the (optional) lore books that can be bought/found throughout the games dungeons and shops. Important details are referenced in your quest  log, and lore unlocks can be easily read from the game menu [spoiler](and can be shared between characters by completing an early-mid game quest)[/spoiler].

[h3]Difficulty[/h3]
The game offers two different difficulty types, the first which governs the power-levels of the enemies (easier, normal, etc.) and the second which governs the number of attempts you have (exploration (infinite lives), adventure (extra lives every few levels), and roguelike (no extra lives)). The default combination is 'normal-adventure', standard difficulty with extra lives (but not infinitely many).

The normal mode of the game is sufficiently difficult to provide a challenge without being overwhelming. On normal, I was able to progress through the first few dungeons on a single life, and each life usually entailed progressing an additional 1-3 dungeons farther than the previous. The primary difficulty is learning how the stats of your equipment plays into the effectiveness of your talents (skills/abilities), and the order in which to prioritize your talents. 

[h3](Potential) Pain Points[/h3]
The largest pain point with the game is that as you progress you will likely lose farther along than before, necessitating a rerun (sometimes many) of the starter dungeons you have already cleared previously. To an extent this is unavoidable (just like the early levels of other roguelikes like NetHack), but it can feel a little dull to have just lost a tense fight with a mid-boss only to spend several minutes speedrunning your build through the early game.

Another potential pain point is the complexity of equipment and comparing different pieces. There are a multitude of immunities, resistances, and damage types in the game, and managing your items to balance your needs for defense and offense simultaneously can be difficult at times. While this complexity adds a lot of customization options and strategic planning (do I use the artifact that gives me resistances or the one that gives me escape powers?) it can be a bit hard to know if your build is a good one or not until you start fighting some enemies and suddenly your previously unstoppable character is being cornered by trash mobs while enemy mages keep you disabled.

[h3]Differences From Other Roguelikes[/h3]
One key difference from other roguelikes (such as ADOM or Caves of Qud) is that your character's development options are largely determined during character creation. There are several ways to unlock certain talent categories while playing, and there are a large number of artifacts which can replicate classes' abilities, however a warrior character cannot unlock all (or even most) of the magic talents, and a mage cannot unlock many physical combat talents.

These limitations make sense in the context of ToME as it helps each class preserve its unique flavor [spoiler](and there is a bonus class that lets you mix and match anyway!)[/spoiler].

One other difference is that there isn't really any sort of 'intrinsics and extrinsics' system (such as that found in NetHack). While there are several side-quests that can provide various talents and stats, there are relatively few ways to gain abilities or immunities that are a part of your character and not obtained through equipment/talents. You cannot (for example) find and eat certain enemies to become fire resistant, or to obtain telepathy.

This also makes sense in ToME as a large part of the gameplay is balancing risk and reward when exploring for gear. Many of the best items are 'artifacts', and many of these have the sort of abilities that would be character intrinsics in another game (e.g. water breathing, elemental resistances, teleportation, etc.). If it were possible to obtain these abilities without equipment, there would be no reason to go fight dangerous enemies for the chance of finding good gear.

[h3]Overall[/h3]
ToME is an excellent roguelike with a (very) large amount of replayability. Its many classes, unlockables, and achievements mean that there is always another goal to set, and the game is still in active development meaning that the number of things to unlock and explore are only growing. I would rate the game a 9/10 in general (only losing points for the occasionally under-explained mechanics/systems), and a 10/10 for the roguelike genre in particular.

I'm not a true fan of the roguelike genre, but this one really reconciliated me with the genre.

Dont go for it if you are looking for beautiful gfx, lets face it its ugly, but its a very robust game and really worth purchasing it over the free version available on the net, as it is still evolving and getting update and very worthwile DLC's.

author: {'steamid': '76561199003946697', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 16645, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 2107, 'playtime_at_review': 9888, 'last_played': 1712272358}
review:
Ah Tales of Maj Eyal...where to even begin...

I suppose that I will start by saying that I probably have put in at least a hundred more hours than what steam shows, as I played this game a lot before I got it on steam with all the expansions. (can't wait for lost land!) I got the game from it's official website, where the base game is available for free. Therefore while I am far from a veteran player, (In fact I will openly admit that I am quite bad) I consider myself well informed enough to write a review. 

With that said, lets start with the basics. Tales of Maj Eyal is a traditional roguelike game, and I consider it to be one of the most polished of modern traditional roguelike games. (modern being as of 2012, or so google tells me.) It takes place in a high fantasy setting with typical Tolkienesk elements, as well as some more modern fantasy ideas, such as time wizards, as well as some steampunk and Lovecraft, if you get the respective expansions. All this combines to make a rich, original high fantasy world with detailed histories and lots of lore. You cane even find some interesting and amusing poems lying around if you look for long enough. While the game has a lot of wonderful lore, the plot itself is not particularly inventive. I'd say spoiler alert, but there isn't a particular lot to spoil. The first half of the game you just spend going around the world investigating exotic and dangerous locations where you fight some baddies, and then for the second half of the game you almost exclusively fight orcs (how terribly inventive) and then take down the evil wizards that were using them as pawns. Yes there are some more details that tie that into the games far more interesting lore, but seriously, I could probably come up with a more interesting plot in fifteen minutes. Now is this really a problem? Not really. People who play play traditional roguelikes, which probably includes you, my reader, aren't really coming here for plot. You're here for strategy and frustrating deaths that make you put an axe through your computer monitor. On that note, let us talk about difficulty.

I have found Tales of Maj Eyal to be a very challenging game, and although ultimately how difficult you find the game can be determine by you and only by you, I'll still discuss what I found difficult about the game, as you may find it insightful. What I have found that makes Tales of Maj Eyal difficult is also related to what I believe to be one of the game's issues, so we shall discuss both here. Tales of Maj Eyal contains an over abundance of trash mobs, which can make a decent amount of combat rather boring (and it is basically just combat, if you were not aware.) Even enemies that it seems should be dangerous, like the elder vampire, which has a description that would make you think you ought to be running for your life aren't much more trouble in my experience than a giant rat or a slime. Enimies only become dangerous when they have the label Unique, Rare, or Randboss (forgive me if I don't have those correct) which can become absurdly dangerous. Allow me to explain. Occasionally, or quite commonly if you are playing on higher difficulties, an enemy has a chance to get some skills from one of the games many classes (more on those later.) They often don't get enough skills to be as powerful as the player, but they can still be deadly, and to the Dev's credit, they can be quite fun to fight. The troubles begin in the fact that certain classes lend themselves to make particularly dangerous enemies. The marauder, for example, is a class that is capable of dealing a lot of damage very quickly, and if they are lucky stunlocking their opponents to the point that they can't really do anything, but if things don't go according to plan their lack of durability shows itself and they are in a bit of a pickle. This makes for a pretty balanced player class, but for a very dangerous enemy. Because the computer is concerned not with it's survival and only with killing you, it will take big risks every time. While the chance of winning as a marauder in a fight by fighting riskily might be only one out of three (terrible odds and they are probably better than that for the player)
Those are very good odds for an enemy, and can become a real problem when you end up fighting quite a number of marauder Uniques, Rares, and Randbosses. Unfortunately, however, it gets even worse. Its possible for these enemies to get skills from multiple classes, to the point that if they are lucky, they can become basically unstoppable. Imagine an enemy with the burst damage of a marauder, the tankiness of a bulwark, and the ranged capabilities of an archer, and you'll be thinking along the right lines. These enemies can hit you from where you can't see, disable you with stuns and similar effects, and then have you dead in a few turns leaving you wondering what you could have possibly done differently. And yes, you probably COULD have done something differently. Tales of Maj Eyal is a strategy game after all, and as a result losing unavoidably is almost theoretically impossible. But all the same, that's hardly justification for what I feel like is bad game design. As a rather unpopular negative review also said, the number of boring enemies can leave you so bored and secure feeling that the one Randboss that has the potential to oneshot you will get under your radar completely undetected because your used to being able to play sloppily and take an excessive number of hits from those bothersome rats and slimes. With that said, onto some good stuff.

What saves Tales of Maj Eyal is the extremely good character building. I'm not going to do the math to figure out how many skills there actually are, but its got to be around two hundred. The game also boasts 29 classes without DLCs and 37 with, as 22 races with dlcs and 16 without. (correct me if I'm wrong on those numbers please) That is INSANE! You'll be hard pressed to find another game with so much character variety. This is what saves Tales of Maj Eyal for me. Making different builds with all that variety is fun and rewarding. I don't mind killing those rats and slimes because it gives me experience which I need to level up and progress with my cool build. And that cool build being good could mean the difference between life and death against those bothersome overpowered Rares, Uniques, and Randbosses. 

Another issue that I would like to touch on is where Tales of Maj Eyal lies on the item to skill spectrum of roguelike games. As the game has so many skills, you can probably already tell that it leans very much that direction. Items rarely ever have activated abilities, there are no one use items, and when they do have activated abilities, they are rarely game changing. As a result, I often wish that Tales of Maj Eyal would do away with items entirely, and focus all of it's attention on skill trees. 
I'm not saying that an item based roguelike can't be good, (I love caves of qud) but Tales of Maj Eyal just doesn't go far enough with it to make it so. In the steampunk expansion (Embers of rage) it even tries to branch out into tinkering, but this feels so weak next to caves of qud's system that I find it almost painful to use. But this is more opinion based than some other issues. I'm happy for you if you can enjoy the tinkering and items :) I Suppose that if you have played many traditional roguelikes you might be thinking: "No single use items?!? What about potions?!?" I'm very glad that the developer decided to not use potions in favor of a far cleaner system that gives you a certain number of slots onto which you can place certain skills called runes and infusions that you find. For example, if I find a shielding rune of the warrior, then I can use it to fill on one of my "inscription slots." (the standard number is three) when I activate it it will give me a force bubble that takes damage instead of my heath bar for a given number of turns.

review:
One of the best character building RPGs I ever played. Storytelling and writing is also excellent. Challenge is diverse and you can get one-shot seemingly randomly, but for the most part I feel it's an exceptional RPG, in a humble package.

Definitely give it a try, and don't let the graphics or simple gameplay deter from an otherwise great game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198141983602', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 43293, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 42748, 'last_played': 1703038594}
review:
ベースはシレントルネコみたいないわゆるターンベースローグライク
消費アイテムがほぼ存在せず、アイテムもクールダウン有のスキルの１つみたいに扱う
基本的には全力でスキルブン回して隠れて休憩の繰り返しで攻略していきます
だから遠くの敵に気付かれたりすると継戦されてスキル回らなくなってつらくなったりする

プレイフィールはなんか三国無双に近いです
雑魚は蹴散らし、たまにチョイ強雑魚にｳﾜｯ!!って思わされるけど結局蹴散らし
そしてつえーユニークエネミーやボスとバチバチにやり合うことになる

ユニークエネミーはプレイヤー側には許されないマルチクラス取得をしやがっているので
たまに撃破不可能なくらいの多重バリア張ってる魔法使いとか出てくる
そういう時は仕方ないまず逃げよう　逃げてもいい
アサシン系ユニークにスロウ･スタン始動から音もなく殺されることもあるけどね

author: {'steamid': '76561199113689496', 'num_games_owned': 101, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 82885, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 78302, 'last_played': 1704639913}
review:
トレハンやキャラクタービルドを何度も「最初から」楽しめるゲーム。

主流のハクスラゲーと同様に装備品は各種性能が自動生成されますが、
戦闘システム面がしっかりと作り込まれていて（結構複雑ですが）、
自分のビルドに合う装備品を探す面白さがしっかりあります。

クラスは多彩（無料版で29、DLCで＋8）でそれぞれが個性的、
ローグライクのため何度もリプレイしても飽きづらい。
つまりビルドを考える楽しみを何度も味わうことができます！

無料版から有料版にセーブデータの引き継ぎが可能なので、まずは無料版から。

author: {'steamid': '76561198034858674', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 54, 'playtime_forever': 7969, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1466, 'last_played': 1703247432}
review:
残機制のローグライクRPG
失敗に対して対策なしで再挑戦してもいい結果はでないという事を学べる
…はずなのに…何で自分は…「運が悪かっただけ、もう一回挑戦すれば突破できるはず！」なんて思ってしまったのだろう…無駄に２回も死んでしまった…ってなるゲーム
序盤のプレイングを覚えて安定してくるとプレイ時間が長くなるので残機が少なくなってきた時の緊張感が半端ない
これまでコツコツ積み上げてきたものが…あっあっあっ
味のあるテキストと壮大なBGMもいい

author: {'steamid': '76561198008621666', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 12739, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 12739, 'last_played': 1678675317}
review:
After dpeg ruined DCSS, ToME became the last big classic roguelike for me. Nethack and ADOM trickled off development and *band kept on splintering, but Darkgod still churns out content to this day. Fans of other classic RLs should be warned that ToME will spoil you with features like autoexplore, autocast, mouse active ability bar, mouse active map, etc., and you will find it difficult to go back to RLs with less UI polish.

Like all good roguelikes, the start is brutally unforgiving and infant mortality is the norm. Once you unlock some of the stronger classes and settle on a build that works for you, though, you can expect to beat at least normal mode every time with perfect play. RNG hits softer than many RLs, since you can manually clear low level areas until you're wearing appropriate gear (or die to [spoiler]overland encounters[/spoiler]). If you really just want to win, there's even [spoiler]an item vault where you can share items between characters[/spoiler].

There is a plot, which is similar in quality to your stoner roommate's homebrew D&D campaigns. For me, the real worldbuilding is done in the item descriptions and lore pages. The "civilized races" are xenophobic and corrupt, and by the end it becomes clear that the player character themselves is just another superpowered mass murderer with an agenda that's been handed to them by politicians. There's an area so disturbing that after you read all the lore there and kill the boss you'll know it was the disturbing area I mentioned. Make no mistake, this is a grimdark setting.

If anyone asked me where to get into classic roguelikes, I'd point them straight at ToME.

author: {'steamid': '76561198250297878', 'num_games_owned': 521, 'num_reviews': 59, 'playtime_forever': 1382, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 742, 'last_played': 1702021850}

author: {'steamid': '76561197989363390', 'num_games_owned': 284, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 28966, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 28966, 'last_played': 1701824607}
review:
ToME practically defines the roguelike genre for me. Two dozen classes that all play differently, various difficulty modes, complex character building and itemization, and extensive mod support. In development for 25 years, and perfected during that time.

What other game can you fracture reality into multiple timelines, explore each timeline for a couple minutes, and then pick which one you want to inhabit? Or tether yourself to multiple points in space simultaneously, being yanked between them instantaneously, sending out explosions from the ripping edges of reality. Or participate in the furry hivemind. Or invade a person's mind and give them nightmares that come to life, having them fight their own hallucinations and hurt themselves in the process. Or feed on hatred and disease to power magic spells. Or hack away at people with steampunk circular saws.

Oh, and if you die, it is broadcast to the global chat. As if permadeath in a 25-hour campaign also needed a layer of public humiliation.

If you want, you can also visit the website for the game and try the base version for free without buying it on steam. There's already enough content without DLCs to keep you occupied for 200 hours - it did for me.

author: {'steamid': '76561198054271628', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 658, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 658, 'last_played': 1545586187}
review:
TOME is objectively my all-time favorite game:  I've logged more hours* in this game than any other -- even more than DIablo II or the Elder Scrolls games.

Subjectively, this is also my all-time favorite:  I keep coming back to TOME because the diverse races & class combinations makes each character feels like a completely different play experience.  No other game I've played has had as much replayability, and still feel fresh.  On top of that, the developer is always tweaking/improving the game and reworking existing classes; so even the same class may play very differently with a major release.

If you enjoy the base game, I highly recommend getting all the DLCs!

* I've played far more days than what's on Steam because I usually play the standalone versions.

author: {'steamid': '76561199010042150', 'num_games_owned': 3874, 'num_reviews': 2454, 'playtime_forever': 402, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 401, 'last_played': 1706879206}
review:
I am 32 years old.

My ex-wife and I have a daughter together, and we adopted our son together. Both are now 4 years old.

When we were going through our separation, I felt lost and unhappy. I was self-destructive. One day, I was so angry with everything spiraling out of control that I punched a concrete wall in a moment of overwhelming emotion. This resulted in breaking my fifth metacarpal in my right hand—the hand I worked with, played games with, and used to carry my children to bed—the hand I desperately needed to ensure I could continue providing.

Upon learning the severity of the self-inflicted damage, I became almost suicidal. Keep in mind that just a few months before this, I was the happiest man, with no history of depression or anxiety. I had never experienced anger outbursts, nor was I the type to break down and cry, but I was in a tough situation that truly prevented me from seeing the light on the other side.

With nothing better to do, I looked for a game I could play WITH ONE HAND while recovering. Somehow, I stumbled upon this game and read some of the comments. I decided it was worth a try... I must admit I didn't beat the game, nor did I play as much as some of you. In fact, I may have played this game for only a day or two. That being said, after doing so, I had a new joy and hope for life. I managed to leave behind the pain and suffering that had been thrust upon me. I could experience the joy and happiness of other people. I relaxed for 5 ♥♥♥♥ minutes listening to this music, long enough to realize that I would be okay.

After realizing this, I turned off the game and went back to work. My hand hurt a lot, but I was motivated. I stopped feeling so sorry for myself and became the father I needed to be at that moment, not the weak boy I was behaving like.

Today, I am close friends with the mother of my children. We don't fight, argue, or say hurtful things to each other. We are parents and friends.

Now I have 3 children. My third child is, wait, ALSO 4 YEARS OLD. The woman I am with was going through a very similar situation at the time of my separation, and we just unexpectedly stumbled into each other's lives. We have been dating for a year and are very happy together.

Moral of the story: you never know what life has in store for you, and if I had given up when all odds were against me, I wouldn't be where I am today. This silly little game helped me realize that.

Thank you.

author: {'steamid': '76561197980483267', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 81, 'playtime_forever': 1159, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 75, 'last_played': 1704016441}
review:
My actual account has 30 hours more than this Steam review says.

Very solid roguelike rpg. Very light on story, very heavy on combat and looting (loot is similar to ARPGs like Diablo).

Pretty impressive for a 3 man project. The game is actually free on the website (see Steam store page for details) and after dropping 30 hours on the game I decided to buy all the dlc since it's a fun, although frustrating game (because it's pretty hard).

I play on Nightmare Adventurer mode and haven't won a run yet :x

There's not really any modern games out there to compare it to, since it's an oldschool roguelike. So if I had to explain what it plays like, it's a turn-based DnD style roguelike rpg where combat is very heavy on cooldown-based abilities, and you only control one character.

You will die though. You will die a lot. Also fudge the Dark Crypt, that place is rough. lol

author: {'steamid': '76561198848065037', 'num_games_owned': 108, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 6510, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6378, 'last_played': 1700831987}
review:
经典roguelike里最现代的那一个，如果受不了adom，cdda，nethack这种老东西，那就来玩tome4（或者以撒？）
自定义图形界面，按键手势控制，完全汉化，支持创意工坊，角色数据云存储，可选难度，甚至可以公屏聊天，用户友好这一块拉满了。
相比传统roguelike的大量模拟属性，tome4更简单也更纯粹，游戏流程基本是“我不知道我是谁，也不知道我在哪，我只知道我要大开杀戒”，绝大多数时间都在战斗——升级——调整bd中循环，rogue？什么rogue，我是纯良rpg。愿意探索的话也有新职业新种族新支线之类的隐藏要素作为回报。
战斗过程非常直接，不需要侦察技能，没有黑箱怪物，只要右键查看就能看到怪物所有属性和技能，剩下的只有纯粹的走位和技能策略，好处是身为同步回合制游戏却有即时游戏一样的快节奏和攻防快感，坏处是没有很多另辟蹊径的操作余地，像经典crpg或者nethack那样利用各种道具地形事先准备杀死敌人还能写个小作文的情况绝少出现，但是快死了仔细想想还有什么技能能用然后翻盘的快乐是存在的。另外在战斗间隙，没有全局的体力限制，没有多场战斗的续航要求，没有花里胡哨的消耗品，只要把眼前这一战打赢，就永远是完全体，强烈推荐强迫症玩家游玩。
剧情基本靠各种收集到的文本，愿意看的话，什么克苏鲁、神圣的卡拉链接着我们、蒸汽朋克、古典复仇剧、泳装福利回、种族战争、教派斗争乱七八糟的要素也能看个乐呵。
人物build，这位更是重量级。一局十几个小时的删档rpg怎么让人玩下去？因为17个种族+48种职业+六大属性+数十种大小系技能组+通用技能组+觉醒技+纹身符文和可替换道具+特殊装备词条。复杂的人物bd带来的是持续的新鲜感，很多时候一局打完也没玩明白某个职业，有经验的话看看技能组就能大致规划发展路线，但是实际玩起来总会想着也许那样更好，然后慢慢调整成你想要的样子。比如影舞者职业，可以潜行强度拉满，突然现身全伤害暴击打满一套再走进拐角进入潜行；也可以学习法术，大范围致盲眩晕，召唤分身双重打击。比如被诅咒者，可以拉满抗性，层层buff，双持光剑，站撸一切；也可以依靠多件装备的主动技能快速叠满恐惧debuff，配合特殊词条精神伤害触发高伤技能每回合打出一串精神伤害。这些bd不是平衡的，但是通关主线没有问题，因为游戏对数值并没有卡得很死，装备虽然有随机数值但强度更多来源于思路和选择，与暗黑2那种数值的精妙取舍差别较大。
这么多bd当然也是有同质化现象的，坦克类近战打起来都像是贴buff然后rua脸，法爷都像是一发大火球没打死就传送走，看起来各种各样的实现过程，打出来的效果却很像，也许这些职业的乐趣在于读技能吧，在庞大的基数下，部分同质化也是可以接受的。
技能设计是bd乐趣的重要来源，时空守卫有一个大招，重复接下来的若干回合三次，结束后选择其中一种世界线；熵教徒可以将自己必死的命运转嫁给敌人，受到致命伤害时让目标即死；苦痛者一条手臂变成触手，还能控制可以加点穿装备设置ai的分身；蒸汽系职业可以制作装备插件和药剂；毁灭使者可以变身大恶魔将目标拉入独立空间单挑；末日使者可以召唤影子用来移形换位抵抗死亡护卫友军；夺心魔可以控制小怪，连boss都能控制几回合。这些只是冰山一角，一百个小时连种族职业都没解锁完，已解锁的有一大半碰都没碰过，噩梦比基尼一命挑战也没打过，仅仅是皮毛就足以支持数十小时的游戏时间。
总结一下就是，极致堆料，快节奏，高度rpg化，但是高度精简系统的同步回合制roguelike，快餐、现代、写不了小作文，但好玩。

author: {'steamid': '76561198000697176', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 7647, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6965, 'last_played': 1704563791}
review:
Great game that keeps me coming back to fail (in a good way). Loads of build variety and rich lore throughout the game. The only negative for me is the static overworld and progression order. You are constantly following the exact same path, making the exact same choices, etc... and the mid-game areas are tough enough that you end up repeating the early game so many times that it gets a bit stale.

Beyond that, though, the game is a blast. Plenty of race/class combos, loads of skilling options, fun gear to find, different factions to support, and a difficult journey to conquer. Satisfying to play once you make it past the initial learning curve and learn to avoid vaults :-)

review:

This is easily one of the best roguelike games I've ever played, and it's creator has a brilliant passion on making the game even better, so many years after release. I wish there were more who could experience the exhilaration of finally succeeding against all odds to win your first run

Play this game!

author: {'steamid': '76561197981012144', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 60422, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 60422, 'last_played': 1696598633}
review:
The Diablo 2 of Roguelikes. Lots of different classes with their own distinct playstyles, resources and mechanics that change the way you approach and experience the game, leading to practically infinite replayability. 

Dedicated dev that has developed, supported and updated the game for more than a decade and added even more content and options to it with the DLC expansions.

Game interface that can be controlled by both mouse and keyboard with ease, fully configurable and rebindable keys and shortcuts.

Easy of use QOL features and streamlined systems makes the tactical combat the focus of the game, akin to a turn-based  ARPG.

Helpful community with lots of information and in-depth discussion across sites, forums, wikis and the in-game chat.

Serious contender for a "game that you would take to a desert island".

On a personal note, the sheer amount of options and mechanics (since each class is almost a different game in itself, plus the long campaign run length) leads to a feeling  of being overwhelmed, so I mostly play in spurts once or twice a year. But thats on me, and if anything this is more of a positive than a negative. 

All I know is that whenever I play another roguelike or think of getting  into an ARPG I'm reminded of this game and that I could be dedicating more time to it, learning more about its mechanics and trying different classes, and all other similar games feel lesser or lacking.

This, to me, makes ToME objectively the best roguelike ever made, and one of the best games ever made, without a shadow of a doubt.

But if you are in doubt, the full base game is  freely available on the dev's site, and that alone can net you hundreds of hours of playtime, enough for anyone  to make their own judgement.

author: {'steamid': '76561197960368623', 'num_games_owned': 522, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 852, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 410, 'last_played': 1700179155}
review:
This seems very overlooked a lot of the time so I'm starting the review with it: the graphical style may give you early 2000's vibe, YOU'LL GET USED TO IT AND START TO LOVE IT, I SWEAR. I have a beast of a computer and besides indie games I also play AAA games on ultra, a real dude football bro into games type, and trust me if you don't want to try this purely because of how it looks YOU WILL regret it massively. Don't be like me and put it off for years for that.

I have put it in a lot of hours into the "demo" (aka the basegame you can download for free on the dev's website), do it! In no time you'll come back to steam and buy everything here just to support the lovely dev.

Go try it. No hat, like the kids say.

author: {'steamid': '76561198330343684', 'num_games_owned': 25, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 833, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 644, 'last_played': 1710100715}
review:
Игра для тех, кто готов ею жить. Учитывая многообразие классов, я представляю себе откуда берутся обзорщики с 1000+ часами.
Но мне не понравилось. Я будто играю диаблоид и бездумно зачищаю кучу мобов, только чтобы добраться до босса и получить некоторый вызов... ну или наткнуться на скрытого босса два раза выше лвл и с позором убежать. Все... сюжетов, квестов, ничего нет. Гринд и прокачка. Ни слова больше!
Тут бы я должен сказать, как каждый третий ревьювер, что играл в какой-нибудь ADOM и там-то все как надо! Не, и знать о нем не знаю. Моим ответным примером будет UnderRail. Не могу сказать что он лучше, обе игры уникальные в своем плане, но Подземка мне зашла куда больше. Вдумчивые пошаговые сражения 1 против толпы. Битв куда меньше количеством, но они куда более тактические и менее рандомные. Кроме спама скиллов сильно решает позиционирование, освещение, звуки, ловушки... Ну и сюжет есть... В общем рекомендую кто желает немного более вдумчивой боевки

author: {'steamid': '76561198005439390', 'num_games_owned': 989, 'num_reviews': 1265, 'playtime_forever': 1563, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 347, 'last_played': 1700599849}
review:
Definitely one of the best rogue-likes I have played. Easily worth the asking price. You can download the free version from the developers website if you want to try before you buy. Unlike most modern games, Tales of Maj'Eyal actually lets you make male & female characters, which is good, because I like women to have representation.

I would like it if health bars appeared over scenery, rather than underneath it, because often you cannot see them clearly.

author: {'steamid': '76561198059153416', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 19374, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 18998, 'last_played': 1710881364}
review:
A gem of the traditional roguelike genre and one of the best there is. Standing besides classics like Caves of Qud, Dungeon Crawl Stone Soup, ADOM, or Cogmind.

ToMEs key aspects consist in:
- [b]Tactical fighting [/b]
- [b]Skill tree progression [/b]
(with so, so many spells and possible hotkey fillers; mouse gestures are bindable and in my opinion recommended for relaxed gameplay)
- [b]Fine-tuning [/b] (by gear stats and order of level-ups, zones, ...) 

Achievement Hunting is fun when you do not aim for perfection and the manifold of classes and abilities provide for a sheer endless blast.
The story and worldbuilding are also great - and optional with lore scrolls enhancing immersion and often times containing clues for what's awaiting you at the end of those corridors.

Information for beginners:
Most players consider the insane difficulty as the main difficulty to play on. If you begin, start out on normal, but aim for nightmare. Fodder enemies will get less and interesting fights requiring strategic action will spice up your game - there the fun really starts.
The graphics might deter you when beginning, but it'll grow on you ("acquired taste", isn't it?).

Finally, ToME is really cheap even though the developer (DarkGod) deserves way more!
I also recommend the DLCs (but only if you have played a bit - they add some brutal enemies into the main game that are not to be recommended for beginners) - especially Forbidden Cults, but that's just personal preference as all are absolutely worth their money.

It's not for everybody, but if you get used to it, you'll propably really enjoy it!
It's a lot of !Fun!

author: {'steamid': '76561198168968716', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 270, 'playtime_forever': 1477, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1477, 'last_played': 1691416770}
review:
戦闘重視のハクスラ系古典ローグライク。ストーリーというか世界観はかなりきっちり固まっていて、読み物としては面白いが、ゲームプレイ中はひたすらダンジョンに潜って敵をぶち殺がしていくだけ、それ以外にやることのないゲームである。昨今ローグライクRPGと組み合わされることの多い生活シム、サバイバル要素は皆無なので、そういうのに期待を持つ人は注意が必要だ。
　運が悪いとラスボスより強力な敵がゲーム中盤に脈絡なく登場したりするので、初回プレイ中はずっと「今後アレより強い敵が出てくるのかよ…」と戦々恐々しながら進める破目になった。そんな心配は杞憂だったが。Lv.98全耐性170%のエモライスエルダーヴァンパイアなんて代物をLv.31のプレイヤーにぶつけるんじゃねぇ。
　日本語訳はかなりしっかりしていて、昨今流行りの学生のレポート文みたいな味気ない直訳ではなく、昭和の邦訳小説を髣髴とさせる妙味に溢れた文章となっている。外語をたんなる「変換（コンバート）」ではなく、自分流に噛み砕いて「出力（エンコード）」できる力量を持った翻訳者を掴まえることは、開発者にとっては僥倖である。
　Moddingが非常に面倒臭い、ソースを読んで根本の仕様（コードの書き方）とシステムを完全に理解してからでないと手がつけられないので、プレイ中にちょっとアイテムを一つか二つ追加してみようか、などという甘えた気持ちで微改造できるような代物ではない。開発者と同程度の知識量を求められるのは勿論のこと、「ToME一本あれば一生遊べるぜ！」と言える程度の愛情と熱量が必要だ。ベセスダゲーのMod程度ならハナクソほじりながらでも作れる、程度の腕前では裸足で逃げる破目になる。
　シングルプレイゲームでオンライン接続とコミュニティとの情報共有前提というのも、リーダーボードに関心のない自分にはちょっとわからない文化だ。
　凄いゲームだとは思うが、自分が求める種類の聖杯ではなかった。

author: {'steamid': '76561198059669570', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 2522, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2522, 'last_played': 1696451172}
review:
超古典的なローグライク
いいか、超古典的なローグライクだぞ。
もう一度言うぞ　超　古　典　的　な　ロ　ー　グ　ラ　イ　ク　だからな。
そういえば忘れてたから言うぞ。　超古典的なローグライクだぞ。

といっても原初のあれやこれからすれば割とマイルド。
死ねるんすか？ｗｗｗｗｗｗｗｗｗおっほｗｗｗｗｗｗ

とはいえ超古典的なローグライクに慣れ親しんだ人なら楽しめるだろうが、現状のローグライトに慣れ親しんだ人からすれば　

めんどくさい　アクション要素なし　当然の権利の耐性

おーまいがー。　ゴミみたいな仕様だなおい。
倉庫すら最初は使えねえぞ　変愚ですらそんなことねーよ！！
だがこれでしか楽しめない要素もある。　日本語だしな！グラフィックあるしな！超偉い

無駄に多いクラス　やったらとクソばっかり増えるスキル　ゲロクソ長い説明　どーなってんだこのゴミ。
だがついてこれるやつだけついて来いと言わんばかりのエリート向けゲーム。

君がエリートなら無限にできるよ。一生遊べる保証する。

エリートかもしれない？　安いし買え。

author: {'steamid': '76561198043445073', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 741, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 741, 'last_played': 1697491837}
review:
An high entry curve oriented around a world of surprise one-shots with permanent death make it difficult to get into. Most classes and races are locked at start, though it is a simple affair to unlock them with an addon. Purchased campaigns do not appear to be playable without unlocking them though, which is pretty sus.
After you get into the swing of things, unfortunately you will find the classes play pretty same-y, even between runs, and that there isn't really any story present beyond some snippets of setting-building you find as drops around the world. The game appears to be quite long, which would normally be a great thing, except for that initial point where the difficulty curve seems to wildly swing between a snooze fest of easy encounters punctuated by a surprise one-shot that you are left wondering how you were supposed to counter. This means you will spend a ton of time repeating the same early content over and over again with the same classes that offer no variation between runs, and little substantial between one another despite superficial differences.

That kind of superficiality seems endemic to the design, where effort to penetrate artificial inaccessibility masquerades as depth. From the builds through to the story, the game seems wide but not especially deep, and I felt like I spent all my time jumping through hoops. This will appeal to some players, but for players with a large backlog of good games to play, it will feel like a waste of time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198148610631', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 7866, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2795, 'last_played': 1703089606}
review:
Jeden z najlepszych klasycznych roguelike'ów w jakie grałem. A mam na swoim koncie praktycznie większość klasyków oraz indyków.

Uprzedzam przed bardzo wysokim poziomem trudności, z którym jak już się zmierzycie to poczujecie prawdziwą frajdę z nauki mechanik gry.

Plusy:
+ Mnóstwo klas których archetyp się różni znacząco od siebie
+ Mnóstwo ras
+ Świetnie zbalansowana gra
+ Itemizacja na najwyższym poziomie, przedmioty są ciekawe oraz ich statystyki kreatywne
+ Mnóstwo buildów
+ Ciekawe zadania i lore
+ Gra na setki godzin

Minusy:
- trudna
- muzyka
- oprawa graficzna
- learning curve

review: Old school feel and pretty open character builder with plenty of homebrew options in the form of workshop mods. If you can get past the old school graphics there is a SERIOUSLY solid game in here. I cannot recommend this hidden gem enough. Some things aren't so intuitive but make sure you go through you settings (I set my sharpness from 0-3 for instance) and keybinds. The auto explore (Z) is a godsend.

author: {'steamid': '76561198114002620', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 4475, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4475, 'last_played': 1695636032}
review:
Disclaimer: My time played shows as 74 but that's not actual gameplay time, most of that is from simply leaving the game on in the background while I do other things IRL and while asleep, I only bothered playing the game for a few hours.

One thing I really don't like about this community is how they will form little 'cliques' then begin verbally attacking/harassing/bullying new members in the community, for no reason...

While I was trying to get into the base game before I decide to buy the DLC I went on their Discord to ask some questions, then I noticed one member in their 'Tarven' channel actually getting verbally attacked and ganged up on by 5 or 10 (if not more) different members in the Discord server after they started a lie about him, claiming "he hates women", that he's a "misogynyst" and "doesn't think women are people" when that wasn't true at all from what the guy was saying (the guy was just basically saying he spends some of his free time learning about women and their needs to improve his success with them over other guys and not get dumped by the girl like what eventually happens in many if not most relationships). One member even pointed out that this guy they're constantly insulting didn't even say anything bad or hateful. 

But because the people in this community are so extremely hateful and miserable, seemingly jealous of the guy, they decided to go with their little lie about the poor guy and run with it as their justification for essentially cyberbullying the guy for over an hour straight and the guy never even said anything hateful or disrespectful to any of them or anyone period, didn't even really acknowledge any of the people throwing insults at him for no reason yet they continued to do it unprovoked for over an hour straight! 

This community is infested with angry, miserable 4Chan trolls.

Moderators were talking right there as this was happening in the chat and my direct messages to the owner/admin of this game on the Discord server, 'DarkGod', went ignored for many days even though he showed up in the server multiple times. Yet they have a rule on their Discord about being respectful and "be nice" but actually do nothing when people form little cliques to gang up on others taking turns insulting a member for no reason. So this community has 'moderators' who ignore cyberbullying taking place in front of them and the owner/admin of the game as a whole doesn't care to read his direct messages on the Discord if you try to contact him about serious issues like this going on in the community. 

This owner/admin named 'DarkGod' clearly cares very little about members of his community. Not going to put my money and time into a game ran by such careless 'staff' who will ignore a guy doing nothing wrong getting picked on and cyberbullied for no good reason, allowing so many evil, miserable, hateful people to do and say what they like to anyone with no consequence. Oh and it looks like their 'moderators' in this community play favorites too - one of the members said a guy in the Discord server can't be banned, the same guy I watched ping the moderators to try and get the guy they were ganging up on for no reason banned, which obviously never happened, which confirms that they were ganging up on someone and cyberbullying them for no good reason and lying on him.

On the bright side, all of those Discord members that were engaging in the cyberbullying of the guy doing or saying nothing wrong were reported directly to Discord. 

Just makes me sick to my stomach to be around so many evil people like that in this community, it is nearly the same as 4Chan seeing how hateful and miserable people are in this community, some of them even saying they do something called "hate read" (lol) not worth my time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198425462345', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 129, 'playtime_forever': 9496, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7624, 'last_played': 1698129667}
review: Much more a diablo2 style build focused RPG than a roguelike really, but still a lot of fun, at least prior to the final third of the  game where some of the dungeons run much too long in a tedious manner and the balance is completely whack (chances are if you made it that far, you're going to roflstomp the next 10 hours). Some of the design with time magic, possession and so on is extremely creative and interesting. I'd recommend, just treat clearing Dreadfell as the end of the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198050750646', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 5894, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3026, 'last_played': 1708014733}
review:
Z 키 꼭 눌러가며 진행하셈.

처음 1시간 해보고 진짜 뭐 이딴 개 쓰레기 게임이 다 있나 하고 1년가까이 봉인해뒀었는데,

이번 명절때 Z 눌러서 자동진행으로 시원시원하게 진행하고, 

전투에 집중하면서 하니까 이번 명절내내  밥먹고 이게임만 하고 있음......

그래픽이랑 시스템이 존나 단순해 보여서 그렇지 하면 할수록 미친 깊이에 

오히려 버거울 지경임

내가 롤 이후에 이렇게 미친듯이 빠져서 한 게임이 있나 싶을 정도로 빠져서 하는 중.

세일할때 닥치고 사뒀다가 심심할때마다 한 두번씩 도전하다 보면

나처럼 갑자기 미친듯이 빠져드는 순간이 올거임.

진짜 강추함

author: {'steamid': '76561198096664491', 'num_games_owned': 154, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 6133, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2805, 'last_played': 1706800011}
review:
Великолепный традиционный рогалик с множеством классов, типов врагов и локаций. По традиции есть бесконечное подземелье. Так же имеются две сюжетки. Карты в них уже готовые, а подземелья генерируются, но по заданному типу. 
По поводу врагов - не знаю, так положено ли или это особенности и видение разработчика, но есть мобы которые буквально неубиваемы твоим билдом (А может быть и любым другим). У них просто хил больше получаемого урона, хотя раньше с этим проблем не было. А еще, на сюжетной карте на любой локации нас услужливо встречает табличка рекомендуемого уровня. Она пиздит. Я пришел на локацию якобы 15-25 уровня на 28м и меня вежливо встретили мобы ~33го уровня, угостив после приветствия пиздюлями. 
Еще нередко просто вымораживает количество дебафов которые десятки врагов одновременно на тебя насылают. Может, конечно, я неправильно качаюсь ввиду того что буквально лишь слегка окунулся в этот жанр, но довольно часто ты просто ловишь глыбу льда лицом, становишься этой самой глыбой от рядового подсоса, одного из двадцати на локации, затем пока ты стоишь в анимении глядя на происходящее вокруг, толпу крипов распихивает босс и дает по тебе ульту, что снимает 2.5 полоски твоих хп иии... твое приключение окончено. 
Конечно, это рогалик, тут так надо, но что-то как-то кажется не честно. Но я терплю. Играю на исследовании, по паре сотен смертей за каточку, но я терплю. Потому что мир интересный, прокачка интересная. Но вот лут.
Система лута просто ужасная. В игре есть легендарки, которые, как я понимаю, прописаны разработчиком, потому что встречал их на разных персонажах и они не отличались, а вот весь остальной лут - чудеса генерации, и уже пройдя обучающие локации, по завершению уровня у вас будет 20 типов разного эквипа, и в каждой варежке, в каждом носке, в каждой кепке будет по 2-20 разных модификаторов, баффов, дебаффов, спеллов, влияния на навыки, на сопротивления, на пробивания, на скорость, на дамаг, на все в этом чудном мире. Поиграв часов 20 я уже просто забил хуй на это дело и стал выбирать исключительно среди легендарок. Грусть правда в том, что легендарки нередко хуже сгенерированного шмота по понятным причинам. Но да хуй с ним.
В общем, рекомендую и одновременно отговариваю.

author: {'steamid': '76561198453338784', 'num_games_owned': 121, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 552, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 404, 'last_played': 1699830798}

author: {'steamid': '76561198052300749', 'num_games_owned': 190, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 9307, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9006, 'last_played': 1699925693}
review:
Я долго думал, а стоит ли вообще писать обзор на эту игру, но в итоге все-таки решил сесть и попробовать обобщить свои мысли о ней. Мне было интересно смогу ли я достаточно кратко объяснить, что конкретно мне в Tales of Maj'Eyal нравится и не нравится, и стоит ли садиться в нее играть более чем через 10 лет после ее выхода.

Как и любой рогалик ToME рассчитан на то, что вы будете много… ОЧЕНЬ МНОГО умирать, анализировать свои ошибки, и начинать заново с полученными знаниями и умениями. Так же реиграбельности способствует просто огромное количество разных рас и классов, которые обладают уникальными механиками и играются совершенно по-разному. Для того, чтобы полностью освоиться с одним классом может понадобиться недельки две достаточно плотной игры по вечерам после работы. И это я скорее преуменьшаю, так как в игре огромное количество артефактов и сетовых вещей, которые могут серьезно влиять на ваш билд, и далеко не все из них вы увидите во время своих первых нескольких десятков попыток игру пройти. А без хорошего билда вы игру не пройдете даже на нормальной сложности. Потому что противники тут…

Да… противники… скажем так: они могут все тоже самое, что и вы! Видите вражеского саммонера или некроманта? Готовьтесь к тому, что уже на следующем ходу он призовет толпу своих подопечных на подмогу. Вы играете за класс, который обладает какими-то сложными механиками с кучей условий, но при их выполнении ваншотит врага? Ну, в следующий раз, когда сдохните так и не успев понять от чего именно, задумайтесь о том, чтобы перед боем внимательно посмотреть, какими классами обладает монстр… да, вы правильно поняли… элитные противники ТОЖЕ имеют уровни в классах, как и ваш персонаж. И пользоваться способностями этих классов они будут не стесняясь. И порой сочетания этих классов настолько убийственны, что вы даже понять не успеваете, что произошло, как уже видите экран смерти.

Казалось бы, все это должно делать игру очень интересной. Однако есть одно «Но!», и оно относится к продолжительности компании. Для рогалика, в котором нормально умирать, игра ОЧЕНЬ долгая. И чем дальше ты проходишь, тем более муторной она становится, потому что противники, как было сказано выше, тут очень опасные, и чем дальше, тем они опаснее. Тут нормально умереть просто расслабив булки и забыв об осторожности буквально на пару минут. И если ты умер где-то в начале компании, то это не так страшно, хотя по десятому разу проходить одни и те же подземелья все-таки задалбывает. А вот если ты умер часу на 20, потому что тебе попался очень неудачно зароллившийся элитный противник или ты случайно сунулся не туда, то от такого просто опускаются руки. Чтобы было понятно, представьте себе, что эта игры – Dark Souls от мира рогаликов, но костров тут нет. Вы бы были рады после смерти в DS начинать всю игру заново? А если это произошло из-за того, что вы случайно перекатились в какую-то яму почти под самый конец игры? Вот игра в ToME вызывает примерно такие ощущения.

Чтобы первый раз полностью пройти игру одним классом у меня ушло часов 70. После этого я ее удалил и не возвращался к ней еще несколько лет. Не так давно я ее проходил снова, и под конец делал это уже на чистом упрямстве. Сколько раз мои персонажи подыхали почти в самом конце компании я даже вспоминать не хочу. Именно в конце, даже при полной прокачке и хорошем билде, умереть проще всего. Я много раз думал бросить эти попытки и снести игру, но ослиное упрямство не давало этого сделать. Я хотел ее победить! И я победил!

После всех этих мучений мне бы хотелось сказать, что больше я ToME не хочу видеть до конца своих дней, но даже несмотря на все перечисленные выше претензии, сказать этого я не могу. Потому что знаю, что вернусь в нее после длительного отдыха, чтобы попробовать какой-нибудь другой класс, найти какую-то новую комбинацию способностей и шмоток и снова ее победить… возможно даже на более высокой сложности. Поэтому рекомендовать ToME я могу только людям с огромным количеством свободного времени и... мазохистам.

author: {'steamid': '76561198019811053', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 40069, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 926, 'playtime_at_review': 37564, 'last_played': 1712176795}
review: This is by far one of the best Roguelikes I have ever played. The game allows you to play like you want with all of the different difficulties and modes the game has to offer. There are a load of classes and races you can play, most needing to be unlocked first. No other game Roguelike game comes close in my opinion.

author: {'steamid': '76561198276634938', 'num_games_owned': 10153, 'num_reviews': 1500, 'playtime_forever': 1964, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1959, 'last_played': 1702528724}
review:
最经典，也是最容易入门的的roguelike之一。
永久死亡，随机关卡，回合制是roguelike最明显的特征，在埋藏在更深的则是由于系统的复杂度带来@的几乎无限的自由。这种自由的感觉是任何所谓3A（包括辐射系列，老滚系列，GTA系列等）都无法带来的。
另外roguelike中辅助玩家的自动探索、自动拾取功能也是足够优秀的发明。

而ToME4则是在roguelike游戏中极为偏重战斗&画面&剧情的RPG，种类繁多的职业&装备，各种奇葩build。

引用开发者DarkGod的话：“roguelike的伟大之处在于，你经常要思考“下一回合我就要死了，我现在必须做什么”。之后你可以停下想五分钟，你的下一步是什么。你可能会死，但你也可能会找到一个自己没记得的奇怪能力、或是一种聪明的方式来使用某种物品之类的。你成功拯救了自己的生命，然后想道：“我好强！”。”

author: {'steamid': '76561198066273990', 'num_games_owned': 152, 'num_reviews': 87, 'playtime_forever': 7493, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 791, 'playtime_at_review': 5729, 'last_played': 1712257712}
review:
If you're looking for a rougelike game that doesn't have an impossibly steep learning curve like Nethack, and isn't annoyingly repetitive as Angband (or one of its successors such as the original TOME), but still a rougelike at heart, then this game is for you. It doesn't have the kind of meta-humor that Nethack has, but it's a decent RPG in its own right.

While you have game modes that allow you to have multiple lives, if you are a rougelike fan then it's recommended to play at Rougelike difficulty, but there are easier modes for more causal players.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025205528', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 29141, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 29141, 'last_played': 1605927562}
review:
I first played this about 12 years ago back when it was ASCII graphics and I've watched DarkGod work on this beautiful game for about half my life. I hold the belief that Indie developers make the best games because having a single complete vision is the most important part of making a game and DarkGod has certainly contributed to that belief. 

The skill trees take me back to Diablo 2 and the feeling of growing in power but also in flavor. Designing inside the limitations of a turn based square grid has allowed DarkGod to come up with some IMPRESSIVELY creative skills.  Skills that REALLY color the story of the class you're playing in ways that just seem too perfect to put into words. The years DarkGod has put into the game really shine when you look at the impressive list of classes in the game.

A few of my favorite things:
-A spell that makes a save point, you play through 3 different timelines and then choose the one you want to be the real one.
-A spell that takes any damage you receive and smears it over the next 3 turns, potentially giving you critical time to escape and outheal what would have been a fatal blow.
-A Difficulty curve that goes all the way up if you want to. I browse some of the Insane/Roguelike winners just to see what crazy shit they cooked up to beat the game.
-You know that scene in Ratatouille where the food critic takes a bite and is suddenly a child again? That's this game but for the Necromancer class in Diablo 2. DarkGod just nails it. The feel is perfect.
-Oozemancer, make slimes, split up, lurk through your goo and spit phlegm at your enemies until they're dead.
-Solipsist, Nothing exists outside of your mind and if you believe that enough, you can make it true.
-So you wanna play a wizard ay? What kind? Ice? Fire? Lightning? Stone? Arcane? Time? DarkGod has a skilltree for that and you will spend hours thinking about the best way to magically destroy your enemies. Do you want flames to burn the entire screen in every direction as far as the eye can see? Bet. Do you want to encase yourself in a brick wall while an earthquake breaks everyone's ankles? Go for it. Meteors, blizzards, thunderstorms, firestorms, tornadoes, tentacles. DarkGod has skillfully painted the scene. 
-Summon Demons
-Be a dragon
-Be a paladin that turns evil
-Be a paladin that turns into the SUN
-Be a 5 foot stack of worms...yeah really.
-Replace your arms with buzzsaws and rain gore.

I could go on but seriously I can't recommend this game enough. Just get the damn thing already.
10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198093539582', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 11740, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11740, 'last_played': 1694175173}
review: Let me start by saying this is one of the best game ever made. That being said...gosh I hate this game so much. It literally keep me coming back after hours upon hours of failed and restart from the beginning. This is an role playing games at it's core and it did not even use make up of fancy graphics and stuff. This is the purest game of how rogue lite game should be. That being said...I still hate this game so much. I keep dying and trying and I decided to make peace today. I've decided to write this review as my final tribute and uninstall this game for the sake of my sanity. Believe me, if i have all the time in the world, I will play this game indefinitely. This game has one of the best character progression that I've ever experienced in years of my playing role playing games and I've tried from Diablo to Remnant, from Elden Ring to Torchlight and countless more. This game will leave you frustrated and consumed so much of your life. My wife, kids, parents, colleague workers hate me know since I keep doing the number crunching in my daily life even when I am not playing this game ? Where did I ran wrong the last time ? What could have been done to avoid the untimely death of my characters ? Wish I knew. I choose to give up. I've choose to live my life to the full potential now. But you don't have to. You can choose this game and stay with it and I wish you luck to finish this game. Like i said, the best game in history.
