author: {'steamid': '76561198007358859', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 5545, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5451, 'last_played': 1693814566}
review:
The complexity and creativity of the classes are insane ... in a good way. Play as a gravity and time warping Paradoxmage, a tri-wielding telephatic Mindslayer or as the coolest Necromancer class i have ever seen. I only scratched the surface, haven't unlocked all classes yet - but from what i've seen and played so far: making builds and min-maxing equipment is a blast.

Only negative, besides the low-budget nature of games like this, early game can srcew you in very frustrating ways - you can run into insane OP enemies out of nowhere. (if you make it past that into mid game, you can absolutetly obliterate almost anything)

There is a very good wiki, whitout that you will have a hard time in unraveling the inner workings of this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198202157038', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 798, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 798, 'last_played': 1693029869}
review:
You're the village idiot.
All the monsters in every battle will have abilities equal to or superior to yours... and some levels higher.
And all the time, you fight against gangs with 3 or more monsters... with the same amount of ability as yours. You act once, they act thrice (one each)
The game has a very interesting and good depth. Lots of customization and evolutions.
But every battle being extremely difficult (even when using infinite lives) makes it unpleasant.


Você é o idiota do vilarejo.
Todos os monstros de todos os combates vao ter habilidade iguais ou superioras as suas.. e alguns niveis a mais.
E o tempo todo você luta contra gangues com 3 ou mais monstros.. com o mesmo tanto de habilidade sua.
O jogo tem uma profundidade muito interessante e muito boa.
Mas todo combate ser extremamente dificil (mesmo usando numero de vidas infinitas) faz com que ele seja desagravel.

author: {'steamid': '76561198070283906', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 4828, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2782, 'last_played': 1694377144}
review: It's fine and for $6.99 you'll get your money's worth, but it's not great.  It's not a sandbox or truly open world.  The options aren't terribly different and replay is so-so (restarting at level 1 to replay all the same boring levels gets old).  Items are not terribly interesting.  The lore and writing are awful.  Stats are so complex that they are the true focus of the game (melee damage depends on physical power, weapon power, opponent's armor, armor hardiness, armor penetration, resistances, RNG).   If you're the type that likes to comb forums to seek out the optimum build to squeak out another 2% damage then you might like it.  Also it's nice to support indie developers and it's only $6.99.

author: {'steamid': '76561198060303605', 'num_games_owned': 272, 'num_reviews': 103, 'playtime_forever': 4728, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3739, 'last_played': 1693558475}
review:
I've completed my first run so I feel like I can review it now even though there's TONS of replay potential.

I think this game is truly special. A hidden and very underappreciated gem in a genre I've never really played before (the true roguelike) and it enthralled me for about a week upon starting. This game has some of the best creativity I've ever seen in an RPG and the fact that I can play incredibly unique classes, both conceptually and mechanically is why this game is amazing to me. This game was released in 2012 and the dev is still making expansions, easily allowing hundreds of hours of runs to be completed. I'm sure I'll play this game for years to come and I still have so much of just the base game to experiment with let alone the current DLCs. I think this game isn't for everyone and I wasn't even sure it was for me but I think it's one of the best games I've ever played. It isn't perfect and I do have minor complaints, usually about UI or QoL and the length of a run becoming a little dulling after a higher number of hours but 8/10 is a well deserved score to me. Excellent game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198884403894', 'num_games_owned': 104, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 3798, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3646, 'last_played': 1706618211}

author: {'steamid': '76561198063864650', 'num_games_owned': 137, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 2385, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 597, 'last_played': 1692405946}
review:
Short version:
Buy? Yes!
Good: Gameplay; Lore; Progression; almost everything!
Bad: Sound; Visuals 



This is a really great game with lots of additional potential. After playing the free version for an evening, I decided to purchase the collector´s edition (non-discounted). 

I can confidently say that the purchase was worth it, even with only ~15hours into the game. 

However, you should be aware this is more of a niche product, both in terms of mechanics (going Roguelike is unforegiving, but not unfair so far). And in terms of "visuals". 

Currently, my main request for improvement would be the sound. Maybe it is just a bug, but there is basically no ambience (foot steps, enemies, ...). There are some door and death sounds, but it feels a bit like a game on mute. The music is okay, but I prefer to run my own ambient playlist in the background.
For immersion, even stock sounds would do wonders.

The art is basic, but does its job. It would be great to have some tile rework done at some point to touch up a few things.

All in all, I think it is well worth getting it even for the full price. With the small improvements it could even be fantastic.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993770823', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 15981, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 15981, 'last_played': 1424286928}

author: {'steamid': '76561198020729018', 'num_games_owned': 804, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 16707, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3562, 'last_played': 1702067464}
review:
TL;DR - Excellent affordable dungeon crawler with tons of options.  Difficult?  Yes, but you can turn it down.  Beatable?  Yes, but it'll take awhile.  Will you lose characters?  Yes, but each one brings you further (usually) and it is rewarding to see my effort yielding results.

Longer Review:

How did I miss this hidden gem?  I honestly wasn't looking for a game like this, but it brought back memories of an old PC game and for $7 I didn't consider it a big loss even if it sucked.  Well, it did suck!  It sucked me in so hard that I'm super addicted!  This is a build up your character from scratch kinda game with more build options than you'd expect from a $7 game.  It is hard and unforgiving.  You can't save scum because the game autosaves as soon as you die.  You do have options to get more lives and there are items in game that can resurrect you as well.  The campaigns are long, but not arduous and gathering loot is always a blast.

A huge plus is that you can play the game for free from the developer's website if you think it might not be for you.  After 60 hours, I've had at least 5 characters die and each time I learn more about the game and progress further.  I have since purchased all of the DLC because it has been a wonderful gaming experience for me.  It brings back the memories of when games were actually difficult, didn't hold your hand, and left you feeling victorious when you finally conquered it.  Admittedly, I still haven't conquered it, but I keep getting further and getting past whatever killed me previously is always satisfying!

author: {'steamid': '76561197993514745', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 75, 'playtime_forever': 812, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 264, 'last_played': 1692137019}

author: {'steamid': '76561198007250987', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 2477, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2382, 'last_played': 1691234932}
review:
Set a spell to autocast when enemies are visible
Enemies appear
Shield does not cast
I guess I joined a friendly TF2 server by accident and those were all hoovies or something



All jokes needless hassle that things like autocast solve (ie making a build around buffing yourself) makes the combat extremely frustrating, why would I not cast a buff that takes almost no resources to cast and 0% of my turn use?
Too much of the game boils down to leveling only passive abilities (since you always get the benefit) vs hotkey management so that you can just go 12345678 + ctrl12345678 + alt12345678 before a fight to have all your buffs up. You could just play a character who has almost minimal active ability usage but that invalidates a lot of the more interesting combos you could pull off, just level passives and pseudo passives and have 1-2 things you actually want to use.

It can be fun but intentional annoyances like not being able to have spells that trigger as soon as a fight starts ruins too much of the balance, it becomes a game of "Do I want to win" vs "Do I really have to do all this uselss busywork before a fight", then you die because your forgot that among your 50 abilities is an everything proof shield that just came off cooldown and got lost in the noise.

author: {'steamid': '76561198144628781', 'num_games_owned': 171, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 6061, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5974, 'last_played': 1690765572}
review:
It's basically turn-based Diablo, but without post-game content. Instead, you replay the campaign on higher difficulties and experiment with race and class combinations or the nearly infinite build possibilities. 

You can play as the same race + class multiple times and have each playthrough feel wildly different depending on how you spend your skill points and which weapons and armors drop for you. 

Additionally, a lot of the races and classes are locked initially. I recommend unlocking them naturally instead of using mods to unlock all of them instantly. It's lot more fun to unlock everything and experiment with what you have than it is to just have everything available right from the get-go.

Oh, and like all traditional rougelikes, this game is balls to the wall hard. It took me over 100 hours to beat it on normal mode for the first time, and even then I was using one of the easiest characters possible at the time (Dwarf Cursed). Your build is also a secondary difficulty slider, something like a Cornac Rouge or an Ogre Arcane Blade is going to be a lot more difficult than a Shalore Necromancer or a Dwarf Cursed.

author: {'steamid': '76561198065794456', 'num_games_owned': 300, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 1927, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 2, 'playtime_at_review': 1685, 'last_played': 1711747868}
review: Massive RPG with so many options for build-crafting. Basically a whole several year long DnD campaign laid out for you to play with tons of options and freedom.

author: {'steamid': '76561198029055397', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 31473, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 26106, 'last_played': 1708252225}
review:
Finally beat the game!  Only took me 430 hours and hundreds of attempts.  I do it normal difficulty, rogue-like: only one life.  There were a few times when I thought I was cheated, but for the most part, every death was a bad choice and so I was ever-motivated to try again.  And again.  And again.

You need to do the dungeons in the right order, lest you bite off more than you can chew, and you need to carefully plan your talents to be the most efficient.  Unbelievably satisfying to finally win.  And I still wanna do it all over again with new character classes, etc.

Montotonous for some people because the world map and the missions are the same.  But it's a "comfort game" for me.  I watch Netflix or YouTube on one monitor, while I go through dungeons on the other monitor.

author: {'steamid': '76561198136966886', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 9749, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3254, 'last_played': 1706031928}
review: Methodical, thoughtful, satisfying gameplay which appears to reward game knowledge. I feel like I've barely scratched the surface.

author: {'steamid': '76561198218960857', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 4408, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2604, 'last_played': 1703189501}
review:
Po 43 godzinach mogę w końcu skomentować ten rewelacyjny tytuł :)

Tales of Maj'Eyal zakupiłem ostatnio na steam summer sale i jednym słowem... Było warto!
Gra (podstawka) jest dostępna za DARMO ze strony producenta, więc każdy może ją przetestować. 
Gra typu klasyczny rogal. Jeden z moich ulubionych. Wielki świat do zwiedzania, mnogość ras, klas, umiejętności i tony sprzętu do zdobywania. Dla fanów statystyk będzie to niezły kąsek bo jest tego mnóstwo.
Na szczęście początkujący gracze też będą zadowoleni bo można wybrać "uproszczone" statystyki, więc nie powinni być przerażeni. 
Rasy i klasy odblokowujemy z czasem, wykonując questy. Każda rasa/klasa ma swoje unikalne bonusy ect.
Rewelacyjny tutorial wbudowany w grze, sprawia, że szybko łapiemy co i jak.
Grafika bardzo przyjemna, interfejs obsługuje myszkę, więc można grać jedną ręką :)
Świetna, klimatyczna muzyka.
Lokacje tworzone proceduralnie, szeroki wachlarz przeciwników sprawia, że gra się za każdym razem inaczej.
ToME jest chyba pierwszą grą, która ma prawie 1800 !!! osiągnięć na Steam :D
Jeżeli drogi graczu martwisz się tym, że permaDeath nie jest dla ciebie to w grze można wybrać między Rouglike a adventure mode (możemy albo mieć daną ilość zgonów w grze i RIP albo odradzać się i tracić exp, złoto ect)
Gra ma rewelacyjne community (chat zaimplementowany  grze! )
Sam twórca gry "nawiedza" graczy i od czasu do czasu "odpala" eventy :D Eventy dla danej rozgrywki możemy kupić za prawdziwą gotówkę w samej grze. Daje ona nowe lokacje dla wszystkich grających w danej chwili!
Warto kupić grę i wspomóc twórców gry bo...warto :)
Jest to la mnie topka z takimi tytułami jak dungeonmaster, FTL, Slay the spire, DCSS.
Gorąco polecam i powtarzam raz jeszcze. Grę można (bez expansion packów) pobrać za darmo i przetestować. Sama podstawa gry jest obszerna i daje setki godzin frajdy.

author: {'steamid': '76561197984034656', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 225, 'playtime_forever': 7, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7, 'last_played': 1450905063}

author: {'steamid': '76561198308535290', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 4726, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4686, 'last_played': 1690162538}
review:
Great game
- A lot of the fun comes from switching from class to class and discovering their talent sets; there are a lot of options in term of play style for each one, so this is quite advanced in term of customisation.
- I wish more RNG were involved in generating the world map; having to do the same-ish road to catch-up after you die can become somewhat bland.
- I suggest defaulting to auto-explore in-between combats, it feel much better to move around this way.
Overall, definitely worth playing

review:
Complex but entertaining Roguelike. Very detailed in its intricacies and well-supported in the workshop.  Strongly suggest using the 'use all classes without unlocking' workshop item so you can tailor exactly what character you want for your playstyle.

Best comparison: Cataclysm: Dark Days Ahead, only in a Swords&Sorcery world with a better tileset.

author: {'steamid': '76561198002536159', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 10130, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9694, 'last_played': 1709479610}
review: Best roguelike game, has a high replay value and longevity, played for years and still able to have fun

author: {'steamid': '76561198119222924', 'num_games_owned': 781, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 25791, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 25309, 'last_played': 1689695148}
review:
One of my biggest surprises in roguelikes and also one I regret not getting into earlier.

The game is so lore rich, has so much diversity in builds and playthroughs and has so many fun mechanics that take some time to get used to that really adds to its replayability. 

It's my second time getting back in this game, after playing 400 hours of it the first time, that I can say we keep coming back for more, especially because of all the updates and changes that have been going over a decade.

Give it a try, try to learn the mechanics and it'll give you tons of hours and guarantee that even after hundreds of hours, there is still more to find out, experiment and have fun with.

author: {'steamid': '76561197983763092', 'num_games_owned': 1299, 'num_reviews': 68, 'playtime_forever': 2798, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2203, 'last_played': 1689616804}
review: Took me ages to finally get around to playing this game as it's been out for years, but I sure am happy that I did.  This is a great roguelike, and is focused almost entirely around your character build and combat.  There are quests, towns to visit for shopping and a home base you can set up, but the vast majority of your time will be spent fighting, collecting loot and tweaking your character build.  Fortunately there is a ton of races and classes in the game, most of which are unlocked through in game challenges or accomplishments.  This gives you plenty of reasons to do multiple playthroughs, along with higher difficulties.  They have a ton of different playstyles so you're bound to find at least a few that fits your preference.  Overall, it's a great roguelike, highly recommended.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007287696', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 2319, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 200, 'last_played': 1709085890}
review:
EDIT: I now have 33 hours and feel comfortable saying that this game does what it attempts to do perfectly. Its not trying to give you a deep story, though there is cool lore. What its offering is the ability to play one of many classes, with most of them having to be unlocked by achieving things with said unlocked classes. It offers a challenge, I had an adventurer die at level one early on. I have not made it past level 13 even though I had a very good build. 

There is deep strategy in how you rank up your adventurer. But at its heart it is a rouge with permadeath plus skilled based progression and loot. Not too much loot though so you dont have to check for better gear every 5 minutes. 

I have only played for 3 hours so far but this game is a lot of fun. It reminds me of a much better version of that mobile game that was popular a couple years ago. The one where you pick one of three classes and see how far down you can get in the dungeon. It was a rougelike with permadeath. 

Anyway to this game. The presentation is charming but thats it, yet the systems are very advanced. The class system is awesome. There is tons of equipment, different enemies and its challenging. My first run was with 10 lives but now I am going to play the way this game is meant to be played. I will update my review as I play more. 

But GET THIS GAME NOW FOR ONLY 2.99 ON SALE. LITERALLY LESS THAN A COFFEE NOWADAYS - its full price now and more than worth it

author: {'steamid': '76561198024475400', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 36823, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 21683, 'last_played': 1710623297}
review:
I've been friends with the author of ToME for about 20 years (we were coworkers). He kept talking about his game, but for some reason I never tested it. Well in fact I tested the old version, before it was known as Maj'Eyal, and did not like it much. Too complicated. 

For some reason I decided to have a go at it again recently and boy, I should have done it much sooner (or maybe not, given the amount of time sunk into it). 

This is a completely different game from what I tested 15 years ago. A difficult, complex but intensely rewarding game. Probably one of the best games I've ever played, and the best roguelike for sure. 

The writing is excellent, and there are many story surprises you will discover. The  gameplay is complex, rewarding, easy to understand but hard to master. There are more classes than you'll be able to play. The game is very well thought out, with everything done to make your life easier, and all the annoying stuff of roguelike (like trips to the shop to sell your inventory) cleverly taken care of in a lore explainable way. 

ToME is difficult. Took me a few tries (10? 15?) to win on normal,  More than I can count to win on nightmare, and I never won on insane. But I enjoyed every minute of it. 

A note, it works well on steam deck. You will have to tweak the controls and bindings a bit to make it playable, but once you have found your perfect setting,  it will be almost easier to play on the deck than on desktop.

To conclude, I have to add that the most notable thing about tome is that it is the work of love of one man, that does it out of love and not to get rich. Personnally, I think he is a genius, and he deserves all the appreciation you can give him, and all your donations. Give him, and ToME, some love. You won't regret it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198129637290', 'num_games_owned': 215, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 1695, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1656, 'last_played': 1693959256}

review:

I only wish there were more sub-classes to choose from, like the currently playable sub-classes [spoiler]Technomancer and Avatar of a distant Star.[/spoiler]

Besides my minor gripes with the game, this game is fantastic, highly recommend it if you love fantasy roguelikes!

author: {'steamid': '76561198114331792', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 2839, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1707, 'last_played': 1704109842}
review:
It's just one of the best games ever. One of the most accessible *real* roguelikes thanks to it's nice graphics, snappy combat and control scheme. Genuinely well written, intriguing, epic and sometimes funny lore. Really fun classes that feel very different from each other. Constant updates. Big updates. 

It's got everything I want from the genre. 

I probably had a hundred or so hours in the free version too, and am just getting into it again on steam.
If you aren't sure go to te4 and get the full, free game. Hopefully you'll get addicted like me and want to buy the steam version too - darklord deserves our money.

author: {'steamid': '76561198020728932', 'num_games_owned': 675, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 56148, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 48300, 'last_played': 1707184947}
review: What the heck can I say about ToME? I've been playing it since high school and I still dig into it for entire afternoons sometimes. My play time, some of which but not a majority is no doubt idol time, speaks for itself. This is one of the Roguelike greats. The lore and world are interesting and well fleshed out and the character building and dungeon crawling is singular. That said, it's going to kill you a lot and you won't always understand why. The amount of disgusted rage Alt+F4's I've done because I turned a corner and died (a phrase that ToME has made a constant in my vernacular) are impossible to count.  It's not necessarily for the faint of heart but Tales of Maj'Eyal's an amazing game and still incredibly well supported, both by its very dedicated dev and its wonderful fanbase.

author: {'steamid': '76561198101069275', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 5089, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1156, 'last_played': 1707881327}
review:
EDIT: ok 71 hours played, 70 in the past week. Yeah. This is the real deal. I am so so invested in every character I play. like emotionally painstakingly intertwined. Their final death is a major blow to my psyche. The lore is rich. There are soooooo many powers (talents) and traits to invest in. This game is such a labor of love and I love every minute of it. 

Give it a chance. I bought this game about 9 years ago and never put more than 30 minutes into it. Now, I played a whole 6 hour life and thought, meh. Then I tried a new class and found the experience very different. I do think it lacks sparkle and world building that other roguelikes have, but to compare it to CoQ would not be appropriate. yes it might be a bit generic, but the mechanics are fun and interesting, and what flavor it does have, however overdone, is authentic. 7.5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198034803690', 'num_games_owned': 277, 'num_reviews': 74, 'playtime_forever': 5878, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1244, 'last_played': 1702696370}
review:
I went from 60 minutes on Tales of Maj'Eyal to 20 hours within like 3 days, even though I owned it for a couple years I never really gave it a good try til now.
Tome is a huge game, but it also has some nice QoL, you can set abilities to automatically activate (there's a lot of abilities in Tome.) It also has a lives system instead of just ending your entire run as soon as you die, earning extra lives upon reaching higher character level and obtaining super rare items.
Each run can get you more things to try later, you don't just start with every race and class available from the start, and even some you don't have every skill-tree from the start.

The only thing I could wish for is more customization over when and how abilities are automatically used.

author: {'steamid': '76561198055562818', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 350, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 326, 'last_played': 1695887584}

author: {'steamid': '76561198122306721', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 11282, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7303, 'last_played': 1709342285}
review:
[h1]神が作ったゲーム[/h1]

2023年になってもまだまだ更新される伝説のゲーム。今から始めても数100時間遊べるという点で非常におすすめ。2D 、ターン制、グリッドベースという本来の意味でのローグライクです。意外とストーリーの背景がしっかり作りこんであるのもすごい。

後半に入るとビルドが仕上がってきて強いアイテムもたくさん落ちるので、ライフを減らしながらでもとにかくレベルを上げて[spoiler]マスター[/spoiler]や[spoiler] ゴルバグ[/spoiler]を倒すあたりまで進めてほしい。最終的にはプレイヤーの技量じゃなくて完成したビルドのパワーで押しつぶしていく感じになってハックアンドスラッシュしててとても楽しい。

スキルツリーによるキャラ育成が注目されるゲームだけど、個人的にアイテム関連も評価されるべきだと思う。「クラフト素材集め作業」じゃなくて、敵がちゃんと強い装備を落とすゲームです。アイテムの供給はちょっと過剰気味（Modでフィルターかけれるんだったかな）、でも本当に欲しいものは滅多にでない、その中からシナジーのある装備を選んでいく。そういう遊び方ができる貴重な一本。

author: {'steamid': '76561197992579587', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 10793, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1263, 'last_played': 1699154124}
review:
I've played ToME since the letters in the name meant something different.

 ToME is the 'traditional' roguelike I still play the most frequently, all these years later.

Years ago when I first dove into the roguelike scene, I would have said ADOM was the best traditional roguelike out there, but that title is easily held by ToME now. ADOM is still the great game it was back then, but the changes to ToME over the years have been steadily raising the bar past anything ADOM, DC;SS, DoomRL, Brogue, CoQ, etc have to offer.

If you only play one roguelike, make it ToME. Possibly the first traditional roguelike to include progression via unlockable content, and there's quite a bit to unlock and play around with. Tons of procedural content along with immense amounts of lore to discover make this a game for the ages.

It's seriously on my short list for best games of all time, not just best roguelike. Fantastic sense of character progression, build possibilities galore, huge world to explore, randomized dungeons that still feel original and thematic without feeling generic, and so many ways to die.

author: {'steamid': '76561198092698130', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 372274, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 210535, 'last_played': 1709068213}
review: Truly excellent roguelike game. simple turnbased, the iconic graphics are complete enough that you don't need to memorize symbols to understand what you are interacting with but not so elaborate that they detract from the strategy of the gameplay. It reminds me of playing Moria in the vax lab at my campus. The variety of races and classes is enough to keep things interesting for a long time. I have only played on Nightmare Roguelike difficulty so I have only barely made it past a level 30 character but I have not begun to tire of the game. Also, plenty of open ended story lines with options to not always do the right thing if you want to take a walk on the dark side. I have not even opened all the class options yet but if I was getting bored I could lower the difficulty and open other classes. But I will never do that, I will go to my grave playing only the hardest difficulty and when I win, I will drag the creators of the game down to hell with me.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971368452', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 35287, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 34887, 'last_played': 1685507957}
review:
This game really just hits the spot for me.  I've had it since 2015 and have put it down for months (or more) at a time when I want to try something new, get frustrated with my characters getting mauled over and over again, or just don't have time to play, but it is always a game I find myself coming back to and enjoying again.  

The amount of races/character types/build options are fantastic and lead to the game almost always feeling fresh with new ways to approach it as you attempt to win.  That feeling you get when you get to the later levels and every move can make or break you is great too.  Do you die a lot?  Yes (particularly on the higher difficulties), but for me that's what makes it such a great roguelike and really leaves you with a sense of accomplishment and satisfaction if/when you actually do beat the game.  If there is a knock on the game, graphics would have to be it, but for the price it's not like I would expect anything more, and the gameplay for me far outweighs any deficiencies in its appearance. 

I always intended to submit a review for ToME, glad I finally got around to it.  This is by far the highest value game in my library where my enjoyment from it has well exceeded the price I paid for it.

review:
The best roguelike of current times.  In a lot of ways the version you can obtain via the website is better (and I'm not saying that because that one is donationware, more addons are available there for example), but here you get to puzzle about how low the percentage is for some achievements and the updater is slightly better.

I have gotten years of enjoyment from just a single purchase, and the game is continuously evolving to ensure I get many years more.  Even one of the few games that updates the DLC and adds content to them every now and then.

author: {'steamid': '76561198131367432', 'num_games_owned': 251, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 7049, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3943, 'last_played': 1710290818}
review: One of the most deep and fulfilling RPGs of all time. ToME4 has the benefit of being possibly the most approachable roguelike classic to an outsider, and boasts an incredibly realized world with a LOT of stuff to do. Try the free version on the official website, play on the mode with multiple lives, and when you're hooked beyond saving come back here and buy the game. Definitely worth 10 bucks.

author: {'steamid': '76561198068041279', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 24347, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 18437, 'last_played': 1706338278}
review:
优点大家都说完了，我说说缺点吧：
1、最大的缺点当然是画质太差了，贴图糊得像坨屎，看久了恶心。
2、主线太短了，还没爽到就结束了。
3、有很多不知道算不算bug的设定，很影响体验，并且很多年了一直不优化。比如技能栏，技能一行放不下，想放到第二行，结果发现第二行有一半的位置是和第一行重合的，以此类推，后面每一行技能栏都和前面一行有部分重合，就很无语；鼠标放到能量条上面想看看说明，显示的却是地面的说明；精神系有个叫灵魂出窍的技能，用的时候经常报错。

author: {'steamid': '76561198149219204', 'num_games_owned': 43, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 11179, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 209, 'last_played': 1705674814}
review:
The best roguelike game hands down. Played the free version for years and still to this day find things i've never done before. Very deep mechanics, open world, challenging, still updated, very cool community. Not really much more you could ask for in this kind of genre. This game makes other roguelikes look tiny in comparison. 

Edit: I also want to say that in my opinion, this game is not only the best roguelike, but the best game i've ever played. Normally I get tired of a game after a certain amount of hours, mainly due to many mechanics being tedious, or lack of depth or innovation. Well, ToME isn't that. This game allows you to build a particular class in so many different varieties, with so many different weapon variations, different races with their own modifiers, etc... that every new game feels fresh. And that's not to mention the procedural generation of levels, loot, and monsters. And what's even better about this game than most traditional roguelikes is that it doesn't all feel convoluted and overly complex. This truly is a perfect game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198368759542', 'num_games_owned': 117, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 48700, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 18829, 'last_played': 1703417790}
review: 传统roguelike中侧重于战斗，少了繁冗的材料管理系统，更加干净清爽。二三十个职业各具特色，差异显著，玩起来少则三四十个技能，多则五六十个技能，都很有用。深度深，广度广，且在官网有免费本体可以游玩，推荐roguelike爱好者不容错过。

author: {'steamid': '76561198007343154', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 449, 'playtime_forever': 3717, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3717, 'last_played': 1680720880}
review: I am a 45 yo father, probably one of the oldest people playing this game. I am a single father to my Son, who is 14 now. My son got this game from his uncle, so we installed it on his computer and he started playing. By the end of the week he had 24 hours on this game. This was horrible for me, as it was already hard for me to find ways to spend time with my son, as he is always out with his friends or just watching YouTube. So I decided to make a Steam account and get this game to see if I could maybe play alongside him. I loaded into the game, picked my character and world and started playing but I was stuck on what you where supposed to do. I asked my Son for help and he hosted a game for me to join. I loved it as it was the best time I had spent with my Son since my wife had died. This game has ever since brought me and my son closer again and now we actually spend time together outside the house together as well. This game reminded me that there's fun to be had in everything, and it has brought both me and my Son many happy memories.

author: {'steamid': '76561197980933159', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 18683, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 18650, 'last_played': 1697326270}
review:
Tales of Maj'Eyal is a truly fantastic game that any fan of role-playing games should definitely check out. From the moment you start playing, you're immersed in a rich and engaging world full of interesting characters and deep lore.

One of the things that really sets Tales of Maj'Eyal apart from other RPGs is its deep and complex character customization system. There are dozens of different classes to choose from, each with its own unique abilities and play style, and you can mix and match them to create your own truly unique character. Whether you prefer to play as a powerful mage, a deadly assassin, or a stalwart warrior, there's something here for everyone.

The game's combat system is also incredibly well-designed, with a variety of different tactics and strategies to employ depending on the situation. You'll need to think carefully about your positioning, your abilities, and your equipment if you want to emerge victorious in battle.

But what really makes Tales of Maj'Eyal stand out is its story. It's a deep and complex tale that will keep you engaged and invested from beginning to end. The world is richly detailed and full of fascinating lore, and the characters you meet along the way are all well-written and memorable.

Overall, I would highly recommend Tales of Maj'Eyal to anyone who loves RPGs. It's a truly fantastic game that offers hours upon hours of engaging gameplay, deep character customization, and a rich and satisfying story. Give it a try - you won't be disappointed!

author: {'steamid': '76561198141982000', 'num_games_owned': 761, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 7161, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5407, 'last_played': 1702497658}
review:
Start a game.
Do the bare minimum.
Give away one of the better items in the game, unlock a new class.
Die to a spider man.
Start a new game with the new class.
Reach some random mountain.
Find a hole in reality.
Do things that you didn't do, and actually can't do because things didn't happen when they did. Don't worry about it, since the hole isn't real anymore. Another new class unlocked.
Death by dragon. Doesn't sound as silly as death by spider man, less likely to be misunderstood. It's an improvement.
New game with the newer new class.
Start outside of reality.
Murder time spiders.
This new class has between one and three dogs, depending on how you count.
Reach that bastard mountain again.
Commit really inefficient suicide to prevent you from killing yourself. I promise, this makes sense in context.
Same. Fucking. Dragon.
New game, newer newest new class.
Again, started outside of reality.
Again, murdering time spiders. This time by hitting them with attacks before I use those attacks.
Unlock master-level magic fuckery.
Find the dragon.
Stop the dragon in time.
Throw the dragon out of time.
Take a break in my own little pocket dimension outside of time.
Teleport myself to safety.
Teleport the dragon so it doesn't compromise my safety.
Extra turns.
More extra turns.
Yeet the dragon out of time.
Even more extra turns.
Eventually kill the dragon via a combination of trolling, magic fuckery and tiny bits of damage.
Die to another fucking spider man.

10/10, would unlock classes again.

author: {'steamid': '76561198012389143', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 37264, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 593, 'playtime_at_review': 13715, 'last_played': 1712018726}
review:
I've come back some time after getting my first roguelike win to say that my enjoyment of this game has only increased. Despite how much time I've invested into it I feel like I've only just scratched the surface of what ToME has to offer.

This is quite likely one of the best roguelikes [i]and[/i] RPGs I've ever played, even if you consider the genres separately. Do not be fooled by its simplistic art style, beneath it is a very complex RPG with an absurd amount of content and replayability. ToME is clearly a passion project by a very dedicated developer. 

[h1]The Good:[/h1]
[*]You can try the base game for free on the developer's website. 
[*]Highly intuitive, customizable UI. Full M+KB support, plays like a modern tactical game.
[*]Full price is more than fair for the amount of content you are receiving.
[*] Workshop and addon support.
[*]In-game global chat: 
[*]Interesting gameplay loop, multiple campaigns, difficulties, and game modes.
[*]Many unique unlockables that contribute to an enormous sense of progression even as you lose characters.
[*]Ingenious ownership model. Your account tracks ownership of the game and DLC, so you can install it even on computers without Steam by using the game's client.
[*]More forgiving difficulties with more or infinite lives if you are initially daunted by roguelike difficulty.
[*]Combat is varied and fun.

[h1]The Meh:[/h1]
[*]Some of the music is great, other tracks can start to grate after hearing them for the 100th hour. Sometimes I play music in the background instead.
[*]Sound effects can be a little basic. Others can be great (WO tentacle attack)
[*]More like a learning cliff than a curve.
[*]You will be randomly one-shot a lot until you learn to be cautious.
[*]ToME is a niche game with a small player base, so you may need to do some research if you have questions.

author: {'steamid': '76561198094216996', 'num_games_owned': 724, 'num_reviews': 49, 'playtime_forever': 4071, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3994, 'last_played': 1680816875}
review: Amazing roguelike with satisfying progression and unlocks.

author: {'steamid': '76561198409075799', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 3691, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 3, 'playtime_at_review': 568, 'last_played': 1711957500}
review:
[h1]これが……老舗王道ローグライク ……？[/h1]
名前も読めない10年以上前のゲームがフレンドから送られてきた時は正直困惑しました。
バタ臭すぎる操作を確認しながらチュートリアルを終えて、よくわからないまま人間の戦士キャラを作り森に出かけました。トロールのボスを倒したあたりから「（あれ、もしかしてわりと面白い？）」と思うようになり、帰還システムやインベントリ整理用のアンロックアイテムを手に入れてワールドマップを散策するうちに冒険意欲が沸き起こり、1キャラ目をロストする頃には間伐入れずに魔法職のキャラクターを作ってすぐさま冒険に戻るほど熱中していました。

グラフィックはチープです。UIは分かりにくいです。操作も快適とは言えません。でもなんなんでしょう、このノスタルジーだけではないゲーム体験の魅力は。きっと開発当時、挑戦的で先進的なゲームを提供しようと野心に満ちた設計で開発されたのでしょう。その熱量のおかげで、それぞれの技術分野が洗練された現代においても、開発当時のプレイヤーのワクワク、没入感、時代感、すべてそのままに体験することが出来ます。自分は今、2012年にこのゲームを遊んでいるのだと錯覚させてくれます。

初めて聞く名前の世界、よくわからない種族、知らない歴史、洋ゲーらしくオリジナル世界を展開することに躊躇がありません。死んだら終わりの世界では手探りにもリスクが付きまとい、ほどよい緊張感が生まれます。
よくあるいわゆるターン性ローグライクなのですが、敵はわんさか装備はジャブジャブ手に入り、ハクスラのような爽快感もあります。要素のアンロックという形で次の周回に変化が起きるのも嬉しいバランス。不思議なことにキャラロストすら新たな始まりのための必要な犠牲と割り切れてしまいます。

決して万人にオススメはできないゲームですが、このレビューを最後まで読む程度に興味を持っている人になら、恐らく勧めても問題ないでしょう。
あの頃のドキドキ、記憶の中にしかないはずだった美しいゲーム体験をそのまま味わいたい人に。
画面を覆う派手なエフェクトに疲れた人に。
乱立する攻略サイトの最強やらマラソンやらの客寄せ文句に辟易している人に。
ゆったりと、どっぷりと浸れる、自分だけのマイ・イヤルはいかがでしょうか。

review: A wonderful game that is extremely unique. Every single thing within this is handcrafted with love and support from probably the kindest gaming community I've seen in my life. This is one of the few games that has ever gotten me interested in the lore, they somehow make a top-down turn based game feel so full of life. I would absolutely pick this up if you are into more traditional rogue-likes.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041766090', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 20754, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 20738, 'last_played': 1695882104}
review:
It's one of the best turn based rogue-likes available, and has much depth of play, multiple difficulties, myriad unlocks, and a lot of expansions.  As long as you aren't frustrated by such a difficult game, and learning with each death, then this game is for you.  

I will admit however, that the game becomes MUCH easier if you spend real money on storage space for your item vault, and I think it's worth it honestly, as DarkGod does quite a lot of work on this game, and he deserves it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197992715394', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 1270, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1270, 'last_played': 1679639786}
review:
There are very, very few times where this game will illustrate mechanics and play to new players. 21 hours of the same race and class and I still have little to guide my decisions other than the basic instinct to just "make the numbers bigger". Plenty of other roguelikes I've played both old and new clicked easier and faster; some with more complex system mechanics; than this one did.

Edit: Forgot to add this, because they are absolutely forgettable, is the "community" such as it is. More concerned with the faded relevancy of a game whose greatest claim to any accord is solving a "problem" that is only an issue to a fraction of a fraction of it's players.

Try DCSS, Streets of Rogue, NetHack, Dungeons of Dredmor for a better time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041076859', 'num_games_owned': 550, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 431, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 431, 'last_played': 1629982108}
review:
가볍게 즐길 수 있는 로그 라이크 게임입니다.
이 게임은 기본적으로 넘버 패드가 있으면 더 편리하게 게임을 할 수 있습니다. 이동키는 넘버 패드로 생각하세요.
자신이 할 수 있는 설정이 정말로 다양하다보니 게임 설정 변경만 해도 야리코미 요소가 많습니다.

가격도 얼마 하지 않으니 로그 라이크에 관심이 많다면 무지성으로 구매하는 게 좋습니다.

author: {'steamid': '76561198090109542', 'num_games_owned': 576, 'num_reviews': 103, 'playtime_forever': 2458, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1799, 'last_played': 1693508549}
review:
As someone who is really new to Traditional Roguelikes having only played Zorbus before, If I had to go back in time I would start by playing ToME first, this game is what I would describe "Diablo as a traditional roguelike" because 99% of it is spamming the same buttons killing trash mobs that stand no chance against you and then meeting a rare enemy that wrecks your health from 100% to 30% all of a sudden.

That is the biggest issue with this game, a lot of the gameplay you do feels a little bit meaningless as it's just killing low level enemies, in the end (After I got my first victory) I downloaded a mod that makes an AI take over my character until it reaches low health because that's the moment when combat becomes interesting, at least all of what I have said applies on normal difficulty.

Then you play the nightmare difficulty and normal mobs (in numbers) become actually difficult, If you give up on this game because it's too easy, try the nightmare difficulty as that's what it feels like the "intended" difficulty is.

The fun of this game is playing different classes and discovering new skills, a lot of skills in this game are really interesting and haven't been done before in any game, this game is perfect for anyone who wants to try a traditional roguelike, and it's actually free! buying it on steam is optional.

review:
Probably one of the best RLs ever made, I'd buy it again in a heartbeat.
tons of crazy, imaginative stuff packed in here.
Steam punk orcs? time travelling mages? Psychic warriors? you can play those and much more.the setting? medieval high fantasy with spaceships and automatons, beautiful landscapes from a dream, horrors beyond imagination, and bears.
Maj'Eyal has it all and more...

author: {'steamid': '76561197991303785', 'num_games_owned': 81, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 7489, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 638, 'last_played': 1699813481}
review:
Like most trad rogue-likes, it can be frustrating at first. Give it some time and the more you figure out the mechanics the more enjoyable it becomes. Most of the deaths you will experience, you soon realize, are from your own mistakes and not the game. There is almost always a way out or way to deal with enemies that give you a sense of survival. Unlike some games where the RNG ends the game before you even start.

p.s. Rolf and Weisman have the best story arc.

author: {'steamid': '76561198974476772', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 18970, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5338, 'last_played': 1695063319}
review:
Very enjoyable traditional roguelike - extensive content and very high difficulty. 

Personally classes being locked behind achievements has felt perhaps too modern, but for most parts this is pretty much like Nethack, ADOM and others like them. Classes feel perhaps too strongly tied to their own development paths, but within each class there are multiple ways to play so that is not too limiting for game experience. 

Expect to die early and often.

author: {'steamid': '76561197996466976', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 15660, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 15470, 'last_played': 1677689042}
review: If you like Roguelikes, you'll like this. The dev is releasing a new expansion soon. Difficulty is high, I consider myself experienced with roguelikes and cleared Insane diff as of writing this. There's something here for casual players too, the world and lore I found oddly charming and unique given the apparent stereotypical fantasy setting. The game has been constantly updated for years by a dev who clearly loves the project.

author: {'steamid': '76561198053391940', 'num_games_owned': 315, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 913, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 355, 'last_played': 1709847204}
review:
Tales of Maj'Eyal est l'un des meilleurs roguelikes de l'histoire du roguelike, et l'un des meilleurs jeux-vidéos que je connaisse. Ne vous fiez pas à mon compteur Steam, je joue au jeu depuis 11 ans, je n'ai que très récemment demandé une copie Steam sur mon compte te4.org.

Le nombre de races et de classes est affolant, les manières de jouer multiples, l'univers est un bonheur à explorer, le lore est passionnant et teinté d'un humour certains. Vous pouvez jouer avec différents niveaux de difficultés, mais aussi en mode Exploration (pas de mort permanente), Adventure (quelques vies), et roguelike (une seule vie).

Avec deux nouvelles extensions en préparation et un livre, Te4 est loin d'avoir finit de nous présenter toutes ses richesses.

Et je ne parle pas de la communauté extraordinaire qui continue d'enrichir ce jeu déjà gargantuesques avec des mods de tout genre.

review:
If you want a unique gameplay experience then you gotta play tome. Imagine a world in which you start a new character, there is the non tome option of course, you can just exit and start again, ORRR you can send a quick prayer to dark god who is on a lot more than you might think through the game chat and get some horror buddies. 

Lmao, honestly its a great game and probably one of the last bastions of true passion in gaming a guy can have. Dark god just wanted people to play his game, Dude will treat you right.

author: {'steamid': '76561198070635029', 'num_games_owned': 203, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 2051, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 441, 'last_played': 1688630533}
review:
If you can get past the initial perspective of "Damn this game looks rough". You'll see beneath it's ghastly guise there lies a beautifully deep RPG. It's got everything you want from lootin and scootin, to complex classes that each have their own play style, tough enemies and bosses, to just great exploring. You can really tell the developers wanted to make a great RPG experience not just a game. Lots of AAA titles with the face of a Victoria Secret model but the personality of a social media influencer. If you really love RPGs, this is one that stays true to its roots and nature.

Also don't make the mistake and play the game super zoomed out. I was on 4k and I was like damn it's a small game. It's an old game with I believe 720P or 1080 max res so anything above it shrinks the game and you can see everything. Make sure you change your resolution so the game is pretty much fullscreened or closer. That way you'll feel like you are really living the Tales of Maj'Eyal.

author: {'steamid': '76561198358343653', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 74, 'playtime_forever': 4852, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3668, 'last_played': 1676172613}
review:
虽然我不是这种纯玩Build纯战斗型游戏的受众，不过还是个好游戏，怎么形容这个游戏呢？很像回合制暗黑3（玩构筑玩装备）+P社常见的一堆复杂RP设定的感觉。

author: {'steamid': '76561198075429360', 'num_games_owned': 255, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 954, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 672, 'last_played': 1676694616}
review:
Great immersive game. 

I like pixel graphics and this was the first true rougelike pixel game I got fully immersed in. 

At this point - with 10 hours into the game - I'm still not sure if there is an overarching story .... all my time has been spent in exploring forests, mines and ruins where you find bits of lore to read and I've enjoyed every moment. The lore though hasn't yet pointed to a story and has random bits from other travelers about the area you are in.

The bosses and higher level enemies are good challenges and it is interesting to strategize and fight them with a mix of talents, spells and physical abilities.

 I'm playing my current character on "Adventure" mode where the game gives you an extra life every few levels (max 7 lives in total). This is enough for me to fear death and get a rush out of trying to tactically fight or retreat from a harsh fight.

All in all, very satisfying gameplay. I don't realize how the hours pass by when I'm in the game. 

If I may make a recommendation - Dungeons of Chaos - is another excellent pixel turn based exploration game that is less rougelike and more story driven.

review: A great Rouge-Like with multiple play settings.  Choose between unlimited lives, limited lives, and single life play style.  Lots of characters and classes to unlock with unique play styles.  The traditional infinite dungeon is an unlockable mode with a very traditional Rouge feel to it.  Main game is a campaign with random dungeon level generation and a fixed world map to travel between them and facilitate storyline/quests.

author: {'steamid': '76561199224997366', 'num_games_owned': 47, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 7512, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 919, 'last_played': 1706272952}
review:
神作！非常杀时间，两天就玩了十多个小时;死了马上重开，根本停不下来,但对新手十分不友好。因为是老游戏压根没有新实况攻略，都是讲解没有具体流程，所以全程都是我自己摸索出来的。这种纯肉鸽难度很大，一旦遇到很强的敌人，跑也跑不了打也打不过，只能开传送法杖然后苟住，苟不住就直接寄，所以我只能尝试低难度无限复活不然被暴捶。
经典像素画风，图像简陋内容丰富，上手困难热度较低等等具体来讲确实还可以。

author: {'steamid': '76561198010211390', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 5483, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4659, 'last_played': 1674376241}
review:
This game is a garbage fire, and I wouldn't recommend it to any but the most desperate of masochists.  There's some interesting lore, but you're not going to give a damn after you've seen the first dungeon for the twentieth time this week.  Getting anywhere is a question of pure RNG:  Did you get any good drops?  Did the encounter table roll up something manageable for your class choice?  No?  Then back to start!

Don't get me started on the bosses.  For the first ten levels or so, they're fine, they're beatable.  But once you start to approach level 20, they become impossible.  Let's look Urkis.  He is the bane of the early mid-game.  After your first attempt at a character fails to kill him, you'll start your next character by preparing for him, gathering lightning-resistant gear.

Except it doesn't matter, because he cheats around the lightning resistance.  Even with 70%, his Hurricane spell was still taking me for about 1/10 of my health every turn!  And once you reach the level where you start to fight bosses of his caliber, no status effects that would be useful against them work.  It would be great if I could lock him down with Stun, Mindblast, and Daze; that would show that there's an element of skill to this game, since I could beat him with good preparation.  Even getting lucky one time and finding a Prismatic Rune before fighting him, I still died a couple of times before I could bring him down.

And that leads me to another problem:  The descriptions of how certain things work are God-awful.  What does the Prismatic Rune do?  The description suggests that it makes you immune to a certain number of elemental strikes over the course of several turns, except that's clearly a lie, as I'm still taking damage from dragonbreath and the like.  My most successful character died to the Orcish Pyromancer explicitly because I could not use this rune the way it says it works, to shrug off his opening salvo and gain an early lead.  Once again, an example of good preparation being of no use in this game.

RNG screws you over once again on loot drops.  They are entirely random, and don't scale well with your level.  My MOST successful character was forced to delve into Dreadfell with a weapon that I had found back when I was level 8, because it was the best one I had found in all of that time.  I only succeeded because I found two better ones on my way up, each one nearly doubling my damage cap because of how under-equipped i was.  And even then, I once again only beat The Master because I was lucky!

Caught off guard in the middle of fighting some underlings, i dropped a Quake and happened to trap him in a little 2x2 room with me, so that he couldn't escape and couldn't summon more than two minions to hit me.  If I hadn't managed to do that, there's no way I would have ever beaten him!

If they would fix their broken mechanics and loot tables, this game MIGHT be playable.  I certainly must have gotten some amount of fun from it to have given it so many chances to persuade me that it was good.  But I can never recommend it, given the experiences that I had.

author: {'steamid': '76561198055367776', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 76, 'playtime_forever': 919, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 708, 'last_played': 1674013823}
review:
[b]Game[/b]: You're dead.
[b]Me[/b]: How?!
[b]Game[/b]: Reasons.
[b]Me[/b]: Explain them...
[b]Game[/b]: You died.
[b]Me[/b]: FROM WHAT?
[b]Game[/b]: Try again?

That's really what most of the game feels like to me. Even after looking at the combat log, I still can't figure out what goes on half the time. Things just [i]happen[/i] and then you're either dead or the enemy is dead. Defense doesn't seem to mean anything. Healing is pointless when the enemy wipes half your health in a hit. Attacks just... Wiff? Animations happen on screen and you're left going, "But, what did that do?" Only to be left with no information.

The thing about rogue-anythings is that the player's main power in the game is knowledge. But, this game just refuses to give you any about anything. You die. You get up and you die again. You continue to slam your head against the impenetrable "depth" of this game only to be left going, "But WHY!?"

The game feels obtuse for the sake of complexity, but that's doesn't make a deep and enriching game- it makes a frustrating experience for anyone who [i]doesn't[/i] want to spend an equal amount of time playing the game as researching [b]how[/b] to play it.

You know what this game is? The 7th Saga re-imagined. That's what this is. No one will get that reference, but that's what this is.

author: {'steamid': '76561198079605896', 'num_games_owned': 28, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 9490, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3694, 'last_played': 1686761011}

author: {'steamid': '76561198068803494', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 177, 'playtime_forever': 15595, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11373, 'last_played': 1701027532}
review:
很好玩，但是没那么好上手，主要是刚开始玩的时候看着眼花缭乱一大堆的职业、种族和技能会不知道要怎么点。。。

其实很简单，这个游戏鼓励你多点不同的技能而不是精通其中某一个，技能等级越高收益越小，换句话说就是可能的话尽量多点新的技能而不是加强已有的，除非是技能随升级会额外多出一些作用范围或者持续时间，那就可以卡着提升的阈值点一下，如果升级只是提升数值的话一般来说只要点两级就够了，再往上点收益很低不划算。

明白了这个之后就比较容易上手了。。。

然后就是，逃生能力＞生存能力（抗伤害能力）＞输出能力，输出能力通常是最次要的，除非面对某些回血极强的boss，生存能力只要保证你作为脆皮不会转角被秒或者作为坦克可以抗住几轮围殴就行，逃生能力才是最重要的，打不过至少也要跑得了。

种族推荐选普通人类，多一个大系点数build的时候不要太好使。

职业的话，刚开始玩推荐盾战，突出一个肉，玩起来也不需要什么操作，堆肉就行了，缺点是输出不高，逃生能力差，切人能力也差，容易被风筝或者被一大群肉度不低于自己的怪围殴致死。法师职业一开始只能选炼金术士，这个职业能不玩就别玩，整个一下水道，不仅操作起来很麻烦强度也不高。

steam还附送一个支配者的职业，这个职业我愿称之为最强，但是不太好上手，需要熟悉整个游戏的怪物分布和数据，前期很难过但是后期就是平推，玩熟了之后可以开始用这个来通关。。。

author: {'steamid': '76561198330001915', 'num_games_owned': 250, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 4238, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4166, 'last_played': 1673758252}

唯一可惜的是不能和DND一样转职、兼职啥的

author: {'steamid': '76561198041772215', 'num_games_owned': 228, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 72928, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 52751, 'last_played': 1707956100}
review: This game is a quintessential example of a perfect game. There's hundreds, if not thousands, of hours of in depth lore and places to discover that will keep each run feeling unique, even after 1000+ hours into it. This game has been actively in development for over 10 years, and always has a new update just around the corner. If you love traditional roguelikes, or are a fan of similar genres, I cannot recommend this game enough. It's by far my favourite game I've ever played, and I don't see that changing any time soon.

review: The evil forces of evil wizzards and evil magic are a true blight upon the world of Eyal. Arcane arts are very nasty and corrupt the mind. You must take matters into your own hands, become a hero the Eyal needs, embark on a journey of righteousness. Go into forests to decimate animals by the thousands, kill all spell casters, destroy all undead, violently expel any eldritch abominations or demons from the world, but above all else, do not try to save any damsels in distress, because a trap lays in every part of your adventure. Join Zigur now, so that antimagic can save the day.

author: {'steamid': '76561198269477593', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 4346, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4290, 'last_played': 1687118179}
review: It has a lot of potential but held back by the fact that the roguelike element is actually a downside when each run feels the same. Preset world map, quests, even unique items. A lot of very cool build options but no reason to change your build on the fly in reaction to circumstances. Also annoying how many hoops you have to jump through to unlock the interesting races/classes. Another issue is that the game, even on high difficulties, is extremely easy 95% of the time, and all of the challenge comes from random enemies that will one shot you out of nowhere the moment your eyes glaze over from boredom. Get it on sale for sure but it doesn’t have the replayability of other roguelikes.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993805040', 'num_games_owned': 852, 'num_reviews': 111, 'playtime_forever': 7376, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2483, 'last_played': 1701994322}
review:
Was looking for a traditional roguelike and boy, does this game deliver! Each class feels very unique and the combat is very brutal and satisfying. While it doesn't look like much, and the story is mostly forgettable, the gameplay more than makes up for it.

My only (big) gripe is the difficulty is very uneven. One moment you're easily grinding for a few hours and then all of a sudden a boss or elite insta kills you from outside your vision. It's very frustrating to lose hours of progress due to gimmicks like these.

author: {'steamid': '76561198048288534', 'num_games_owned': 382, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 7184, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7140, 'last_played': 1673023290}
review:
I have hundreds of hours on this, back in the days, before it was released on Steam,

This is the best beginner friendly game when it comes to Traditional Roguelikes,

It have state of the art UI, and it can also be customized, and this alone is a huge leap over the other Traditional Roruelikes.

When it comes to gameplay, Powerplay is the name of the game, So all Diablo 2 fans obsessed with min/maxing will be right at home, but here The Powerplay is cranked on 11. 

When it comes to value, there are hundreds of hours of content in this game, and I put it in the same league as HoMM3.

author: {'steamid': '76561197990762902', 'num_games_owned': 380, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 4890, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4890, 'last_played': 1587146837}
review:
It's like nethack, but with graphics, and lot of classes to play, from a simple barbarian to a dual shield dwarf or some weird creatures holding huge weapons by telekinesis.

There is a lot to discover, lot to learn, lot to unlock, the game can be downloaded for free and is open source, but buying it on steam unlocks a few extra (non essentials at all) features and give money to the single developer.

Oh, and there is some kind of a global chat in which you see other player's characters dying, or their achievement, it's a funny mechanic.

author: {'steamid': '76561197986093133', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 4736, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3459, 'last_played': 1671663316}
review:
This is definitely a solid entry in the classic roguelike genre, and there's many good things to say about Tales of Maj'Eyal. However, if I'm going to be honest, the more I played ToME4 the less I enjoyed it, so I'm not sure if I can give this offering a positive recommendation.

My main points of criticism are:
- The game receives periodic updates, however almost all of these are purely additive and only add content to the game (e.g. new classes), and do very little to improve the core of the game.
- Though the tile graphics are nice, the interface in general is overall quite minimal as far as usability goes. Inventory management is only one step up from 80's roguelikes. To give an example, "19 foos" will be sorted before "2 bars" because the "1" in "19" comes before "2".
- The gameplay itself, though interesting at first, becomes tedious and repetitive quickly, with most of the excitement coming from the difficulty curve which often resembles a seismograph. Unlike most other classic roguelikes, Tales of Maj'Eyal does not have consumables (potions / scrolls) to allow overcoming difficulty spikes, and does not have grinding (the amount of XP you can earn in one playthrough is capped), so your only tools are kiting, and coming back later, which may not be an option depending on the RNG.
- In my opinion the game's author seems to take too much of an interest in players' progress. Features are gimped unless you create an account on the game's website and upload your gameplay data. The game also, without warning or explanation, messes with your operating system's settings when you run it and, for whatever reason, associates itself with some subset of the Discord protocol.

I think most of these shortcomings are entirely forgivable considering that ToME4 is a free game, so my review above only applies to the paid Steam offering.

author: {'steamid': '76561198137250093', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 1230, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1230, 'last_played': 1652328993}

review: Un des meilleurs jeu solo auquel j'ai pu jouer de toute ma vie de gamer. Je le recommande chaudement pour tous ceux qui recherchent un gameplay très fourni et une énorme rejouabilité. Il faudra cependant faire abstraction des graphismes assez sommaires.

author: {'steamid': '76561198101540225', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 68, 'playtime_forever': 447, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 447, 'last_played': 1671503014}
review:
Thought it was a decent old school game like avernum or the TSR games at first but, after playing 7 hours, I gotta say it would be just better to play those games than this.  People say it's difficult but it really isn't its just unfair.  Difficulty would imply interesting enemies and combat, which there are none.  Twice while playing it I have have been stomped by random high level enemy that shouldn't have been in the area to begin with.  Fights are you clearing out boring 2 hit trash enemies and hoping they didn't put a level 25 in a level 7-15 zone.  Dropping a random super enemy among wimpy ones and calling it "old school hard" is just a sign of bad design.  Makes you feel cheated, especially with perma-death.

There's no story, no characters, and quests are just objective markers.  It's just randomly generated dungeons, random loot, and nothing tying it all together.  Feels like the game had the minimum effort put into it, but it still has a RL cash shop...wow.  Dungeons have zero personality, even if it weren't random generated, the designs are empty and lack that extra detail/ambience.  Old school games were the way they were because of the times, not because the developers were lazy/greedy.  They still had a lot of great stories/characters, memorable areas,  and epic fights despite limited technology.  I will admit it has nice character and creature art, unfortunately audio is bland and you'll get sick of the same looping music and 5 combat sounds fast.  Definite pass.

author: {'steamid': '76561198145465415', 'num_games_owned': 401, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 2399, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2275, 'last_played': 1707878393}
review:
Sucked me back in again so its time to pay my respects to this game.

Excellent Roguelike with the benefits of modern technology with an old school spirit.

Incredible lore and worldbuilding, and very challenging, but fair.  

Absolutely recommend, I'm still scratching the surface.  

Dev is just about the coolest MF too.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971704307', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 126, 'playtime_forever': 1590, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 481, 'last_played': 1673171276}
review:
Both yes and no.

[b]Yes[/b], because loot and it's kinda fun, i like creating a character, walk around kill monsters, it checks a lot of boxes as they say.

[b]No [/b], because all of a sudden you meet a monster you didnt even know was there, that 1 shots you without you being able to do anything about it, not being able to prepare, not being able to flee, nothing, nada, zip, da, di, doo, daa.

And then you rage quit... you try rage quit, alt-f4 doesn't work, you ctrl-alt-del and force shut the damn thing.
And a few days later you fire up the game again for another run. RINSE AND REPEAT
The game has nearly 2000 achievements, but even getting the lvl 10 achievement (out of i have no idea how many levels), is a feat in an of it's own.

7/10 - pure OIL

author: {'steamid': '76561198081554978', 'num_games_owned': 2104, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 20910, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 20910, 'last_played': 1669675627}
review: Tales of Maj'Eyal is a must have for anyone that enjoys traditional roguelikes. There is an incredible amount of depth and intricacy to the game thanks to its vast array of race and class combinations. The difficulty is almost perfect for this style of game and it will regularly encourage you to explore new builds and strategies. The developer of this game regularly engages with the community through events and ensures every update is packed full of content and QoL improvements. Definitely pick this one up if you want a challenge and are passionate about traditional roguelikes.

author: {'steamid': '76561198065090311', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 173, 'playtime_forever': 4017, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3802, 'last_played': 1693067185}
review:
This is by far my favorite "open world" traditional roguelike. 
- There is an overworld so you're not confined to an infinite dungeon. 
- Unlike Nethack and Rogue, randomness is minimal so no dealing with cursed pickups and unidentified scrolls/potions. Moreover, sudden BS unfair deaths are extremely minimal, but you will still get instantly smitten when you accidentally walk into a high-tier dungeon boss room (which can be avoided once you know the dungeon tiers). On the plus side, there's a difficulty setting which allows you to gain lives at certain levels which further mitigates permadeath from misclicks or dumb mistakes.
- There are many viable and fun classes to unlock and try out, so if you die it's an opportunity to play a different class. 
- There's an in-game online chat (mature boomers all around so it's nice) which also displays active player deaths sometimes hilariously so.
- The artwork and sprites are great, reminds me of early 2000s 2D Isometric RPGs.

review: Never heard of this game till a friend gifted it to me so I can try it out. 6 hours in I can tell this game has a lot more to offer, but but from what little of the game I've played, I'd give it at least a 8.5/10! Great game!

author: {'steamid': '76561198088697162', 'num_games_owned': 251, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 1008, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 299, 'last_played': 1675182301}
review:
Hands down the best roguelike game out there. It has enough lore, classes, skills and campaigns to make it feel like a proper RPG as well :) 

Exactly what I needed after the disappointment of The Binding of Isaac:Repentance. Here, your choices and skills matter. The game is not unfair in any way. If you lose, it's on you.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998614060', 'num_games_owned': 706, 'num_reviews': 97, 'playtime_forever': 12992, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 12992, 'last_played': 1620238809}
review:
This is a great roguelike "dungeon crawler"!

Pros:
* There are a LOT of classes, each of which play differently/distinctly.
* I like the branching overworld style, rather than the linear tower of some games.
* The upgrade system takes a little getting used to, but works really well.
* Each of the campaigns is fun.
* Can't beat the price (even including the DLC, which are all good)
* Difficulty is easily adjustable

Cons:
* Items are a little more random than I'd like, but you can generally find/create/modify what you need
* Stats can be a little hard to figure out, but read the wiki for a few minutes and it makes sense

author: {'steamid': '76561198025289105', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 30133, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 77, 'playtime_at_review': 18087, 'last_played': 1711296191}
review:
A roguelike in the classic fashion of the earliest examples of the genre, but with a much larger amount of content included.  It also takes the approach of many "mini-dungeons" available from an overworld, rather than the classic "tower of levels" approach.  This branching layout allows some areas to be reordered (or even skipped entirely) to allow further freedom of playstyle.

Too bad I've managed only one win.

author: {'steamid': '76561198288323819', 'num_games_owned': 505, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 18460, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 18131, 'last_played': 1688140980}
review:
满分游戏来啦~里面请~
毋须讳言，就当今的新游戏而言，画面表现是构成吸引力的最直观因素，也是游戏体验的重要组成部分。但对于一些老游戏，在外观上占据天然劣势的情况下，仅仅依靠其无与伦比的游戏内核，也足以令人沉迷其中。《Tales of Maj'Eyal》正是这样的一款作品。
很难用一两句话去概括我的游玩过程，因为其本身存在一定的上手门槛，搞清楚游戏的框架就需要一点时间，且我这300小时自觉也还有很多摸不清楚的事情。但它就是有那种吸引力和魅力，让我一次次的暴毙又一次次的重新建立人物。它既是复杂的，可以给我上百个小技能树供我选择；又是轻松的，我不必有那么多的算计，只需要投入一场似曾相识的全新冒险。
作为一款传统rogue游戏，它天生兼具有rpg的流程感和roguelike的随机性；类似于回合制的游戏机制也不会带来难度上的操作压力；海量的独立文本构建出了独特的世界观；丰富的种族和职业相互搭配更能让人永远保持新鲜感；更不必提流程中俯拾皆是的小小巧思。它有一种常见常新的独特魅力，像是标签泛黄的陈年老酒，沉淀着时光的芬芳。
优点：世界观独特，build丰富，内容量大管饱，且永远令人沉迷
缺点：上手有难度，整体很有nerd气质，作者怎么还不更新
个人评分：10/10
并不适合所有人，但是我想对所有人说：快来试试吧！

author: {'steamid': '76561198025847094', 'num_games_owned': 1014, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 1917, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 777, 'last_played': 1700648737}
review:
A modern roguelike that's one of the best.

New content is still being added to this for more than ten years, and it was already very good a long time ago. Voted for Labor of Love even though it's unlikely to ever have the attention to get it.

author: {'steamid': '76561199054377659', 'num_games_owned': 1186, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1171, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 641, 'last_played': 1700592904}
review:
Unlike other roguelikes, Tales of Maj Eyal has a deep and rather interesting story. It's more like Adom, has the feeling of a crpg shoehorned into a roguelike. This is kinda nice, because I found the story compelling, but also kinda bad, because being it a roguelike you will have to play again and again at least the beginning part of the story. 

It has tons of items/monsters/resistances/attributes/whatever. This makes it hard at times judging if an item is better than others or how the several resistances/attributes are playing together.

One negative aspect is that randomness in enemies generation is so high that every now and then an almost unbeatable enemy gets generated. This happens usually mixed with other trash monsters you'd usually slash trough like butter, thus giving you an easy death.

This is a good game, very addictive. But, after having played hundreds if not thousands of hours (I played the free version from the developer's website before getting it on steam), the fundamental problem is the same shared with others roguelikes with tons of enemies: you have to pretend to pay attention/care to trash mobs in the rare case where an almost unbeatable rare boss gets generated among them if you don't want do die. And this is kinda not a very funny way to play the game.

However, to let you enjoy the game as an  rpg and not a roguelike, you can play the mode with limited (7) number of lives or unlimited (only pay versions). After all, the purpose of playing a game is having fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561198157253396', 'num_games_owned': 507, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 11681, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6976, 'last_played': 1697505687}
review:
我对各种RPG的战斗系统都有诸多不满，所以竟然有这么一款RPG能够以纯粹的战斗系统吸引我，是我自己也没想到的。

Tales of Maj'Eyal在我看来，几乎是纯粹的由战斗系统组成的游戏（虽说有剧情，也有大量手札构建的世界观），全部乐趣都在于Roguelike可控随机下的人物构筑和战斗。游戏的最成功之处便是回合制战斗模式下极高的策略属性，技能设计差异化带来的无限构筑可能，无继承的（共享仓库算是一个附加奖励机制）永久死亡带来的无限重复可玩性。

如果真要评分的话，我可以给它10/10，真正属于能玩一辈子的类型。

另外还有一个重要的加分项：[b]它是开源游戏。[/b]

author: {'steamid': '76561198015978758', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 100340, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3098, 'last_played': 1694843463}
review:
Roguelike with an excellent plot and hilarious writing.  The interface is good and the art is mediocre.  If you like the genre, you'll love the gameplay.

For people who are obsessive optimizers, you can make extraordinarily powerful characters through careful design, and there are higher difficulty levels that make doing this almost mandatory.  It can become a spreadsheet simulator if you want.  If you'd prefer to just hack and slash your way through fun stories, there's an exploration mode that allows you to die as many horrible deaths as you like.

Lots of unlockables, many different classes with radically different gameplay, and lots to learn.  Bring your thinking cap and research your choices very carefully if you want to play on harder difficulties, or just have a good time bashing skulls for loot on easier modes.

The best roguelike I've played going back to the original Nethack.  I'm old and old-school.  I'm in love with Tales of Maj'Eyal.
