author: {'steamid': '76561198060527581', 'num_games_owned': 243, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 12553, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6057, 'last_played': 1708372650}
review:
Definitely would recommend this for anyone interested in traditional rogue-likes. The genre has a high learning curve but mechanically Tales of Maj'eyal is excellent.
So many different classes and races, which you unlock as you do certain things in the game.

I love the campaign style to the game in that rather than it being one dungeon like most traditional roguelikes, you explore many smaller dungeons each with their own backstory and boss. Each dungeon also has an alternate layout which can quite drastically change enemy types and the final boss. Although the campaign style takes some getting used to, there are some great guides of order to tackle particular portions of the game which helped me get a lot farther and avoid situations where I may get a 1-hit death (although this still happens on some of the harder difficulties). 

A good guide is Cath's BFG: https://forums.te4.org/viewtopic.php?f=41&t=48660

I think this is an accessible roguelike because there are a variety of different game modes - some which give you infinite, finite or no extra lives.

author: {'steamid': '76561198054973583', 'num_games_owned': 936, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 5836, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5827, 'last_played': 1669180311}
review:
I started on Nightmare Adventure mode straight off the bat and died at level 3 as an Elven archer. Then again, at level 12 as a Dwarven Berserker. Then, a level 47 Human Bulwark. I've played many variations of races and classes.

But... What am I now? Well, I spent all of that time on each play-through getting the requirements for unlocking a Necromancer class and the Skeleton race. Now I'm playing on Nightmare Roguelike and I just walk around maps as my skeletons, ghouls, dreads and other undead unleash hell while I stand back and maybe launch a spell every now and then.

The class and race options are likely what sold this game for me. The game can punish you pretty harshly sometimes, but if that's not what you're into, there are easier difficulties.

The developer will occasionally get drunk, join the chat, and award everyone with invincibility, give them seasonal quests from Easter, Halloween, Christmas, etc, and just be a cool guy.

Oh, and I guess the game is pretty good.

9/10 - Only problem I have is the difficulty of some of the rare and unique enemies having abilities that make them 5-10x tougher than other enemies of the same level.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972205659', 'num_games_owned': 844, 'num_reviews': 63, 'playtime_forever': 1423, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 780, 'last_played': 1664485254}
review:
One of the all-time greats. Child of Tales of Middle Earth, a child of PernAngband, a child of Zanband, a child of Angband. I've been playing this one since I was a kid and this version is by far the most interesting and unique.

Can be 99% played with a mouse alone, everything is cooldown based (even the potion/scroll stand-ins), and the tile set is not only gorgeous but actively dynamic. If you're holding a cool sword, you see a cool sword in hand etc. It's the little things that count!

Add to all this the fact that it's open source. cross platform, and easily modded and you've got a hell of a deal.

If you're on the fence, just grab the version at the main website (https://te4.org/) where the dev has it up for free.

author: {'steamid': '76561198068641845', 'num_games_owned': 223, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 1894, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 196, 'last_played': 1683298337}
review:
TOME4 feels significantly easier to get into than other TradRLs. In essence:
If you have ever played an MMO, the itemization and abilities will click for you.
If you have ever played a TTRPG, character building and leveling will click for you.
If you like both, and have struggled with Traditional Roguelikes, this might just be the game for you! :)

In more detail:
The really clean UI and the option to use your mouse for most menu actions while still maintaining a lot of keyboard control feels awesome. Animations are simple and easy to read, as are the tiles. This is the first game where I'm not opting to play ASCII. 

As for the gameplay itself, I've decided to start playing and learn the game on Nightmare Roguelike difficulty. So far, everything seems really fair. There's definitely more longevity in the early game, and you're given a decent bit of room for error in your first 10 levels. I can't exactly speak for later -- I haven't hit 10 yet. 

There doesn't seem to be a super strong punishment for not knowing builds, at least early. It feels like you have a lot of room for experimentation in each of your runs. I get the feeling I'll figure out what's good and what's not good naturally over time without a lot of frustration. 

TOME also has Metaprogression! This comes in the form of convenience items, races, and classes.

Not having 16 races and 20 classes to choose from right off the bat made my introduction to the game really pleasant. Even though not everything is unlocked, there feels like just enough to suit most playstyles from other roguelikes.

Overall, this feels like a breath of fresh air after having tried many, many, many traditional roguelikes. (This list inludes Rogue, Nethack, Sil, DCSS, Infra Arcana, Qud, ADOM, Brogue, Cogmind, and a tiny bit of Angband.)

I may have just found my favorite of the genre! :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198341756331', 'num_games_owned': 213, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 3038, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2986, 'last_played': 1663782207}
review: Tales of Maj'Eyal is probably the easiest Roguelike I've ever gotten into and that's not to say it isn't difficult cuz it really can be although this game leans more towards old school RPG's with how diverse the race and class selections are (and trust me, there are A TON OF CLASSES) plus to add on to that, every class has multiple viable playstyles within them and your race of choice will definitely have more synergy with certain classes over others. This is a very high fantasy game with humans, dwarves, elves, trolls, undead and all those archetypes you'd expect and luckily the lore is quite well written more so than the quests however if you have the DLC's there's more interesting themes added on to the original fantasy setting of the base game with the first DLC being more evil themed and the second going for a steampunk meets fantasy approach reminiscent of Arcanum: Of Steamworks and Magic Obscura (which is a great but heavily flawed game worth checking out as well) and the third DLC being Lovecraft themed and all these DLC's add more classes and races to the game while expanding on the already extensive content of the main game. The main highlight of the game is of course the tactical turn based combat that varies by which class you play and how you choose to build said class since ever class has multiple skill trees as well as passive skill trees, the classes range from what you'd expect from most fantasy RPG's to some really strange and unique ones like a time controlling warrior/ranger known as a Temporal Warden or a wizard who uses Sun and Moon magic known as an Anorithil or even a warrior with the powers of elemental dragons known as a Wyrmic, they are very creative with these classes even the more basic ones and there's significantly way more than I just mentioned but just to let you know, you have to unlock a lot of these classes since you only get a select few to start your first few runs with and they do have some oddly specific criteria's to unlock certain classes so I recommend reading the game's wiki. Despite being a Roguelike, there are modes for unlimited lives (the usual save/load or respawn after death) and limited lives (think of it as Super Mario where you got limited lives before a game over where you have to restart entirely) but personally I don't mind the traditional Permadeath in this game since it feels more rewarding to me at least knowing my build is viable enough to make it far. Also the music in this game is amazing, sure it's pretty typical fantasy game music but it ranges from very chill to sounding like an epic battle is going on, I personally like it a lot since it works with the general theme of the game anyways and most importantly this game is mostly made by one guy which is even more impressive. I highly recommend this to old school RPG fans who prefer to focus on building characters with unique and fun playstyles rather than choice and consequence, get it with all the DLC too its more than worth it considering how much content is given and it being made primarily by a solo dev.

author: {'steamid': '76561197967213633', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 44153, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 693, 'playtime_at_review': 20953, 'last_played': 1711506494}
review:
Absolutely incredible game. Mind-blowing that the creator offers it free(on the game's website) and the source code is public. 
So, so good. Turn based 'we go' system, heavy fantasy a la MTG/LotR etc with excellent itemization, class/race combinations, great writing. Interesting, compelling story that also doesn't take itself too seriously. I've played hundreds of hours and still have so much to try out. 
Several interesting/viable class and generic skill trees for each class/race.
Truly a passion project resulting from a mountain of effort. Difficulties for all types of gamers (from easier to very very hard, roguelike or multi-life modes).
Bravo

author: {'steamid': '76561198204417927', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 7717, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4787, 'last_played': 1684244966}
review:
Tales of Maj'Eyal, or ToME4, is a very complex, turn based rpg game, with ridiculous amount of achievement. Unlike a normal roguelike that have at best 2 hour before the game absolutely will kill your character, you can and have to play for 12 hour for one run, AND survive! Or you can pick infinite live mode and make the dev low key mock you for "Not playing the intended way"

Game progression always revolve around carefully grinding every single enemy in all map with a somewhat very specific sequence, less you will die a horrendous instant death. Using the item and skill you need will feel like a RNG situation where you hope that the next enemy you fight is weak enough to die in a single turn, or not, and you have to run if that happen.

There's a massive amount of build that you can choose, but knowing will it work require either trial and error, or you could just read the description for each skill, foreseeing if it work or not, then die after testing it as your character is locked into that bad set of skill. All Item is very RNG, and having the right equipment for the right skill tend to be tied to each run, but there's feature that allow you to get through this after you discover the Shertul fortress that act as a home for all of your character when unlocked.

The character is diverse, combined with a lot of background that you can choose, and most of them are terrible / challenge mode. Play as Elf, Dwarf, Orc, Human, Taller human, Skelly, Undead, and some more i can't remember. Some of the character and background are locked with achievement, but to know how to unlock them will require googling. The build you can choose is diverse, but at higher difficulty you have to use specific build to survive.

The story...are not memorable, the npc.. i don't remember anything, my memory of this game is filled with agony of each unfair death, as if it was supposedly avoidable but i failed to do so. Trial and error will be your only memory of this game.

The build, the skill is not all you need to survive. In this game after playing for long time you will gain wisdom to know the strategy for each situation. Like you are not supposed to open locked door unless you are overpowered, or near endgame there's a door that must NOT be opened at any time, taunting enemy so you can 1v1, and many more.

And for the final score...
8/10
The dev are making me guilty for not playing at higher difficulty, and completionist must not look at achievement

author: {'steamid': '76561197979414350', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 167, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 145, 'last_played': 1661579497}
review:
Was expecting a classic-ish roguelike, but what I see here is nonsense with ugly tile graphics, a microtransaction menu, spammy public chat like in an MMO and reminders to buy DLC.

The game itself appears to be extremely heavy on stat numbers and theorycrafting. Not sure what happened to all the supposed "Tales".

This is purely combat with all other roguelike elements "streamlined" away.

Being accustomed to ADOM, Nethack and DCSS, this just feels like a huge combat simulator with its hand up the player's wallet.

That said, the game is also available for free, so it's probably a good idea to try the non-Steam version first if you're hankering for some turn-based hack'n'slash.

Also note that the tutorial is outdated and even the first info boxes tell you keybindings that don't work.

author: {'steamid': '76561198062617798', 'num_games_owned': 268, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 10679, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10417, 'last_played': 1708141540}
review:
[h1]A LENDA[/h1]
uma absoluta masterpiece. quanto aos gráficos, o jogo possui um aspecto horrivelmente retro e à primeira impressão, parece mais um jogo mal acabado, que deixa a desejar. mas depois de se jogar dez ou quinze minutos, percebe-se que os aspectos positivos do jogo contrabalanceiam FORTEMENTE os contras. 


[h1]RESUMO[/h1]
o jogo é um RPG roguelike de turnos e o seu aspecto mais positivo é ser complexo na medida certa. você é capaz de criar builds até com aspectos antitéticos, e da maneira que quiser. conta com uma complexidade de classes absurda, por exemplo, você consegue jogar com um arqueiro especializado em facas, um guerreiro que usa magia, ou um monge que possui poderes de possuir inimigos (possessor), um mago antimagia (!), etc, etc, etc. tudo é possível. são tantas as opções, que estatisticamente dizendo, é capaz de você criar uma classe com combinação de talentos jamais antes usada.

não se engane, esse jogo é um indie, é um jogo de nicho. mas apesar disso, faz muito bem o seu papel em entreter e em desafiar o jogador diante das mais diferentes situações e cenários. não existe build perfeita: se você toma proveito de uma build forte no começo, ela certamente será fraca em algum momento do jogo e vice-versa, te obrigando a utilizar abordagens diferentes para vencer os seus desafios - que por muitas vezes, serão obrigatórios para prosseguir nas quests. os itens possuem tantos atributos que você é capaz de escolher qual o atributo primário que quer focar no seu personagem.


[h1]PONTOS FRACOS[/h1]
a história do jogo, apesar de poder ser desprezada, não é recomendado que se faça. são mais de onze mil linhas de história, que explicam o contexto e os motivos para os eventos acontecerem, tal como o caminho que você deve traçar. não se engane, a história como um todo é linear, mas você é livre para fazer quantas side quests que tiver oportunidade. a comunidade não está morta, visto que o idealizador do jogo (darkgod) ouve bastante as opiniões dos jogadores e trabalha nos novos updates também com base naquilo que lhe é sugerido.

por ser feito por uma equipe pequena, o jogo possui, uma vez ou outra, bugs que irritam, mas nada que autosaves ou reabrir o jogo resolvam. algo muito negativo é que ele conta com um sistema complexo de conquistas steam, dividido para cada tipo de gameplay (soft, medium, hardcore), e isso, talvez poderia ser unificado ou simplificado de alguma outra maneira. os gráficos são feios, não espere um jogo bonito. mas definitivamente espere um jogo F0D4.


[h1]TEST DRIVE GRATUITO[/h1]
o jogo consta aqui na steam, mas somente como compilado organizado de arquivos que são auto atualizados se tiver algum update. você pode baixar uma versão de graça completa na internet (no site "te4(PONTO)org") e jogar à vontade, com os mesmos recursos do que aqui. inclusive sugiro que seja feito isso, que prove o jogo de graça no site, e se achar que o jogo merece uma força, comprar por aqui.


[h1]VEREDITO[/h1]
absoluta masterpiece. sólido 10/10. recomendo fortemente.

author: {'steamid': '76561197987101941', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 75, 'playtime_forever': 6979, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6809, 'last_played': 1701122846}
review:
I know some people have dumped literally thousands of hours into this game and I know some people are going to play this and wonder how that's possible.
If you like it, you're probably going to REALLY like it. It's a game that goes as fast as you care to, everything is based off of your actions. Take as much time to plan out every encounter from each turn as you like, there are no penalties. Play as safe as you like, no one is rushing you. Be as aggressive and as risky as you like, the rewards are there to be had! 
Death, however, is unforgiving. You may receive a second chance or two, but once your luck is up, it's up. No save profiles to reload, death is final.

This is a game that brings me back, i don't really know to where or when, but it does, and it's a very nice place to visit.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994928050', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 8564, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5354, 'last_played': 1709151121}
review:
One of the best rogue-likes out there and incidently, one of the most interesting RPG's as well. 

Using a turn-based WEGO system (hooray for the 21st century, begone IGOYOUGO!) ToME asks the player to choose a class, a race and a few points to be invesed in said class before shoving you into the world of ToME. There are more classes and races to unlock and these require various achievements (mostly hidden). Each pairing of class and race has many ways to build; some certianly more effective than others. For the more intricate classes, a few deaths will be required on the players part before you begin to understand and figure out which abilities to combine/put points into and honestly, that is half the fun. You might initially feel a class sucks, only to realise on a replay that there are other tricks and combinations you didn't try. 

If you like these games for the loot, then fear not as this game is bursting at the seams with generic, graded and legenadary items to mess around with. And as I said in my opening line, this isn't just a rogue like with RPG elements; it has a proper world with its own lore and many quests to try out, so there is no risk of being turned off the game in the long run due to being shallow. Often these kinds of games struggle to find such a balance between depth of options and narrative and this is especially true of rogue likes. ToME has managed to find that sweet middle ground. 

It also has a very active developer; the official Discord is awesome (unlike most official game rooms that are toxic cesspools of basement dwellers just waiting to find something to be offended about), a nifty in-game chat room for bragging and crying over your adventures and there is heaps of more content in the form of multiple DLC.

author: {'steamid': '76561198150047696', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 27927, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8338, 'last_played': 1663333512}
review:
[h1]1. 공략 모음[/h1]
  가. 블로그
    https://tome4guide.tistory.com/
  나. 디시인사이드 로그라이크 갤러리
    https://gall.dcinside.com/board/lists?id=rlike  (톰죽, ㅌㅈ 으로 검색)
  
2. 테일즈 오브 마즈'에이알 지도 / 본편 던전 공략 순서

https://gall.dcinside.com/rlike/412955

참고1) 키보드 J키를 눌러서 퀘스트를 확인하세요. 마도사 시작퀘('너무나 광활한 공간' 던전의 마법 폭발의 후폭풍 퀘) 하는 분은 위상 관문 스킬로 섬을 옮겨 다니며 랜덤한 위치에 나타나는 3개의 웜홀에 주문 스킬을 적중 시켜야합니다. 마나 회복을 위해 몹 1마리 잡을 때마다 R키나 Shift + R키로 휴식을 취하세요.
참고2) 폭풍우 봉우리는 앙골웬 마을 안 서쪽의 npc와 퀘스트를 진행, 대화 후 입장합니다. 
전기 저항템 필수!
참고3) 발명 스킬(팅커), 아티팩트 옵션 변경 기능(리롤), 새로 추가되는 직업 때문에 Collector's Edition (모든 DLC 포함) 을 추천합니다.
참고4) 지구르 마을에서 반마법 서약을 한 캐릭터는 반마법 캐릭터로 분류되어, 마법장비 착용이 불가능합니다. 초보자는 반마법 서약 하지 마세요.
참고5) 샌드웜 굴에서 획득한 샌드웜 여왕의 심장을 사용하면 스탯 3 , Class points 1 , Generic points 1 , 자연의 권능 / 조화 기술계열(Category)를 얻게 됩니다.
참고6) 세계지도의 랜덤한 위치에서 나타나는 NPC 은둔자 - 아그림레이를 먼저 만나서 직업기술(Class points) 2 점을 주는 연금술사 형제단 퀘스트를 가장 먼저하세요. 퀘 완료시 인벤토리에 집중의 영약이 넣어집니다. 그 다음 마지막희망 마을 안 5시방향 건물의 웅그롤의 집에서 퀘스트를 진행하면 일반기술(Generic point) 2점을 주는 기초의 영약을 줍니다. 그리고 엘발라 마을 중앙 건물의 말루스의 집에서 퀘스트를 진행하면 능력치(stats) 4점을 주는 기술의 영약을 줍니다. 위 3가지 퀘 모두 미리 받아 놓는 게 가능합니다. 이후 연퀘는 취향 따라 보상 받으세요. (미라화된 뼈는 고대 엘프의 폐허에서 구할수 있음, 고렙존)
참고7) 데르스 마을 안의 NPC 수상한 코르낙 남성과 대화하여 투기장 퀘스트를 하세요. 일반기술(Generic points) 2를 줍니다. 14렙이 되기 전에 꼭 투기장 퀘스트 하세요. 14렙에 폭풍우 마을 퀘스트가 시작되며 NPC가 모두 죽을 수 있습니다.
참고8) 폐허가 된 하플링 복합 단지(4) 에서 한길을 구할 경우, 정신 내성+15, 혼돈 저항 10%를 얻습니다.
참고9) 일부 직업은 전투 기술 / 전투 훈련이 열려 있지 않습니다. '마지막 희망' 마을에서 구입할 수 있습니다. 활/투석﻿구/총기 사용에 필요한 사격 기술도 '마지막 희망' 마을에서 구입할 수 있습니다.

3. 세이브 파일 백업 해놓는 방법
- 테일즈 오브 마즈'에이알은 스팀 클라우드를 지원하지 않습니다. 세이브 파일을 평소에 백업해두시기 바랍니다.
C:\사용자\윈도우 계정 이름\T-Engine\4.0\tome
이 tome 폴더를 압축해서 따로 저장해 두세요.

4. Tales of Maj'eyal 체험판
https://te4.org/download

5. == [팅커(발명 스킬) 해금법] ==
https://tome4guide.tistory.com/#5tip

장비에 붙이는 부착물, 일명 팅커(발명)가 사기라서 DLC - Embers of Rage 는 구매 필수입니다.
캠페인: 오크:분노의 잉걸불을 선택하고 발명가 - 톱도살자와 총잡이 두 캐릭 모두 전초기지까지 깨서 동대륙(본대륙)으로 갈 다리를 열어야만 팅커가 해금됩니다.

스팀 창작마당에서 Select your Escorts 와 Escorts Enhanced, ZOMnbibus 를 게임 시작전에 구독하세요.

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=588789394
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=295210042
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=203060064
 
6. == 팅커 사용하기 ==
https://gall.dcinside.com/rlike/394246

위 6번을 따라 팅커(발명가)를 해금했다면, 캐릭터를 만들고 Escorts(호위) 선택지에 발명가가 보일겁니다. 순서 정할 때 1번으로 나오게 하기 위해 제일 먼저 누릅니다. 발명가는 1번 밖에 안나옵니다. 호위 실패하면 새캐릭으로 다시 시작해야합니다.
호위 순서를 잘못 지정했다면 ESC키를 눌러서 맨 위의 Escorts (again)을 눌러주세요.

호위 도달 지점은 Tab키를 누른 후 마우스로 이동, 확인할 수 있습니다. Tab키를 두 번 누르면 미니맵이 원위치됩니다.
호위가 완료되면 선택지가 나오는데 제일 아래쪽의 발명가의 위치를 알려달라고 합시다. 
그러면 세계 지도에 발명가의 대가 동굴이 나오는데 Category Point를 아꼈다가 20렙 쯤에 가서 몹을 잡고 길을 뚫은 후, 맵 중앙의 기계장치 상점에게서 500골드와 Category Point 1을 주고 배웁시다. 

참고) 발명 스킬(팅커)을 배우면 자동으로 아이템을 변환 상자가 아닌, 휴대용 자동 추출기로 녹이게 됩니다. 쉐르툴 요새의 기능 해금을 위해 에너지가 필요할 때는 인벤토리의 퀘스트 아이템 탭에서 다시 변환 상자를 사용하여 아이템을 녹여주세요.

7. 추천 애드온(창작마당) 
== ZOmnibus Addon Pack ==
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=203060064

옵션 설명) https://gall.dcinside.com/rlike/351819

개인적 추천 설정 - [ZOmnibus 아래 목록 이외에는 다 꺼짐을 추천합니다. 일부 애드온은 충돌 오류가 잘 나니 문제발생시 하나씩 끄고 켜보면서 해결하세요.]

Auto-transmo gems - 없음(취향 따라 선택. 보석을 자동으로 팔지 여부)
When to auto-transmo-gems - After link
Keep auto-extracted gems - 던전 끝나고 자동으로 판매(변환)하지 않고 남길 보석을 선택. No Gems는 판매 안하겠다는 것
Adventurers party respons strategy - Ask 혹은 Always Evade (모험가 무리 항상 피하기)
Orc patro response strategy - Ask 혹은 Always Evade (항상 피하기)
Sunwall patrol response strategy - Ask 혹은 Always Evade (항상 피하기)
Open talent point planner on character creation (활성화 Alt+Shift+G, 스킬 플래너)
Sort unlearnt talent trees by name - 켜짐
Store wish list tracker popup (활성화 Alt+Shift+W , 상점에서 아이템 위에서 Ctrl + Enter)
Alternate zones - Block all 혹은 Force all (알트존이라고 랜덤 굴입니다. 미궁 알트존이 어려우니 쉽게하려면 Block)
Sort gems by tier - 켜짐
유지버프 설정(Restart sustains)은 Alt+Shift+S 를 누르세요. 
Wall clock format - 시계
No hotkeys in chat dialog - 켜짐
Clear tooltips on focus change - 켜짐
Display effects under actors 켜짐(저사양 컴 추천, Experimental 은 건드리지 마세요)
특이)
Hotkey handling on unwield - remove
Roguelike keybidings - uninstalled
Use-item dialog shortscuts - 0/0 (오류남, 건드리지 마세요.)

8. 랜덤 아티팩트 아이템 옵션 변경하는 방법 - '리롤'하는 법 (DLC - Forbidden Cult 필요)
https://gall.dcinside.com/rlike/386317
주의!) 이상한 차원문 동굴에 들어가자마자 쪽지하나가 보이는데 읽으면 문양4개가 보일 겁니다. 메모해두세요. 문양 4개를 조작하면 동굴 중앙의 장치를 통해 랜덤던전에 들어갈 수 있습니다

17. 보석의 용도
  가. 상점행 (기절,빙결 저항 빼고 대부분의 1~3티어 보석)
  나. 발명(팅커) 제작 재료 (다이아몬드 등)
  다. 특정 직업(정신파괴자, 연금술사)이 스킬에 사용
  라. 반지, 목걸이, 몸통, 허리띠에 박을 수 있습니다.
    1) 반지 - 앙골웬 보석상인, 동대륙 NPC가 박아줌, 아티팩트는 불가능. 기존 옵션 사라지니 주의
    2) 목걸이 - 동대륙 특수퀘를 깨면 가능
    3) 몸통 - 암석의 연금술 카테고리를 열면 가능
    4) 허리띠 - 특수기술 찍으면 가능
  참고1) 앙골웬 보석 상인에게서 반지와 목걸이 제작시 랜덤하게 파템, 보라템, 랜덤 유니크가 나옴. 결과물은 재료가 되는 반지의 색깔/옵션 무관, 오직 등급만 관련
  참고2) 동대륙 보석상인(리미르) 퀘스트 - 잊혀진 지식 , 달의 골짜리(협곡) 스톤헨지에서 퀘스트템(소환의 두루마리) 사용

author: {'steamid': '76561197992865480', 'num_games_owned': 280, 'num_reviews': 92, 'playtime_forever': 52554, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 50, 'last_played': 1671694630}
review:
公式日本語有り
ゲームオプションは最初は英語だが
ゲーム内でオプション開くと日本語になる

ほぼ変わんないフリー版があるので、買う前に試した方がいい
違いは共有倉庫が使える、クラスが1つ解放される、DLCが使えるだと思います
私が良いと思う買い方はフリー版で試して気に入ったら、
全部入りセットをセールの時に買うという方法です
別にセールじゃなくてもいいです、十分その価値はあります
はまったらDLC全部ほしくなるのでいきなり全部入りでOK

正直、無料と有料版の詳しい違いとか
オンラインアカウント作るとどんなメリットがあるのかとかよくわからない

分かってる限りではオンラインはオンラインイベントがある
チャットで実績取得や死亡ログが全世界に公開（他のプレイヤーの情報も見える）
公式HPに自キャラのキャラシートが公開などなどです
チャット欄がちょっと邪魔ですね、チャット欄だけ消したい
自キャラのキャラシートは使ってるAddon(＝MOD)、難易度、スキルその他
ほぼ全てのゲーム内情報を確認できる
オンラインであれば常に更新され、死亡済、プレイ中、クリア済キャラを見れる
検索もでき他プレイヤーの高難易度の
アーチャーのクリアキャラが見たいなと思ったら
その条件で検索すれば参照できる
MODの追加難易度・クラスにも対応してるので
MOD追加クラスで検索することもできる

ただナイトメア難易度のクリアキャラでも
入れているMODによっては額面通りの難易度とは限らない

このキャラデータは一部ゲーム内の言語で表示される
（スキルやアイテム等、日本語でプレイ中なら日本語で表示）
日本語でプレイしてるキャラデータは英語日本語混合で
外国の人が見てもわからんかも
中国語のキャラデータとか英語中国語混合でわかんない
アイコンがあるから辛うじてスキルとかはわかる

スキル・アイテムの名前とかは意訳されてます
このゲームの情報って基本的に日本にはなくて
解説情報も攻略情報もビルドも英語圏の情報頼りなんで
そのまんまカタカナ直訳名詞とかにしてくれた方がよかったかも
ほとんどの攻略情報は英語だから
意訳された日本語訳とスキル・アイテム名が違うので？？？ってなる
日本語なのはとってもありがたいんですが

ストーリー関係の文書とかは意訳のおかげで読みやすい

ターン性ローグライク
消耗品はなくてスキルと装備アイテムで攻略していく
消費アイテムとかはない為、育成メイン
育成に失敗したらマジでどうにもならない
格上や苦手なタイプに相対した際シレンみたいにアイテム使って
切り抜けるみたいなことは難しいと思う
とりあえず緊急回避して他のところで育成して再挑戦みたいな
やばい奴にあった時どう切り抜けるかみたいな情報があんまない
たぶん英語圏にはある、まぁ逃げるしかないと思う

ゲームバランス等は細かく調整されている（と思うたぶん）

自動探索機能があるためサクサク遊べる、自動探索機能最高
といってもまぁクリアまで20時間以上かかるのでそれほどサクサクでもない
慣れているプロローグライクプレイヤーなら別

パラメータが敵味方ともにシークレットではない
敵味方自キャラの能力は普通にほとんどプレイ中に見れる
これ超重要、これのおかげで私のような素人でも自分で考えてビルドを作れる！
ただ一部のパラメータ（Luckなど）は隠されてる、見せてください
ただスキルの説明がよくわからないというのが時々ある

余計な部分をそぎ落として、ノーストレスを目指して要る様に見える
問答無用で名作で楽しい

ただし一部ダンジョンはストレス（砂虫の巣とか）
パズル要素のある崩壊したダンジョンとか
ダンジョンに仕掛けられてる罠は自動探索を妨げるだけできつい
NPC護衛クエストの救出対象NPCが
敵モンスターに突っ込んでいくのが意味不明
Solipsistのアンロックもきつい（難易度の高い運ゲー）
いくつかのきつい部分はMODでなんとかなる

ウィンドウ切替てもバックグラウンドで動き続けるのがつらい
止まって

エキスパンションモード（残機無限）は
タレントのポイントの振り直しができるので
慣れないうちはエキスパンションモードでいいかもしれない
ゾンビ戦法でごり押しできちゃうので死んだら
ワールドマップに出るなどの自己縛りをしたほうがいいと思う

author: {'steamid': '76561198026787753', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 564, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 190, 'last_played': 1690335962}
review:
Awesome roguelike - it is difficult but fair, has plenty to explore, lots of customization options, and even has some online capabilities in that you can chat with other players and see how their campaigns are going via announcements. You can also have this turned off should that not be your style. Been surprised with how much I like some of the classes that I otherwise might not have tried at all in other games. There is lots of depth to building your character out.

One of the greats in the roguelike genre.

review: This game is a pure gem in the entire genre. I've been a huge fan of ToME ever since it was called Tales of Middle Earth. This rendition of game is great, has some very deep systems, steep difficulty level and huge replayability potential. If you're a fan of classic rougelikes from back in the days, you're going to love this one.

review:
1. Play ToME
2. Choose Insane/madness difficulty
3. Play as everything you like
4. Then, get attacked by 6 green slimes on level 10 at the same time
5. Die
6. Crying and mental breakdown
7. Repeat

100/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198134995874', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 25186, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10807, 'last_played': 1708316483}
review:
Let's get a couple things out of the way first:
Does this game look like it was made in MS Paint?  Yes.  Yes it does.
Is it disgustingly difficult?  Sure.
Am I still finding new lore, unlocks, and strategies after 180 hours on the steam version plus untold hours on the free version?  Yup.
TOME has a disgustingly huge amount of content, even before you add the expansions.  And even when you finally figure out one build that can survive and thrive in the unforgiving bloodbath that is TOME, that's just one of hundreds of unique builds that all play differently and require different strategies to master.  So whether you're playing an orcish sawbutcher carving a path forward in a shower of blood and shrapnel or an elvish necromancer ghostwalking at the head of a ravenous undead horde, you're going to have a great time.  Highly recommended.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007479341', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 5375, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5328, 'last_played': 1704583680}

author: {'steamid': '76561198056323288', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 16389, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9144, 'last_played': 1707836394}
review:
This quite possibly might just be the best game ever made.
I find myself playing other games, trotting through the endless steam libraries only to be disappointed it's not ToME.
The only negative thing about this game (apart from maybe learning curve) is that it will ruin you.
It will make you long for more content, because you already played for hundreds of hours and even the most ambitious of roguelikes will run stale after that much time.
Oh how the heart will start to long for a ToME 5.
I simultaneously recommend this game with every piece of my bone marrow and also would advise any and all brave adventurers to stay awake from this cursed contraption of a game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198031986652', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 14450, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 13085, 'last_played': 1703906406}

author: {'steamid': '76561198318717301', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 730, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9, 'last_played': 1710861195}
review: Played for a couple hundred hours before buying the Steam version, can confirm this game is amazing, complex character builds and incredibly deep, tactical combat. On higher difficulties there is endless fun with randomly generated enemies and items (this shows up way less on normal), so if you've got the hang of the game I'd recommend sliding it up even if you can't beat it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198003058668', 'num_games_owned': 440, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 20991, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 14059, 'last_played': 1698452309}
review: If you like just playing games this one is not for you. You really have to like to learn games in order to enjoy the Tales of Maj'Eyal. There are a lot of nuances and mechanics which safely covered by deceptive simplistic game flow. And when your character dies one more time, you ask yourself why. You find no answer, you ask others and find out that you did too many mistakes. And you learn to do it right. And you are really thinking about it and plotting to kill all those bastards, that one-turn melted, burned, frozen to death, tore apart and butchered your precious, cherished elves, dwarfs, writhing ones, etc. And one day they pay with their blood, limbs and guts, every one of them pays and begs you to spare their useless beautifully designed tiles. And that is your sweet revenge done. The dish best served cold, like an ice cream, they say. And you'll come back for even more ice cream, I promise.

author: {'steamid': '76561197963605503', 'num_games_owned': 222, 'num_reviews': 61, 'playtime_forever': 4594, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 47, 'last_played': 1708498965}
review:
Fun roguelike, beat the tutorial dungeon accidentally sold all my weapons. Didnt realize until I was fighting a wizard who killed me. Woops lol, excited to make a new character and jump in again. lots of customization/gear options looking forward to playing this more.

Edit at 40 hours: Still having fun, this is a game you play over several sessions (many hours to beat the game). I would really recommend normal mode even if you are looking for a roguelike. Normal gives you limited respawns instead of just one life. But as a new player starting out you will get one shot by things, and it can be frustrating to lose hours of progress because of 1 mistake. Save roguelike mode for when youre more experienced!

Lots of classes/races to unlock. Lots of builds to try.

author: {'steamid': '76561199239530988', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 4732, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2251, 'last_played': 1699630932}
review:
一部のモンスターの強さが常軌を逸しており、バランス崩壊してますね。こういうのは「硬派」とは言いません。「理不尽」と言います。好きな方には刺さるでしょうが、私はこういうの大嫌いです。何よりも、そういうモンスターに対する対処法が「ゾンビアタック」ぐらいしかないのがもうやばいですね。これ作者さん「あかん」と思わなかったのが不思議なぐらい。
さすがにもう少しゲーム性というものを意識したほうがいいのでは？

追記
「さすがに簡単に諦めたらだめだよな？」と思い、しばらくプレイしていたのですが「堕ちた騎士アルイン」というボスと戦っていたら、メインウェポンであったタイタンフィストが突如としてロスト。「武装解除食らったのかな？」と思ったのですが、そいつを倒しても、持ち物欄を確認してもどこにもなく、文字通り完全にロストしました。
ふざけてんのか？ここまでどれだけ頑張ったと思ってんだ？最悪ですね。二度とプレイしません。あいつに「武器を破壊する」なんていう能力が備わっていたのでしょうか？だとしたら完全にやりすぎです。マジでゲーム性というものを考えろや作者。

author: {'steamid': '76561197993886755', 'num_games_owned': 1181, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 6218, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3485, 'last_played': 1684607347}
review:
I'm not huge on roguelikes  in a general sense, personally. I think they're often kind of a fiddly pain in the ass in a lot of aspects, and frustrating in others (permadeath + rng = huge potential for a random schmuck to wipe your save because he just happened to get modifiers that made him infinistrong relative to your character's build/level).

TOME manages to avoid that feeling for me. There's some light progression systems in class/race unlocks (and at least one item I've found that is a persistent unlock that loads in with new characters after you find it,) that can give you something to strive for in a meta-sense, and while yes, I have been shafted pretty hard by RNG at least once or twice (An enemy in a crypt spawned with 1.5k health, massive resistances, a shield with a large bar that could be cast near back to back for their purposes, a big free heal that had no limit beyond cooldown and a summonable healing pillar... etc.) overall it has a good curve, a lot of pathing options, a lot of character building options, classes that are BOTH fun and feel distinct from one another, writing that's oftentimes really neat if a little sparse at times...

This is a treat, I guess is what I'm trying to say. This kind of game is often pretty far out of my wheelhouse, but this happens to hit the perfect place in a lot of different 'zones' that make me keep coming back and spending entire evenings/workdays playing for one more dungeon, one more run.

author: {'steamid': '76561198171919637', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 3298, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3143, 'last_played': 1679012550}
review:
[h1]NOTA 7,5/10[/h1]

O jogo é bom , é um Roguelike tradicional de turnos , tem poucos elementos sandbox só pra dizer que tem , as classes são bem diversas e diferentes , as raças nao fazem tanta diferença no final , mas no final a classe mais quebrada é o Adventurer 

os mapas são sem segredo , geralmente não faz diferença 
os inimigos são pouco explorados, a não ser que vc esteja na dificuldade nightmare , não vai ter tanta dificuldade , os únicos inimigos que me deram trabalho foram uns dragões que invocam uma copia sua com as mesmas skills e atributos que vc

as batalhas contra boss são até divertidas, geralmente eles tem magia de cura , então vc tem que encaixar uma estratégia pensando nisso , e usar as habilidades de debuffs com cuidado e no momento certo, cada turno importa

o crafting existe , mas não é mt legal , não bem aproveitado , muito limitado
o mesmo da pra dizer dos equipamentos , um equipamento tem milhares de atributos, mas o que vai importar no fim das contas é só uns 3 ou 4 

o sistema de runas é legal , você dropa uma runa que tem uma skill, vc "implanta" essa runa no seu corpo e pode usar a skill quando quiser , porem se for colocar outra, vc perde a anterior (da pra ter até 5 diferentes) 

existe vários itens únicos com habilidades ativas , vc não precisa equipar eles, só de ter no inventario ja da pra usar as habilidades deles , embora só uns 2 ou 3 únicos me ajudaram de fato

as quests são legais , e bem simples , geralmente se resumem a buscar algum item , ou matar algum boss, porem as recompensas são horríveis , umas 3 quest me deram pontos de habilidade (que foi o melhor) , mas a lore do jogo é boa!

a DLC dos orcs nao tem nada de novo RELEVANTE , é uma campanha diferente , mapa diferente, mas é tudo igual...mas não quer dizer que seja ruim 

o Sistema de Dungeon infinita é meio sem balanceamento e sem proposito , é meio que um "desce ae até onde tu aguenta, mas tu vai morrer! , porque sim" você não ganha nada com isso. 

as lojas dos NPCS só vendem itens inúteis...sério , não usei nada deles , é irrelevante no endgame comprar item TIER 5 ego++ , sendo que vc dropa UNICO TIER 5 à-vontade no endgame

o dinheiro no jogo num serve pra muita coisa, quase nada na verdade , tem uns NPCS que te treinam e liberam skills pra vc , ajuda bastante dependendo a sorte , porem é só. 

o Multiplayer nao devia existir , é simplesmente ruim , assim como as features Online , só atrapalham o jogo
depositei uns itens no "baú online" e tenho dificuldade de acessar ele no jogo

o jogo num te permite farmar, então se tu curte grindar level e itens , lascou.

o jogo podia ter um New Game+, é broxante depois que vc chega level máximo e fica com um equipamento descente, nao resta nada pra vc fazer  [spoiler] a nao ser zerar o jogo e sacrificar o personagem na quest final  [/spoiler]

enfim , o jogo podia ser muito melhor aproveitado, vamos ver futuramente como vai ser.
mas se voce ta procurando um roguelike legal , esse daqui é, e vai render varias horas de gameplay e vc vai morrer duns jeitos muito estranho.

author: {'steamid': '76561198018544055', 'num_games_owned': 1531, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 10332, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8720, 'last_played': 1689028475}
review:
145 hours and just got my first win, so it's time to write a review!

Tales of Maj'Eyal is a very cool rogue-like. It doesn't have a lot of complexities that other rogue-likes like Nethack have, there's no need to deal with mechanics like hunger and there's no "scumming" - you're not gonna pile up a bunch of items and transmogrify them, or transform yourself into a worm to eat a ring to gain its power. Instead, your power comes from ~skill trees~! It's like an entire RPG over here! There's an impressively large amount of classes and races, and variety even within those classes, that every new character I've tried has felt fresh and for the most part, a lot of fun. The game also has a difficulty mode that gives you a significant amount of extra lives, if permadeath isn't entirely your thing.

If you're interested in summoning swarms of undead, time travel, subjecting your enemies to the horrors of entropy, bare-fisted combo attacks, using the power of hate to curse everything around you, using your massive brain to twist reality, becoming a mage that REALLY likes beam attacks, or being an anti-magical sludge summoner covered in fungus, this is the game for you!

author: {'steamid': '76561198013421261', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 3763, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2406, 'last_played': 1679538761}
review:
Very complex dungeon-crawling roguelike. No food system - the game is balanced around coming to each fight fully healed up and ready to rumble, so as your character grows in ability, encounters start to become incredibly hairy.
There's a huge variety of classes/races available, and most classes have gotten at least one overhaul during the game's lifetime, so pretty much everything's playable. Races are a little less so, but not by so much that you can't make do. More recent stuff tends to be more complex and work better - Necromancer got a full overhaul just recently.
Traditional consumables are replaced by cooldown-limited infusions and runes. The space saved in the inventory is replaced by the enormous amounts of trash loot you scoop up. Shops in the game are very important - you can buy access to utility skill-groups, and shops are a reliable source of the cooldown-limited consumables I just mentioned.
The game's Angband roots show in the item system - there are an awful lot of elemental and status resistances to keep track of. Status resistances, in particular, are vital - getting to 100% stun and/or silence immunity is a big breakpoint in QoL for some classes.
Difficulty settings are very important. The default is Adventure mode, which gives you some extra lives based on story progression, which is nice for reasons I will touch on shortly. Then there's Roguelike (perma-death, etc), and after that... well, difficulty settings after that are for people who enjoy pain. Oh, Nightmare isn't quite as hard as you'd think because more and better loot drops, but after that, good luck. I don't think every class has even cleared the top difficulty level yet, it's that rough.
The main reason Adventure mode is the default difficulty is because of rare monsters. The game takes a base monster type, and then slaps one or more classes on it. The higher the difficulty, the more classes get added. As a result, the power of rare and unique monsters varies wildly. Some combinations are actively counterproductive for the monster, others will one-shot your max-level geared-to-the-gills superhero before you even get a chance to read the tooltip. It is customary to screenshot the most ridiculous murdermachine rares you see, to share with your fellows.
I got distracted, bored now. If you like dungeon-crawling with extremely complex and distinct character classes, TOME4 will last you a very, very long time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198382876245', 'num_games_owned': 566, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 1071, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 162, 'last_played': 1694008729}
review:
A powerful artifact from a time when "roguelike" actually meant "games like Rogue", Tales of Maj'Eyal is one of the best dungeon crawlers I've had the pleasure of playing. if you can't get past limited animation and tile-based graphics, then you may find this a hurdle, but those who are comfortable with such a thing will have themselves a pretty juicy roguelike experience.

Unlike say, Nethack, TOME has far more of a focus on building your character and methodical use of skills and tools, rather than using items. Each class in the game is insanely meaty, containing multiple skill trees that allow you to customize them to your taste. Many classes have mechanics unique to them that make their flow a lot more interesting than just "cast damage spell, repeat" - for example, one of my favorites, Necromancer, has various summons that require "souls" - a resource unique to them that is gained from absorbing the life force of enemies, as well as a passive that allows them to live even when their health is in the negatives. One of the most interesting classes, Paradox Mage, manipulates a force called "paradox" - your abilities get stronger as it increases, but the potential for anomalies that distort you and possibility get you hurt in a crucial situation also increases.

As far as tile-based roguelikes go, the visual polish on this one sticks out too. Your character has a paper doll like visual, so any armor and weapons you pick up actually appear on their graphic. All spells and skills have icons you can discern at a glance. There's various particle effects to indicate sprays of fire, auras, necrotic air, etcetc. It's still basically not animated at all, as other games of its kind are, but it's definitely a lot more pleasant in presentation than the usual ASCII @-sign grid.

The classes, gameplay, and overall polish make for a genuinely enthralling and surprisingly modern experience (as modern as a roguelike can get, anyway). The game itself is actually free, but i'm more than willing to pay money for it to have it in my library considering how much work has been done to it. Check it out!

author: {'steamid': '76561198006941898', 'num_games_owned': 397, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 7642, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7642, 'last_played': 1652171546}
review:
it's basically a turn based diablo game.  It was marketed as  a rogue like with differences based on what race and job you pick, but the impact of both is minimal at best, 95% of the game is the same no matter what race/job you pick.

Don't get me wrong if you enjoy turn based diablo games stuffed with 99% useless loot that you sell, you will enjoy it.  

I also don't reccomend playing anything but exploration mode that gives infinite lives.  Rogue likes are supposed to be fair.  As in if you die it's because of a mistake you made.  This game kills you while lying to you.  going to a zone that says it's a level 30-40 zone, and then opening a door in the dungeon to find level 90 dragons that one shot you?

Yeah that's common in this game.  It's deliberately and goes out of its way to be as unfair and bullkrap as possible.

Again, if you like that kind of thing this is your game, I do not. I beat this game, and in exploration mode only, I died over 100 times.  The game as the developers intend it only gives you  a max of 5 or so lives.  You have to be a special kind of masochist to enjoy the pain it offers.

author: {'steamid': '76561198144136865', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 185, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 185, 'last_played': 1652023351}
review:
NOT RECOMMENDED FOR MAC USERS

As far as I know this is a problem only met by mac users. If you are a pc gamer, don't take it into consideration

The main and only problem I have with this game is that the video configuration is bugged for mac users. The display is not consistent from one launch of the game to the other. Whatever resolution I choose, The action bar in the lower part of the screen is always either cropped or not visible at all. The game can start as a windowed mode or full screen despite selecting the other option. It is as messy as it sounds and I can't figure the logic of it at all. The help I found online wasn't enough to make it work properly on my computer.

After 2 hours of try and error, I am giving up and waiting for a better mac support of this game before launching it again.

I also had a weird glitch where my mouse click were doubled so I could not use checkbox as it would check and uncheck it at the same time.

The small part of the real gameplay I saw seemed fun but my configuration problems prevented me from enjoying it very much.

author: {'steamid': '76561197979579620', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 15116, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10333, 'last_played': 1703664730}
review:
I have so many things to say about this game, without having the skill to write a concise review that lives up to the game, so I'll just set out some of my favorite features for you as well as the couple things I like less about the game.

Love it: A whole lot of different classes / races / skills - tons of variety in character creation / evolution. A huge number of monsters, and excellent procedural generation with many alternate zones (which come with their own boss and mobs) and monsters. I've played the starting zones dozens of times and I still occasionally get a surprise. Lots of random side dungeons with their own little quest / lore. Writing is good, some stuff is really wholesome / funny like the Trollish poem "I like to club". It's about how this troll likes to club various things to eat. Big world - I thought the game was the first 2 sets of dungeons - lmao, that's more of a prologue. You're not finishing a run in one session (unless you die). If you play on Roguelike difficulty (ie no respawns whatsoever unless you find ... 1 of 2 very rare consumables) even normal difficulty is quite hard if you aren't using an optimized build. I'm probably not doing it justice - it's a great game though.

Stuff I dislike: Sometimes it just feels like the game decides it's time for you to die and, well, get fucked. You very rarely run into truly IMPOSSIBLY situations, but like, once in a long while you'll open a chest in a level 10 area and a level 25 slime'll pop out and be like SUP BITCH!? So, not all deaths feel great. A small complaint which is common among roguelikes and this is no different; You'll rarely find anything useful in shops, so outside of a few quest interactions I've come across gold feels pretty useless. On the bright side, the game does a great job of bulk selling all your junk so at least its not a time consuming process.

One quick tip for anyone thinking of buying ToME - If you don't like the graphics, try using the Sharpen feature in the options. Honestly, I hate to say it, but the visuals really put me off at first - it felt muddled and it was hard to tell what was what. Once I found that feature though, I started finding the game actually quite pretty. Personally, I really like 6-7 sharpness, so give that a try. It's all personal preference, but it can make a HUGE difference in how the game presents and a big QoL improvement imo.

author: {'steamid': '76561198265630325', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 8173, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8173, 'last_played': 1651784196}
review:
Highly recommended! I almost never finish games, because I'm busy and easily get sidetracked. But I played the original game and the Embers of Rage expansion all the way through to the end. Intriguing, entertaining, and satisfying game! I paid about $14 for 137 hours of game time! Kudos to the developer, for whom this is clearly a labor of love. Note: there is a lot of lore, some of it lengthy, but it's worth reading because there are stories within stories, it is very well written, and it has funny little jokes interspersed in the text.

 I am going to take a break now but may well come back in the future to play a different kind of character. Oh, and the tinkering stuff in the expansion is great fun and very clever. The attention to detail... well, just awesome. It's such fun to play the Gunslinger and roam around shooting things with Explosive Shots!

I think this game ranks right up there with some of the very best games of all time. Give it a try!

author: {'steamid': '76561198301832536', 'num_games_owned': 393, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 3457, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 169, 'last_played': 1680182289}
review:
非常好玩的Rogue游戏！看到这游戏的画面时一下就被吸引到了，复古的画面加上简单的操作方式，可以说游玩体验十分舒适。游戏内有多种职业以及种族，内容以及相当丰富了，这些内容都包含在这个1.5G的小体量游戏中。
喜欢Rogue的玩家且能接受画面的可以直接入了，不可多得的好游戏。
（话说游戏内商城有闲钱可以支持一下。）

review: A nice mix of generation and similarity with how the overworld and locations works. Diverse classes and many builds based on level points, class, and gear aquired. Decent mob diversity, though like many roguelikes they become somewhat bland later on despite this (if your build becomes strong enough). That said, you will die over and over and over, but that is a core aspect of the genre. This is probably the best rogue like I have played in general.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041998416', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 6604, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 39, 'playtime_at_review': 2282, 'last_played': 1712202859}
review:
From the past, I had ignored this game because it is not my kind of game, but as this point, upon watching people play this game, I got curious and wanting to try it out. Then my friend gifted me this game, along with  the dlcs, and after trying them out, I became speechless. I couldn't stop playing this game for hours because how good and addicting it is. So many classes to choose with different styles and builds, and I have died countless times, but I'm slowly learning. I regret ignoring this game so many years ago, and I'm happy to be able to play this game now.

A really fun roguelike game. Give it a go, You'll never stop playing it!

author: {'steamid': '76561198951735495', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 3416, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1736, 'last_played': 1677426834}
review:
Стоит игра сущие копейки, и при этом наполнения там очень много. Отталкивало отсутствие локализации, но на данный момент есть хорошая локализация в мастерской на основную игру и дополнение с демонами.

Как новичок в рогаликах и до этого игравший всего несколько часов в оригиналтную "Rouge" с переведчиком, могу сказать что эта игра очень хороша.

Играю естественно с в режиме роуглайк на кошмаре)

10 сливов по твоей глупости из 10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198140056203', 'num_games_owned': 170, 'num_reviews': 64, 'playtime_forever': 17980, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 17980, 'last_played': 1610820363}
review: ToME is a challenging game wherein you quest about the land of Maj'Eyal, a large continent with factions, dungeons, lore and topped with a plethora of classes, skills, and items to choose and choices that effect the narrative. As the game is fairly challenging, you'll die early on, learn from your past mistakes, test out new classes and skills until you find what is right for you and begin conquering larger swathes of the game. In normal mode, you have a finite number of lives available before perma-death kicks in and as Darkest Dungeon so aptly reminds us, "Overconfidence can be a slow and insidious killer". For those looking for something more forgiving gameplay, ToME has a "Story Mode" which gives you infinite lives. Although the graphics aren't the greatest, they serve the core game well in what is an overall compelling experience.

author: {'steamid': '76561198358577496', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 132, 'playtime_forever': 16900, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6973, 'last_played': 1687022268}

review:
The game is great.... Overall.... 

But in details it sucks..... 

You may drown on full air, if you were left without air for even a turn. 
Or die, despite having a working revival. 

The core of the game is random, even if you act extremely cautiously. 

Prepare to have lots of frustrating deaths, that were never meant to happen.... 
And try to have fun <3

review:
I bought this game less than 5 days ago. I don't know exactly how long it's been, time has lost all meaning.

Every time I think I know what I want from this game it shows me something it hadn't yet, or I just didn't notice. I wanted to unlock the other psion classes. Now I'm running through the woods pummeling hordes upon hordes of varied woodland critters with my bare fists and basically suplexing giants. 

This game has shown me things I had no idea I wanted, from the game itself, and from life in general.

I will never be the same

review: Very fun game, be prepared to spend a lot of time on single runs only to lose them. The challenge of the game adds a very high level of value to the information you gain through lore and just experimenting. The world is very complex and getting further is always rewarding. If you like Civilization or Hades, or obviously Dungeons and Dragons, I think you'd love this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198068037864', 'num_games_owned': 480, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 6277, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6264, 'last_played': 1709829568}
review:
Здравствуй мой дорогой друг, позволь мне рассказать тебе об одной из моих любимых игр.

Перво наперво скажу, что в игру можно поиграть совершенно бесплатно! Ты можешь прямо сейчас зайти на сайт игры, скачать её и опробовать. А после уже решить стоит ли брать её или нет. За покупку тебе всего лишь дадут один уникальный игровой класс (который с выходом новых длс можешь измениться, такое уже случалось).


Русский язык отсутствует, но энтузиасты уже перевели игру и все длс к ней. Русификатор можно сказать в мастерской стима, или на сайте разработчика.

А теперь можно поговорить об игры, Tales of Maj'Eyal - игра жанра рогалик, а значит тебе мой дорогой друг придётся умирать, умирать, и ещё раз умирать. Тебе придётся умереть более сотни раз, чтобы понять, что твой билд на варвара сосёт, и надо попробовать что-то другое.
В игра КРАЙНЕ много классов персонажа, некоторые отличаются не сильно, например плут и ночной клинок. Но у некоторых есть настолько уникальные механики, что голова разболится от запоминания всего, что они умеют. 
Вещи дропаются по системе суффиксов. Но есть уникальные вещи, которые всегда будут иметь одинаковые статы, так сказать "Именные вещи"

Метапрогрессия "Практически" отсутствует. Тебе не надо покупать какие то улучшения между своими забегами, но есть пара вещей которые обязательно надо сделать, чтобы разблокировать некоторые улучшения. Например выполнить секрет квест, чтобы разблокировать ветку ядов для плутов. 

Боссы - Большая часть боссов из забега в забег будут одинаковы. Например в лабиринте минотавра в 90% шансом будет именно минотавр. И зная его сильные и слабые стороны, ты всегда можешь подготовиться к боссу. И так с любой локацией.

Что касается длс, можно ли играть без них? Ответ да. Длс несут лишь дополнительный контент, однако я крайне рекомендую их купить, пройдёмся кратко по ним.

Пепел Урхрока - Длс добавляет 4 новых класса и 1 новую расу, кучу предметов, и целый ад! Рекомендую купить если хочется разнообразить свои забеги.
Забытые культы - Если вы любите Лавкрафтовскую неведомую хрень смело брать, 3(4) новых класса с уникальными механиками. Новые локации, и самое главное неведомая хрень!
Ярость Эмбера - Рекомендуется покупать если вы прошли игру хотя бы один раз. Длс добавляет целую БОЛЬШУЮ новую компанию, действие которой происходит после финала игры. Добавляет 4 уникальных класса которые значительно отличаются от того, что было раньше. И несколько новых рас. Берите!

Надеюсь тебе понравится игра мой друг, я крайне её рекомендую. Просто пройти порог вхождения!

author: {'steamid': '76561198379255096', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 146, 'playtime_forever': 1301, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1301, 'last_played': 1648631307}
review:
not for me. 
did the escape from  hell (?), killing demons. escaped to the world (lvl 7). entered a dungeon for lvl 1-7 and was killed by a super bear. it's a wonder how any race can LIVE on that world.
i have made it to lvl 14 with an archer, thats it. put time into a char. and have it wiped away.
not for me, i did give it a chance (21 hours of wasted time).
seems like a good game but you have to build your char. in a set way to live. 
so, if you try this one, i would suggest that you read all the guides, watch a few play throughs and take notes. 
get your degree and maybe you might last long enough to enjoy it. good luck

author: {'steamid': '76561198027783889', 'num_games_owned': 214, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 4311, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3003, 'last_played': 1681864592}
review:
Un Roguelike con mayúsculas. El referente del género para todos los que quieran probarlo. Tiene una cantidad de personajes, combinaciones, clases, profesiones, habilidades, hechizos, objetos, armas, etc... IMPRESIONANTE. Es a efectos prácticos un juego infinito a pesar de no serlo por diseño pero tiene tantísimo contenido y tan variado que yo creo que nunca podré ver todo el potencial del juego por muchas horas que le dedique.

Tiene una historia fija con puntos fijos como las localizaciones (aunque algunas son aleatorias) pero lejos de eso cada zona dentro de las localizaciones de mundo son aleatorias. Es un juego muy, pero que muy retante. Verdaderamente difícil si quieres pasártelo entero en dificultad roguelike (mueres y se borra tu personaje), por lo que recomiendo encarecidamente que se juegue en modo aventura que te permite morir un par de veces pudiendo revivir. Así tomarás conciencia de que te puede matar con solo verte mientras que el modo entrenamiento que te permite revivir infinitamente lo pondría solo si quieres ver el final de la historia si todavía no eres muy bueno en el juego pero de esta forma el juego pierde mucha emoción ya que el miedo a la muerte es lo que hace que sea una verdadera aventura y no un paseo.

Es de mis roguelikes favoritos y todavía no le he dedicado ni la mitad de las horas que quiero echarle pero sentía la necesidad de expresar con los demás que este es un gran juego y si os gusta el género es un juego que debéis comprar si o si. Realmente podéis jugarlo de forma gratuita en la página web pero este juego tiene tanto trabajo y amor a lo largo de todos los años de desarrollo que tiene que me sentiría mal si no le diese dinero al creador, lo merece y con creces.

TOP del género al que pertenece, ofrece una aventura y un mundo memorable.

author: {'steamid': '76561198039654710', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 6027, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4465, 'last_played': 1702772847}
review: Softning up the rogulike behavior with the adventurer mode, and the turn-based combat makes this much more accessible to me than most roguelikes. I like the tactical rpg aspect and often unrelenting attacks. There is always variation because of the volumnous and variable loot that can boost your characters power in lots of different ways.

author: {'steamid': '76561198008355995', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 2574, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1045, 'last_played': 1648708789}
review:
Good rogue-like what contains lot of loot and enemy´s to kill. But have to say absolute honestly one thing. I hate fact game throws some absolute random bullshit what one hit kills you and you lose all progress. But same time i still keep playing. Some random gunsnake comes and one hit kills me. how i´m suppose to counter that. Had some eldrich horror hiding behind corner and no ability to escape. How can i escape that. Like there is so many times where so called challenge is bullocks. I do not like that. But game has way more good in it to hate that small portion of issues. After all i can play different difficulty. Where this does not happen.

Just hope this game still gets expanded on. Fact i have been addicted this simple game more than last 5 years AAA studio games tells a lot. Like shit.... There is workshop. Did not explore it yet. There is Debug for those who like cheating. I´m not shaming anyone. Play as you like. Lot of classes and Unlockables.

Been playing these two classes. Possesser. Whom uses capsure bodies to buff them self greatly. Like i managed to steal boss bodies and use them kill 10x stronger enemy´s to steal their bodies become immortal! untill cunt of 40 level shooter enemy one hit kills me........

Then one demonic type i don´t recall its whole name. But you can use magic and strong close combat abilities to handle eneme´s like passives what give fire dmg AoE on melee. Like you can turn ghost and move throught walls. Lot of fancy and i barely gotten far in game. Around 15 level as roguelike difficulty tend to ruin my games fast... Hey i know i killed 200 demons i guess that´s something.

author: {'steamid': '76561198278343766', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 33582, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4226, 'last_played': 1708226248}
review:
PT_BR

Jogo há mais de 10 anos, fora da Steam, e considero o TOME4 o melhor roguelike dos últimos 20 anos. Tem a melhor interface, mecânicas interessantes (algumas são chatas), o auto-explorer é o melhor do gênero, excelentes addons do workshop e até a música é boa. As conquistas são muito bacanas, muitas delas verdadeiramente inesperadas.

Minha crítica é que o jogo tem alguns chefes bem difíceis em relação a outros roguelikes, e a história do jogo é bem longa, além de ser um pouco "grind" em alguns momentos. Porém o jogo tem um "quality of life" muito acima da média, então o player não se sente "explorado" pelo jogo. 

Recomendo jogar no modo "Exploração", pois o jogo é cruel com novos jogadores e a morte permanente, depois de horas de jogo, pode ser muito frustrante, especialmente para jogadores mais casuais. Na steam tem um addon que libera todas as classes/raças, aproveitem.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043348500', 'num_games_owned': 2591, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 11230, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8163, 'last_played': 1647472060}
review:
This is, without question, the deepest and most engaging roguelike that I have ever had the fortune of playing.
It doesn't have ridiculous hard-to-understand systems, it has intuitive gameplay mechanics that are explained in detail as well as an incredible amount of lore, customization, racial options, secrets, unlockables, seasonal events, and (I think) the most achievements of any game on Steam.
Are the graphics great? Nah. But they don't need to be. This is one of the only games that will still feel fresh after hundreds of hours. It's almost not fair to other games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198148058377', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 12455, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8705, 'last_played': 1669459753}
review: This game is awful compared to other rogue likes. There is no balance. You'll be one shotted repeatedly on normal by random recklessly OP mobs. I have taken 1200-1500 damage in a single run ending blow after hours of grinding  multiple times in a row. Thats all 150hp, 500 point temporal shield, 500 point mana shield and 200 mana converted to health at a rate of .4 mana per health in one blow. I was level 24 in a 10-25 zone. All 3 of my last runs ended in a similar manner. Grind for 2-3 hours, get one shot in a dungeon your over leveled in. Buy literally any other rogue like game because its better than this hot garbage.

author: {'steamid': '76561197960391359', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 6473, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6318, 'last_played': 1653456886}
review:
This is the best turn-based roguelike, and I don't say that lightly. It's a labour of love made almost entirely by one person and it really shows. This is no early access slog, this is a highly polished game that was already of finished quality more than 10 years ago which the dev has constantly improved since. It is an excellent investment and you'll play for hundreds of hours and keep coming back for more. There is so much replayability with highly unique classes, races, and difficulty settings. Gameplay is the perfect balance between random to keep things fresh and constants, so you are rewarded with knowledge and experience the more you play, but it never gets boring.

Note that this game is not very story heavy, it is very much a gameplay focused game. So if you want a mega lore RPG with choices this is not for you. If you want a very challenging and strategic turn based game where every death is a learning experience that won't dishearten you, but rather make you want to try again even more - this is it.

I've played this game every now and again for more than 10 years now. Crazy to think about. Recently came back for the first time in 4 or 5 years and so much has been added it's crazy. Thank you Darkgod for the amazing work you've done on Tome 4.

author: {'steamid': '76561198050401916', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 1616, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 886, 'last_played': 1645765013}
review:
Good game, it's fun to explore, build new characters, get new loot, etc. Unlocking new classes, experimenting with builds (at least when RNG allows), and playing with new and interesting mechanics is an absolute blast. 

RNG can be a massive asshole and the reliance on excort quests with *impossibly* brain-dead AI that will walk straight up to a group of monsters -- even if it means walking away from you while your stuck in a different fight -- but that's more a minor nuisance than any kind of deal-breaker.

*However,* FUCK this game with permadeath. There's nothing so infuriating as putting 7 hours into a character only to stumble on a dreaming horror (also, whoever designed *that* thing deserves to be punched directly in the dick) so you get to spend the next 10 minutes rapidly clicking through the *many* turns you spend asleep until eventually it wears you down and kills you because it can teleport faster than you can run away even with a speed boost. Or putting 4 hours in, only to randomly come across a unique enemy that's a full 10 levels above the area's supposed cap and his entourage and *instantly* die.

I tried permadeath because it's what the devs intended, and while the first character I lost was wholly on me, the next 2 were down completely to random, *enormous* difficulty spikes that whittled away my extra lives until I lost all progress. I don't understand how anyone can prefer losing progress like that, it's so disrespectful of your time.

Luckily, there's a permadeath-free Exploration mode, which while it will keep you from unlocking certain things that are tied to achievements, is just a *much* better experience that completely fixes the only glaring issue I have with the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198066726246', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 8379, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6626, 'last_played': 1645887114}

author: {'steamid': '76561198110334770', 'num_games_owned': 777, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 21736, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1013, 'last_played': 1698875713}
review:
I have now reached the end of this game, and quite frankly, I have no idea how I feel about it still. It's unbalanced, the items are often random to a fault, the upgrade points for the thing you unlock in the wet place quickly become redundant, some abilities just don't show any signs of actually doing anything (Looking at you, weird dwarven more-gold=more-good passive ability), the classes vary wildly in strength, the menues take forever to learn, let alone find, and long combats just don't feel very satisfying. Oh, and the amount of times where you're just exploring and you randomly get detonated by an unseen something with bogus skills and abilities stacked is infuriating in a game where multiple gamemodes revolves around limited lives.

Yet I keep coming back to it.

It's like I've stared too long into the abyss, kind of like what I imagine the madman who enjoy Dwarf Fortress have. I have more fun with other games. Other games are more rewarding. Other games feel like actual games, and not 2D-icon-v-2D-icon simulator. Yet I come back to it. 

So... I guess I recommend it? I kind of have to. Apparently there is something I like about, and I don't know how to feel about that.

author: {'steamid': '76561197982540331', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 1737, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1218, 'last_played': 1648694137}
review:
Tutorial does a good job of getting you familiar with the basics. From this point on, you can just play and have a ton of fun. However, if you want to explore the real depth of the game, I suggest looking for info online. I love that the depth is there, but i phu-king love that you can ignore it and just play the game. The depth is there if you want to get lost in this.

Replayability is unlimited due to number of choices on character creation. And you can unlock even more as you play, which is great reward for playing the game.

Also, if you buy on steam, you get access to an item vault that allows you to swap items between your characters.

author: {'steamid': '76561199091740838', 'num_games_owned': 797, 'num_reviews': 102, 'playtime_forever': 31032, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 240, 'last_played': 1686854392}
review:
很好玩，可以说是小众精品Rogue。
游戏内容要比表面上看的多得多
很多地方网上找不到攻略，只能迫使自己硬着头皮摸索
新手入门很难，但过了新手期会发现这款游戏的魅力

(而且做成就有点难)
成就虽然多，但大都是不同难度模式的同一成就，一共应该有195个，而且成就图标很有DND美学的感觉。将Te4官网和Steam账号绑定，官方支持已获得更高难度成就时，可向下解锁相应成就，难度高低参照上文列表（不过冒险模式只能向下解锁冒险模式和探索模式成就，不能解锁低难度rogue的成就，只有永久死亡模式也就是rogue可以向下解锁全部模式成就）

author: {'steamid': '76561198044622737', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 2357, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2210, 'last_played': 1644184989}
review:
By the time you join the 10% of us that beat The Master you'll hate the awful boss fights like I do. 

Who designs a game where your character has 50 abilities but only 1 or 2 viable strategies to kill a mandatory, nearly impossible boss 15 hours into a run? [spoiler]Dig zig zag tunnels to cheese the AI by interrupting line of sight while you hit and run? Really?[/spoiler]

Do you like reading through lists of dozens of garbage items to find the one magical gear that might help with another awful op boss? Do you enjoy sifting through inventory to swap gear for the best resists for the next boss? You'll love this.

Try another roguelike.

author: {'steamid': '76561197992006667', 'num_games_owned': 635, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 14212, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3215, 'last_played': 1694228728}
review:
This game goes deep.

If you like open world RPGs with permadeath, this is for you. It's a true roguelike, with lots of stat & build nerding, lots of exploration & routing, and lots of dying & trying again—But when you get "the run" it feels amazing and can last dozens of hours. 

The game is fairly consistent between runs, but mixes some randomness in drops and enemies, always allowing you to iterate on your build but keeping some of the nuance fresh based on what you stumble upon. There is a staggering amount of content, I've around 150 total hours in the game (steam hour count is inaccurate as I played standalone for awhile), and I've barely scratched the surface. The more I play, the more hooked I get... It's a bit of a slow burn, but once it clicks, you won't be able to stop. 

I recommend starting on Nightmare difficulty with Roguelike mode on, playing blind. It requires dedicating some time to really sitting down and understanding what's in front of you; read all your stats, skills, infusions, and inspect the monsters you come across. Personally I started to make progress once I started keeping notes about the dungeons & my progression paths; you can look up guides I guess, but it's the type of game where guides will only get you so far, the sheer amount of freedom and customization means builds and progression can really be tailored to you. I think if you look up guides you'll be a much worse player. The only thing I'd really recommend looking up are the classes and how to unlock them, I found the game to be a bit of a slog before I finally got muh Archmage.

At first you'll die in the first couple dungeons you come across a lot, don't feel discouraged, just keep learning. Your runs will slowly go from lasting 20-30 minutes, to an hour, to a couple hours, and so on... you'll find the gameplay loop really teaches you about the world and you'll start naturally refining/optimizing your build to adjust to whatever gave you trouble last. It's the ideal open world roguelike loop with enough RPG mechanics to keep you entertained for a long while.

Don't put too much emphasis on quests or else you'll have a bad time, just explore the world and get stronger, quests take a backseat to exploration here. You'll know when you feel ready to do your main quest, and it certainly isn't right as you spawn in; find dungeons, get levels, obtain gear. Focus on survival and information, then mix in more damage as you can. You'll make progress and optimize your power soon enough.

The workshop also has some nice mods, in particular the "ZOmnibus Addon Pack" is probably worth picking up right off the bat. The graphics are a turn off for some, but once you get in game, it isn't really a problem. Especially if you use a custom character tile that you like. Not to mention the client feels good to use, anywhere the visuals don't feel up to par, you'll find the technical competency in the client offsets it. It's also fully customizable, there are people who have modded the game with RPG Maker tilesets and stuff, but I dunno, I think the base graphics are perfectly fine. But, probably turn the music off after a couple hours and put on your own stuff else that'll get tedious.

There's too much to say about this beastly game in a short steam review. But if the keywords "challenging, deep, open world, RPG, customizable" are ones that get you excited, then just go in right now, you won't regret it.

review: This game proves that you do not need to have amazing graphics to make a great RPG game. The are many different races, classes and skills to choose from, and they are all worked out very good. For beginners I advise to use an easier class because the game can be a bit complex for beginners. Once you know how it all works, you can take a more complex class. The game offers good replayability and nice challenges.

author: {'steamid': '76561197969062133', 'num_games_owned': 2114, 'num_reviews': 1251, 'playtime_forever': 1411, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1411, 'last_played': 1643393591}
review: A roguelike where you go on quests and kill monsters and whatnot. Classic. The different options in terms of species and classes, and the different build options. The problem I have with it is the issue I have with a lot of roguelikes which is how swingy it is. One second you're oneshotting hordes of monsters. The next you have been oneshotted because you stumbled on some unique badass. It makes it hard to get invested in the really long runs the game asks you to make.

author: {'steamid': '76561198064624996', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 13977, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 13122, 'last_played': 1663808592}
review: Full of totally unique classes and bizarre, inventive quests. Legendary items are game-changers with a ton of imagination behind them, often with class-specific special effects that can boost or modify skills. Races have unique starting locations, their own skill trees, and synergize with different classes in fascinating ways. The sheer volume of content will make your head spin. I've played games that are prettier and I've played games that have meant more to me personally, but I've never played a [i] better [/i] game. Long live the madman who dreamt all this up
