author: {'steamid': '76561198064390944', 'num_games_owned': 545, 'num_reviews': 49, 'playtime_forever': 19028, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 18865, 'last_played': 1683801404}
review:
This game is the ultimate oldschool roguelike RPG.

Every single class is unique enough to be worth playing.
Even I, someone who basically only plays the simplest melee builds in most other RPGs, enjoy playing mages and archers and all the unique classes ToME has to offer. Among others, there are: A nature "mage" who spawns slimes for defense and offense and surrounds himself with mucus and moss; a sleeping psychic, who uses his mind powers to damage and debuff enemies and manifests sleeping enemies' nightmares; and an otherworldly warrior with a tentacle arm that can summon other horrors and has a lot of nasty abilities. 
In addition, the dangerous enemies usually have the same abilities as the player can have, so playing different classes also teaches you about what the enemies can do.

Every single class has a fun playstyle.
Depending on the class, the gameplay will vary wildly from carefully setting up traps and critical attacks as a Rogue, casting spells from apart and teleporting out of danger as an Archmage, or just straight up charging at your enemies and mowing them down as a Berserker.

There is a lot of content in this game. 
250+ hours in (and I haven't touched Embers of Rage DLC yet, which, among other things, adds a whole new campaign!) and I still haven't played with all of the classes and races, and I just got the last unlocks a few hours ago. I expect to sink thousands of hours into this game without getting bored, because there is just so much stuff to do.

There are a few things that may annoy people, though.
Firstly, the game is not perfectly balanced. It also isn't terrible, but there are classes and talents and artifacts that are obviously better than others. This is usually doubly true for DLC and harder-to-unlock content. Overall it is not too bad, though, as everything is more or less viable. The enemies and the game itself is pretty well balanced, with one caveat, which brings me to my next point.

Secondly, the game is very difficult and has a steep learning curve. Expect to scour the wiki for information and ask lots of questions in the official Discord, especially if you want to win on Roguelike and higher difficulties than Normal. For reference, by the time I had spent around 250 hours in total (playing + gathering information) on this game, I only managed two wins on Normal/Roguelike (as Skeleton/Brawler and Yeek/Summoner). You die to something, then you figure out why you died, then you prepare yourself for that enemy next run, only to die to something else this time. It sounds frustrating, but it's actually very fun and rewarding, because eventually you'll be prepared for everything the game throws at you.

Thirdly, connected to the second point, you will play through the same zones and bosses dozens and hundreds of times, while only rarely seeing the later parts of the game (especially if you're playing Roguelike aka permadeath mode, like I am). The zones and bosses are always one of two variants, though the individual "stages" are randomly generated, as far as I can tell. Since the 100 hour mark I have been getting a bit bored / annoyed by this, but it's by far not bad enough to make me want to stop playing.

And if you take issue with a few things mentioned here, ToME has solutions for that too!
If you don't like permadeath, you can also play game modes with infinite or many lives. If you don't like some of the game mechanics, you can change them with addons from the workshop and you can (relatively) easily interact with the code, if you want to (or so I'm told, I haven't actually done that yet), because it's an open source game. That's also why, if you don't want to spend money (yet), you can play it for free by downloading this game on its official website!

In conclusion, I can not recommend this game enough.  There is no reason for you to not play this game (besides not being interesting in roguelike RPGs and not having enough time, I guess), so just do it!

author: {'steamid': '76561198008104743', 'num_games_owned': 604, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 952, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 101, 'last_played': 1693767585}
review: I'm going to lose my life to a $7.00 game

author: {'steamid': '76561198008630286', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 10909, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10909, 'last_played': 1627199066}
review: First an Elven Alchemist focused on creating a powerful golem. Then a Dwarven Wyrmic breathing clouds of various horrors across the enemies. A Ghoul Reaver duel-wielding weapons and slowly turning into a living horror of worms. A Yeek Psionic controlling his enemies. A Human Archmage with impenetrable shields and a mastery of the elements. An Ogre Time Warden with the same dog summoned from three different points in its timeline (so 3 dogs... but one dog...) firing powerful arrows that ripple through space-time. Finally a Human Paradox Mage who's divorced from the typical turn-based system somewhat, shoving his enemies forwards in time and stepping outside of time himself. First win at 180 hours. 10/10 for everything except visuals and hand-holding (I was still learning new things on my fifth or sixth play-through).

author: {'steamid': '76561197978864743', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 23480, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 16765, 'last_played': 1707353512}
review:
ToME is why I'm no longer mortified of the inescapable march of time.  I could play ToME for the rest of my life and be happy.

ToME has caused me to feel good about contributing to my retirement plan for the first time since the financial crisis.  Thanks DarkGod!

author: {'steamid': '76561198069761867', 'num_games_owned': 87, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 2501, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2279, 'last_played': 1663136874}
review: Лучший Hack'n'Slash roguelike из всех, что я играл. После того, как надоест классы перещупывать буду вникать в сюжет. А хотя даже просто кромсать мобцов и зачищать локации очень приятно. Огромное разнообразие противников, скилбилдов, предметов. Глубины взаимодействия нет, но затягивает от этого не меньше.

author: {'steamid': '76561198359361341', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 920, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 502, 'last_played': 1679268349}
review: One of the best roguelikes I have ever played. Although I have not played it for long, I can already see the care that was put into this game. It has a much more "fair" feeling difficulty curve when compared to something like Nethack, which some people may like more than others. There seems to be many available builds with the option to unlock more classes as you play which ensures there is going to be more new stuff to look at as you are playing. Also, the developer has worked hard all this time and has made this game FREE like the alpha they are. If you try and like it, please throw some money their way.

author: {'steamid': '76561198219461764', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 95, 'playtime_forever': 2279, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2279, 'last_played': 1626191971}
review:
얄팍한 볼륨에 대충 운빨ㅈㅁ(?)으로 밀어붙이는 3류 로그라이크(트) 게임과는 격을 달리하는 내용물이 꽉 찬 게임입니다.
다양한 종족 및 직업(해금을 해야 해서 좀 귀찮긴 합니다만)과 직업 한개당 수없이 나오는 빌드 오더, 말도 안되는 종류의 아이템들. 그리고 엄청난 볼륨의 던전들과 거기에 몰려다니는 적들까지, 디아블로식 진행에 가까워서 자유도는 별로 없지만(던전별 티어가 있어서 거기에 맞게 들어가야됨) 방대함과 볼륨으로 압도합니다.
로그라이크 게임 주제에 회차 한번당 20시간은 충분히 찍을 수 있습니다. 물론 살아서 엔딩 볼 수 있다면.
로그라이크 특유의 극악난이도도 있으니 얌전히 탐험모드로 합시다(응?)
한글화도 잘 되어있으니(아쉽게도 장비 옵션은 번역이 안되어 있습니다.) 구리구리한 그래픽의 압박만 이겨낼 수 있으면 사실상 플레이타임 무제한을 보장하는 게임입니다.

author: {'steamid': '76561198024651578', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 31427, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 17624, 'last_played': 1689285886}
review:
[h1] I GOT MY FIRST WIN AFTER ALMOST 300h OF PLAY  [/h1]

Whew, what a game. 

What. 
A. 
Game. 

It's in depth. Has great, detailed lore. Tons of replayability. Absolutely A+ community. Tons of excellent humour. The dev, Dark God is extremely involved and is a very nice person. Really addictive. And most importantly, extremely fun.

To get into a bit more detail, this is an old school, grid-based fantasy roguelike rpg. You start by making a character from a great variety of ancestries and classes which include both the tried and true ones like elves, dwarves, humans and halflings for ancestries; and warriors, mages and rogues for classes; and also some more creative ones. 
The gameplay is definitely focused on combat and ability (which are called talents) and loot optimization. You go around the world, killing monsters, getting loot, completing quests and leveling up. And dying. Definitely dying a lot. 
The world is always the same template with a healthy dose of randomization for events, locations and such.
During your playthroughs you'll gain a lot of permanent unlocks which grant you new starting options and more. And achievements. Tons of achievents.
The game provides you with several difficulty modes to ease you into it if you don't want to go full masochistic right away. There are also various gamemodes to try, like an endless dungeon or an arena if you want to test your perfectly minmaxed build to the limit.
The DLC are well worth the price, and so are the minimal microtransactions the game features. In truth, it doesn't feel really fair to call them microtransactions, they are just a really good way to support the dev and spice your playthrough a little bit (or even other player's playthroughs).
The dev is also very involved both with the community and with creating new content/updating the game.

As I said I got my first win recently, but that's just the start of my experience with this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198021990624', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 8143, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5832, 'last_played': 1706727596}
review: Easy to get into but hard to master roguelike dungeon crawler, with mechanics that reduce the micromanagement characteristic of the genre. Has been consistently fun to play, and compares well with other games like it I've played. After 100 hours, still feeling like scratching the surface, having just won once on normal difficulty. Graphical aspects and UI are fairly oldschool, but more modernized than the plain ASCII + keyboard shortcuts schemes of its ancestors.

author: {'steamid': '76561198028407888', 'num_games_owned': 67, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 16791, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1025, 'last_played': 1628083739}
review:
9-16级的场景刷了个23级的精英
这河里吗

如果有遇到买了DLC但是无法加载新游戏的童鞋，可以右键游戏在属性里把steam的DLC先去掉，然后
a.进游戏主界面的插件--DLC页面--点击某个DLC--页面最下方点download下载（就是贼慢）
b.也可以直接上官网下载（用steam账号联动登录）--选择DLC--直接下到本地以后，放进steam的TOME4下的game/addons文件夹下，游戏会自动识别
官网地址 https://te4.org/dlc/cults
参考：https://forums.te4.org/viewtopic.php?t=42624
https://steamcommunity.com/app/259680/discussions/0/613940109929125408/?l=czech&tscn=1415120565

author: {'steamid': '76561198393945587', 'num_games_owned': 124, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 68682, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 112, 'playtime_at_review': 37959, 'last_played': 1712197161}
review:
Tome4!
作为一款历史悠久的传统roguelike游戏（回合制战斗），tome4十分注重战斗方面（其它方面只能说是差强人意），有着非常丰富的种族和职业搭配以及技能树的选择，文本丰富（但玩多了就会发现根本活不到发现新文本的时候）。
本游戏精髓在于暴毙，包括但不限于：不小心多A了两回合、在狂A的过程中被致盲、、致盲z图、原地tp。然而，作为一款优秀的roguelike游戏，暴毙并不会带来强烈的挫败感，而是——再来一局！（只要下局小心一点就不会暴毙了 或许）
综合画质、ui、语言（tome4不久之前更新了官中）等等方面，与其它几个（adom、caves of Qud）相比，tome4是最适合普通玩家入坑的（最容易搞懂的），基本上可以用鼠标完成所有操作。
总而言之，这是一款非常杀时间的游戏，非常适合炎炎夏日升高血压，当你跨过层层障碍最终达到高峰时（你就会加入tome4神教

review: Basically this game has one of the close-knitted communities I've ever seen in my life. This game is not just a solo roguelike, but a nice multiplayer experience where you can share what you have between everyone in the global chat system. The creator, DarkGod, is an avid player in the community as well and is just a delightful person. I really enjoy this game, and hope that more hours are to come from this.

review:
공홈에서 무료로도 즐길수 있으며 스팀구매시 창고기능과 직업+ 종족(조건은 클리어하셔야함), 캠페인,커스텀외형등이 오픈됩니다.
DLC들도 강추합니다.
로그라이크류를 좋아 하신다면 강추! 도전정신 강한사람도 강추!
창고는 수중던전 마지막 클리어후 본인기지가 생기는데 그 이후 이용가능합니다.
추가로 기부하면 창고가 일정금액당 몇칸씩 늘어나욥
모드도 창작마당,공홈 등에서 지원하고 있습니다.
나무위키에도 종족,직업해금법이라던가 여러 공략들 많으니 참고하세요

author: {'steamid': '76561198041632909', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 12455, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9536, 'last_played': 1688494511}
review:
I could tell you all the reasons why I like this game but then you would be reading all night long....

Do you like rogue-like games, are you a total stat slut, are you a completion whore, are you fond of DnD, do you enjoy a challenging game, do you want to buy a cheap game and spend literally hundreds of hours and still not come close to beating it, do you love when games have been actively and amazingly updated for over 9 years? 

If you said yes to any of these then you should buy this game, you might not care for the graphics, but the gameplay and story are so overwhelmingly complex it will have you playing over and over and over and over to try all the classes, races, skill trees and weapon types, this game is so under-rated by gaming media but take a look at all the reviews, you will not waste your money if you buy this game. No lie. One of the best games of all time.

Dozens of extremely diverse classes, each with their own unique builds and skill trees. Tons of races with sub-races. All of which need to be unlocked in their own fun and challenging ways. The RNG changes around the dungeons, enemies, equipment and side missions. This game can be enjoy on easy mode for sure, but beating it on a harder difficulty will give the greatest sense of accomplishment ever, please buy this game!

author: {'steamid': '76561198046943002', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 25032, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 23540, 'last_played': 1701031941}
review:
I've gotten more value for money in this particular game than in any other one I've ever played. There are countless upsides to this game:

The gameplay is complex and varies a lot based on race/class, hence replayability is incredible.
Difficulty can be adjusted as you wish on character creation (general difficulty and amount of lives available to you).
There is a LOT of content.
The game is still getting updated.
You may randomly get turned into a vorpal bunny by the developer.

Don't be intimidated by the relatively steep learning curve at the start and you will be able to enjoy one of the best roguelikes in existence.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993510649', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 29481, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 15054, 'last_played': 1701663165}
review:
This game isn't Dungeons & Dragons. It's what you [i]actually[/i] want to play when you say you want to play Dungeons & Dragons, if you're all about the combat. And boy is the combat varied, with races and classes galore.
You can, for example, play as classic Dwarven fighters, Elven wizards, Halfling rogues etc...

Unless you would prefer to play:
A sling-wielding assassin with poison rocks that put evil orc snipers to shame
An evil orc sniper
A holy paladin who just happens to be a rotting ghoul
Literally Doctor Who
An elvish anti-mage so in tune with nature that slime just, you know happens
Really, slime everywhere
Why not a psychic baby yeti [i]dual-wielding buzzsaws[/i]

Or an actual yeti? Who is a wizard?
A halfling who is a dragon fanboy to the point they have learnt how to swallow minotaurs whole
A body-snatching skeleton
An ex-demon slave who casually takes enemies on a trip to the shadow realm together
A Cthulhu cultist specialising in tentacle magic
Did I mention Doctor Who

review:
Played a lot of similar games back in the days, and I also didn't give too much hours into it.
But my god, I always loved it. To me, games like these are not about how it's played or how beautiful it looks like. It's about the concept, ideas. This game (and some other older games like this) gives me so much choices and opportunities on what I want to be in a role-playing nuance. It's beautiful.

author: {'steamid': '76561198022497144', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 9171, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2472, 'last_played': 1697465609}
review: The aesthetics and steep learning curve of the game can be a bit off-putting at first; honestly this game is not for everyone. But if you like this type of game there's nothing better. ToME is THE definitive turn-based roguelike. This game is fun, complex, deep, and it scratches the part of my brain that adores progression. It also has over 1750 achievements, so you'll never run out of things to do.

author: {'steamid': '76561198097651315', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 12409, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1660, 'last_played': 1695953588}
review:
10/10 roguelike so far, going to buy all of the DLC as soon as I can and I'll probably get at least a couple hundred more hours this summer.

As soon as I unlocked a class and realized the sheer diversity of playstyles in this game, I knew I'd be hooked. The community has been incredibly supportive and kind so far, as well.

Update after reaching 60 hrs on June 15th: Yeah, this game is incredible. I just wish I could fix this bug where I can't get enough sleep at night because I keep staying up until 3 AM playing it.

Update after reaching 148 hours on June 23rd: Send help. I'm still at the tip of the iceberg with this game. 11/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198056307163', 'num_games_owned': 287, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 12563, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7037, 'last_played': 1708987574}
review:
The one thing that I can say about this beautiful creation is that while you will die numerous numerous times you just may be able to get further on your next life.

In all seriousness, the replayability of this game can only be compared to few games like this out there. Amazingly the developers also seem to have not let this game die out and become unplayable. These wonderful devs update this game frequently with new content, bug fixes, and other changes.

Right now at 117 hours I have not quite gotten into the high level of gameplay of this game and feel as though I am still learning this masterpiece of a game. Additionally this game is incredibly modifiable and the devs complete support modifications to their baby. Although I have not dabbled to much into it (only just recently downloads some addons) I believe this game has the capability support any gamer's taste.

All in all 10/10 Roguelike.

author: {'steamid': '76561197968222517', 'num_games_owned': 1079, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 2583, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2392, 'last_played': 1701238655}
review:
If you like Roguelikes and you're on the fence, this is one of the big ones. It's complex enough to be the one you start over and over again, but easy to play and understand. It might look like a mid 90s MMO, but it's full of a lot of smart design choices that make it easy and compelling to keep playing even after you lose. I don't want people to think I think this is an ugly game though, I actually find the art incredibly charming and actually seeing your armor equipped is pretty fun. It also has what I am usually looking for in a Roguelike, which is a dynamic early game, so I don't feel like I have to retrace my steps when I die, and I do die a lot.

It's an easy to play roguelike, with a ton of complexity and fun character building.

author: {'steamid': '76561198445311751', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 2570, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1400, 'last_played': 1652613644}
review:
読めないテイルズといわれて気になってて日本語化されたので勢いで購入。
何個かアンロックしたのでとりあえずレビュー。
とてもオーソドックスなダンジョン探索系のゲーム。
キャラクリエイトで職業・人種を選んで、ある程度ステ振りしたら、はい、よーいスタート。
ただし情報量が多くてどれが正解か雰囲気でしかわかってない為、
とても調子よく進んでてもいきなりあっさりやられたりする。
死んでも即ゲームオーバーモードもあるが
レベルがあがったり特定条件をクリアすると残機数が増えるので、一般的なローグライクよりは多少有情。
ただしその場で復活→再戦→また殺されるとか余裕である。
耐性はとても大事。
テレポートやデコイ系統での緊急脱出手段が非常に大事。
道中の雑魚は雑ぁ魚ｖ雑魚ｖとサクサク行けてていきなりボスやレアに封殺されることもあるので
備えは大事。
残機がなくなるとセーブがなくなるので、一瞬虚無るけど
全体的なゲームスピードがかなり速いのであまり苦にならない。
移動で何もなければスキップ移動できるし、ある程度進むと回収も楽になる。
ゴミは店売り価格と同じに等価交換がいつでも可能になったり
あれこれこうなったら便利かなぁというのが手に届く。
まぁ、どうしても古いスタートなのでグラフィック関係はしょうがない点は多いけども
こういうもんだと割り切ればとても楽しい。

author: {'steamid': '76561198032586088', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 20926, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4987, 'last_played': 1702707932}
review:
ついに日本語化が正式実装された。

　古典的なローグライクRPGに分類されるであろうゲームだが、フィールドマップがあるタイプのローグライクでは必要性がほぼなくなっていた食料値が廃止され、デフォルトの設定だと数回蘇生できるなど革新的な部分は多い。
　種族もクラスも非常に多いが最初は大半はロックがされており、アンロックするには特定の実績を解除する必要がある。
　日本語化、蘇生可能などもあるため敷居は比較的低め。
　とはいえ難易度が低いわけではなく、自分はこれまで一度しか勝利することは出来ていない。

　難しい理由は属性耐性、状態異常耐性どちらもカバーしようとするとリソースが全く足りなく、敵もしっかり回復をしてくるため火力が低いと数百ターンかけても倒しきれないなんてことにもなる。
　その上状態異常は非常に危険な物が多く、属性耐性はしっかり積まないと中盤以降は容易に即死する。
　圧倒的火力で即死させられるほど強敵はもろくないので雑魚の群れに無双していたら気づいたら死んでいた人も多いだろう。
　そんなの無理ゲーじゃんと思うかもしれないがそれをなんとかするのが面白いところ。

　難しいゲームを求めてる人、ローグライクRPGが好きな人、ハクスラが好きな人などにお勧め。

author: {'steamid': '76561198009689432', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 76667, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 61806, 'last_played': 1705818187}
review:
It is a fantastic game. It took about five years (1000 hours) to win.
At last, I understand that I should decide if I would like to play for fun or would like to win?
I focused on the most valuable skills.
And I changed the style of the gameplay while the character is evolved.

I started as a lighting mage and finished as a dual-handed fighter that does 2.5-3k damage in a single turn with multiple 1k-2k damage shields with a duration 7-8 turns and 99 defense. On the 35+ levels he jumps across a battle field like crazy killing most of the enemies from the 1st hit and do a splash damage 0.5k.
https://te4.org/characters/188460/tome/57ab198c-e64f-4e09-9113-4c53fe7242a6

author: {'steamid': '76561197968073802', 'num_games_owned': 381, 'num_reviews': 173, 'playtime_forever': 4813, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4813, 'last_played': 1473993339}
review:
[[[[ WARNING! Before the review starts, I just wanna tell anyone that comes across this review, and wants to buy this game because it has the most achievements on Steam. Don't do it for that reason :P! Unless you really, REALLY wanna play this game, it's not worth it. The reason there are so many achievements is that you have to do em one time for every mode in the game, which means you have to the same achievements as much as 9 times each! ]]]]

It's been years since I played Tales of Maj'Eyal last time, but I somehow forgot to write a review. I can see that I quit at 80 hours, and that is in my opinion more than enough time to try to make sense of a game as immense as this one. 

First of all. Many people might have had the same idea, that finding the game on Steam with the most achievements in one game would be a real challenge, and fun to try to get through. I myself have been playing Binding of Isaac for years, and passed 1300 hours on the game...but the difference is that I actually have had lots of fun with Binding of Isaac. Realising that at least 1/6 of these achievements are just the same ones, over and over again, was not something I was very impressed over. Maybe fun if you're playing 1000s of hours in the game, and actually wanna try the different modes.

I remember trying alot of classes and playing the game normally. I did get somehow far, and I did get to explore and see alot of the game. I can't exactly remember the lore and story as I write this review, but it was kinda random what part of it you got. Probably also something you need to play alot to get.

Anyway. To make an 80 hours long story, shorter. I played the game, I died alot, tried new classes, and even did some never ending dungeon with over 100 floors. At some point I got tired, very tired, but I wanted to try one more thing.

I gave myself millions of HP, by editing a notepad file, and tried to do the game over again, just one last time. Now it just felt meaningless, because I couldn't die, but I did get to explore alot more, and see the story. Did I say I couldn't die...well, I was wrong...because at some point, even with millions of HP, insane strength and just everything maxed, something managed to kill me. I might have clicked too much, too fast, but yep...that is how hard this game is. Sometimes I can finish a game like that, but not with this one.

I tried to get a friend to test Tales of Maj'Eyal as well, but I don't think he even played for 2 hours...

Anyway. To sum this up. I didn't like the game. I might have found it more interesting to play, if the achievements were unique, and not added up 6 times over, for every single mod. I really like to do achievements, and in almost every game I play, I try my best to finish them, but for this game it's kinda silly, unless you actually wanna spend those 1000s of hours on it. Even if I put my 1300 hours from Binding of Isaac into this game instead, I would surely have gotten far, but I really think this game requires even more than that.

review:
ToME is really fun and quite hideous. I find myself wishing it had more simplistic but stylised sprite graphics (like Caves of Qud for example) as I find the visuals really muddy and unsatisfying here. Maybe it's time to bite the bullet and switch to ASCII...

As far as gameplay goes it's a solid roguelike and a pillar of the genre - if you like RLs at all you should enjoy ToME.

author: {'steamid': '76561198262190628', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 61735, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 69, 'playtime_at_review': 12606, 'last_played': 1711291923}
review:
上steam之前就玩过全职业，这回补课好评。

评测：硬核，仅适合有一定游戏阅历（重要：代表近十几年市面上大作基本都玩过），并对rouge能接受的老玩家，至于不懂的新玩家右上点X赶紧离远点，这不是你现阶段该来的场地，别等犯傻买了后说些抱怨画面古老，自个死得快这种蠢话。

个人体验，这游戏是完全舍弃了画面优化，换来的是同类型最优秀的build职业系，比如从锁一血的狂战到召唤大军的死灵法师，到驱动蒸汽兵器的链锯屠夫及反魔法的绿色孢子植物人等等，几十种职业和种族间互相搭配，再配上各自差异很大的技能与特殊传奇装备，可以延展出花样繁多的各种玩法。

音乐上，tome4意外的带感，听起来高昂雄壮又凄凉，我也不懂这种简单音乐是怎么选的，反正挺配，剧情则是不跟npc对话，而是以散落在迷宫卷轴和装备上的方式描述（史诗感很强，但不少手札写的还挺逗，例如高塔的吸血鬼主人那段），会比魂系列更有孤独感，非常适合游戏内角色孤军深入黑暗地下的风格，难度上我不推荐无限复活的模式，那个模式就是练练手，也没法完成成就，最好的自然是永久死亡，会从各种墓碑里深刻感知到为什么法师脆，战士手短，刺客不能露头的终极奥义。

剩下的打字累了，反正其它的评测也说了很多，总之这么说吧，你如果玩过欧美博得魔兽永恒之柱这种的，并且喜欢在捏人界面挑技能，那这款就别废话马上买，肯定不亏，完事~

author: {'steamid': '76561198265290956', 'num_games_owned': 130, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 4177, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 646, 'last_played': 1693022418}
review:
我看到了Diablo和might and magic的影子，然而它带给了我更多惊喜和满足。

优点：具有roguelike、地牢寻宝等特点的回合制游戏，要素多，极具探索性。没有紧张感但也需要技巧和规划，属于能玩很久的游戏。

缺点：目前大方向仍然是刷怪做任务收集装备，重复性比较高。强烈建议像elona借鉴以增强自由度（如大地图上增加随机npc，在城中有更多的互动事件等等）

author: {'steamid': '76561198047534585', 'num_games_owned': 1259, 'num_reviews': 111, 'playtime_forever': 3016, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2644, 'last_played': 1699944362}
review:
One of the best actual rogue-likes you can play on Steam. It's free from the developers website, but buying the Steam version directly supports the developer, so I'd recommend it (although donating would probably be the most direct way to support them). The game has a ton of content and is still updated pretty consistently. It's had so many QoL updates that at this point, anyone can play it without any prior knowledge of how to play a typical turn-based ascii rogue-like. It makes a great introduction to the actual definition of the genre if you've never played a true rogue-like before. It also has G R A P H I C S, which for some people is the biggest turn off to trying a typical ascii rogue-like (sad, I know).

ToME isn't my favorite rogue-like (that would be [i]Cataclysm: Dark Days Ahead[/i]), but it definitely lands in my top ten. It's also infinitely easier to actually play than CDDA, which is a hotkey nightmare control-wise, even for seasoned rogue-like veterans. If you enjoy rogue-likes, you owe it to yourself to give this one a shot.

review:
One of my favourite games of all time.

For how complex ToME is, it's very easy to get into and learn. Everything has tooltips, you can thoroughly inspect any creature and always see exactly what happened in the combat log.

It's free on te4.org, so go play it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197989067922', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 77418, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 72740, 'last_played': 1691658988}
review:
1000回遊べる，ならぬ，1000時間遊べるローグライク。

次のような方にお勧め。
・Diablo1～3，PoE，Grim Dawn等の海外製ハクスラにハマった。
・死んで覚える系ローグライクに抵抗がない。
・英語に抵抗がない。
・他プレイヤーのキャラ情報を元にビルドを考えるのが楽しい。
・ハクスラで刺激を求めてHCモードを選びがち。

特徴的なのは死亡設定。プレイヤーの趣向によって選択できる点が良い。
・無限に復活できるExploration(いわゆるSC)
・レベルによって残機が増えるAdventure
・1回死んだら即ゲームオーバーのRoguelike(いわゆるHC)

難易度はEasy，Normal，Nightmare，Insane，Madnessの5種類。
Normal，NMをクリアし，難易度Insaneで遊ぶのが一般的。
(難易度Madnessはバランスが破綻気味なので通常プレイには向かない)
Insane-Roguelikeをクリアするのが一つの目標になるだろう。

公式HPから本体を無料でダウンロード可能。
お布施をしたくなったらSteamから購入すればよい。Steam連携が必須ということはない。
やってみてハマれそうであれば，有料DLC(Ashes of Urh'RokとEmbers of Rage)導入を推奨。
Forbidden Cultsは他2つのDLCほどには重要ではない。

author: {'steamid': '76561198257842838', 'num_games_owned': 187, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 14944, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 12624, 'last_played': 1625310359}
review:
Great RogueLike albeit not classic style and might be bit confusing at the beginning due to multitude of skills for each of countless of classes / races (lot of unlocks) but it works perfectly.

review: An ultimate roguelike game. It is a bit old school, and some items have a wall of text, which can be daunting to read through. An amazing amount of depth and so many classes/builds to choose from. If you like traditional roguelike games, you will love this! It can be pretty tough, so don't be afraid to explore and try new things, even if you may end up in the wrong spot and die really easily.

review: I've been playing roguelike since... well, rogue. My favorite of the old school games was Furyband, and this is the best of the modern crop of games that feels like Furyband. It's got a good overworld, different difficulties of short dungeons, and the infinite dungeon for when you're bored with the story. I enjoyed ToME well before it was on Steam, and I'm excited to play it still via Steam.

author: {'steamid': '76561198334361558', 'num_games_owned': 1232, 'num_reviews': 56, 'playtime_forever': 1817, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 418, 'last_played': 1622823909}
review:
チュートリアルを楽しめた(洋風トルネコにハクスラ要素を加えた感じ)ので早速タローレの魔法剣士を作成し、本編へと進んだらエラー連発でまともにプレイ出来ませんでした。

調べると日本語化の影響らしく、魔法職以外のキャラであれば問題無く遊べるようです。自分と同パターンの人は公式の日本語実装が近いのでそれまで待つか、非Steamの無料版でVer.を下げて遊ぶ必要があります。あとはキャラを作成し直す(一番確実)手もありますが…初見は攻撃と回復のバランスよさ気なタローレの魔法剣士使いたかったなぁ。。。

【追記】
ついに日本語対応バージョンが出ました。ありがとうございます！
再びプレイしたら見事にエラーが消え去ってました。近々攻略開始しようと思います。

author: {'steamid': '76561198188187106', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 5560, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1276, 'last_played': 1708527249}
review:
One of the ONLY thing this game lacks in is it's graphics. Don't be fooled by the old school graphics, this game does everything a roguelike wants correctly. It takes all the best features of the top roguelike games and puts them into one masterpiece of a game.

The class & talent system is has incredible depth and versatility, but not in a way where it overwhelms you or punishes you for not playing a "meta" build unless you're playing on the highest difficulties. 

Literally everything is done right, with the highest replay value out of any game in the genre. I cannot recommend this game enough to people who like the roguelike/roguelite genres.

author: {'steamid': '76561199087074342', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 5757, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3670, 'last_played': 1639235279}
review: 这个游戏是我第一次写测评，就游戏来说是非常好玩的。里面的职业很多，在一些打boss的时候你以为不会用到的技能反而可能有着很大的作用。不过新手建议先不要打正常模式，先去探险模式熟悉一下职业的的技能。种族和职业怎么搭配。

author: {'steamid': '76561198119788983', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 12660, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 12244, 'last_played': 1693119970}
review: Began its life as one of the first roguelikes. Open-world with more emphasis on challenging, tactical battles than staving off starvation in the dungeon. Each playthrough is unique and the same strategy won't always work twice. Each class is unique and definitely takes some time to learn, but there are so many options to customize your character that you can build something completely different each run using skills, talents, items and inscriptions. Also, you can wear a mankini.

author: {'steamid': '76561198019172944', 'num_games_owned': 951, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 5829, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1014, 'last_played': 1688549342}
review:
I've certainly enjoyed my time in Maj'Eyal, though I'm not a particular fan of roguelikes in general. The writing is charming enough to make up for the often unfair and quite frequent deaths. I would recommend trying the game for free on the website first.

I've experienced a few gamebreaking bugs, but nothing out of the ordinary.

author: {'steamid': '76561198133708514', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 26194, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 23393, 'last_played': 1656452593}
review:
This is the best class heavy fantasy rogue-like I have ever played. 

Zipping around dungeons and melting faces in a multitude of ways is so much fun! Interesting loot, varied enemies and locations, and a robust class system make TOME the game to take with you on a desert island.

author: {'steamid': '76561198028235650', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 211, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 186, 'last_played': 1703885040}
review: Classic Roguelike with loads of classes to discover and many talents/skills to choose from. It's been in development for a while so you can rest assured the game is complete even without buying into the expansions.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999099369', 'num_games_owned': 334, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 6690, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 228, 'last_played': 1681930647}
review: This is my favourite game - if you're looking for a GREAT roguelike - check this one out, you can play it forever

author: {'steamid': '76561197973553821', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 22891, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2100, 'last_played': 1710583002}
review:
This reminds me of the great games of my childhood like Castle of the Winds. You get a multitude of character options, combined with some great dark story telling (particularly when reading scrolls with blood on them).  Both hardcore and semi-hardcore modes available. Below are the only NEGATIVES I could find:
- Pointless progression locks on character races and classes (removable by mod)
- Pointless progression locks on certain minor quests
- Pointless progression locks on difficulty
- Game starts censored WITHOUT informing you (it is minor and easily removable in options)
- Some high level dungeons inside low level dungeons, leading to ridiculous deaths
- Dialog text of kills is only gruesomely detailed if it is your character that dies

[EDIT: removed dialog box fading fast criticism as there is an option to delay fading]

author: {'steamid': '76561198008892940', 'num_games_owned': 1578, 'num_reviews': 138, 'playtime_forever': 1367, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 939, 'last_played': 1676462065}
review:
모험, 탐험모드로 하면 죽어도 다시 할 수 있긴 하지만 일단은 로그라이크 분류에 자주 들어가는 TOME4 입니다.
돌죽과 비교하면 캐릭터의 육성에 훨씬 더 많은 초점을 둔 게임이라고 할 수 있습니다.
플레이어는 자동탐험 돌렸다가 적 만나면 1234 누르고 자동탐험돌리고 적 만나면 1234 누르고를 반복합니다
말하고 보니 로그라이크라기 보다는 디아블로에 가깝네요

개발자인 다크갓의 토사물로 만든 그래픽만 제외하면 게임 자체는 매우 재밌습니다.
생각해보니 그래픽 말고 캐릭,종족등등 각종 해금도 좆지랄입니다 왜 이따위로 만들었는지 모르겠네요
암튼 재밌습니다.

author: {'steamid': '76561198057815250', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 122, 'playtime_forever': 2550, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2517, 'last_played': 1614946765}
review:
This review was longer but steam sometimes just autorefreshes a site for no reason and i wont be bothered to write a 20min review again. And since we all know steam devs have exactly 0 programing skills (which shows by this autorefresh) than this problem will stay so... whatever.

Amazing world, amazing story, well worth for the texts and to find out the game's inner stories BUT!
BUT!
You will pay a heavy price for it ;p the game is madly unfair, tells you nothing at all and generally tries to be as garbage as it can be and use every cheap unfair trick in the book to show the player (oooh haha you died) cos the devs clearly are sad little virgins with 0 skill in designing actual difficulty for their games ;p
Also 95% of the builds won't make it through the cheatfest even with godlike luck (which you wont have; my last 3 heavy armor wielders just walked around in robes cos i never found an even HALF decent armor and shops offer only the worst of the worst of the worst of the worst.)
Basically money exists only to buy books with interesting stories and to get dwarf that sweet resistance bonus for having lots of gold. Otherwise you can ignore it cos shops NEVER have any good items (outside when you have lv. 1-3 cos the items in all the cities in the entirety of the game are locked to SUPER EARLYGAME power; that and the fact that these are the greediest vendors in gaming history cos they pay you literally 1/1000 the items worth and i am not joking ;p thats the sad part).

And a Prime BS example this game likes to pull off and both rudely and ignorantly call it "difficulty":
A boss that can autoheal to full when he touches an item, can teleport to the item automatically on wish with nothing in extance that can stop him, even when antiteleport is active and he is confused, cannot be stopped from touching an item and the item cannot be destroyed cos... for some reason the game allows you to explode walls but not glass chairs?
The answear is only one: You need to hit him REALLY REALLY HARD.


I may be wrong, whatever, this is for people that agree that leveling enemies always to your level is horrible. And making it mechanically IMPOSSIBLE to cheese just to force you to beat an enemy in that one and only one way (worse yet the way is "punch hurrdurr"...) is even worse.

IN SHORT: If you like to read and want to read some amateurish but actually very VERY good quality writing, then this game is great, go to the elf town library and buy the entire Spellblaze chronicles, great read.
If you want a GOOD RPG? Uhhh... No ;p Run away.

author: {'steamid': '76561197968770052', 'num_games_owned': 859, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 14170, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5887, 'last_played': 1710662086}
review:
At it's core, ToME is sort of an Roguelike meets ARPG hybrid. It's quite remenisent of looters like Diablo, but with the harshness\difficulty and playstyle of a roguelike. 

At the start, there's 7 classes (with an additioanl 21 unlockable as you proceed through the base game for a total of 28!), and 6 Races (with 7 unlockable for a total of 13). Each offers something new and unique, both in terms of actual playstyle, and in synergy with abilities.  Depending on race, and\or class selected, you will end up in different start-zones, doing different beginner quests.

The game features multiple different difficulty modes to help tailor your experience, but ultimately the recommended (and design-target) is normal/roguelike.  Normal do not alter stats or effects in anyones favor, while roguelike is an perma-death mode. Beyond that, you have adventure mode (gain a new life every x- levels) and exploration mode (infinite retries). The highest difficulties (madness\insane) must be unlocked through winning the game on the previous tier of difficulty.

There are optional online functionality in the forms of an in-game chat-log (that mostly show activity of other sonline, such as achivements earned, or deaths), storing of character information (not the save itself, but stats, quest-log, etc), and the item-vault (which allow sharing of items between your characters)

--

If uncertain if it's a game you'd like, I encourage downloading the game from their webpage (in the store description!) and trying it out. It is the entire base-game, for free. Buying it on Steam gives access to Steam Achivements and 'premium' features (such as the item-vault).

author: {'steamid': '76561198424734613', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 59350, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 2801, 'playtime_at_review': 28901, 'last_played': 1712283404}
review:
Diablo II was my favorite childhood game due to its sheer number of builds. Tales of Maj’Eyal is my favorite adulthood game due to its sheer number of builds. This game features great loot drops, enemy variance, and tons of classes with unique skill trees.

If you’re new to the roguelike genre; the graphics are a turn-off, the difficulty is a turn-off, and the learning curve is a turn-off. But if you believe in the process, ToME is a major turn-on.

author: {'steamid': '76561198047965744', 'num_games_owned': 796, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 5812, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1447, 'last_played': 1679542427}
review:
I'm ashamed to admit that the graphics are the reason I was so hesitant to try this game. There's a good reason this game currently sits at Overwhelmingly Positive. If you're a fan of roguelikes, RPGs, loot, character building, and want a challenge then this game is a no brainer. As others have pointed out you can download it for free from the game's website that I'll put below. This game is single player but it has a pretty strong (and helpful) online community and the game itself has an in game chat. You can also check the website and view all of your stats, and it's pretty cool to go back and look at your progress. I'll be playing this for a long time.

https://te4.org/

author: {'steamid': '76561198057775596', 'num_games_owned': 425, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 10309, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7673, 'last_played': 1617631649}
review:
The perfect "I wanna try this D&D character concept" simulator and one of the most customizable roguelike RPGs I have ever played. Seriously, think of pretty much anything and it either is included in the base game, one of its expansions or the many mods.

Wanna be a yeti brawler? Go for it.
Dwarf necromancer? Sure thing, king.
Feeling like a skeleton with chainsaws? Of course it is there.
Perhaps a demon gunslinger? Take it for certain.
What about a time mage elf? I'll give you three flavours of it.
Perhaps an eldritch abomination bent on consuming or possessing all life? Guess what.

The options are so many that I still haven't run out of fun stuff to try. But maybe you are worried about it being a difficult game. Well, as far as roguelikes go, I'd say it has a medium-tier entry barrier (not too difficult, but it has some specifics that you will have to come acquaintanced with after a few test games). If you are not feeling brave enough to try your luck with a character build of your own you can always find ones that are already tested as good enough for general play and campaign completion.

Talking about campaigns, I'll be blunt here: they are fairly long for a roguelike, and while quirky and with some interesting turns on certain tropes, for the most part it is "generic D&D fantasy". You know what stuff to expect from it. On the base game's campaign you have to do the full hero's journey: from the bottom to saving the world from a calamity. However, Embers of Rage, its most interesting expansion, allows you to play a sequel to that campaign in which you can see the consequences of what happened previously, and technology has advanced enough to guarantee chainsaws, guns, mechas and the like.

For what's worth, I'd advise you to get the game if you like roguelike RPGs, it will give you waaaaay more entertainment for its price than you would expect. If the graphics feel like a deterrent, I know that it can be a big hit or miss. Personally, I am not a big fan of the art style, but it doesn't bother me and it is pretty consistent, so there's that.

author: {'steamid': '76561198120530818', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 455785, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 3143, 'playtime_at_review': 201396, 'last_played': 1712283255}
review:
Been playing this game for at least 7 years, since version 1.1.x. Nothing in this world is "perfect", however:
1) Great game, great experience (overall), highly recommended. Available for free as well (without the infinite lives mode - don't think this has or will be changed) on all 3 platforms (works perfectly on Linux).
2) Worth it for the lore alone, on easier/story mode. Game is not easy or "fair" since it is partly luck based, but if you git gud this ain't that much of a problem.
3) Still being developed/expanded. Tons of features have been added. New expansions aren't being added fast enough, though the quality is quite good. A lot can be potentially added in the context of the already existing world.
4) Hard to master, but has great resources such as the official site (te4 org) and the wiki, tometips, forum, character vault, addons. The game might require you learn from your mistakes or spend some time getting to know the basics. The cool arcane blade didn't work for me at first, as "mages" have some weaknesses (alternate Maze boss, oozing horrors, antimagic adherents, etc). Shadow blade was an easier "mage" win for me.
5) Tons of races and classes, though most are locked (can be easily unlocked most of the times). For the less patient ones there is an addon for this. Also, a few require one of the 3 extensions (Ashes: 1 race, 2 new defilers; Embers: 3 races, 4 tinkers; Cults: 2 races, 2 demented).
6) Relatively "poor" graphics, but good looking for me and much better than the pixel like graphics that are for some reason popular (which make my eyes burn).
7) 100% worth buying at full price. I've bought it on discount and I regret it. I should donate.

Tip: try the new "beam purist" build (archmage with high thaumaturgist class evolution). Guide available on the forum. Or choose from any of the classes available in the 11+1 metaclasses: 5 warriors, 4 rogues, 3 mages, 4 wilders, 2 celestials, 4 defilers, 2 afflicted, 2 chronomancers, 3 psionics, 4 tinkers, 2 demented, 1 custom made adventurer.

author: {'steamid': '76561197992284688', 'num_games_owned': 284, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 9742, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 27, 'playtime_at_review': 4387, 'last_played': 1712142209}
review: 73 hours in and it feels like I just started playing. Tons and Tons of fun and enjoyable build variety. Nothing better than what seems like an impossible encounter with all the odds against you and emerging victorious by the skin of your teeth.

review: This is a quality rogue-like with many different options for character building. Obviously some builds work better than others, but there's enough room to experiment and it's satisfying when things come together. The special events like Land of Poosh, The Bearscape, and the random gift items are pretty cool as well. If anyone were looking for a new rogue-like to play, or if someone were looking to try a rogue-like for the first time, this is one I would recommend.

author: {'steamid': '76561198092507999', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 4668, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4668, 'last_played': 1566154470}
review:
Wow.  I started this up on a whim, and was thoroughly unimpressed; I prefer my rogues a styled either entirely 8bit or a little more involving.  I wanted to throw it away and never return upon playing.  Except I couldn't.  I missed some quests, and had to make a new character to get them.  And another, when i figured out the quests are slightly different from race to race (or run to run?)
Then I downloaded more races.  My wife was going crazy from the sound effects and purchased me a bundle to keep me away from it.  Be wary.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030784015', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11196, 'playtime_forever': 200, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 200, 'last_played': 1611656043}
review:
This is an old school Rogue/Hack ripoff game where you stumble around procedurally generated dungeons, hacking and slashing through various monsters.  The game is presented similar to Rogue, with a top down grid, but simple raster graphics tiles have been presented instead of the raw ASCII characters. 

While it's good to see proper western RPG game mechanics in an RPG game, this is let down a little by the simplistic/low quality graphics.   The game does feature some sort of UI scaling, but it's more of a zoom feature.  If you run the game without scaling on a typical 4K monitor in 2021, the text is too small to read.  If you use the zoom, the text is too fuzzy.   This makes the game generally unplayable.   While the procgen that made Rogue/Hack famous is present here, it's important to remember Hack didn't have a lot of competition when it came to RPGs.   In the post-Pool of Radiance/Baldurs Gate/Might & Magic/Morrowind era of gaming, using procgen is just a copout because writing proper level design is hard... too hard for some developers, apparently. 

The simplistic/low quality graphics, the display issues, procgen used instead of content all make this too hard to recommend.  On top of that, there's a $10 price tag for this, which is higher than you would pay for Skyrim, Baldurs Gate, etc etc etc.  It's not good enough to recommend.

author: {'steamid': '76561199012670230', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 49, 'playtime_forever': 4079, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4042, 'last_played': 1644206913}
review: 这游戏职业奇多，战斗构筑十分丰富，但是每次流程很长，要体验新职业重开一轮的话需时太长了，大部分玩家并不能坚持到玩遍大部分职业，削弱了辛苦设计这么多职业的意义，也减少了乐趣，因此如果不进行系统改进而只是添加新职业的话，效果很不明显。建议选职业以后能兼选一个副职业——这样搭配很丰富，即使降低了游戏难度也值得，实际上传统DND游戏本就有兼职。或者保留单职业但同一系的职业在战斗以外能相互转职（这样也算灵活，当然如果能兼职的话就更灵活）。或者开局选职业时能选5个人（不能同时上场，进迷宫之前可以切换主战斗的人，并且让同伴可以帮忙扛装备）

author: {'steamid': '76561197971232555', 'num_games_owned': 232, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 37520, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 37520, 'last_played': 1540341722}
review:
Have you ever wondered what its like to dunk on the strongest necromancer in the land in his big fancy tower only to run from a vagabond group of lowly robbers like an anxious antelope? Have you ever stared certain death in the eyes in the form of an LGBTQ+ dragon because "there might be swag loot in there"? Do you like things that are similar to Lord of the Rings yet divergent enough to not infringe on intellectual property? Is your greatest fear a writhing bipedal invertebrate?

If these are themata you find yourself pondering over, or if you find yourself with an overabundance of free time this game is for you. This game is free for download on the devs website, except DLC. This is only a donation platform, which is well deserved. IMO this game is worth more than what it costs as it has been actively developed to this day.

[b][i]*ALL GLORY TO THE DARKGOD*[/i][/b]

author: {'steamid': '76561198087698269', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 4390, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4390, 'last_played': 1610588300}
review:
I had lots of fun exploring multiple classes and mechanics. The game is certainly worth its money.

Unfortunately absence of consumables, free rest and excessive auto-leveling means there is no strategy component, ToME4 is pure tactics. Which makes it a 70 hour game, not 700 hour game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198220783224', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 4301, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4301, 'last_played': 1610306475}
review: The game is interesting, but genuinely stops being fun when the RNG punishes low level characters harshly right in the beginning zones. Despite the interesting character design and abilities, and the amount of lore - clearly a game made by people who care - the lousy interface and callous disregard for playability and fun for low level or starting characters means I absolutely WOULD NOT EVER recommend this game to anyone else.

author: {'steamid': '76561198175089025', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 2378, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 737, 'last_played': 1612571706}
review: The only game on Steam that boasts a direct line to the granddaddy of them all -- Rogue. Rogue, then Angband, then Zangband, then T.O.M.E. (Troubles of Middle Earth), and now T.O.M.E. (Tales of Maj'Eyal). A proud line stretching over 30 years of gaming. Squint, and you can see the '@' and the various ASCII symbols as they were, and the gameplay is still that satisfying mix of random exploration and fighting. Don't you dare miss this if you at all loved the Angband, Kangband, Hengband, X-band days of old.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998094924', 'num_games_owned': 1562, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 21233, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 18836, 'last_played': 1615609069}
review: Hours played/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198064811677', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 77, 'playtime_forever': 2372, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1827, 'last_played': 1610837784}
review:
Steep learning curve, high barrier to entry, but a gameplay system that will occupy dozens of hours. There is a lot to play around and experiment with. My advice for newcomers is to go to the forums and wiki to look up guides. The game doesn't bother to tell you anything and it's frustrating to learn without help. Traditional roguelikes always suffer from a complete disregard to explaining mechanics or gameplay strategies and TOME is no different.

My only major complaint is that the current version (1.7) is a little unbalanced. The game has a tendency to spawn random elites with abilities that you are categorically unequipped to handle and it is incredibly annoying. You will plow through trash mobs who can't touch you and then die in 2 turns to an elite. How is this properly balanced? After reading complaints about it I rolled back to version 1.5.10 in the steam beta tab and was pleasantly surprised to find that I wasn't getting 2 shot anymore. Elites still represent a threat, but my heart rate didn't jump 20bpm from just spotting one. I feared random elites more than I feared bosses, because with bosses they are the same every play through and I know what to expect. So, my advice is to check online so see if the game is still like this and roll back to 1.5.10 if it is.

author: {'steamid': '76561197976798183', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 19401, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 13205, 'last_played': 1709759339}

author: {'steamid': '76561198065440199', 'num_games_owned': 752, 'num_reviews': 80, 'playtime_forever': 1279, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1094, 'last_played': 1640312714}
review:
I'm usually not a big fan of games like these, but this game got recommended to me a bunch so I had it on my wishlist for a while.

I saw that the game is actually free and tried it out. Thought to myself "welp I guess I can give it a try" and then played for 2 hours straight (I know its not that much but my first character died lol). 

After that I put it into my cart on steam with 5 other games for the winter sale. And since the purchase I basically didn't play anything but this game. 

This game just pulled me in with it's simplicity. You can start a character, put on a livestream or podcast and basically just play on autopilot with some intense fights mixed in. It's pretty fun and relaxing tbh. Didn't get past lvl 25 yet tho

author: {'steamid': '76561197960304530', 'num_games_owned': 2872, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 753, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 753, 'last_played': 1610051564}
review:
Worthwhile but not great. There are much better options in the genre. 

The UI's a nightmare, this coming from someone who enjoys Cataclysm: DDA, Caves of Qud, Dwarf Fortress, Angband, etc. You'll come to dread comparing items. Mechanics have seemingly been littered about without much care for how they work together and how they form a cohesive whole. The graphics are tacky and opting for ASCII sees you still stuck with the middling, slow graphical UI and little effort seems to have been made to make the most of this text-based mode.  

The music's not bad. The snippets of lore are okay.

author: {'steamid': '76561198087885124', 'num_games_owned': 116, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 30544, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 27551, 'last_played': 1698374842}

author: {'steamid': '76561197995491919', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 71, 'playtime_forever': 19600, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 18367, 'last_played': 1692559054}
review:
You fight 500 enemies in a row who can't even scratch you, then you fight one enemy that can kill you in two turns.  You were, I guess, supposed to know that was going to happen, but you didn't know, so the game's over.
If you had killed that enemy, it would've dropped a piece of gear that gives a bonus to a stat that your class doesn't have.

author: {'steamid': '76561198148676717', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 541, 'playtime_forever': 172, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 172, 'last_played': 1639156971}
review:
3  above average
2  average
1  below average
0  not in game

loot   3
crafting  2
exploration  2.5
combat   2.5
replayability  3
game mechanics  2
customization   3
story   2
visuals   .5

fun? yes
potential hours? 100s. It has over 1700 achievements.
bugs or lag? No. Too simple for anything like this.

Reminds me of playing D & D on my computer in the 90s: same basic races (human, elf, halfling, dwarf), same basic classes (fighter, mage, thief, psionic), same joy of play. Gaming grandpa's way: lots of imagination for hours of fun. There are stories and quests like a modern game without the hassle of having to watch brilliant graphics. You still get lots of choices in how you play, but without all the fuss of real visuals. There is a lot of loot and lots of places to go. When you level up you get to add fun new abilities. 

conclusion:

if you love D & D and don't need visuals to have fun, play this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198296579803', 'num_games_owned': 193, 'num_reviews': 59, 'playtime_forever': 253, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 201, 'last_played': 1641295599}

author: {'steamid': '76561198045741611', 'num_games_owned': 89, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 3712, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 183, 'last_played': 1699200860}
review: I'm really enjoying this game so far, but I'm also finding it a little difficult to master. The UI is quite bewildering if I'm honest and there's so much to learn. review: I love this game so much I bought it twice, once on steam and once on the creator's website. It feels like reading a good fantasy book, while also being challenging enough and having enough depth in the mechanics to keep you playing again and again. Maybe the graphics aren't the greatest and the music is a bit cheesy, but they just help make the game more endearing, and besides, you can always use your imagination.

author: {'steamid': '76561198103248913', 'num_games_owned': 378, 'num_reviews': 161, 'playtime_forever': 3421, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1047, 'last_played': 1662686262}
review:
有毒啊这个游戏，能玩坏你的肝。
明明画质，优化，UI都烂的不行，放固态里都加载各种慢，但就是停不下来。

——————————

17个小时，我的第一个狂战士档终于挂掉了。
555他死的好冤啊……
麻的被这些法师又是风筝又是走A的死了好多次，受不了了，果然不论什么游戏，法师都是亲儿子，近战都是孙子。我也要玩个软饭召唤流了，做人上人去。

直到最后……我都没点觉醒技呢……28挑战9层地牢里的那个亡灵法师，还是太勉强了吗？
走错图害死人啊。

author: {'steamid': '76561198053531044', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 91, 'playtime_forever': 41462, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 30118, 'last_played': 1696054797}
review:
The pinnacle of all roguelikes as far as I'm concerned.

Tales of Maj'Eyal doesn't [i]need[/i] to be brutally hard thanks to the options it provides, but I genuinely believe it is best enjoyed when it's played at a difficulty where the game is still capable of destroying you. Really mastering the game requires sometimes taking your time and planning things out via the extensive tactical options available, but the sheer amount of freedom and flexibility you have in controlling character growth is incredible. 

Graphically...Maj'Eyal doesn't look the most impressive and won't wow anyone. The story...exists. The writing, however (despite the story being an excuse to walk from dungeon to dungeon) is actually fantastic and the world lore is extensive once you start to dig into the meat of the game. It isn't a game for everyone, though. If you're looking for something lighter or less crunchy, this is probably not the direction you're seeking. Even so, the ways in which Maj'Eyal seeks to streamline the roguelike process with auto-explore and healing via infusions instead of potions to get back to making meaningful decisions as quickly as possible is something to absolutely be lauded. In 2020, it's certainly not the only roguelike doing this -- but even after all these years I still say it's unquestionably the best.

author: {'steamid': '76561198064974670', 'num_games_owned': 775, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 57497, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 22484, 'last_played': 1705126153}

review: I love/hate this game. Died more than any other game I have ever played. Yet I keep coming back. It takes several restarts to get a character going but its a blast once you start progressing. And then you die unfairly (usually as a result of poor life decisions), rage quit, walk away for a few days or weeks before picking it up again. All in all, I love this game and usually find something new every time I play.

review: The best thing i like about this game is the sheer amount of class and race variety present as well as the fact that it has my favorite summoner/necromancer classes. The game also has a lot of more convenient features like hotkey bindings for skills so you don't have to go through 4 button presses every time you want to cast a single skill. It has your standard top down grid turn based roguelike gameplay which may not appeal to some and the locations are all the same throughout playthroughs with only the area specifics being randomly generated.

review: If your looking for a fun game to relax with, thats easy to learn but hard to master, this is not that game. I love this game but i was still a clueless noob 20 hours in and at more than 100 hours is still havent beat the base game or gotten half the unlocks. If you have time read to all the lore its worth a look. hundreds of hours of fun its worth the price as long as your not the type to rage quit. I stayed up till 6am playing this game for a couple of days strait. Would recommend for anyone with a bunch of time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198031337509', 'num_games_owned': 599, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 6230, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4147, 'last_played': 1696603911}
review: This is an amazing traditional rogue-like mixed with modern RPG mechanics. There's so many classes to mess around with and the game will absolutely punish you for being careless. I also really like the Adventure mode where you get a limited amount of lives. I think this is a good mode for people who want still want there to be consequences for their actions, but way less punishing. The DLC also adds a good amount of content on top of a base that already has a ton of it. You can even try the base game for free on their website if you're still not sure about this game. The main difference between the free and paid version is the Posseser class.

author: {'steamid': '76561198091101884', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 67, 'playtime_forever': 5394, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5394, 'last_played': 1607334245}
review:
伝統的ローグライクというタグに惹かれて購入したものの、中身はハクスラだった。
このゲームはクラシカルなローグライクゲームのシステムを導入したディアブロである。

ザクザクと手に入る装備品、程よいテンポで出現するレアアイテム、多種多様なキャラクタービルド。
プレイを進めるほどに実感するキャラクターの成長を楽しみながら敵をなぎ倒していくゲームだ。

つまるところ、このゲームの難易度設定におけるローグライク、即ち「パーマデス」はオプションであり、やり込み要素に近い。ディアブロのキャラクター製作時にハードコアを選ぶのと同じである。

DCSSや変愚蛮怒、あるいはカジュアルゲーマーにはシレンやトルネコを例にすれば分かるだろうが、これらのローグライクでは死因を振り返ったとき、たいてい「こうすれば良かった」という点が見つかるものだが、このゲームでは死因の多くは場違いに強いモンスターを引き当てた不運による蹂躙である。
序盤に学ぶべき生存術が「このパターンの小部屋にはアイツがいるから今は避けよう」くらいしかないゲームが伝統的ローグライクのタグを付けていけ良いのだろうか。

翻ってローグライクのシステムで遊ぶハクスラとして評価すると良作であることは間違いない。

author: {'steamid': '76561198096729446', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 9679, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7129, 'last_played': 1710576237}
review:
118小时终于通关了噩梦冒险，可太难了。
Tome4是一款非常经典的rl游戏而且非常本格。它专注于战斗而且花样很多。普通游戏可能是一个伤害类型或者一个技能组做一个职业，tome4是一个机制做一个职业，元素法师有三四种可行的build路线，光是发现新东西的新意就能支撑玩好久。
而且这游戏低难度还是很简单的，可以按Z自动探索，不用担心像nethack那种必须步步为营，总体来说上手也比较轻松。能够精进的地方也很丰富，什么时候打什么时候跑，技能怎么点，装备如何选择，都是值得研究的部分。如果想要了解本格的rl，我完全推荐这个游戏。毕竟这是五大rl最容易上手的了。
顺便，我会推荐新手用炼金（

author: {'steamid': '76561198063345547', 'num_games_owned': 437, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 8539, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5173, 'last_played': 1668508350}
review: Insanely deep game. Very frustrating at times given its nature as a roguelike, but ToME makes you feel like you've earned every single bit of progress that you make. It's got a rather steep learning curve at first, but once you have a decent understanding of the game's mechanics and are at least somewhat familiar with the visuals things start to mellow out. A lot of content is locked behind progress that is difficult to make, so if you're not happy with the class/race selection that is available at the start of the game, it could be difficult to get into. I recommend Tales of Maj'Eyal wholeheartedly to anybody that likes roguelikes, fantasy, and meaningful progression in a role-playing game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970819060', 'num_games_owned': 1436, 'num_reviews': 316, 'playtime_forever': 9233, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7109, 'last_played': 1638372962}
review:
I drunkenly stumbled across this in my Steam library one night a few weekends ago while looking for something completely original to play. Unfortunately for me, I didn't realize how dangerous it was... over a hundred hours later, I am playing it while at work, hammering hotkeys while burning through hordes of orcs. Despite how it looks, Tales of Maj'Eyal (also known as TOME4) is a wonderfully complex breath of fresh air; a genuine Rogue-like experience swimming in a sea of mediocre indie "Rogue-lites".

Graphics have never been a strong point for Rogue-likes and yet screenshots of this game don't really do it justice. All of the icons are sharp and easy to read, spell effects are well animated and colorful, and there's a large variety of environment tile sets. While the audio is nothing impressive, with its stock sound effects and bland music, this is one of the few games that I prefer to listen to music or podcasts to while playing. Currently there are 35 classes across 11 meta-classes which all play wildly uniquely. When combined with 16 races, you'll be able to craft a unique run every attempt regardless of what the game throws at you. It's honestly hard to find problems with this game... The last tier of dungeons get tedious because you're fighting walls of different archetypes of orcs, alt+tabbing seems to trigger a bug with movement, and there's a steep learning curve (but is that a bad thing for a Rogue-like?). 

TOME4 is as close to a masterpiece as you'll get for $7. Even that is a bit of an understatement because this game is actually free on the developer's website. However, purchasing it on Steam gives you the "donation" benefits along with access to Steam's benefits such as achievements. As long as you're ready for an uphill battle that requires reading forums and guides to survive, you'll lose dozens of hours to this game. I've only managed to beat it once on Normal/Adventurer difficulty, with a second character getting to the last tier of dungeons before dying, but I am still thinking ahead to my next play through. I need to take a break for my own good but I can't wait to pick this up again.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027718979', 'num_games_owned': 232, 'num_reviews': 49, 'playtime_forever': 1074, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 363, 'last_played': 1704333433}
review: Naprawdę genialny rogalik, grałem w wiele takich no i w Beneth Apple Manor czy LORD (Legend of the Red Dragon), Nethack, Albo nowsze jak Quest of dungeons. Ale siłą tej gry jest masakryczna liczba statystyk, clas postaci, podklas, umiejętności, run i skili z przedmiotów, niech nie zwiedzie was umowna grafika bo dzięki temu, że gra nie wygląda, skupiamy się na statystykach i na tym by przez jeden nie przemyślany ruch nie zginąć od jednego czaru... xD No i oczywiście polecam Tryb Rogulike, czyli jedno życie najlepiej na Koszmarze grałem ze 3 razy 6 godzin zanim padłem, bo delikatnie mówiąc odkopałem jeden z grobów co, doprowadziło mnie do walki a że napaliłem się jak szczerbaty na suchary, to, prawie mi się udał przeżyć, prawie bo podczas leczenia wyłapałem krytykiem :D, no nic takie życie trzeba spróbować znowu :) Polecam gra jest za darmo na stronie producenta ale, nie żałujcie dychy na podstawkę. Bo wsparcie osobie która napisała to cudo, Na pewno mu się przyda... :) To jeden z nielicznych tytułów które dzięki paru spritom i tysiącu statystyk, przyciągną was do kompa na tysiące godzin. Samych osiądnięc na steam jest 1700+ :D Więc nie zastanawiajcie się o ile oczywiście lubicie "rogaliki" :D no i angielski przynajmniej podstawowy się przyda.

author: {'steamid': '76561197967023333', 'num_games_owned': 236, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 484, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 433, 'last_played': 1606964461}

author: {'steamid': '76561197998520738', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 40059, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 29190, 'last_played': 1705862507}
review:
[b]TL;DR[/b]
Tales of Maj'Eyal (TOME) can be described in brief as a traditional or classic rogue-like RPG. It captures the true essence of the genre with turn-based combat, randomly-generated maps and loot, permadeath, unlockable permanent classes/races/abilities for future playthroughs, optional zones and quests with big risks with big payoffs, and importantly, a strong sense of satisfaction when you finally overcome a tough challenge and eventually beat the campaign(s).

Although the game can be downloaded free of charge, I encourage you to purchase it outright if you enjoy it (or just purchase it to begin with if it sounds even remotely interesting to you). I nominated this game for the 2020 Steam Award "Labor of Love" due to the dedication from the developer to continue enriching the game with content, and to diligently optimize and fix bugs. The dev truly takes pride in the game and it shows; with as much enjoyment as TOME continues to provide me, it deserves a solid review. If you're on the fence, I strongly recommend buying it with all the DLC. Full price is worth it and deserved but sales are always nice. Each DLC adds a great amount of content, including a full sequel campaign (Embers of Rage) to enjoy a different perspective of life in the game world. Read on if you want a more detailed breakdown.




[u]High points[/u]:

+ The combinations of classes and races allow for a great deal of replayability - at almost 500 hours as of the time of this review, I have hardly tried half the possibilities.
+ The numerous ability trees, divided by those offered by your choice of class and sometimes race, offer further customization and experimentation with different builds. Relatively easy to understand with a bit of a learning curve if you are new to rogue-like RPGs; a challenge to master as the randomly-generated maps provide new experiences every time. No two runs will be the same; as you unlock permanent access to new trees through in-game achievements, even playing a repeat class/race combo will provide a new experience.
+ The game world is filled with bits of discoverable lore that, after a certain point in a run, will become preserved for review on future runs.
+ Optional quest to obtain your own personal domain complete with optional (for a very small and well-deserved donation) access to a permanent, inter-dimensional vault to store your most prized rare or unique equipment. Should you pursue the permanent vault access, it enables stashing equipment sets over multiple runs so that you can plan a build tailored to maximizing its benefits.
+ A consistent world map with consistent low-, mid- and high-level areas rewards persistence by letting you plan around familiar challenges and bosses, or in many cases skip them altogether. You will come to hate certain unique endbosses until you develop a strategy and/or character build combo that satisfyingly crushes them.
+ Starting class, race and ability choices are interesting and plentiful enough to carry you through the initial hurdles of familiarizing yourself with unique game mechanics and learning the world map while you unlock more character options.
+ A handful of classes and races provide an alternate starting location and quest, and additional lore. These areas are typically inaccessible to other character builds.
+ Various difficulty settings enable you to adjust to an appropriate challenge for yourself at your own pace. The strength/weakness of the player character and mobs can be adjusted in traditional difficulty settings, and the permanency of death can be set to infinite lives, a handful of extra lives to cushion bad luck or mistakes, or classic rogue-like permadeath.
+ Optional vaults and world map zones sometimes appear and can be undertaken by the brave, the overconfident or the foolhardy. Higher-level and higher-rarity randomized mobs can be a difficult challenge and may unexpectedly end your playthrough, but they are just as often full of rare and powerful equipment that can improve your odds of continued success.
+ The tiles and mobs are fairly detailed and easily identifiable at a glance. Graphics and effects are certainly minimalist overall, but the default character tiles change their look to reflect your equipment (and some status effects) at a given moment. If you pursue the optional domain quest, there will be an opportunity for you to change your character's look based on equipment you have encountered throughout various playthroughs.
+ Technical requirements to run this game are low and have been optimized over time.


[u]Low Points[/u]: (but not really)

- Some might consider the graphic style to be outdated, I guess. I think the graphics fit the game fine, but it feels like something worth mentioning as a potential turn-off for some.
- The world is rich in lore and a familiar and mostly consistent zone placement on the two continents. Despite all that fuel for the imagination, all playthroughs feel vacuously devoid of sentient life with which you could interact socially. At worst, the most common non-hostiles exist as cardboard cutouts; at best, the important NPCs or those few with conversation cues resemble animatronic automatons (or sometimes exist only in the mind's eye as they talk to you from behind a closed door. How rude!). My counterpoint is that this style of game isn't meant to recreate a living, breathing world. It is designed for you to erase all evidence of life other than your own, by transforming it into loot and experience - through the magic of creative violence.
- Mastering the game mechanics will take a while. Certain unique abilities may take longer to learn by virtue of being initially locked from availability until you achieve some particular feat; some by accident or luck, sometimes a result of significant choices in optional dungeons, and some by just following/completing the campaign. Learning the basic game mechanics can be a trial-and-error process, but I remember having several "a-ha" moments where certain nuances became easier to recognize and predict. There is also the aforementioned option for infinite lives to provide a safety net while you learn.
- Some of the unlockable content requires you to risk permadeath. Some of it requires access to other unlocks first. This promotes replayability and is an appealing challenge to most, but it bears mentioning for those more easily frustrated; there are options to get immediate access to unlockables, but you won't earn any progress toward unlockables on that playthrough.
- You may not beat the game on your first playthrough. Or even your 10th. Some of this is just a gradual learning process and familiarity with the consistent aspects of the game. Some of it amounts to unfortunate crits or bad luck with random loot drops. Your favorite character will die permanently, and only their great deeds (in the form of expanded character creation options) and legendary gear (if you survived to reach your shared character storage vault and have donated at least once to obtain permanent vault slots) will persist beyond your death. Take risks with optional areas early and often - learn from them to increase your odds of survival in the future.
- The tradeoff for having a largely consistent world map, and only randomly generating the contents of the individual zone maps, is that after enough playthroughs it can lose a bit of luster. In spite of hundreds of hours invested in this game it never truly feels like a grind, but you'll probably end up with a ritual order of zones you stick to every time and some aspects of your later playthroughs may feel like you're marking off a checklist or going through the motions to get to the part you "really care about" for that particular run, whether it's in pursuit of an unlock, trying a new character combo or some new strategy. This perception of monotony is hastened along by the relative lack of friendly or meaningful interactions.


7/7 would do a mankini run again

review:
One of the best roguelike around in my opinion. Fairly balanced, which is pretty much an oddity in the genre (along with the simple controls and intuitive UI), deep systems and insane build customizations.
I guess it could serve as an introduction to the genre, thanks to the detailed tooltips that pop above each important terms and attributes, so don't feel threatened by the apparent complexity.
