author: {'steamid': '76561197970717560', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 30334, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9700, 'last_played': 1705055588}
review:
This is it. This is THE traditional Roguelike. 160 hours in and I feel like I've barely scratched the surface - classes are well designed and play very differently from one another. Multiple campaigns/difficulty levels, interesting builds/skill trees. Compelling, well-written lore to find scattered throughout the world. Occasional laugh out loud moments - almost all of the jokes landed for me.

On top of that, you can download the base game for FREE from their website at te4.org  before you buy it. I did, and it convinced me the game was 100% worth the asking price. If you're on the fence I urge you to do the same.

If you are looking for a traditional Roguelike or any sort of single-player, turn based, tactical combat I cannot recommend this game highly enough.

author: {'steamid': '76561198080839312', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 62, 'playtime_forever': 952, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 952, 'last_played': 1603363333}
review:
판타지 세계관 컨셉질의 끝,  상상했던 모든 직업으로 플레이 가능하다.
이제 그래픽과 퍼마데스 그리고 진입장벽만 넘으면 당신은 완벽하다.

전통적 로그라이크가 워낙 취향을 많이타는 게임인지라 한쪽에선 저딴걸 왜하지? 이럴거고 또 다른한쪽은 ㅉㅉ 그래픽이 전부가 아닌데 이러겠지. 취향은 존중해야 제맛 아니겠나? 

아쉽게도 필자가 생각했든 게임플레이와 달라서 그렇게 오래 즐기진 못했다. 하지만 좋은게임인건 편하지 않으니 엄지척은 주겠음. 
이게임은 당신이 가야할 길을 제시해주고, 플레이어는 그 길을 따라가면서 재미를 느끼는 게임이다. 어떤 스킬트리를 타던지, 어떤 프로제니를 찍는지에 따라 플레이가 바뀔수 있지만 처음에 정한 직업이라는 하나의 굵은 가지는 변하지 않는다. 옆동내 slay the spire를 예시로 들면, 이 게임은 당신이 어떤 카드를 얻냐에 따라 플레이 스타일이 완전히 달라진다. 초반덱과 후반덱이 다른경우가 허다하고 심지어 키카드가 안나오면 그대로 게임오버 당한다. 반대로 톰죽은 처음 정한 직업에 따라 당신의 플레이가 고정됨. 대신 고를수 있는 직업의 수가 정말 토나오게 많아서 모든 직업을 플레이 하는 것 만으로도 수백시간이 걸린다. 

뭐, 이런게임 하는사람들은 리뷰따윈 신경쓸 필요 없으니 그냥 사면 된다.

author: {'steamid': '76561198308899076', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 14123, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11774, 'last_played': 1696781644}

author: {'steamid': '76561197998992876', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 46012, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 36342, 'last_played': 1708689201}
review:
Simply the best Rogue-LIKE out there.  Still have not found another that I like as much, even the ones other will say edges this one out or is it's equal.  Between the hours into the Steam release and from the pre-Steam era I played for free (you can still do this and get basically the whole game right now from te4-dot-org), I have WELL over 1000 hours (yes, that is the correct number of zeros), even if that is nothing compared to some others, all of that says a lot on it's own.

Buy it - it's cheap, and can give hundreds if not thousands of hours of entertainment - and you can even get the base campaign for free from their website (extra campaign are either DLC or can he gotten from donating at the official website).

Stop reading this, since this review is now over anyway, and download this gem!

author: {'steamid': '76561197970681177', 'num_games_owned': 2507, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 36363, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 36282, 'last_played': 1690486752}
review:
I've nominated TOME for the 2020 Labor of Love reward because it's the long-shot up there against the obvious choices of Rockstar's descent into Bethesda-like levels of rehashing and rechurning the same old product again and again with - or PAYDAY2's awkward rising from the grave once they realized they don't know how to make anything else.

TOME is over a decade old - it didn't land on Steam for a while after its inception - and it just keeps getting updated again and again.  Sure, some of these are paid expansions to bring new races or classes to the formula - but those are rare compared to the constant and regular drumbeat patches to fix, expand, add, and rework old content.  This is what all roguelikes aspire to be:  a timeless timesink - where you'll hardly notice the hours flying by due to the sprawling number of possible race/class combinations as well as dynamic game world.

author: {'steamid': '76561198014007641', 'num_games_owned': 509, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 172688, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 109390, 'last_played': 1703017794}
review:
My yearly nominate for Labor of Love!

+ Insane replayability
+ Insane character customization
+ Feeling of constant progression
+ Interesting lore and atmosphere
+ constant updates and bug-fixes. Even after years this game gets love from it's one-man game-creator. This keeps me coming back.
+ "Just one more dungeon"-feel
+ even my girlfriend watches me play sometime. 

- you will get addicted and neglect other things. Sleep will be your first neglection.
- while addicted this game will haunt you in your dreams, leading to very bad sleep.

~ It is highly recommended to take a look at mods, although several may brake the fun or brake the game altogether, you have been warned!
~ if you have performance issues (which at later levels with massive spawns and effects might happen): there are several mods that fix this!
~ remember that mods need to be installed before starting a new char!

Final verdict:
This is THE GAME for in-depth character-creation nerds, like myself! Basically the whole fun and all the hours of this is char creation and planning before starting a new go. Another batch of hours is trying to get (really fun and special) achievements with special hardcore builds, if you are into that! (you probably are, if you are into building chars)!

ENJOY!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198027142159', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 3348, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3348, 'last_played': 1606391279}
review:
Le seul roguelike" tour par tour "classique" qui m'a réellement accroché. On lui reprochera ses graphismes... éco+ ? Mais leur simplicité à l'avantage d'avoir toujours le jeu lisible.

On y jouera avant tout pour la quantité astronomique de builds possibles, et tous très variés dans leur style de gameplay. LA difficulté est importante, mais le jeu peut se jouer avec différents modes de difficulté pour une entrer en matière tout en douceur.

A destiner à ceux qui connaissent le genre et veulent une expérience très complète qui leur tiendra longtemps. Pour les nouveaux venus, ce n'est surement pas le jeu le plus facile a aborder, mais si vous y arriver, plus grand nombre de jeu de ce genre vous feront peur.

author: {'steamid': '76561198100828814', 'num_games_owned': 631, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 2619, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1730, 'last_played': 1701096797}
review:
Один из лучших роуглайков в стиме, да и вообще в принципе. Даром, что клепается одним энтузиастом в гараже, а базовую версию вообще можно бесплатно с официального сайта скачать.
Вагон рас, классов, шмота, пространства для разнообразных билдов. Неказистая, но аккуратная графика и отличная музыка. Игра до сих пор обновляется, даже большие дополнения нет-нет, да выходят.
Из минусов - нет русского, а текста в игре достаточно.

review: This is my favorite Roguelike of all time. I've spent more time with this game than with my children. Though to be fair, I've been paying this game since before any of my kids were born. Don't let the Roguelike tag discourage you if you are a fan of RPGs. Permadeath is just an option, and this game has loads of content. I still haven't tried some of the class combinations. It also can be played for free if you go to the website. At least give it a try.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006573439', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 2443, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2443, 'last_played': 1700623594}
review:
Кто-то назовёт эту игру рогаликом, но по мне она скорее пошаговый Диабло. Убиваешь мобов, делаешь квесты, апаешь уровень, раскидываешь очки в характеристики и прокачиваешь навыки, лутаешь предметы (иногда уникальные, но чаще - рандомно сгенерированные) и всё это ради того, чтобы убивать более сильных мобов, включая боссов (как случайных, так и рандомно сгенерированных).
Если вам такое нравится, то вам понравится ToME.

author: {'steamid': '76561198039993465', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 5122, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5030, 'last_played': 1672205248}
review:
This game has a lot going for it. Tough-as-nails difficulty, deep and tactical combat, and addicting itemization all the while giving the player a plethora of options in terms of race, class and advancement throughout the lengthy (relative for a roguelike) main campaign.

The expansions also provide great content with new items, classes, scenarios/quests, mechanics and even an entire extra campaign setting. I didn't feel that they were lacking and they are especially worth if you're the type who likes experimentation and variety in your run.

Really sunk my teeth into this and managed to get a nightmare and an insane win (albeit only the numbered limited lives setting).

author: {'steamid': '76561198332781429', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 141, 'playtime_forever': 2543, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 466, 'last_played': 1607640689}
review:
很好玩的一款游戏，引用老菊五年前的一句话，“这游戏就是神作”。
内容很丰富很复杂，各种职业和种族的搭配纷繁复杂，但又并不显枯燥，总能让人有钻研下去的念头。
玩了七个小时，感觉也仅仅是摸到了一点点门槛，开局就狂妄地选了支配者职业，然后便正如介绍所说的并不适合新手，死得奇快；然后老实得选了个盾战士，做一个稳妥的铁憨憨，但也一不小心死于群殴。我个人不太喜欢单纯的翻阅数据然后去推算，更喜欢一边玩一边思考，所以感觉每一个职业每一个种族都能花上不少时间去琢磨，很有意思。

author: {'steamid': '76561198025435681', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 2541, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2541, 'last_played': 1605496338}
review: Good roguelike, so if that's your style, you'll enjoy this. Just like every roguelike however, you rarely will die to anything that isn't super stupid. You can be 10+ levels higher than the "min level" (just last play through it was a min lvl 7 and I was 18) pretty good gear and be literally obliterating everything, walk into a random room and there is a mob in there that will CC you and kill you before you can even use an ability. I think I remember one time that I died to something that wasn't someone just 2 or 3 shotting me when everything else in the area can't even hurt me. I guess that's just what roguelike players want.

author: {'steamid': '76561198058074788', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 1781, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 660, 'last_played': 1677421043}
review:
Skill build depth that beats almost any ARPG that I can think of. There's not just variety, but some real craziness to this game. For example, I just played as an insane dude who replaced his left arm with a tentacle that has its own skill tree. The same character can cover his enemies in vomit or even swallow enemies whole. There's actually a whole skill set dedicated to the swallowing enemies thing. Crazy.
Lots of quality of life features like auto-loot, auto-sell and auto-cast.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998371737', 'num_games_owned': 1047, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 45963, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 12724, 'last_played': 1671761102}
review: Amazing amount of content, races (with meaningful differences), and classes. Tons of unlockables, a shared item vault. Multiple difficulty levels and lives settings. 200+ hours on steam and I played it a ton before steam. I've unlocked 16 out of 22 classes so far (missing 1 DLC) 5/6 races (not counting sub-races which also have meaningful differences). Special talent trees unlocks are also present for some classes.

author: {'steamid': '76561198103017513', 'num_games_owned': 23, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 2574, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2221, 'last_played': 1635486949}
review: 杀时间神器

author: {'steamid': '76561197967863280', 'num_games_owned': 1259, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 5250, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3987, 'last_played': 1689486730}
review:
A fantastic Rogue-like game with tons of replayability. The gameplay is a traditional turn-based system. There are a ton of classes and races to unlock, all of which play very differently (everything from your standard warriors, rogues, and mages to things like the Reaver who showers everything in diseases (you're basically Nurgle), the Cursed that curses all items they touch but gains set bonuses from them, and the body stealing Possessor.

Tons of options for playing including several difficulty levels as well as true Rogue-like mode (die and it's over), Adventure Mode (limited lives), and Exploration mode (unlimited lives). There is something for everyone, whether you're looking to casually play through without worrying about restarting or you are like me and enjoy a brutal experience and tons of restarts as you try to master it.

review: Tales of Maj'Eyal is like chess... easy to get going and play but difficult to master. The interface is simple enough to quickly get started and enjoy messing around in the game quickly. I can easily see how this game could shift into a very strategic hardcore game. I never bothered to learn the subtleties to get there but even so I still enjoyed the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198005301074', 'num_games_owned': 366, 'num_reviews': 94, 'playtime_forever': 2741, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1981, 'last_played': 1606229727}
review:
Aloha, this is my review of Tales of Maj'Eyal [TOME], a top turn-based roguelike RPG set in a fantasy world filled with mystery and wonder. When you start the game, you have the standard tolkien-esque fantasy fodder races [human, halfling, elf, dwarf] and classes [warrior, wizard, rogue]; but this is just the beginning, each time you play you unlock new races and classes, even a fortress which you can trade items between characters. The game currently [as of 2020] three expansion packs which have new races, classes, and areas to play. The game is a roguelike and unforgiving be prepared to spend hours levelling a character and have them die in one turn, especially in the later areas, especially with some of the unfair encounters that can demolish you.

The Good: massive game world and plenty to do, easy to learn difficult to master, classes each have their own play style, unlocking new content feels really rewarding, music is decent, pixel graphics are charming, mammoth amount of achievements, multiple difficulty settings for different styles which range for the slider [explore, rogue, etc.] to challenge modes [kill the final boss without taking off your starting bikini] and hidden hard modes [fight for control of your body with a parasite that makes you act randomly]. I recommend  playing a few times on roguelike to try out different classes and then playing through the whole game on exploration mode with your faves. 

The Bad: the main story is the bog standard orcs/dragons/demons vs. elves/humans and overall forgettable. The gameplay is addictive, if you have important things in IRL to do, maybe set a timer?

The Ugly: I had to turn off special effects after the parasite had taken total control of my character because I was getting nausea and dizziness from the graphical effect of mind-control.

author: {'steamid': '76561198014391315', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 86, 'playtime_forever': 3424, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2644, 'last_played': 1624935225}
review: it a ♥ game

author: {'steamid': '76561198103874486', 'num_games_owned': 621, 'num_reviews': 86, 'playtime_forever': 1890, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 987, 'last_played': 1605459231}
review:
Holy shit this game has a lot.
My first run lasted like 12h, and as far as i can tell i just barely scratched the surface of this game. So many classes/races, so much really interesting loot, incredible variety of enemies, ect, ect. I saw a fucking bear that summoned (or was it some illusion idk) another bear that had a bow and shot at me with explosive acid arrows...
If this game was 3d skyrim like, it would be an amazing mess. This really works well as (kind of) grid based combat with "turns" (with abilities/equipment you can slow down time, and perform more actions).
Also, so many ways to play. You can go full roguelike permadeath, or have many lives, or just exploration mode with infinite lives. Not interested in story? Just unlock arena or infinite dungeon crawler modes and just go full hacknslash...

The only bad things would be that some parts of the UI are kinda bad - like key bindings - why are the key names shortened? How am i supposed to know that C5 means Ctrl 5, and not the letter C... Or the equipment that has an insane amount of stats, but a lot of info is shortened and not really well explained, so if you really want to understand everything, its either to test how it works yourself or just go read the wiki...
But you can pretty much ignore most of it and just equip what you want and kill some mobs. The complexity is here for the hardcores who want to play on ridiculous difficulty settings.

I will probably lose hundreds of hours on this game, and i'm really looking forward to it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198096657845', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 4268, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4268, 'last_played': 1605016541}
review:
Frustrating but fun. If you don't play on the easiest setting that lets you revive from death as much as you like, then get accustomed to the game by making plenty of throwaway characters and going on throwaway runs. You'll probably want to look at the wiki and use that as a guide, to some extent.

Locking a lot of the classes and races is annoying, especially for DLC content.

author: {'steamid': '76561198152064647', 'num_games_owned': 398, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 2940, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1918, 'last_played': 1676781681}
review:
This game took a little while for me to truly get into, but now that it is, I truly understand why this is a time-trap for most people. 

First off, this Steam version is only a little different from the free version you can get from te4.org; so if you'd like to try the game, it's pretty much there for free in it's entirety. Purchasing on Steam only gives you small buffs, like being able to use custom tiles for your characters and of course it gives you the ability to purchase the amazing DLC so far. The Steam purchase is moreso to support the developers than anything.

ToME4 is a traditional roguelike along the lines of Angband, Nethack, etc. This means Turn-Based, Grid-Based combat around procedurally generated landscapes and dungeons (though this game also has different options, like multiple lives instead of just one, etc.). This game has a huge amount of variety in it's character creation, races and classes; as well as the ability to mod your own in with ease. If you're a fan of the character building aspect of the old Diablo games, then this game will automatically appeal to you.

This game doesn't throw much unfair insanity your way like a fair amount of Roguelikes do, and so every move you make feels immaculately strategic as opposed to just pure luck; though that certainly is an aspect too. The UI is fairly slick, controls modular and very easy to learn in comparison to other games in the genre, and the gameplay loop is incredibly addictive.

The devs are wonderful and work on the game non-stop pretty much, sometimes they'll hop on the game and grant players some items to help through their run, or just some goofy abilities; like the Sheer Badassery ability, which makes all creatures in a certain radius compliment your badassery when you kill them. It's a load of fun, and the game is fairly social for a singleplayer experience. All your characters are saved online on the website if you have a profile, letting you share your amazing builds, items and the inevitable varied ways your character will perish.

The game is a lot of fun, and the setting is creative; ranging from generic fantasy stuff, to lovecraftian stuff, to hellscapes, etc. I highly recommend this game. Amazing experience, and I'll undoubtedly pump more hours into it as time goes on.

(Update: All the DLCs are well worth it too.)

author: {'steamid': '76561198046263366', 'num_games_owned': 378, 'num_reviews': 110, 'playtime_forever': 3625, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1815, 'last_played': 1605412034}
review: Endless fun game, love it

author: {'steamid': '76561198008715280', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 20751, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 583, 'playtime_at_review': 14716, 'last_played': 1711684439}
review:
what drew me to this? I'll admit, it was the overwhelmingly positive reviews. 

I mean...c'mon....tiles? what is this 1990!?

And it's wonderful. If some part of you thought games 'grew' in the wrong direction even before most people thought games were growing in the wrong direction...this is your answer to "what-if"....which is what if someone decided to grow a game based on gameplay, options, pure content, replayability, consequence and depth, vs. spending a very long time modelling a mostly empty 3d world. 

and you get this, a modern masterpiece built on the game building concepts of old. Every class, race, campaign, is full of gameplay possibilities, and even within each combination, even more options to play how you want. And there's even lore...and it's actually good, though it does require attention to detail to piece it together.

TOME is amazing, highly recommended, I urge anyone that misses gameplay depth to not pass this up based on the graphics...which not only grow on you, but are fantastic in of themselves.

author: {'steamid': '76561198197348674', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 1883, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1507, 'last_played': 1704687205}
review: If you're looking for a traditional roguelike you can't go wrong with ToME.  Tons of un-lockable races/classes to keep the game fresh.  It is also a good starting point for people that are new to the traditional roguelike genre, as you can play with permadeath, have a set number of extra lives, or play with unlimited lives.  Tons of different skills and spells to play around with, bunch of different ways to build each class, very re-playable.  Must buy.

author: {'steamid': '76561198112021505', 'num_games_owned': 85, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 14854, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3649, 'last_played': 1695565871}

author: {'steamid': '76561198343599121', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 1297, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 207, 'last_played': 1694875569}
review:
Ne vous laissez pas rebuter par l'apparence et l'interface qui peuvent sembler chaotiques au début. Le jeu s'avère au final bien pensé et très clair, ainsi au bout de quelques heures vous aurez pu assimiler l'essentiel des mécanismes. 
Je n'en suis qu'à mon deuxième personnage, et je prend déjà mon pied. Le nombre de classes disponibles (certaines étant à débloquer) et le degré de personnalisation lors des montées de niveau font plaisir à voir.

author: {'steamid': '76561198083595167', 'num_games_owned': 890, 'num_reviews': 109, 'playtime_forever': 2510, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1355, 'last_played': 1704013447}
review:
我很难形容这游戏的体验

真的很难想象作者花了多少心血去写职业这块

每次地牢还有简短的剧情可以看

很对我的胃口，其实一开始玩起来感觉挺一般的

玩了几个小时就开始上头了

可惜我买的4人包里玩到时长最长的就是我了，第二长的倒也有10几小时

推荐给喜欢暗黑类bd，能接受2D画风的玩家

review: Solid Rogue-like. It can be hard at to get going but over a few play throughs you'll start making solid progress and unlocking a heap of extra races and classes to start trying out and experimenting with. Hours upon hours of play time potential.

author: {'steamid': '76561198066645868', 'num_games_owned': 149, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 4385, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 988, 'last_played': 1708864685}
review:
[b] ABSOLUTELY AMAZING ROGUELIKE [/b]

Be warned that this videogame has a very VERY steep learning curve, but once you understand the core mechanics and how the game work, you will be sucked in in this vortex of pure gaming pleasure.

It's fun, has a huge amount of replayability and you can run this game on a potato computer.
The only negative, is that the learning curve is very steep as i have said, and that could potentially turn off many people (myself included back in 2016 i think) 
But as i said, once you get around the first four hours of torture, you'll find a hidden gem of gaming.
The story is a bit "Dark" and very grim i must say, and there's a lot to read. 
You can literally spend hundreds of hours just reading stuff. and you will most likely find a class for you, but it does get a bit of work to find it.
I highly suggest to either donate and/or buy the DLCs, for they do add a lot of extra content to the main game. like: More campaigns, character, maps, classes; items and more.

review: 优点大家都知道，说几个不足和建议，希望采纳。1、地下城所有墙壁设置为可挖掘和魔法穿越，老是有一些墙挖不动和穿越不了，又分辨不出那些能挖那些不能挖。2、金钱作用太少，后期基本没用钱的地方。3、可以对话的NPC建议设置特殊标识。4、希望不同城镇雇佣不同类型佣兵，设置佣兵育成和成长。5、增加阵营系统、中立多做任务变为友善，友善城镇可接特殊任务和学习特殊技能。也可叛阵营、友善变敌对。而不是人物创建就注定。

author: {'steamid': '76561198038765149', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 64971, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 43259, 'last_played': 1676419768}
review:
Take the time to learn it and it rewards you with really deep and enjoyable game sessions. I love it as a roguelike but you can also turn on extra lives if that is your preference. It's a lot of fun unlocking new classes / magic schools / races and other easter eggs that make char customisation even deeper. 

If you like turn based RPGs with deep character customisation - there's a lot of fun for you here. 
This game deserves support.

author: {'steamid': '76561198258057186', 'num_games_owned': 220, 'num_reviews': 49, 'playtime_forever': 10896, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1192, 'last_played': 1682583624}
review:
Tales of Maj’Eyal is a very good game. It’s not perfect but it’s among the best rogueLike games. I really have enjoyed my time with it despite not getting very far. Every class feels fun to me and they’re all viable. The game itself is very hard imo. I destroyed Hades, Binding of Isaac, Risk of Rain 2, but I’ve struggled to survive in this game. The combat is unique and a bit strange. It’s an isometric turn based action rpg. I say action because mostly the fights flow and resolve quickly. 

A few pros and cons:

Pros: 
-tons of classes. No fixed route through game, even though certain classes and races start you in a certain location, you can simply leave and start elsewhere if you want. 
- lots of skills : each class have several viable ways to spec and level up. 
-a huge amount of items. This game has armour pieces, weapons of a large variety, and even has cool items called wild runes which give you strong survival abilities. 
- fun and worthwhile side missions where you Escort a person to a zone safely in exchange for a stat increase. 
- bosses and treasure troves are hard - if you’re not careful it’s easy to die very quickly to them. 
- I should also note I’ve only played on normal and rogue like difficulty. There’s a choice upon new game to remove permadeath which is nice imo. 

Cons
- time to die is very, very, very fast with some builds. If you build a damage oriented build like archmage for example you can get to level 15 ish like I did and still die pseudo instantly. Quite a few times I’m not even aware of the danger until it hits. I’m probably not the best at this game, but I think I’m better at this type of game than most people. So I think it might be a little too hard tbh. That said, I bet when I finally beat this game it’s gonna feel great, 
- the escort missions Can be incredibly frustrating when your escort moves towards the goal like a moron, and you lose track of them. It happens a fair bit and feels more based on luck than skill. If you fail an escort mission your run can be set back big time because you’re missing a huge stat boost. 
- DLC - there is stuff hidden behind dlc. I don’t like dlc so I put this as a con. The dlc aren’t expensive but neither is this game.

Overall, a good, cheap rogue like that’s hard af.

author: {'steamid': '76561198276215814', 'num_games_owned': 116, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 10724, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2821, 'last_played': 1665600365}

author: {'steamid': '76561198044839833', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 10301, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10301, 'last_played': 1599525799}
review: This is an excellent game. It is a rogue-like in the sense that there is perma-death and levels and world-maps have randomly generated enemies and loot. It has permanent maps though, and completing various quests unlocks classes etc. If you survive a decent way into the main game you can find a spot to transfer loot from character to character, although storage is limited. I would say the spots where the game excels is in character building (TONS of classes, skills, augments, Items) and lore (well written with a good bit of dark/wry humor). There is also a story line to follow which is fleshed out enough to distinguish it from stuff like DCSS. Another place where it beats most classical rogue-likes is the UI, which is fairly intuitive and keeps the majority of skills and stuff on an extremely large but visible hotkey bar.  The base game stands alone, but the DLC is good too.

author: {'steamid': '76561198080637071', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 10228, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5713, 'last_played': 1604901454}
review:
這個工作坊的插件可以解鎖 =全種族&職業=

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=203057541&searchtext=Unlock

還沒有詳細測過不知道有沒其他問題就是了。

============

★★★　有繁體中文就是好   ★★★

這款遊戲我已經很久沒有玩過了~~~
最近看到他更新所以想說再來玩一下

沒想到關注了一下才發現，竟然出現了繁體中文版本
沒甚麼比這個更開心的事

以Rogue遊戲來說，這款遊戲真的會給予最高的評價
別看畫面好像品質很低的樣子，玩起來可是超級有趣的
強烈的推薦這款遊戲

這裡要評價幾個希望可以改善的缺點部分
(不過因為我很久沒玩過了，
所以不知道缺點是不是有改善了，
如果改善了我會再修改評價內容)

★★★   希望改善的缺點   ★★★

1. 雲端備份
這款遊戲好像沒有雲端備份，
有聽說他有內建雲端備份，只是沒有啟動，要透過一些方法手動啟用

2. 角色的解鎖
我之所以抱怨沒有雲端備份，
最主要原因就是角色解鎖的部分
很多角色要解鎖真的非常麻煩
好不容易打通解鎖了角色
可是重新安裝WINDOWS系統之後
全部都消失了
一想到要全部重新解鎖角色
我就想要放棄遊戲了

★★★
所以我希望，要嘛就是一開始就解鎖全部腳色
要嘛就是可以雲端備份(STEAM CLOUD)
讓資料可以保存下來
不用重新再打一次

除此之外，沒想到啥缺點了

強烈推薦這款遊戲
對Rogue遊戲有興趣的玩家
強烈的推薦

好玩

author: {'steamid': '76561198051411665', 'num_games_owned': 270, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 28568, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8153, 'last_played': 1706907343}
review:
Not enough people acknowledge the existense of this amazing game. A roguelike with such scope that puts other games to shame. The gameplay is very fun and engaging and the replayability is off the charts. This is mostly thanks to the amount of classes available that you can unlock through progression. Each class being very well designed and unique, having several different skill trees that enables you to play that class in different ways. 

The game does have a steep lurning curve if you want to get into the real meat. But if you have played games with RPG elements before it won't be too rough. 

All hail the almighty DarkGod! (the developer of this game)

author: {'steamid': '76561198072062754', 'num_games_owned': 140, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 10454, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7064, 'last_played': 1688289600}

review: A prime example on how roguelikes can look like crap and still feel good to play. All the unlockable races and classes, all the multiple ways to build each combination of them, all different permutations of places to go through each run...there's just SO MUCH in this game, guys.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041673937', 'num_games_owned': 556, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 11968, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4026, 'last_played': 1676919700}
review: Great classic roguelike with a billion different options to customize both your character and the ruleset. Despite its complexity it's probably one of the friendliest classic roguelikes to learn with its variable difficulty options. Being able to use your own custom paper doll is a huge plus if you're a piece of shit like me and create your own OCs.

author: {'steamid': '76561198144875746', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 192, 'playtime_forever': 2060, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1054, 'last_played': 1710907168}

review: Playing this game impacted my life strongly. After readjusting my schedule to give myself the time I need to think about, plan about, read about and play this game I'm finally brave enough to start wearing fedoras and Naruto Hokage Headbands in public and finally freed myself from "society's" programming that I have to "fend for myself" by returning to living in my mom's basement. I quit working my dead-end job to go on FREE subsidy checks from the government which I exclusively spend on Steam keys I purchase in a futile attempt to "chase the dragon" as all the kids on the roguelike forums are saying these days. I want to turn my hand into a tentacle in real life.

review:
Dangerously addicting. Took me 79 hours to finally beat on "Roguelike" setting with permadeath. I think after that I'm done.

The only downside is that you gotta grind through the same stuff every time you permadie, and it's a bit grindier than other games. It seemed like I was sinking 3-5 hours every restart just to get the the difficult/fun part again.

Still, it's a great game, especially for the price.

author: {'steamid': '76561198005518489', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 19841, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2870, 'last_played': 1608835642}
review:
Отличный рогалик.
Хочешь ходить с двуручным мечем и раскидывать по врагам фаерболы - пожалуйста...
А можешь играть за алхимика сделать голема и прятаться за спиной своего механического друга...
Можно отринуть любую магию и вступить в клуб любителей убивать магов.
Можно стрелять по врагам из паровых пистолетов, и пилить их паровой пилой. А если пила на колесиках это даст бонус к скорости!
А можно превращаться в демона и забрать врага в свой ад чтобы расправиться с ним там.
Есть чем развлечься.

author: {'steamid': '76561198144332040', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 2932, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2612, 'last_played': 1645980893}

Etwas unübersichtliches Inventar und der Einstieg ist nicht ganz leicht, aber es lohnt sich die Anfangshürde zu überwinden. Dicke Empfehlung und Vorsicht: großes Suchtpotential. :D

author: {'steamid': '76561198084019881', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 480, 'playtime_forever': 2986, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2986, 'last_played': 1602158702}
review:
Это не игра  и даже не рогалик — это такой стиль жизни!

[h1]Abstract[/h1]
This is not a game or even a roguelike — this is a lifestyle! Works perfect on Ubuntu 18.04. Notebook with Intel® HD Graphics 4400 and i7-4600U CPU @ 2.10GHz is enough. 

[h1]Настоящий рогалик![/h1]
Начинается с того, что глаза разбегаются от вопросов вида «Кем быть?» и «Где тут можно выбрать мага?» После почти случайными кликами сляпываешь протагониста, выходишь во вводную локацию наводнённую какой-то нечестью,  выходишь в мир, открываешь журнал, следуешь совету и почти сразу же умираешь… Правда некоторые умирают ещё в «тьюториале».

Главное: если игра вам говорит «А вы точно хотите коснуться этого жуткого торчащего из земли щупальца?», то отвечать утвердительно — это 100% способ получить премию Дарвина. И да, даже если вы будете вести себя аккуратно,  издалека разглядывать монстров, проверять их характеристики, вы всё равно вскоре умрёте, так как этот мир весьма разнообразен на разного рода пакости, так что обежать его в лёгком темпе не получится. 

Поэтому для «поглядеть» следует выбирать бессмертие или уровень Exploration. Во всех остальных случаях смиритесь с тем, что вы потратите не одну _сотню_ часов для того, чтобы дойти до конца, открыть вот этот вот интересный класс под вот эту не менее интересную расу, чтобы налезла вот эта артефактная шапочка, чтобы опять же убиться этой комбинацией наиболее глупым образом.

[h1]Open Source[/h1]
Да, вы не ослышались — исходник игры доступны под лицензией GPLv3  и бесплатную сборку можно скачать прямо на [url=https://te4.org/]родном сайте[/url]. Лицензия на графические ассеты  к сожалению более ограничена "with the Tales of Maj'Eyal game only", но в любом случае развивать её имеющемуся сообществу это не мешает.  Донат или покупка игры на Steam открывает некоторые дополнительные возможности и расширения, в частности уровень сложности Exploration, но по большей части это возможность просто сказать спасибо DarkGod — создателю этой вселенной. Поверьте — есть за что!

[h1]ЛОР[/h1]
Тут есть История, буквально с большой буквы. Она возможно не сразу заметна, но тексты, свитки которых можно найти на просторах Eyal, написаны весьма и весьма хорошо. У каждого народа тут есть своя правда, даже у орков и демонов. Абсолютно у всех есть скелеты в личном шкафу…

[h1]Роль протагониста в истории[/h1]
С одной стороны её нет, так как это рогалик и никто особо не стремится сказать вам что делать за исключением некоторых ключевых моментов. Это рогалик, где по идее всё завязано на геймплей. Да и мрут эти самые протагонисты как мухи, поэтому обращать на них особого смысла нет, но с другой стороны по сути дела вы реально спасаете этот мир, ну или захватываете…

[h1]Советы казуалу[/h1]

✔ Не усложняйте себе жизнь и выберите Exploration, так как удовольствие от регулярного «геймовера»  получает разве что мазохист, а сунуть нос в каждую щелку очень хочется…

✔ Почитайте какое-нибудь из кратких руководств, например, [url=http://forums.te4.org/viewtopic.php?f=52&t=48756]это[/url]

✔ Запаситесь терпением — этот мир стоит того, чтобы его изучить.

[h1]🐧 GNU/Linux[/h1] 
Спас этот несчастный и полный чудовищ мир посредством полурослика-варвара с огненным вампирским двуручником и умер при этом каких-то 205 раз в среде Ubuntu 18.04 на ноутбуке с видеокартой Intel® HD Graphics 4400 и ЦПУ i7-4600U @ 2.10 ГГц. Графические спецэффекты от заклинаний иногда тормозят процесс, но игра пошаговая и по хорошему основное время должно занимать обдумывание следующего хода, если вы не хотите умереть, конечно.

[h1]Обзор входит в список [url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1103944566]Игры, Linux, Steam, обзоры.[/url][/h1]

author: {'steamid': '76561198026638931', 'num_games_owned': 1418, 'num_reviews': 57, 'playtime_forever': 6661, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2371, 'last_played': 1706271984}
review:
I absolutely love this game, and one big reason for that is the developer behind it.

About the game itself: this must be one of the most approachable roguelikes while at the same time one of the deepest ones. Lots of classes, races, quests... So many things to do. Absolutely in love with this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197973051663', 'num_games_owned': 495, 'num_reviews': 63, 'playtime_forever': 7362, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1025, 'last_played': 1698369093}
review: A very nice little starter roguelike for younger players and those with no experience of the genre.  The interface is mouse-driven, alleviating one of the main entry barriers of roguelikes, and the mechanics are easy to grasp.  Magical loot drops in great abundance and the typical mobs are easy to fight, with bosses providing a slight challenge that requires some basic planning skills.  Veterans of the genre will probably tire of it after a few hours, as it's definitely on the "easy mode" side, but it is well-executed and continually supported.  Think of it as a transitional game from those BioWare & Obsidian RPG-lites into the more challenging world of real CRPGs, (i.e., roguelikes).  When you've finished with ToME I recommend you move on to Caves of Qud, which will beat you like a red-headed stepchild but is quite possibly the best CRPG ever created.

author: {'steamid': '76561198281034380', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 9160, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9055, 'last_played': 1657504916}
review:
I want to start by making something extremely clear. If you are just getting your feet wet in roguelikes, maybe you've heard of ToME from doing some research online or happened upon this game and are trying to make a final decision between Caves of Qud or a number of others popular at this time, [i]start here[/i]. This game deserves a recommendation to that specific audience, and high praise for the level of simplicity brought to what can be a very complicated genre. No ASCII, no arduous keyboard commands, hell you can play ToME almost entirely with a mouse. Many have spent likely thousands of hours mastering the many intricate classes in this game, there's mounds of content, and winning feels good.  This review is not for you, and this is a good game for you to get your feet wet, or maybe even soaked for a while.

[b]To everyone else[/b] - I'm not an extremely experienced roguelike player, I've got a couple hundred hours here and there but I am far from a salted veteran, [i]I should not think this game is easy[/i]. But it is... But its not.. But it is. 

Let me explain. 

The most likely element to kill you in ToME is far and away, without a doubt - [b]boredom[/b]. There are just WAY too many trash mobs and so much of the combat is meaningless, tactic-less, skill-less filler. The fact that on each floor of a dungeon you can easily encounter [i]dozens[/i] of one shot-able foes lulls you into this repetitive trance all to be broken by some beefy elite that can KO you in 4 or 5 turns, a couple of which you've likely burned through before you even noticed there was [b]FINALLY[/b] a real threat. Everything about ToME screams, "more is more", with a complete lack of restraint in consideration to the gameplay loop itself. I have not been at this for long, but I have to commend those of you have frequented the 8 monotonous levels of [spoiler]Dreadfell[/spoiler] just to get the the 9th and final meaningful one. Then there are the pages upon pages of items to skim through when exiting each floor, because even the most seemingly benign enemy can somehow drop random uniques 2 or 3 tiers above what you may have (it appears gear is level-based, not enemy-based). [b]Every enemy doesn't need to have a loot pool[/b]. I found myself really wanting to try other classes and skill combinations, an area I'm actually happy to see this much content overload, but just simply could not sell myself on the monotony of it all. Its a real shame too because I feel like this is so easily fixed, [i]cut some of these dungeon levels[/i]. I found myself actually happy to find a new area that had only a single floor, or the nice design of the Tannen's Tower with multiple floors but compact rooms. And most importantly, above all else [i][b]cut some of these meaningless hoards of fodder[/b][/i]. Fighting elites and boss level enemies is fun, ToME has masterful tactics and thrilling combat that is quite simply ruined by the overabundance of rats and snakes and ants and slimes and [b]oh my god why am I still fighting this stuff at level 47[/b]. I'm sorry, I know there is a lot of love for this game, and my opinion is likely unpopular, but it comes from a place of love. There were some really, truly amazing experiences throughout my time here in Maj'Eyal, this game does some things so incredibly well. But the fact that in another round, my end of days would no doubt come from glazing over and dying from [b]the encounter I actually wanted the whole time[/b] has me signing out. 

I'll finally just touch on the fact that increasing the difficulty does somewhat bandage this problem. As I played mostly on normal and just a tiny bit on nightmare I actually feel pretty strongly that nightmare is bit more fun. But its the [i]disparity[/i] between the difficulty in enemies that sucks, even on normal, elites and bosses are plenty hard enough to my taste and I enjoy the battles. And the reality is making a rat an HP sponge isn't going to fix this long term, it may make some earlier gameplay more interesting, but its just going to make it even more tedious over time. At the end of the day the fodder is always going to be fodder, and I just can't take 100 more slimes.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971014968', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 52, 'playtime_forever': 5566, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3720, 'last_played': 1603987001}
review:
Отличный рогалик, совмещающие в себе качественную для поджанра графику, интересный лор и обширнейший набор возможностей. Отдельное спасибо автору за Exploration Mode c бесконечными жизнями, позволяющий комфортно изучать игру новичкам и тем, кто не обладает гигантским количеством времени на все новые прохождения.

К сожалению. не обошлось и без недостатков - количество трэш-мобов и трэш-лута зашкаливает, что приводит к усталости от игры и ошибкам при долгих сеансах. Тем не менее, проект является несомненным хитов среди роликов. Рекомендую попробовать.

P.S. Важная подсказка для тех, кто считает графику мелковатой. Для исправления ситуации лучше всего измененить размер плитки с со стандартного 64x64 на что-нибудь вроде 80x80. И игра сразу преобразится.

author: {'steamid': '76561198018952608', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 1342, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1082, 'last_played': 1601240579}
review:
So much lore! So many different weapons, play-styles, and enemies! Don't let the graphics of this game put you off, it simply allows you to exercise your imagination along with the amazing descriptions the game provides. It's like a solo D&D campaign!

Will you be a nimble archer avoiding your foes and dispatching hordes with shrapnel shots, or perhaps a berserker whirlwind slashing with your mighty greatsword, or yet maybe a wizard either tricky or simply with power overwhelming?

If you have ever played (and enjoyed) Dungeon Crawl Stone Soup you will love this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198125913365', 'num_games_owned': 153, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 3663, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2642, 'last_played': 1643613927}
review:
Игра в жанре пошаговый рогалик, еще и с настройкой сложности - мне понравилась!
Можно не спеша обдумывать каждый ход, сделать перерыв на чашечку кофе.
Я наиграл мало часов, потому что сначала купил ее в GOG, но там нет привязки к аккаунту на сайте игры https://te4.org/ Пришлось покупать второй раз со всеми дополнениями. Но если играть без дополнений, то можно вообще не покупать - базовая игра бесплатна.
Плюсы:
Отличный баланс. Автор годами его выверял, получилось очень гармонично.
Огромный мир, ре-играбельность. В конце надо убить злодея, но для этого надо открыть несколько континентов.
Много персонажей и контента. Причем для открытия персонажа надо еще попотеть, у многих не очевидные условия открытия. Например, чтобы играть вирмом, надо съесть сердце королевы червей.
Весь прогресс и все персонажи сохраняются на сайте игры. Можно создать аккаунт и прямо оттуда смотреть свои достижения, инвентарь и прочее.
Нетребовательность к железу. Свежая версия игры пойдет на однопроцессорном ноутбуке HP Compaq nx6310. Конечно, приятнее играть под Win 10 на стационарном компе с видеокартой и процессором intel5.
Графика и в плюс (не грузит систему) и в минус (ну нет тут лучей!)
Минусы (а как же без них!):
Нет русского языка. В игре надо много читать, хотя английский простой.
Не очевидные настройки. Хотя, как плюс, настроить можно почти все.
Всем любителям РПГ и рогаликов рекомендуется!

author: {'steamid': '76561198041680016', 'num_games_owned': 365, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 2896, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 795, 'last_played': 1677406154}
review: this game reminds me schrodingers cat. you do not want to die because you have only one life. you want to die because you want to try it again with completely different setup and setting. very ambivalent feeling about being alive. would gladly die again.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970739209', 'num_games_owned': 604, 'num_reviews': 117, 'playtime_forever': 33724, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 38, 'playtime_at_review': 16218, 'last_played': 1711302307}
review:
The best roguelike I've ever played. 

It starts out pretty simple: archer, berserker, stuff you've seen before and know how to handle. Then it starts to get weird. I'm currently playing as a tiny psychic amphibian who spits slime at my enemies and exudes mucus wherever I walk which poisons my enemies and empowers my deadly OOZE BEAMS.

If I had to find things to complain about, I'd say the following:
The interface can be visually overwhelming and setting up the hotbar to my liking took much too long. Sound effects are weak and sometimes annoying (wolves howling every turn, I'm looking at you). Itemization is a bit limited and tends to usher you towards certain supported builds within each class. The biggest complaint though is that work, social relationships, and other real life obligations are suffering because I can't stop playing this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198021909918', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 71, 'playtime_forever': 5000, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2203, 'last_played': 1698950087}
review:
Удивительно залипательный рогалик. 
Причём, именно классический rogue-like, а не всё это новомодное казуальное недоразумение. Когда к простенькой аркадке добавляется "пермосмерть" и прокачка. И разрабы такие сразу, вот, мы запилили рогалик, восторгайтесь нами.

Главный плюс игры - огромная вариативность при создании персонажа: доступно множество рас и классов. Причём, большая часть из них в начале игры заблокирована. Проходя квесты и выполняя достижения игрок может разблокировать их, а также дополнительные навыки и скины для персонажей.
Причём, игра за разные классы отличается. Подчас - довольно сильно. А иногда - полностью. Разработчики сильно заморочились, и придумали огромное множество механик и параметров, так или иначе взаимодействующих друг с другом.
Причём, каждый класс можно развивать по разному, и подбирать разную экипировку. В итоге получаем практически бесконечную реиграбельность.
А ещё ведь есть несколько кампаний, разные пути выполнения квестов и дикое количество контента. Подчас открываемого по чистой случайности. 
Нашли вы, например, подозрительный воротник с хорошими статами. И, недолго думая, надели на шею. И ничего, что у него зубы растут. Но вот после очередной смерти этот зубастик предложит спасти вам жизнь, нужно просто предоставить паразиту полный доступ к своему телу.
И всё, больше мы не гном, хоббит или эльф. Мы теперь существо, управляемое паразитом, поселившимся у нас на шее и голове. Причём, этот паразит обладает собственной волей, и может сожрать ни в чём неповинного NPC,  не спрашивая нашего разрешения.

В общем, разнообразия очень, очень и очень много. Вполне хватит, чтобы компенсировать примитивный графоний. И вообще, всякий знает, что графика в таких играх - не главное.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994430441', 'num_games_owned': 495, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 25797, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 15, 'playtime_at_review': 24192, 'last_played': 1712184303}
review:
A true roguelike.
For the gameplay, it's great with tons of classes and specialization, the ability to reset the last points invested can make it so you can still turn around and change your skills at the start of the game to best make use of the first unique item you find. Speaking of items, they're really interesting with sometimes build-changing effects, the bosses will always drop one so you're not completely at the mercy of RNG. The game also has good original lore and an overworld to explore it, while the dungeons change in shape the overworld stays the same and the quests are (mostly) always at the same place so you can play faster once you know where things are. The unlock system is nice, you have to do certain things in game to unlock the different races and classes, which is way more interesting than juste grinding.
The game is hard and even on the base normal/adventure(multiple lives) mode you'll be challenged, and then there is roguelike mode with only one life if you really want to challenge yourself, or there's the exploration mode(unlimited lives) if you just want to play for fun. There really is something for everyone, and that's why it's such a great game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198960636032', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 67, 'playtime_forever': 6665, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 796, 'last_played': 1678636242}
review:
Great traditional roguelike. One of the best even.

There is a good variety of difficulty options for accessibility. Adventure mode (set number of lives), Roguelike mode (permadeath) and even Exploration mode (infinite lives). That and 5 difficulty settings.

Replayability is very high thanks to unlockable classes and build options. There's also an Infinite Dungeon mode.
A good amount of mods is available too, giving you access to more classes and Quality of Life changes.

If I had to find some negatives it's probably that the game often makes you feel unstoppable by throwing trash mobs at you just for some random unique enemy to be super overpowered. That combined with the length of the game makes me think it's a little too long for the permadeath mode.

Regardless this game is fantastic and I fully recommend it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197989415506', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 93, 'playtime_forever': 443, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 368, 'last_played': 1600268740}
review:
Bardzo rozbudowany roguelike. 

++ olbrzymia liczba klas i ras do odblokowania, niewiele jest gier. które mogą w tym dorównać ToME, czasami aż chce się zginąć, by wypróbować inną kombinację, która właśnie wpadła do głowy

+ interesujące przedmioty (choć niestety gra raczej idzie w ilość)
+ dosyć jasne reguły (wyjątkowo jasne jak na roguelike'i)
+ czytelna grafika
+ niezły interfejs
+ duża liczba metod radzenia sobie z sytuacjami, które napotkasz

~ dobra muzyka, która jest dopasowana do lokacji, zamiast do tego co się dzieje

- w wielu sytuacjach można zginąć w jeden - dwa ruchy, jeśli odwiedzasz nową lokację możesz nie wiedzieć, że właśnie się w coś takiego pakujesz
- kolejność rozgrywania poziomów jest raczej stała
- lokacje są troszkę za długie

author: {'steamid': '76561197993819052', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 18745, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 18745, 'last_played': 1599350485}
review:
While the game has most of the features of the standard roguelike it differs in a critical way. All the strategy elements have been stripped out. Most roguelikes feature a strong element of resource management, it forces a player think about each battle and think before using powerful, but limited scrolls or potions. 

This game does not have any potions, scrolls or any other limited items. Everything is on a cooldown; the player never has to think about the next battle or balance the risk/reward of challenging a dangerous opponent. You can just steamroll over multiple levels of trash mobs to get to an occasional boss. There is no light or hunger mechanic, so you just heal after every battle and come out exactly as strong as you went in.

review:
This game has garbage graphics, has a steep learning curve, and overall it will be hard to understand why people even play this game for a new player. But, you will find yourself being pulled back every few months to give it another try with a new class and a new guild and 100 hours later you will wonder how you ended up wasting your life on a game that looks like it was made in the early 2000s. 

But, I would highly recommend it the best way I can describe this game is computerized dungeons and dragons.

author: {'steamid': '76561198056334725', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 16912, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 16795, 'last_played': 1703724797}
review:
the game is $7 right now

This game was one of the reasons i started looking to reviewers time played when considering buying, I usually look to see what the norm for the hours played are and compare it to the cost and how long the game has been out.

With this in mind i want to point out... $7, and my 280 hours is actually on the light side for this. 
the value is ridiculous, ive spent 50-90 on high end games that while also fun, lose me somewhere between 25-50 hours (thats not ALL AAA games, but alot of them)

If i had more time I can easily see my time played going 10 fold higher, I'm not great at the game but i ONLY play permadeath style, with that being said in my hours played ive beat the game ONE time. I could do it again now that i have a style that works but, i don't need to, there's higher difficulty levels and soooo many more character options to explore

Why are you still reading... its $7 skip one fast food meal and instead sacrifice a massive chunk of your free time to the rng gods, you wont regret it

author: {'steamid': '76561198156226901', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 20457, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5813, 'last_played': 1700764406}
review:
Very rarely does a game become an instant favorite of mine. The fact that it is even compared to other roguelikes is baffling to me. In my humble opinion, this game is far superior over any title of the genre I've played so far (incl. ADOM, DCSS, Caves of Qud, maybe Elona comes close but certainly isn't as polished):

1) Multiple weird races and classes. You don't just have your usual suspects aka mages, paladins, fighters etc. There are "Writhing Ones", "Possessors", "Paradox Mages", all with their own slew of talents which make them unique. 

2) Huge talent screen. The sheer amount of abilites and their interactions with each other make for a lot of different character builds, a very deep RPG-like feel and complex tactical encounters.

3) Some item tooltips are a sight to behold haha.

4) Lots of "plot", side quests, story, unique bosses. A lot of roguelikes feel like you're just thrown into an empty world full of mobs. TOME has a unique boss for every single part of the world, a story progression that uncovers another "continent", lots of lore, multiple side quests and very importantly, a world that actually feels alive. Oh and every zone looks different and plays different soundtracks. It's not just dungeon after dungeon after dungeon and all look the same. Which is a nice touch.

5) This game will kick your butt on higher difficulties. And no, it's not because of RNG. It's you who made the mistakes and there's always a number of things you could've done better if you're actually honest with yourself, stop crying and turn on your brain. This isn't a hack'n'slash.

6) The game is being actively updated to this day.

7) Icing on the cake is the incredibly friendly and helpful community. There's a well-frequented in-game chat that you can always ask questions in, and some veterans of the game will be there to help you out. 


Only thing I don't like is the severe lack of documentation. Guides are several years old, the wiki is oudated. TOME is a big, dark forest but rejoice, you're not alone.

author: {'steamid': '76561198425917363', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 10359, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4236, 'last_played': 1614133704}
review:
개인적으로 취향을 매우 많이 타는 게임이라고 생각합니다.
제 취향에는 맞는데... 그래픽의 직관성이 좀 떨어지는 편이고, 그렇기 때문에 처음 하시는분은...어쩔때는 내가 왜 죽었는지 모를때가 많습니다.  
언어의 장벽 문제도 있네요. 스팀에 넘어오기 전에는 한글패치가 있었으나, 스팀으로 넘어오고나서 최신버전에서는 한글이 적용이 안됩니다만, 듣기로는 한글 패치가 예정되있다고 합니다.
다른 사람에게 강추하기는 조금 애매하다고 생각하고...음... 한번 해보시고 좀 아니다 싶으면 환불하는게 맞을 듯 싶네요.

author: {'steamid': '76561198092339989', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 211506, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 72959, 'last_played': 1710157391}
review: so. much. replayability. A little overwhelming to start (first few weeks of playing it is a steep learning curve - exploring different classes/races and finding the right one for you, even if guides say theyre nuanced, helps a lot) and get ready to die, but so fun and worth it. I put 1000 hours into it in 6 months (during covid in the USA, granted). Cannot recommend this game enough, one of the best of many roguelikes ive ever played. Reminds me a little bit of Angband, but with an actual (and beefy) levelling/ability system. DLCs are great too - I put hundreds of hours into cultist of entropy alone - but not necessary to enjoy a really cool game that you can delve into (in terms of lore, play strategies, and even achievements) as much as you want. Steam workshop has a lot of cool little and big tweaks too.

author: {'steamid': '76561198028555103', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 19001, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8422, 'last_played': 1685687686}
review:
I'm not sure how to describe my 140 hours spend playing this game. I couldn't stop playing. If I played right now, I probably wouldn't stop. This is without a doubt the best roguelike that I ever played. It probably will be true 30 years from now.

- I enjoyed any and every class I played. This has never happened to my in any game I played.
- Customization of each class is great and has a lot of flexibility.
- Combat is always hard and is paced properly. I never felt like things we're too easy or too hard.
- You always know when you mess up and you don't feel like its out of your control. 
- Item and skill upgrades come at the right pace.
- Interesting bosses and enemies. There is a lot of variation.

In general, TOME really just has the whole package deal. It has this great foundation in terms of game design and utilizes its tools very well to deliver an entire experience.  A lot of games fall short in certain areas but I can't really  think of anything that this game really sucks at. The only thing I can even think of shitting on really is just the graphics. I don't even care. If most games today could be as well thought out and designed as TOME, I would take that over the graphics.

I really didn't play very many roguelikes before this. Now, I have an interest in the genre. I always look for things that are distinctly different than TOME because I'm fairly certain that they will always fall short. It pretty much ruined everything (EDIT: This has proven to be 100% true so far).

author: {'steamid': '76561198046322962', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 9547, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9546, 'last_played': 1595704919}
review:
I have played quite a few roguelikes extensively. My favorite game is DCSS, to give you an idea of what I like about the genre. I really want to like TOME, but I can't.

The choices for player creation are awesome in this game, and they make each playthrough meaningfully different... when you are fighting the stronger enemies. Unfortunately you are mostly going to be mashing low cooldown abilities to clear thousands upon thousands of enemies in dungeons that have far too many floors.

The worst part of this game is the places that disable your autoexplore or resting. Water levels make you drown after a period of time which messes up the AI from autoexplore, rarely some floor tiles deal damage every turn, and some levels (or even small areas WITHIN levels) automatically fizzle your teleport without warning, wasting your turn.

There are quite a few UI changes that would make this game a lot easier to get into. I had to install a mod to remove some of the ambient noise to eliminate some of the shrieking birds. There simply isn't a slider for ambient noise separate from sound effects. I spent way too long trying to wrangle my AI so that it wasn't hiding the playable portion of the map TOO much. The default keybindings are really bad (you have to turn off numlock to move a targeted spell diagonally???). Certain characters and common objects (TREES) are made to look they are two tiles tall, obscuring the tile behind them and making it harder to read the map. Bizarre.

I think it would be a better game if you could unlock all the player races/classes by playing whatever character you wanted. Or if you didn't need to rely on a % chance of something spawning. Or if you didn't need to unlock them at all.

I just beat the game with a 33 hour long playthrough. I would say the fun/challenging part of the game was about 10% of that. Granted, my first victory was on normal/roguelike. Maybe I would have had more fun if I played on a higher difficulty (having no idea at the start of the game how difficult it would be), but right now I don't want to touch this game again for a long time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027977720', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 60, 'playtime_forever': 739, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 213, 'last_played': 1611767599}
review:
Looks bad, even for a Roguelike (how??), has terrible UI (very low information density, very large blocks of texts for even something as simple as a basic sword), has an overworld (never been implemented well in any RL), and has weird design issues where the game wants to focus on classes but gives any character access to free and infinite powers via runes.

It's not a good game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198332413018', 'num_games_owned': 294, 'num_reviews': 97, 'playtime_forever': 2989, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 543, 'last_played': 1627443856}
review:
TLDR: Believe the hype. Get it on Steam and pay full price. Worth every single penny.

More:
One key feature that makes this game so incredibly good is that it is *eminently playable*, meaning that it's very easy to learn but deep and complex enough to be extremely difficult to master. The many years' worth of work that's gone into this game absolutely shows: The interface and gameplay are so straightforward and intuitive, it makes it a breeze to pick up and play.

This is an absolute paragon of outstanding game design (which explains why it's won awards and universal praise). From something as basic as the UI to the game's deep mechanics, ruleset, and the brilliant subtle aspects of the procedural generation, it all just *makes sense*. 

As one example of why the procedural generation here works so well and feels so natural: I was exploring a forest with animal enemies you'd expect to find in a forest. I come across a stone building, and it's filled with human enemies (cutpurses, bandits, rogues) and loot. There aren't random bears or sentient trees in there; it's a bandit hideout! Yet another stone building might have undead; it's a crypt! You might come across a grave that you have the option to disturb....and oh crap, bad move!! An ancient vampire comes out!

*Feel* is such a critical piece of what makes a game enjoyable, and TOME feels so organic and authentic. I find it as easy to completely lose myself in this game as any of the best, most engrossing games I've ever played in my life. And the fact that the gameplay is so intuitive and fun means that you can easily pick this up and make your way through a dungeon when you have some free time.

Better yet, TOME pulls off an impressive balancing act in this regard: While you don't have to sit through endless tutorials or read an encyclopedia worth of information in order to play and have a good time....this is one of the deepest, most complex, most varied games I've ever encountered. From the lore to the items to the dungeons to the HUGE bestiary, named elites/bosses, locations, quests, etc....this is just a huge, deep world. You'll make your way through dungeons, reading diary entries from some dead explorer about an ancient civilization, and then realize you may have to come back some time later because the ruins are underwater, and you have no idea how to breathe underwater (yet). By the way, did I mention you can drown?

One very cool feature in this immense game is the fact that you can see live (optional) chat from other players (though it isn't an MMO). Any time you have a question on *anything*, helpful veterans are always on to give you clear answers and worthwhile advice. This is a very welcoming, friendly community. A breath of fresh air these days! Another fun feature in the live chat is that you also see real-time updates when other players get achievements....and when they die! It's hilarious seeing a red message that so-and-so "was ripped to pieces" by monster X.

If you're on the fence, all I can say is that the price of this game on Steam is insane; for the amount of content you get, the fun you'll have, and just the sheer enjoyment of the experience...it's a no-brainer. Look through the reviews here and notice that some folks have over 1,000+ hours. I get it now. You will too.

author: {'steamid': '76561197985285087', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 2016, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1420, 'last_played': 1660016799}
review: Beware the wrath of RNGesus, for they can make this game very difficult. The basic premise is straight forward, the available quests are consistent, playthrough after playthrough, but the turn by turn activity can quite easily cause your characters death if you aren't lucky enough to get the right equipment or choose the best skills. It can be frustrating at times, but it is always enjoyable from start to untimely death.

author: {'steamid': '76561198144365023', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 153, 'playtime_forever': 18190, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6022, 'last_played': 1644871766}
review:
Deep, fun, and good-looking RPG with dozens of interesting classes and endless replayability. You have your warriors, rogues and mages - but also chronomancers who manipulate time, mentalists who run around with heavy shields and heavy nukes, steampunk gunners, and other cool toons. Combat is deep, hard, tactical, and fast.

One of the best games ever! 10/10, highly recommended.

EDIT after 100 more hours recently: Comrades, this game is godly. Here are some of the things that make it so awesome:
- High quality variety and content - there are a couple of dozen playable classes and a dozen races, two campaigns, infinite dungeon mode, hundreds of artifacts, and hundreds of cool monsters. The classes are not just stat sticks or variations on a theme - they are fully fledged archetypes gathered from all of scifi pulp. You can wield lightsaber-type "psi-blades"; time travel; fry enemies with elemental torrents; maintain your own army of demons; snipe enemies with guns; or turn into an earth elemental and pound your enemies into dust. The mobs come in all shapes and sizes, and the mean ones are nasty in a good way! One can put you to sleep, another put you in a chokehold, a third one can strip your defenses and heal to full in a couple of turns.
- Speed - you can complete a full run in ~10 hours, and have a good idea about your build in 2-3 hours. There is no grinding - you just push onward. 
- Good looks - the monster and character art are both grade A. Some of the levels are also neat.
- Balance and pace - it's hard to balance a game this rich in content, but DarkGod has done it. No monster, item, or skill breaks the game; but at the same time, they all feel like they pack an oomph.
- Tactical richness - you will often find yourself in tight spots juggling 30 cooldowns and thinking of a good way to dodge another death. And in TOME4, every death feels deserved and avoidable, and you can always raise the difficulty on your next run.

Bottom line, this game is phenomenal. TOME4 isn't just another rogue-like - it sets the bar for roguelikes in the 2010's and into the 2020's. This thing will be fun and playable 30 years from now. I hope Valve hires DarkGod (the main dev) and the artists and lets them make Volvo the Roguelike.

author: {'steamid': '76561198011885477', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 5227, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5050, 'last_played': 1608582164}
review:
First, I played Moria. Then, I discovered Angband. Now, I primarily play ToME.

There's a ton of classes, ton of races, several different game modes. You can jump into the Arena if you just want to fight. Do an infinite dungeon for more of an Angband experience. Or, jump into one of the two campaigns and spend hours exploring, figuring out the optimal dungeon order, and reading through the lore.

I would definitely recommend picking this up, along with all the DLC, at full price. It is worth it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043969089', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 20943, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 1, 'playtime_at_review': 1560, 'last_played': 1712199099}
review:
Behind its simple appearance lies a challenging and engaging game that after almost thirty hours of play, I hardly feel I've scratched the surface of.
There's loads of race and class combinations, an endless supply of interesting equipment, tons of entertaining lore to bring the game's world to life, and every adventure is different. 
The RNG encounters can be a little too punishing at times, but this game has an enormous amount of content to explore and in almost every fight and level up you'll find yourself making interesting and important decisions. If you like roguelikes you should definitely play this game. 
There will also be even more updates in the future - but don't mistake this for an early access title or one of those games in a seemingly endless beta. The developer seems to make sure everything works before letting it go live.

author: {'steamid': '76561198047691462', 'num_games_owned': 199, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 9326, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3696, 'last_played': 1708562703}
review: This game is seriously one of my favourite games of all time... and based off all the other games I play that is really confusing for me to consolidate why. I initially started playing this game when I broke my hand and was no longer able to play anything else, the investment in characters and the freedom of builds, interesting items and the endless replayability come together to form one very complete, extremely fun and nostalgic old school experience.

author: {'steamid': '76561198036428488', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 64215, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9761, 'last_played': 1694140751}
review:
I'll cut straight to the point and list what this game does well.
+Adjustable experience through difficulty settings, keybinds, mouse gesture bindings, and community addons
+Visual feedback through sprites, small movement animations, particle effects, auras, etc. (I hate staring at the plaintext ascii that most roguelikes make you sit through)
+Wide variety of playstyles from whacking enemies with a club, cutting people down with pain inflicted to yourself through eldritch reflection, using energy swords made out of psychic power, hijacking bodies, and much much more.
+Unlockable objectives that not only reward you for playing but contextually make sense when you get them.
+Interesting writing. I actually like reading the lore notes in this game (which can be read anytime after the first through a menu).
+Challenging gameplay. It feels good to get far or even win because it feels hard-won.

Okay, on to the negatives.
-Random events. Sometimes for your build you REALLY want to get a certain escort quest to show up or a certain event to happen that could define the build you are after, and sometimes it just doesn't happen (this can be fixed with an addon, but i'm judging just off vanilla).  In some ways this makes things more interesting, but after you have ran into them before it just becomes annoying.
-Random enemies. You could be cruising through a dungeon because you got lucky and have an awesome gear and skill setup and the normal mobs and bosses just cant compete, however you run into one rare enemy that has just the right randomized talent setup to kill you instantly, and it feels BAD when it happens.
-Class imbalance. Some classes are much more powerful than others. Some races are much more powerful than others. All of them are capable of pulling wins but some are just painful to play compared to others; like alchemist, who has a total of [[ONE]] good talent in their entire kit and the dev is like "yeah, this is good enough :)".

author: {'steamid': '76561198025466259', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 50733, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 48188, 'last_played': 1682102770}
review:
With all the reviews from people that have hundreds of hours played, it's no understatement to say this game is highly addictive and massively replayable.  The graphics are very limited, but everything else is top notch.  With new patches and changes coming out every few months and a large amount of modders adding new classes and races the game never feels old.  If you still have any doubts, you can download the full game (except dlc) for free from the developer's website te4.org; there's no risk as you can link your profile to your steam account later if you buy the game

The game can be a litle overwhelming at first as the tutorial is rather limited and the game throws a lot at you when starting your first character, but you'll quickly get a hold of it after your first death or two.
