author: {'steamid': '76561198043418312', 'num_games_owned': 3018, 'num_reviews': 60, 'playtime_forever': 38374, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 32721, 'last_played': 1598178740}
review:
This game is one of the best roguelike dungeon crawlers out there.  The graphics are not spectacular.  Lets face it they look 15 years old.  There's not a storyline with gloriously rendered full motion video cutscenes.  It has one but its absolutely irrelevant.  What it does have is fair, fun, and difficult hack and slash slash and ranged combat with dozens of different classes with tons of fun skills to unlock and enough difficulty levels that you can find one that *will* challenge you.  It has many many hours of content.  All the dungeons, item drops, and monsters are randomized so every game will be a bit different than the last.  Its gameplay aspect is so great that it doesn't need eye candy and filler to fool you into thinking you got good value for your money.  This game is the real deal.

If you like roguelikes and appreciate games with adequate difficulty and the threat of permanent death (optional), this is one you should not miss.

review: I don't always play roguelikes, but when I do, it's either Dungeon Crawl Stone Soup or Tales of Maj'Eyal. author: {'steamid': '76561197995200857', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 121, 'playtime_forever': 100, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 100, 'last_played': 1457921083}
review:
I never thought graphics mattered to me as a gamer until I played Tales of Maj'Eyal.

To be fair I only put in a little more than two hours and maybe I'm just not the target demographic for this game but really though, this didn't feel like a video game at all to me. I never actually felt like I was doing anything that was happening in this game. I was just seeing tiles move around and text appear on screen.

The tradeoff with a a game like this is supposed to be the depth of customization, interactivity, and story, etc. But none of that stuff really stood out to me when I was making my character and playing the opening quests.

If your goal is to play a super simplistic RPG where there's a depth of customization and interactivity then my advice would be not to play a game like this. But instead join a tabletop RPG group. That is the deepest level of customization and interactivity you can get to and it also involves hanging out with real people and drinking beer, so that makes it even better than this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198065809132', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 662, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 34, 'last_played': 1604360834}

author: {'steamid': '76561197978110919', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 82610, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 47142, 'last_played': 1690755797}
review:
Tales of Maj'Eyal or ToMe brings me back to ye olden days of turn-based roguelikes like Castle of the Winds. Curerntly I have around 850 hours and keep coming back to ToMe from time to time. For its simple sprites and tiles, this game has a crazy amount of depth in combat and character building, and each playthrough always has its own flavor. Sometimes those flavors can be quite bitter, as the world of Maj'Eyal can be a deadly place to the impatient or the overconfident. A few pros and cons:

Pros:
- ToMe is difficult, but as you learn the game you'll do better every time
- Every playthrough is unique! Different zones, uniques or orange loot, events and side quests with every character!
- Great character customization! 10 races, >20 classes, each with several talent paths to choose. Even more with DLC
- Full of lore! Every zone, item, and boss has a story behind it.
- Loads of information is available to you. Can look up enemies skills, saves, resistances, etc. Nothing is hidden!
- Great mod support! Make your own race or class, with blackjack! And hookers!

Cons:
-Some classes are little weaker compared to others, especially the starting classes.
-Game engine kinda bogs down when zones get really crowded , or while saving
-Rare mobs basically roll different class skillsets, so some rares can be quite insane with certain unlucky combinations
-A playthrough can be as long as a full DnD campaign.
-RNG is a cruel mistress sometimes

author: {'steamid': '76561198058911806', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 8658, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4255, 'last_played': 1569168564}
review:
9/10
One of the best games of it's kind. Atmospheric music, complex combat system but you don't actually need to look up too much (or any) of it to do well at the game. Good interface which is fully customisable. The lore is deep and interesting. There are many characters/classes for almost every playstyle ever existed. The map is set but the dungeons are randomly generated with random unique loot (the item itself isn't randomised) providing almost infinite replayability. Would benefit from having an intuitive tutorial system but you can get the hang of it in a few tries. I recommend starting in the easiest difficulty setting just to get a feel for the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198049597302', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 62, 'playtime_forever': 3235, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3114, 'last_played': 1686491256}
review:
C'est incontestablement un des meilleurs rogue-like jamais créé ! 
Il est possible de choisir sa classe ainsi que sa race, avec leurs trucs bien à eux, mais aussi de se ballader à l'air libre et d'y visiter des villes pour faire vos emplettes. Ce qui est plutôt rare parmi les jeux du genre.

C'était mon premier jeux du style et je ne lui ai jamais trouvé d'équivalent...

Pour info, il existe sur internet une version gratuite et légale de Tales of Mal'Eyal. Pour ma part je l'ai pris sur steam car je n'ai pas trouvé le prix excessif au vue de la qualitée du titre.

author: {'steamid': '76561198080090036', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 2406, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2076, 'last_played': 1488748067}
review:
Tales of Maj'Eyal is a rogue-like RPG game. Although many people dislike hardcore rogue-like games, Tales of Maj'Eyal will satisfy even the most casual player. Here are some pros and cons of the game:

Pros:
1- One can disable or tweek perma-death option. Ideal for casual players.
2- There are endless possibilities for character creation. A big variety of races and a even bigger variety of classes.
3- You can unlock new races and classes as you play the game and complete certain tasks a certain way, opening up the possibility to run more than one playthrough (considering you play casually *coughs*).
4- Really well done skills and skill tree learning system.
5- Trasmogrification Chests are the BEST THING EVER. It's basically a chest the player carries that allows him to pick up all and any item in a level, disconsidering his/hers emcumbrance. After you complete a level, you can choose which items you want to stay with and easily sell the rest instantly.
6- There are lots of ways to reach the end of the main storyline, and I gotta say, what a storyline.....
7- Players can dig through most walls if they have a pickaxe.... that's awesome and adds to what makes this game so different.
8- The world treats you differently depending on your race, class, past deeds and more.
9- Ability to re-spec most talents and skills.
10- I'll add a pro to the amount of different magical channeling power the game has. a.k.a. Mana, Stamina, Vim, Psi, Equilibrium, and more. It adds variety and explicitly shows the player that no magic type is the same.
11- The player can learn some skills they would never possibly have by equipping certain items.
12- The ability to stroll through easy levels.
13- Inscriptions and runes are freaking nice. I have never seen a rogue-like game doing that sort of system before.
14- The dungeon balancing system is gold.

Cons:
1- I know it's a rogue-like game, but it's not meant to be completed without dying at least once, no matter how strong you are. You will either have a stupid death, or a big monster will exploit your weakness and insta-kill you (props to High Peak) (more info below the cons)
2- Certain classes are heavily unbalanced compared to others. Example: Play as a Doombringer, and then switch to an Alchemist. You'll feel the difference.
3- Dungeon balancing system not working for High Peak. If there was ONE PLACE in which this system SHOULD have worked.... it just didn't budge.

Sit down guys, it's story time.

First character I made, was an elf archer. Nothing special. He died after I got ambushed by a hand saw guy. GOLD.

The second character I made (with permadeath off *coughs*) was the most ignorant guy I could've ever created. A Higher Doombringer. I would simply run through hordes of enemies without a problem, no biggy. That's the character I used to learn about the game, the story and to explore Maj'Eyal and the Far East.
The best/worst experience I can tell you guys, was basically as I entered High Peak (last level of the game). I quickly noticed mobs 17 levels above mine. "Wtf is that supposed to mean?". Luckily my character was just an ignorant prick, so I started "playing" the game. As I cleared areas and moved to other areas of High Peak, I noticed the level difference between me and the mobs was getting bigger and bigger. "Now that's a problem". Plus, all the mobs there seem to confuse you, blind you, time warp you, pin you down, slow you down, silence you, and... the worse in my case... disarm you, every... freaking... turn. "Wtf am I supposed to do?? I can't even calculate how many turns I'll have until I can cast certain skill, because I'm slow and being time warped". I felt like playing the game inside a vortex while high on heroine, because.. oh man... all of the status effects actually play a visual role on your screen (which is a pro). I wish I could tell you about my final boss experience, but that's way too much for now. 

Even though it was serious BS, I give my High Peak experience a 10/10. That's simply a rogue-like game for ya.

author: {'steamid': '76561198127258047', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 10855, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9855, 'last_played': 1664232837}
review: One of the best pure roguelike games out there. Full of content, huge amounts of unlockables, and strategic depth. Will keep you busy for hundreds of hours if you let it. For those new to roguelikes, download free titles such as Stone Soup, IVAN, or brogue. TOME is much more accessable than those titles due to mouse controls and full graphical interfaces, but they will give you an idea on what to expect.

author: {'steamid': '76561198018687510', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 3771, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 696, 'last_played': 1674324390}
review:
Crack! That's what this game is!

I'm so hooked on this. I'm usually bummed out playing games because I'm old as shit and hate single player stuff, yet how does one meet old people that aren't dead inside and still like gaming?

I downloaded this and suddenly it was three hours later. I peed (in the potty like a big boy), came back and played for what I thought was 10 minutes (it was actually two hours).

It's such a simple looking game, but such fun. I can't really say what is so enjoyable, just give it a try!

author: {'steamid': '76561198037877358', 'num_games_owned': 111, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 1801, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1519, 'last_played': 1529854204}

author: {'steamid': '76561197987548219', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 30014, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4331, 'last_played': 1694644899}
review:
50 hours into this game and not planning to stop anytime soon.

This game is fantastic! Cant stop playing 10/10


So much depth its almost overwhelming.  After 50 hours I still discover new things and have so much more to learn.
The classes are so varied/fun/unique and there are plenty of them (most of them locked at the begining of the game).
10 years of developpment and it shows.  There is so much content here it makes AAA games look like games from google play store.

Get this game now!! The value you get for the price is insane.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041079616', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 2466, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 95, 'playtime_at_review': 106, 'last_played': 1711980695}
review:
这个游戏本身好玩就没啥好说了
其实论资排辈下来也非常的有资历。

Roguelike以战斗导向和战斗BUILD构筑为核心的一脉叫Moria系，Moria后来变成了Angband，Angband引入了泽拉兹尼的小说元素变成了ZAngband（前面那俩看名字也能看出来，就是魔戒），ZAngband在引擎升级之后变成了Troubles of Middle Earth，ToME3，再后来，去掉了这些奇幻小说爱好者元素之后，它变成了Tales of Maj'Eyal，ToME4。

而Moria这个Roguelike作为一个从最顶上的一个村庄进行补给，然后一层一层向下杀的地牢探险游戏，它直接影响了——没错——暗黑破坏神1。

所以这游戏事实上保留了暗黑体验中最精华的那部分——猛杀、猛捡装备、搞BUILD、然后面对更极限的战斗强度验证BUILD、重复这个过程，而且因为它是roguelike，同步回合制下玩起来比暗黑还要凌厉和痛快。

review: 麻雀虽小，五脏俱全，这游戏绝壁是个装在麻雀身体里的凤凰。另外，这游戏并不是画风不好，乃哪去找一个半G多一点的游戏有如此细腻的细节表现和统一的画风？？？用画面/游戏体积比的话，该作碾压不知多少体验向，电影向作品。跟现在那些所谓的大作动不动10G+的容量（大半都是给显卡作托的CG，贴图啥的）相比，这游戏更追求游戏本身的可玩性内容。非常难得的游戏，更难得的是作者还那么逗比和平易近人！！！2333333

review:
It took me awhile to really get the hang of this game, and even longer to get my first win(80 hours in!). This game has a vast  amount of wellwritten and interesting lore, a plethora of classes and races and challenging but engaging gameplay. I recommend this game to anyone who likes Roguelikes or just challenging but fun games in general, but watch out for Snake Archers!

600ish hour update - Still Good

author: {'steamid': '76561197987696587', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 6683, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5564, 'last_played': 1628836775}
review:
This game has slowly become quite addictive.. Deceptively simple, yet wonderfully complex as you have many character types, skills and weapon combinations to choose from. I was very happy rampaging about as a skeleton once unlocked :-)
Complete and utter death add caution back into your tactics, think and retreat, and a little more excitement, but you can also choose to play in different modes to suit you, unlimited lives, limited lives - or the true - one life.
A wonderful little understatement of a game I fully recommend - be warned, you lose a fair few hours / days / weeks with this one.

author: {'steamid': '76561197986611371', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 5176, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3033, 'last_played': 1672436681}
review:
"Do you recommend this game?"

Yes, yes I do. 

When in search for something new to play, I came across this game while it was on sale for a measley 2.00. That also included all the DLCS. I had never played this type of game before, and if you look at my games library you would know this to be true.  I almost passed this game by but the 1620 achievements caught my eye. 1620 achievements for a 2.00 game? Admittedly, it was the achievements that made me purchase the game, what the heck, 2.00, if i dont like this game, no harm done, right? I love collecting achievements, although I am not good at it! So, there I was creating my character, giving them a name and choosing a player tile. I entered the world of Maj'eyal a lvl 1 archer. I died as a lvl 1 archer. Game Over. My character had disappeared. There was no, try again. No respawn. Nope. Game Over. My first lesson on what Roguelike means. ;) 

There is different lvls of difficulty though, you do not have to play it as roguelike until you get to know the game really well. Exploration mode allows you to play with infiinite lifes, Adventure with limited lifes. 

I am probably the worst player at this game, I am still learning the game 30 hours in, and admittedly the highest lvl I have made it to is lvl 16 on normal mode. I have lost track of how many times i have died and had to start over - but that is the testimony to the game. I keep coming back to try again.........and again.......and again. This game is fun and really a challenge. Its cheap even when not on sale and worth the money.

author: {'steamid': '76561198148431597', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 3281, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1454, 'last_played': 1606249496}
review:
A really great game: so much to see, do and fear!
If you have the heart of a warrior and the curiousity of an adventurer you should join this game asap.

So far there are only positiv aspects in my point of view:
- nice interface with lot of explanations
- much races, classes to choose from - even more to unlock further on
- really deep and funny lore
- great mixture of random generation and fixed points
- reading something about this game doesn´t help you - you come much further when trying yourself
- modes for everyone - rouge-like for the die-hards, standard for the die-hard-wannabes, exploration for the I-love-my-character-way-too-much-people

review: Aside from everything feeling a bit too... zoomed out, each run is pretty unique and every time i died (which was a looooot), i said oh just one more try, one more life, i know how to do it now! review:

It actually just presents itself very differently from that type of rogue-like, how there is more of an open ended singleplayer rather then just a random dungeon crawl deeper and deeper. The skills and talents for all of the classes and races really make it stand out and interesting.

Good Video Game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007367950', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 1058, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 806, 'last_played': 1547155795}
review:
I bought this game on a whim during the Steam winter sale. I wasn't even sure if I liked Roguelikes, let alone whether or not I'd like this game. However, it has completely shattered my expectations in a good way. I love the looting, the fighting, the tactics, the world it builds, and the history is hints at through books and other sources in the game. It's a very fun game that you can play in short bursts due to its turn-based nature, or you can sit and play for hours without even realizing that it's now dark outside. 

This is a game that I can see myself playing for years to come, and I'm very happy with this purchase. At this price tag, you can't go wrong for hours and hours of actual fun. Pick this one up if you like turn-based games, or roguelikes. You won't regret it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007263275', 'num_games_owned': 579, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 1772, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1567, 'last_played': 1580929928}
review:
This game is better than a AAA game, of course the graphics are not Skyrim but there is so many path to build your characters ( a lot of classes to unlock + a lot of skills) 
You can play with 3 differents modes : exploration ( doesn't matter if you die) adventure (you get 1 extra lives at level 1, 2, 5, 7, 14, 24, and 35) or roguelike (1life). 
There is so much content, when you unlock a race, a class , get a achievement, you get a amazing feeling of progress.
For the price i think there is too few games who are that good.

author: {'steamid': '76561198293222661', 'num_games_owned': 216, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 2615, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1230, 'last_played': 1709785263}
review:
对于我这种传统roguelike玩家来说简直就是传奇作品。
Tome应该算是angband一系的作品，专注点在于战斗，而且tome没有饥饿值的设定，使得游玩可以更注重于战斗的技巧和策略，在战斗方面玩法十分丰富。不会被饥饿值打乱节奏而专注于战斗，这是我最满意的地方。如果真的喜欢传统回合制rl的玩家千万不能错过。

画面：经过1，2，3代，4代的画面依然是这么的“渣”，但是如果真正是传统rl玩家应该完全不会在意这些。毕竟对我来说只要不是ASCII字符画面我就心满意足了。

音乐：配乐很亮眼，作为传统rl游戏，玩家的游玩时间肯定是会非常长的，甚至长达数百小时，这个时候在bgm方面就必须做到十分耐听。而我认为tome4恰恰做到了这一点，不同场景的bgm恰到好处，使人完全不会感到厌烦，另外竞技场的bgm我个人认为是最棒的，大家可以去听听看。

游戏性：不必说，也根本无法说。作为传统rl游戏最不用担心的就是游戏性了。随机的道具属性、地图、怪物、事件，让你沉迷于未知无法自拔。有限的生命使你高度警惕。总而言之这款游戏肯定会让你嗨到不行！

关于汉化问题，游戏官网有汉化补丁，除了少数非必要文本还没有完全汉化以外，整体汉化质量数十分高的。

2021/3/21:已经有官方中文了

author: {'steamid': '76561198044919810', 'num_games_owned': 451, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 169386, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 46806, 'last_played': 1681158504}
review:
First of all, let's get it out of the way: Tales of Maj'Eyal is a roguelike (in the traditional sense). That genre is notoriously difficult to approach due to its depth, random elements, and permadeath. However, ToME is much more approachable than its brethren. 

In terms of Permadeath, there are three options that you, the player, may select when creating your character: Exploration (you have infinite lives, and you can still unlock races/classes/other) , Adventure (you have finite/limited lives. By progressing, you earn more lives.), and Roguelike (you are the character, death is final... though, there are means of cheating death that you may discover).   

In terms of random elements,  you will rarely straight up lose/win because of your luck (though it definitely seems that way at the start). Within ToME, randomness can affect your loot, the difficulty of champion monsters (enhanced versions of a regular monster), enemy placement within a dungeon, and types of obstacles (i.e. dungeon variations, random events, etc.). Despite all of that, ToME gives you a few powerful tools to compensate.  
[olist]
    [*] The ability to inspect ANY unit that you can see, as a free action. This allows you to see what abilities an enemy has, their stats, defenses, and much more. This means that if some enemy is new to you, or a champion variant is using some strange new ability, you can inspect it and adapt accordingly.
    [*] Dungeon Consistency. Certain dungeons in the game will always be present in any playthrough. They will always fall within the same power level, and (almost) always have the same type of enemies. So, if you know you are approaching a certain area that is hypothetically filled with insane amounts of electric damage, you will be able to plan accordingly. The other aspect of this is that certain character excel in different dungeons, and are terrible in others. As you become more familiar with the game, you learn to play around your characters strengths/weaknesses, which leads me to the next point...
    [*] The ability to RUN and ESCAPE. Some encounters are straight up unfair/impossible. Perhaps you got surrounded by a bunch of weak enemies and are being stunned repeatedly. Or, you are stuck in a corner with a big, spooky minotaur. Unless you are tanky as all hell, and can heal for days, it is actually perfectly acceptable to just run/teleport to safety.
[/olist]


In terms of depth, or wealth of mechanics, ToME is easily one of the best (if not the best). While other roguelikes may give you a bunch of ways to interact with a single item or the environment. ToME's depth comes from: 

[list]
    [*] Vast amount of start options (race/class). It is impossible to emphasize how DIFFERENTLY some of the classes play from one another. You do not just unlock new classes and races, but new racial groups and types of classes outside of just the  typical warrior, rogue, wizard archetypes.
    [*] Unique Items (items can have class abilities attached to them, or even unique abilities).
    [*] The lore (if you care about that sorta thing).
    [*] Environments/dungeons. Past a certain point in the game, you feel like you are starting a whole different game (for the main campaign). It definitely caught me off-guard.
    [*] Boss encounters. With minimal spoilers, you definitely want to inspect some of these guys/gals/things.
[/list]


Honestly, this is easily my favorite game in my library. I don't play it too often now, but that has nothing to do with the quality of the game itself.

author: {'steamid': '76561198060612493', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 3738, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1044, 'last_played': 1655786428}
review:
31 hours so far into this game, and I can already tell that I won't be buying another game for quite some time.  There is so much to do and learn in this game.  The replay value of this game is ridiculously high.  I was shocked when I was mid-game and there was an event that popped up for those currently playing.  

The art tends to be a gripe from what I see in the feed.  I'd simply suggest the dev open it to allow players to easily mod the asthetics, namely to shut up the nay-sayers and tell them to do it themselves if they don't like it, and go back to what he does best... making an addictive game.

Thats just my 2cents though.

author: {'steamid': '76561197987103121', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 27337, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1692039755}
review:
Holy moly. This must be one of the best rogue-esque games I've ever partaken in. The classes offer wide replayability even tho the world map is static. It has a narrative that is actually enjoyable to make up for its linearity, something that is a bit of an oddity in this type of game. Has a decent presentation, albeit not not the greatest in comparison to its other modern peer titles, but better than alot of the "hardcore" types of its kind. 

Great amount of options on how you wish to play it. Play it classic with one life, or explore its story faster with a couple of extra lives. It still offers a bounty of ways to die very quickly to expend those extra lives if you are unprepared. 

As is a standard with these games, if you are persistant, power is plentiful, along with the amount of extraordinary circumstances you will find yourself in. Very rewarding even if one is under time constraints.  


You can travel through time and space in it. With that said, you can also dodge projectiles if your speed is high enough. I mean like see them in projection and move out of the way instead of relying on only a stat percentage. Wins a bunch of points right there in my book.Fantasy matrix for teh win. The important part is , when you make a character that succeeds, you actually feel feel acomplished. I feel that is the most important thing a rogue-esque game stands for. Accomplishment beyond odds and determent.

author: {'steamid': '76561198028165763', 'num_games_owned': 195, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 1100, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 176, 'last_played': 1483347047}
review:
This game does some things that push it above other roguelikes in terms of fun:

1) Interface is very player-friendly compared to most roguelikes. You can pretty much play the game with just your mouse if you want to.

2) The player character is actually decently powerful at the very start. You can one-shot vermin and easily take down wild animals. It's not like most roguelikes where the player will probably get butchered by random crab. You'll only die to huge swarms of enemies or powerful unique enemies.

3) The world is significantly less random than in other roguelikes. The actual structure of dungeons are randomized, but the dungeons' content and locations are chosen from a fairly short list.

Basically - The game is closer to being a normal RPG than most roguelikes, and it's more fun because of that.

author: {'steamid': '76561198047916254', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 5383, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3084, 'last_played': 1693488127}
review:
This is probably one of the best roguelike dungeon crawlers on Steam (for the price:play ratio). I've played (and supported) this for many, many years and seen it grow and change and evolve... 

All I can say is:  if you've not played it (and are a fan of the genre), where the hell have you been?!

There is so much content and so much to discover, You'll find plenty of people with 100+ hours of gameplay and they'll tell you that they've barely scratched the surface of the game.  

It's a game that, in general description, sounds generic but I promise you, it's anything but.

You won't be wasting any money if you like a good dungeon crawl (one that is both blissful and brutal.)

author: {'steamid': '76561198002593216', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 32650, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7782, 'last_played': 1680570845}
review:
This is one of the best games I ever played! I'm not particularly a fan of the Rogue-like genre, because I don't like the idea of progression loss. YET, I only like to play this game in the Adventure mode - the standard mode that the game was made to be played with limited lives (I eventually gonna try Rogue-like mode, with just 1 life). If you don't like this, you can play in exploration mode, that gives you infinite lives.
Tales of Maj'Eyal has a very immersive gameplay, regardless of its simple graphics. The story is pretty good and interesting, but what shines is the well composed challenging elements. It's different from riddles or gimmicks that other games put you through. The situations that ToME put you are complex, composed by various elements, that you need to judge and measure to take decisions. THIS. You FEEL the situation, you feel the DANGER. And you must to analyse and find a solution that can be simple or complex, still there is not only one solution, it is circumstantial. Sometimes you can't see solutions to a challenge but you progressively learn how to deal with it. One of the best feeling that the game gives you is the discovery of a solution to a apparently impossible situation.
Yes, the challenges are complex. But, the game gives you various options. Whereas you learn the dangers that you can face, you learn how to counter it. And, for this, you have a vast character building system, with numerous races and classes that you can combo and choose between vastly different playstyles. Each class and race have different ways to deal with situations, some classes and races are best to deal with some types of dangers, some have flaws that you must find a way to cover. And to deal with that, you have Trinkets, items and equipments - that gives you habilities to use -, you can loot or buy them in shop - you must choose wisely what you want to keep with you.
The exploration element of this game is good, there's tons of secrets to discovery and unlockables enable, like races, classes, and skill trees options to make your characters. The game has around 1500 achievments to unlock, if you are a achievment hunter.
The storyline is very good and interesting too, but beyond the main storyline, you have a deep and complex universe, which you unfold gradually in various logs and pieces of story that you must find in dialogue options, logs, places, doing secret quests and getting achievments.
The one-guy dev team is active and keeping the game alive, with online support, events, random blesses of the DarkGod, updates and expasions. The game is still alive. Even though you can play the game for free, it's definitely a game worth supporting. You can donate directly or buy the Steam version, those gives you donator privillege. Let's Feed The Dark God to bring more Awesomeness to us!
Finally, if I should describe this game in few words:
Sheer Badassery!

author: {'steamid': '76561198020670396', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 10883, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4552, 'last_played': 1587830671}
review:
Tales of Maj-Eyal (TOME) is a magnificent game. It uses a deep system of combat and customization that starts simple but starts digging quickly. The story is engaging and often humorous, but appears almost entirely in the background through gameplay elements rather than tedious cutscenes and copy-pasta tv tropes. 

Everything about the game deserves praise: the combat, the customization, the freedom to make ambiguous moral choices, the art***, the replayability.

Despite the omfg-is-that-dog-poop art, every other element of this game is so amazingly well done that this game has *earned* its glowing reviews and I felt obligated to add my voice to the choir of praise.


***the part about the art deserving praise was a complete and utter lie. Not a fib, not an exaggeration, but a lie. The art for this game is the worst video game art I have seen, ever. It's truly unacceptable and there is *no* excuse for the author's failure to get a few fans to replace it with... anything really. 
...
...
F*ck*ng seriously, start upgrading the art already, you've got plenty of fans who would do it for free.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993188898', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 6984, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2586, 'last_played': 1594497657}
review:
This game has already started to consume my soul and I think it will do so for quite a long time. A lot of complexity there, but not an unmanageable amount, nor an uninteresting type. The game will destroy you, and it will keep you coming back for more, and more, and MORE. Brings to mind a quote from a recent movie, something about living and dying and such...but this is fantasy, not post-apocalypse. 

Looking at others' playtimes, I see I've barely scratched the surface with a measly 36 hours so far, but already it's managed to enthrall me and challenge me. Still only playing on the starting difficulty, but roguelike mode (so one life only, instead of several) and I have yet to get a character even to level 20. I can't even imagine how thoroughly the higher difficulties will rip me to pieces, but I'm looking forward to it. 

Even if you don't know if you'll like the game that much, or have never played a roguelike (this one is fairly close to the "true" formula, but without the (to me) annoying need to eat or starve to death), it's a very cheap buy. If you think you'll like it at all...go ahead and go for the pack with the expansions to save yourself a few pennies since you'll likely grab the whole thing soon enough. 

Now that that's out of the way, I guess I'll get back to dying endlessly.

review: 通关撒花，总共死了1200+次。WRTM最终BOSS打了100分钟，死了200次。那四个传送门竟然是要用水晶球关，我四处问才问来的结果。种族职业超多，随机性超强，超耐玩。我第一个号20级地下城碰到了几只60级左右的BOSS，然后那号就被我删了。公共仓库小的感人，通关人物直接死了，身上无数极品装备化作飞灰。不杀最后的太阳骑士竟然不能解锁太阳骑士！

author: {'steamid': '76561198030899618', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 67843, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 253, 'playtime_at_review': 23147, 'last_played': 1711251805}
review:
Classic Rouge/Angband Experience with a user friendly GUI. Superb gamplay. Difficult yet fair. Fun gameplay mechanics. Incredible balance. Great character class choices and top tier flexibility. There's always some new twist to consider for your next run through the game. Very high replay value. 

I started playing the second generation of this franchise nearly a decade ago and even then I'd rate it a solid compettitor to current AAA RPG Titles. From what I can tell, the Indy developer built it as a labor of love / hobby, and now makes a living developing it. Very well maintained with a great wiki, a very large active user base, and a helpful online community.

The only downside is the lackluster graphics that do the job of communicating all the relevant information, but will never excite.

Shareware! You can actually download the game for free at http://te4.org/ But I recommend paying the ~ 10 bucks for the game because the man's got to eat too you know. I probably got the most bang for my entertainment buck ever on this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198095906674', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 22469, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7325, 'last_played': 1674965271}
review: If you like rogue-likes at all and have not played this game, do yourself a favor and buy it. Loads of strategy, challenging even on the easiest difficulties. Stats and character profiles available to browse on the ToME site to give you ideas for future builds. Great game with a great community and support team behind it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198054966168', 'num_games_owned': 800, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 17829, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8763, 'last_played': 1630782905}
review:
This game is fantastic. I've put hundreds of hours into this game, but Steam hasn't tracked it all properly. Some of it was in offline mode, some in a non-Steam version.

I've enjoyed this game enough to purchase nearly a dozen copies for others, and it's a fantastic roguelike.

I'm not going to write a proper review. If you enjoy roguelikes, you owe it to yourself to either purchase this, or try the free version from the ToME4 website.

author: {'steamid': '76561198035357785', 'num_games_owned': 2111, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 3197, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2907, 'last_played': 1612018425}
review:
TOME4是我个人最喜欢的Roguelike游戏之一。本体免费，Steam版相当于捐赠版，有一些原版捐钱才有的功能，有兴趣又拿不定主意的话可以先去把免费版找来玩玩看。还有就是有汉化。
优点：
传统Roguelike中上手难度最低的作品之一，操作直观，UI亲民，不像很多同类作品一样上来就甩你一脸快捷键；
多彩的职业和更多彩的角色build，极有深度，真正做到每次玩都有不同体验；
大量独特的技能，种类丰富实力强大的敌人，抛弃很多传统Roguelike要素（比如药水和满腹度）而完全集中于单场战斗战个痛的独特系统，即使只是用一个build通关一遍也很有嚼头；
虽然剧情简单直白，但游戏中有着大量的书信、传说、神器，创造出的故事世界绝不空洞单调；
可调难度，可调永久死亡，有汉化mod，门槛低不高冷；
BGM很好听。

如果你不追求华丽画面、不在乎难度挑战，有着在同一个精英怪手上死了又死也不会气馁的精神和被boss突然秒杀也不会砸电脑的脾气，那就来试试这部游戏吧。只要对了胃口，这部游戏能让你感受到“再来一回合”“再下一层”甚至“再通一遍”的魅力。

author: {'steamid': '76561198079414431', 'num_games_owned': 830, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 66520, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10040, 'last_played': 1633307480}
review:
This is what roguelikes are meant to be. Fair but brutal. Easy to pick up, but can also plot, plan, conive, and strategize to the end of days. Loads of start options (classes, races, that sort) to unlock, with a decent assortment of default-unlocked characters ranging through easy-hard and beginner-complex spectrums. Graphics, sound, music all functional enough to work nicely, backed by gameplay that would've still dwarfed them anyhow if it would've had a big studio throwing insane money at artists to pretty it up. Completely turn-based, so you can jump up to answer the phone or door or grab a snack or whatever else (like just trying to think your way out of a rough patch when it looks like next move could be the last) without needing to find a pause, but you'll likely find yourself already up later than intended claiming to yourself that you'll go to bed after just one more level. Replayability already high when played on regular difficulty and some extra lives allowed, then you can always turn up difficulty while playing one-life mode and playing a class you're less comfortable with to make it more interesting, while also hunting down large amounts of achievements, some of which are challenging all on their own, others are challenging except in the rare case that the RNG components smile on you. Or start a character with difficulty turned down and/or lives set to infinite just to get a better idea of what will and won't work out later before doing it on a "real" savefile. And then you could always get into using or making mods if you're into that. Have spotty internet sometimes? As long as you had it already downloaded, completely works in offline mode (with minor limitations of not getting special event dungeons unlocked if the dev sprinkles it to everybody, and offline mode has a separate shared stash from online mode).

Still not sure? Poke around their website, there should still be a free version available (had some minor limitations when I did so years ago, looks like less limits now?). Worth every penny to buy though. Looking forward to getting Embers expansion and checking out its content before or after when I eventually get through more of what's already offered by the base game and Ashes expansion.

I've logged 200 hours in this game. Here are some statistics:

Playtime: On the low end, all things considered.
Quality of player: still pretty bad, even after all that time.
Victories: 1 (on "multiple-life" mode, while following a guide to the letter)
Enjoyment: Would play another 200 hours, and then another 200 after that, and after that...

author: {'steamid': '76561198061267712', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 8318, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3017, 'last_played': 1686962495}
review: Great game. Difficult to learn and hard to master but once you do, it is a very rewarding experience. Large amount of depth with skill trees, progression, enemies, bosses, etc. Lot of unlocks for replayability, even more so with the amount of builds per character. It is a rogue like, which seems to be trending these days, but unlike other roguelikes, you can turn it into an rpg with no penalty for dying, or turn up with difficulty and allow no deaths. Be prepared to spend first few runs learning the feel of the game, determining what is good/bad, and most importantly what playstyle is going to be most effective with whatever build you go for. Cursed Cornac ftw!

review: Очень разнообразная и большая. Каждое прохождение происходит по другому засчёт случайно генерирующихся уровней по различным шаблонам. Обилие классов с отличающимися механиками. Так и смакуешь каждый заход в игру.  Есть только один недостаток. Неравномерная сложность в зависимости от времени. На первых уровнях сложно - потом легче и это усыпляет бдительность. Как бац: сложность резко возрастает, к чему не очень готов. Ошибаешься - и всё, последние несколько часов уходят в никуда, начинай всё сначала.

author: {'steamid': '76561198009742597', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 21199, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 15921, 'last_played': 1701019427}
review:
One of the greatest games ever made in my opinion. The sheer bredth of build possibilities and playstyles puts it up there with AAA action rpg's and full scale million dollar JRPG's, and its this little shoddy rogue-like made by one dude in France.

Super cheap, expansion packs with about as much content as the base game, full modability and steam workshop support, a super open dev who talks to his playerbase, in game events, the game literally has it all.

It's hard to even remember this game is based off original ToME, which in itself was an Angband clone. Just incredible work.
Hope we get another expansion soon.

review: Rougelike类画面最佳，最易入手的游戏。10年开始入门，先玩免费版，再入手Steam，屡次尝试，手残党终于在15年通关，又建了N多角色。最有趣的是游戏制作者经常在游戏里出现，DARK GOD突然冒出来，ZZZZ，彩蛋来了！

author: {'steamid': '76561197989425351', 'num_games_owned': 316, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 15036, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6125, 'last_played': 1663278429}
review:
Just hit 100 hours, so basically I just started playing.I'm here to give you guys the down and dirty but I'll be back at 1000 hours to give a more detailed review. Fans of the genre need this in their inventory. It's very cheap and the expansion content isn't as necessary as other games so just grab the base game if price is a factor. This game could easily be priced at 3-4 times the amount that it's priced at and it would still be worth it based on the quality and the extreme amount of content that it has.

Pros:
1. The combat is insanely deep. While it is difficult for the inexperienced player even on normal level difficulty, it is always very fair. 
2. The amount of classes (and race combinations) in the game is ludicrous. They aren't like DCSS in which classes just dictate starting levels and items. Each class has skill trees to choose abilities from that have a huge impact on the way the character is played. 
3. There are several unique and rewarding mechanics, but I won't spoil them.
4. Unlockables: Starting out with only a few options and then unlocking different races and classes feels very rewarding.  
5. You find lore on the ground and can read it to get the storyline of each dungeon and the Maj'Eyal itself. I don't read it personally but the ones I have read are well written and thought out.
6. It has an actual soundtrack, attack, spell, and ability sounds that are all high quality.
7. Mods: Classes, improved resting, exploring, etc. 

Cons:
1. Some people consider the game easy. That being said, the game comes with multiple difficulties that increase to an almost unbeatable level. Playing on the hardest is nothing like playing on normal.
2. Lives: not so much a con, but you can choose to play the game on or off roguelike. You can't unlock achievements or unlockables with unlimited lives, and you can't unlock roguelike level achievements with limited lives. 
3. I want to put bugs in here but I can't because I haven't run into any that weren't caused by mods. As it's an older game many of the mod creators haven't kept up with their mods.

review: An amazing game with so much replayability.  Initially it can be hard to figure out how to get started, but it is one of the most friendly roguelikes you'll find with graphic interface, and a lot of quality of life upgrades over older roguelikes.  It also has an amazingly friendly and helpful community.  It's free on their website if you want, buying it here gets you some nice perks like access to the item vault and a unique class, and the expansions add a bunch for their price and are well worth the investment if you find yourself having fun, which won't be hard to do.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999616683', 'num_games_owned': 659, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 29253, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 15484, 'last_played': 1648113279}
review:
Currently this is my most played game on Steam, and for a good reason - the number of options for character building, equipment combinations and unlockables in ToME is enough to warrant hundreds upon hundreds of playthroughs. Granted, many of them are going to be short - this IS a roguelike, after all - but the game has enough to offer for both experienced veterans of the genre and explorers who are just in for the sights. ToME features a huge main campaign with a pre-determined world map and randomly placed quest dungeons, several dozens of class/race combos with unique skill trees and expansive battle mechanics to liven up the experience.

Unlike many other modern roguelikes, ToME's one and only focus is combat. Even though there's an overworld and a bunch of peaceful cities, don't look at them as more than just trade hubs. What you're gonna do 99% of the time is look for a way out of yet another impossible situation that you recklessly rushed into, be it an unexpected boss or a group of trash mobs that you foolishly underestimated. Luckily, the player is always equipped with numerous tools to deal with trouble or escape to safety - there are runes, infusions, magic artifacts, proccing gear, abilities, status effects designed to keep you alive and your enemies either dead or, at least, a safe distance away. Learning how to use all of these is a different beast entirely, and you'll quickly find that even the normal difficulty playthrough might take you more than a hundred hours to master (even though the total time spent for an actual normal playthrough run without deaths might not exceed 10 hours in total). Once you've done it, higher difficulties unlock, and there's a good chance you also discovered some new classes/races to play along the way, so that your next game is completely different from the previous attempt.

1.5k achievements (currently the record-holder on Steam), insane replayability, a quest progression to keep you motivated, and brutally difficult yet fair fights in the classic turn-based Rogue fashion - there really isn't much else to say. ToME deserves all the praise it gets, and the regular updates only make it that much better.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970768273', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 68, 'playtime_forever': 27897, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 14436, 'last_played': 1708771204}
review:
Absolute favorite roguelike. I could play this game forever and be content. There's an incredible amount of gameplay, and incentive to go through the game multiple times due to unlockable races and classes, powers, etc. My favorite class is the Oozemancer, which is an interesting twist on a sort of druid/mage that focuses on nature/poison type magic. It's still in active development too, and has been for a long time. You can see character and player stats on the te4.org webpage too. AND there's a neat way to transfer items between characters, in case you're the type of person that likes to collect one of everything you can throw them on a storage-type character and dispense them to others as needed.



If you're curious about this game's roots, check out ToME 2.3.5, which was an entirely different version of the game listed on Steam, but with a Tolkien theme (Tales of Middle Earth) and in ASCII. The 2.3.x branch is still under development, but not as active as this one. It's worth checking out also.

author: {'steamid': '76561197982140874', 'num_games_owned': 758, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 8849, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3950, 'last_played': 1687679223}
review:
Massive story-driven roguelike, crafted over the course of years with great care.
It breaks several traditions and streamlines away a lot of unnecessary baggage (consumables, or the classic Angband loot problem) -- and replaces it with a whole lot of entirely unnecessary but fun complexity.
And if you're into lore, there's at least one book's worth of text spread across the game, if you're willing to find it.

Overall, a very solid title. Whilst it's available for free on the creator's website, it is a project well worth supporting.

review: By far the best Roguelike I've ever played, Tales of Maj'Eyal still has an active developer and an active community, so it just keeps getting better, both the vanilla game and the mods. There's nothing quite like wiping out 80% of the orcish race as some kind of dragon-person and then being killed by a random halfling unique that happened to get an overpowered class combination.

author: {'steamid': '76561198095215847', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 199752, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1060, 'last_played': 1697525517}
review:
优点：以战斗为主的Roguelike，丰富的职业技能选择，职业与种族的搭配组合是其吸引人的地方，作为Roguelike也是玩的爽快我优势很大的一类了，具体的可以去官方下载免费的本体试玩就可以了。DLC也多了很多的内容，使得组合更加丰富了，觉得好玩肯定推荐购买。

缺点：更新不快，对于老手而言，部分场景的进程略枯燥或繁琐，当然，在成为老手之前，并不太会意识到这个问题吧大概，所以还是有相当长的时间不会厌倦的。当然，只要过段时间平息了这份不快的感觉，回过头来还是能玩上一阵子，若是有了新的内容更不必说。

这个游戏的平衡性很值得一提，从简单难度到疯狂难度，从弱势职业到强势职业，改变一直都在进行，此起彼伏，我并不在乎它们之间的平衡问题，觉得强势职业快餐也无可厚非，只能说一代补丁一代神的做法确实存在，偶尔玩玩强势职业割割草，或是弱势职业领悟人生，都还是有的选的，挑选自己觉得合适的去玩吧。

author: {'steamid': '76561198067420198', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 29983, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1085, 'last_played': 1686714821}

author: {'steamid': '76561198199342671', 'num_games_owned': 752, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 2902, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 13, 'last_played': 1625385144}
review:
I got a lot more than I bargained for with Tales of Maj'Eyal. I wasn't expecting much because of the low price point and odd graphics, but I've spent hundreds of hours in the game since I bought it (and all of that was before I installed my Steam copy).

Every character class has widely varied and interesting abilities, which makes them feel unique and fun. Warriors and rogues don't have quite as much to do as mages, but they aren't just "easy mode" like with some games, and the way their abilities behave makes the tactical battles as dramatic and fascinating as if they had magical powers.

Practically every enemy has interesting abilities of its own, and even small ones can be dangerous if you aren't careful. The AI is simple, but effective. You can't just kite your way through fights. Small mistakes can escalate danger quickly, and death is rough (if you're playing on Adventure or Roguelike difficulties, at least), but when I die, it's usually my fault, and I can do better next time.

Loot is plentiful, but easily managed, since you have an inventory item that stores new pick-ups, and sells off junk at the end of each area (at no loss, even). It takes a little while to figure out what items are good for your character, but once you know, inventory management is a breeze.

The story is mainly told through notes you pick up, and the lore is pretty deep and interesting. I'm there for the combat, though, so I'm glad subsequent playthroughs aren't bogged down by having to wait through dialogue and story scenes.

The game is very thoughtfully crafted, and I greatly appreciate the effort that was clearly put into it. I can see myself playing this game for thousands of hours and still enjoying the heck out of it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198071845922', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 6871, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6274, 'last_played': 1561637659}

author: {'steamid': '76561198046606972', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 12544, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8555, 'last_played': 1700590125}
review:
This is a surprisingly good roguelike. There are loads of things (classes, races, skills, cosmetic options etc.) to unlock simply by playing the game, loads of very different classes which al have different ways of playing. The game is difficult, but you can choose whether it's classic roguelike (permadeath), if you start with multiple lives, or if you can continue as often as you'd like. Additionally, you get a warning if you enter an area which is way too difficult or easy for your current level. However, there's always the chance of a nasty surprise if you decide to open a sealed off door.. There is a lot of really strong loot to find and secrets to discover. Not everything happens in every run, so you have to keep your eyes open. There's also a lot of really nice QoL additions that I'm surprised other games haven't been copying, such as a really neat way of managing loot. 

Ultimately, I'd highly recommend Tales of Maj'Eyal as well as its DLC and many years later it's still holding up very well. It's a hidden gem which you can spend loads of time on without running out of stuff to do.

author: {'steamid': '76561197989203587', 'num_games_owned': 10456, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 42314, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 40253, 'last_played': 1704179642}
review:
Although it is hard to get into in a way from the sheer information you have to know, none of the difficulty in the game involves having to learn a deep crafting system(there is one in the embers of rage expansion, but its really simple, and completely optional for most classes), having to grind, or having to get amazing rng drops (at least on the reasonable difficulty levels). Even then players that are bad/new at roguelikes can just change the difficulty level/the amount of lives they get to enjoy the game without fear of losing progress. For those who are new to the game, there is a helpful community along with in game chat rooms that can assist you. For people that are looking for something different, there is an extensive modding community for quality of life mods, class additions etc; and some of these even get integrated into the main game.

With or without the difficulty, you will still get the gripping gameplay of a roguelike (although it is of course better if you have a chance of dying). Additionally, there are many unique classes in the game so that you can find a playstyle that suits you. 

Overall, I believe it is the best roguelike of all time, because it keeps the good things about roguelikes and avoids most of the annoying things about them.

author: {'steamid': '76561198000610228', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 29538, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9669, 'last_played': 1706249060}
review: Tales of Maj'Eyal is a deceptively hard true rogue-like with lots of content and tons of replayability.  There are a wide variety of classes and builds to choose from and unlike most games, the different classes actually play and feel very different from one another increasing the already overwhelming replayability of this game.  The difficulty curve is just the right mix of being a true challenge but not unfair as it is extremely rare to come across a situation that results in a truely unavoidable death that isn't the player's own fault.  In addition to the large number of classes there several difficulty modes, some of which are INCREDIBLY difficult (to the point where you can count the people who have successfully beaten it on one hand), as well as very levels of perma-death ranging from 1 and done to infinite lives.  While the graphics are nothing groundbreaking, they are definitely above par for a roguelike and they generally give you a good feel for what is going on and setting an appropriate atmosphere.  All in all this is a very solid game and my person favorite of any rogue-like I've ever played.

author: {'steamid': '76561198050613307', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 11731, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2775, 'last_played': 1708377536}
review:
What time I spent with this game is - still - literally nothing. There is so much content, and so many possibilities, so many things to unlock that it can be fun for long, long hours, if not days, if not weeks even. Of course, in it's standard gameplay mode, it's a roguelike, and not even a roguelite, so you have to accept things like permadeath, turnbased combat, complicated items (sometimes too complicated for their own good - I mean how many preffixes and affixes can a hat name have?), RNG and punishing mechanics.
Still, it's very much a game of risk vs reward and I think I can wholeheartedly tell you to give it a chance.

author: {'steamid': '76561198009129586', 'num_games_owned': 395, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 10680, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9617, 'last_played': 1480319972}
review:
This game is absolutely unforgiving but incredibly fun. The people in chat are very nice, Darkgod has random events that keep the game exciting just by being logged in at the right time (looking at you Bear Scape).

The game has a lot of mechanics to it that I haven't even begun to understand the late part of the game. It's a fun adventure filled with lots of deaths and can only begin to imagine the sense of accomplishment once I eventually beat the game.

This game has unexpected quests, interesting monsters, lots of character classes, abilities and equipment, and an unending amount of difficulty. Talk to people in chat for fill in the huge info game that the game has between the tutorial and actually playing the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198055273499', 'num_games_owned': 1009, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 4873, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2419, 'last_played': 1709904587}

author: {'steamid': '76561197968262487', 'num_games_owned': 467, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 41297, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 15746, 'last_played': 1709422954}
review:
The gold standard for modern roguelikes.

The gameplay is varied depending on your class and even race. Each class have their own skills and passive abilities, and most classes can be played in several different ways depending on skill build.

Generally, the core gameplay loop is exploring until you find enemies, asserting the situation and deciding which offensive/defense skills you want to use while making sure to keep an escape route ready. Combat is turn-based and somewhat similar to MMORPGs (lots of skills which use a resource such as mana and most skills have a cooldown).


The UI is intuitive and accessible while remaining quite powerful, which means that unlike most roguelikes you won't have to learn strange key-combinations to perform simple tasks.

Inventory management is relatively straight-forward, and instead of consumables players have access to cooldown-based items. No more stacking up on different potions and scrolls.

The difficulty can be set according to your own taste and you can play both the classic 1 death = game over or have the ability to gain more lives as you level up.

author: {'steamid': '76561198037425273', 'num_games_owned': 135, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 3997, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3262, 'last_played': 1562282486}

author: {'steamid': '76561197980749889', 'num_games_owned': 693, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 12741, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6660, 'last_played': 1696069293}
review: Simply an excellent roguelike with huge choice, lots of considerations, ridiculous amounts of content and beautifully written lore. Play it if you like roguelikes.

author: {'steamid': '76561198051945087', 'num_games_owned': 798, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 66795, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 25404, 'last_played': 1704397125}
review:
[h1]Tales of Maj'Eyal[/h1] is an incredibly deep and challenging roguelike game.

[list]
[*]Dozens of classes and races, each one feels unique and their combinations reveal not obvious synergies.
[*]Multiple-layered skilling system: passives, cooldown abilities, sustains, prodigies, abilities on items, abilities on hit, etc.
[*]One-classy tactics: you must decide almost every turn whether you continue to fight or start to escape from the danger.
[*]Big variety of enemies which often have classes and even combinations of class abilities, and they're used to them.
[*]Many areas which feel unique (layout, inhabitants), side quests and sudden events driven by the mighty developer, DarkGod.
[*]Probably, one of the best communities - ever-helping veterans and modders. If you don't like anything in the game, chances are there's the addon that changes this already.
[/list]

What would one need except mentioned above - endless dungeon, continuous developing, two different campaigns, various difficulties, dozens of unlocks - takes place in this game.

Fortunately, due to adjustable difficulty, good wiki, and forum, this game has a low entry barrier, so I wholeheartedly recommend you to try it out.

author: {'steamid': '76561197986879504', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 5792, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3210, 'last_played': 1575220715}
review:
Easily the best game of it's style out there, this combines my fond memories from my earliest years of gaming, but this has successfully maintained a continual development cycle to still be a completely viable and enjoyable game to the current generation of gamers. I would thoroughly recommend this game for anyone looking for something like this.

You can also make it as hard or as easy as you like but it's a game that really rewards patience and if you play it as intended, the learning cycle will include lots of characters that do not make it very far at all - either due to being disregarded or killed outright. I personally enjoy this challenge because when you find some things that work - they work very well. E.g. Sun Paladin being my most succesful class by just being unkillable or Summoner probably being the easiest but a bit dull later in the game when everything just works while you hide behind a corner.

review: 屡战屡败，屡败屡战。这就是tome4，总有一种魔力让人在永久死亡后再次踏上征途。优点已经不用再次多说，如此多的好评已经说明了一切。缺点就是，明天又要起晚了，还能不能好好早点睡觉了。

author: {'steamid': '76561198287231719', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 145696, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 56, 'playtime_at_review': 5956, 'last_played': 1711972070}
review: tome4算是我接触比较早的roguelike游戏，比起其他roguelike游戏tome4更加好上手，战斗系统、装备系统都非常赞，人物build多种多样，我一直没能把所有的职业和冒险家build都尝试一遍，游戏性极高，忽略画面你会不知不觉沉溺于其中，还有海量成就，逼死强迫症啊！总之这是一款烧时间的好游戏，另外这块游戏十分适合手残人群（比如我），官网这款游戏还是免费的，steam买tome4也算是对作者的支持，感谢作者为玩家奉献出如此精彩的游戏。

review:
Rogelike, indie, awesome, difficult and replayable like no others. It has a lot of classes and races and you will die before winning with all of them. Lots of different skills that will blow your mind. Which one to pick?


I first saw this game on a ytb channel. The guy was doing a lets play and he kept saying all the time that the game was awesome. I thought: "Huh, I wont play this. The game looks very ugly and seems very difficult"
Then, one day I said: "Fck it, Im gonna try it"
Well, now it is my favourite game of all time. Every now and then Im like an addict.

review:
1 of the best roguelike. It is indeed a "Rogue"-like.
Interface is modern. Many frustrating features in other Roguelike is not here.
The game play is deep and not between the casual and hardcore.
Hardcore player can turn the difficulty their way and casual player can play "soft" roguelike.

The skill/talent in this game is as deep as most RPG fans will love.
Replayability is superb with so much race/class combo.

author: {'steamid': '76561197966375347', 'num_games_owned': 4172, 'num_reviews': 61, 'playtime_forever': 13458, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 12835, 'last_played': 1561745776}
review:
Tales of Maj'Eyal is considered by many roguelike enthusiasts to be one of the best games in the genre. Not only has it won several awards over the years for its in-depth gameplay mechanics, but the base game is totally free (non Steam version) as well.

The difference between this roguelike and many of the other classic ones (NetHack, ADOM, DCSS, Brogue, Angband etc) is the use of an unlock/progression system. This progression system is similar to what you'd see in many modern roguelites (Binding of Isaac, Nuclear Throne, Enter the Gungeon, Crypt of the Necrodancer etc) where you unlock new races, classes, abilities and lore as you play or do specific tasks.

The game has a very active and friendly player base and modding community, they will always help you out if you ask for help or suggestions if you're stuck or have support problems with the game.

Personally ToME is a game I've played for close to 1700 hours (both on Steam and the DRM-free version). I highly recommend if for all roguelike and turn-based RPG fans.

author: {'steamid': '76561197969092165', 'num_games_owned': 554, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 9064, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7037, 'last_played': 1582259597}

author: {'steamid': '76561197992835958', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1855, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1765, 'last_played': 1651151284}

author: {'steamid': '76561198020755818', 'num_games_owned': 3071, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 22078, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 21919, 'last_played': 1550904354}
review: The graphics are awful. UI is a pain. But somehow this game has become the one I've spent more time playing than any other on Steam. Tales of Maj'Eyal is one of the best roguelikes ever made with its creative classes, worlds to discover, and surprises to keep players entertained. Also, it does away with tedium like hauling junk to sell at shops and hoarding potions that never get used. It's a solo game, but with connected chat one never really feels alone in the world. Sometimes the game designer appears and bestows stuff upon the connected players. Finally if you like achievements, then this is the game to play.

author: {'steamid': '76561197983967132', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 8849, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 158, 'last_played': 1704045692}
review: I played the free version before getting the remastered Steam version, and I have played a number of other roguelikes. I can only say that any modern roguelike should check this out for how to do it right.

author: {'steamid': '76561198014524389', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 92, 'playtime_forever': 37308, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 236, 'playtime_at_review': 26499, 'last_played': 1711212166}
review:
If you want a game that is challenging, deep, has many different character possibilities, and follows many of the hardcore roguelike mechanics (but with a more modern sensibility) then this is what you need. I've been playing this game for many years and have seen it evolve and become better and better every year. This is a no brainer for any Roguelike fan or RPG fan that enjoys turn based combat on a grid and loot.

All Hail Dark God!

author: {'steamid': '76561198084330460', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 51553, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 18532, 'last_played': 1648597170}
review:
Points négatifs :
-pas de version française (ça peut en arrêter certains, la lore étant très développée et intéressante, il faut un niveau correct pour en profiter au maximum).
-graphisme un peu simple, "fait main", moi j'aime beaucoup :p

Points positifs :
-un rpg rogue-like très stratégique en tour par tour.
-la possibilité de créer énormément de persos différents, et chaque race ou classe a vraiment un esprit bien à elle.
-un monde assez grand, et qui grandi à chaque dlc (dév très impliqué, et ce depuis des années) et à chaque mise à jour gratuite
-une difficulté paramétrable, qui peut donner un réel challenge
-des races/classes/modes de jeu à débloquer pour relancer l'intérêt régulièrement
-beaucoup de mod pour adapter le jeu à vos envies

Résultat : Des centaines d'heures à voir vos persos amoureusement choisis crever impitoyablement de manière définitive... et à chaque mort récréer dans la foulée un nouveau suicidaire parce que c'est fun !

author: {'steamid': '76561198058553061', 'num_games_owned': 888, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 5559, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4454, 'last_played': 1685887009}
review:
Warta każdej tury, którą w niej spędziłem. Za każdym razem witał mnie świt, więc musiałem się ograniczyć.

Nie ma grafiki 3D, a dzięki temu autorowi jest dużo łatwiej dodawać nowe treści (nie jest też z tym sam). Tona tekstu, tyleż umiejętności. Każdy ma umiejętności - dostosowane do profesji. Ciągle rozwijana. Współczynnik jakość/cena przebija sufit.

Gra jest skomplikowana, ale nie ukrywa nic przed graczem, jak robi to np. NetHack. Każdy ruch można naprawdę zaplanować. Śmierć postaci jest wyłącznie winą gracza.

I'm lovin' it!

EDIT: 4 DLC później, a gra wciąż się świetnie trzyma :D

author: {'steamid': '76561198016634360', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 7387, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6802, 'last_played': 1527362181}
review: Been sitting in my library for a while. I was surprised at how much I 've grown to love this game. There is so much replayability. If you're one who likes to min-max and try out different builds, this definitely caters to that kind of playstyle. This is not a perfect game by any means, I didn't like the default HUD for example. If you've read through the reviews, there are gripes here and there ranging from trivial to significant game elements.  Certain things, like the HUD, are customizable however. Mod support is also available to suit your personal needs.

author: {'steamid': '76561198098359574', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 36843, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 29299, 'last_played': 1688100281}
review:
神作無可匹敵。
傳統類roguelike之大成者，內含遠超一般遊戲尺度的龐大複雜系統跟世界觀以及遊戲內容
沒玩過tome4的別說過自己玩過roguelike，更不要自稱roguelike玩家

你問他經典在哪?你必須看著你的敵人、打開他的狀態欄確認他的技能以及數值還有你自己的技能狀況跟數值
然後花上十幾分鐘細細思考、推敲下一個回合你該如何行動
100%的真策略遊戲...這是一個充滿了各種隨機性跟超多機率要素卻還能依靠策略選擇引導出必然結果的一款真正的好遊戲

author: {'steamid': '76561198047893285', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 1680, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1332, 'last_played': 1479601659}
review:
For all of the positive reviews that this game has, I expected it to be a lot more polished than it is. If you told me that this game was in Beta, I would have belived it. It's not the old-school graphics, it's the clunky User Interface. Menus cover up each other and several buttons don't work when you click them. The font is often too small to read, and some of the menus I still haven't figured out what their purpose is. Sometimes it feels like you are fighting the UI, more than the monsters of Maj'Eyal. 

 I have yet to play a roguelike that I thought was fair, This one didn't really come close. I like the deep customization and unlockable classes and races. Where the game fails centers around it's claim of "no grinding  required". This is the game's downfall as you clear out an area and the monsters don't respawn. You move on to the next area only to find the monsters are too hard and kill you instantly. You are stuck and can't continue with the character becuase there are no ways to get stronger without a likely death. You have to start the game over or throw your body at monsters that are a lot stronger than your character. This is hardest on the classes that I think are really fun to play like rogues and mages. You are just not powerful enough to make it through the early areas and you can't grind to level up. The game doesn't compensate to allow classes that start off weak to be able to make it through the beginning of the game. If this was fixed, I would reccomend this game even with the clunky UI.

Final Reccomendation: Download it from the website and try it for free before purchase.

author: {'steamid': '76561198104674173', 'num_games_owned': 151, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 6030, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1979, 'last_played': 1614129082}
review:
Graficos não são importantes neste jogo, algumas vezes eu tive dificuldade com isso pois alguns inimigos se movem de maneira imprevisivel ou atacam de distancias altissimas. Faz parte das surpresas de encontrar um inimigo novo em um rpg.

O jogo tem muitas classes e cada classe é bem unica na sua skilltree. Existem classes e 'secretas' e basicamente você morrer no jogo não é de todo mal por que você as vezes desbloqueia elas sem saber hahaha.

É um jogo desafiador e cheio de opções e como todo bom rougelike o replay value é justamente o que faz o jogo ser bom!

Uma critica que eu tenho é que o modo de desbloquear personagens/ progredir na historia é muitas vezes obscuro.. e isso pode lhe frustar se você não conseguir progredir e morrer muito.

Mas de maneira geral é um excelente jogo!

author: {'steamid': '76561197994584318', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 12, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 12, 'last_played': 1478730969}
review:
Seems like no thought has been given to user interface or usability at all.  HUD & menus are illegibly tiny.  Controls aren't immediately clear. 

Got a disappointing sense that the game would have a lot of choice for character levelling... while having very little to make it clear what the effects are. Maybe don't tell me I can buy a skill to add acid to my special attacks before I've ever seen what my attacks are...  It looks like I'll be faced with endless choices that are unclear...

As a D&D fan and a Diablo 2 & Torchlight 2 fan I'm pretty positive about character choice and levelling.  But that stuff has got to make sense or feel worthwhile.

 After navigating menus and character screens for 10 min, I finally saw the main game graphics.

I knew it wouldn't be pretty, but the videos make it look like maybe it makes sense.  I uninstalled 2 min later.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970372340', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 35227, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 22563, 'last_played': 1682786992}
review:
What first brought me to this game was the sheer variety of class selection. If you've ever played a fantasy character that fought in a particular way and you enjoyed it, chances are ToME has you covered. Spellcasters, melee fighters, melee spellcaster fighters, anti-spellcaster fighters, anti-spellcaster non-spell casters (Slimes, foreals though). Rogues, spell-casting rogues even, as well as ranged ones, and traps are pretty op. Bows, slings, guns. Telekenesis as a caster or because you think wielding weapons with your mind is a good time, I mean you can do that AND beat things up with the weapon in your own hands. 

Uh.. Yeah there's a lot to go, just try the game. I have around triple what Steam reports, I played it a year or so prior to it coming to Steam, but this game has been around a day or two, go look it up. 

TL;DR: So much class depth and variety, if that's your thing, have at it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198020728468', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 113, 'playtime_forever': 21339, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10858, 'last_played': 1681734767}
review:
The lore of this game troubles me. Spoiler warning, I'm gonna discuss the lore. If you still don't know what most of this review will be about, I have some bad news for you.

So TOME has a pretty lengthy backstory, somewhere around three to five pages per area and dozens of areas. It's a decent fiction novel when taken as a whole, well written at the very least. What makes me question it is the modern cultural and technological lens through which most of the factions are viewed. Virtually all races are modelled after some modern day oppressive government or terrorist organization. They're all busy to some degree with opressing or exterminating the other races, even outright destroying the world. And there's lots of stuff about aliens, weapons of mass destruction, virus outbreaks, mindcontrol gadgets.
On paper it's actually kind of awesome, yet the spectre of this interesting idea never quite materializes. Being a writer myself, I'm trying to find the right lesson to learn, the right advice to take away from all this.

About halfway through the game you'll meet the orcs, a sort of Al Qaida style hyperviolent desert people. They're about to start another war and conquor the world, and you foil their plans and kill them right back into obscurity. Then it turns out they were part of some other scheme and it all comes down to... something?
In the expansion, the remaining orcs are spared and thrown into a ghetto. You play as an orc, break out of the ghetto, overthrow your oppressors and then confirm everyone's prejudice by being exactly as violent as everyone thinks you are. Huh. That almost went somewhere.
My conclusion is that it's an issue of theme and philosophy. Combining medieval fantasy and modernity is bound to have some interesting results, but it's also bound to clash. There's no obligation to pick sides or distill a moral truth, that's the job of a political essayist, not a writer. But you have to tie it together somehow. 
In this regard I feel the everyman cypher protagonist is something of a missed oppertunity. Put someone unique there, an actual hero (or villain). It's incredibly stale to have the main character be unique among their species, the one hero who is different, but that's why writing isn't easy.

Anyway the game is good, it's a roguelite, there's hordes of enemies, there's limited respawns, I'm sure some other review can explain it better.

7/4 would project on the moon with a giant slideshow projector.

author: {'steamid': '76561198014242604', 'num_games_owned': 446, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 5640, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3313, 'last_played': 1629324070}
