author: {'steamid': '76561198116300473', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 5500, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4490, 'last_played': 1454160056}
review: For beginners: I found it easiest to start with bulwark thalore build. Archmages are also good, I've tried them, but I do not have patience to observe all the stats all the time... The bulwark has enough of defence to withstand onslaught of enemies, but even with that 90% of deaths for my character resulted due to the hasty way of playing. Be sure to have a way to escape critical situations. Also, be aware that there are situations when you will not be able to escape... I managed to reach lvl 34, but after stupid death I am skipping this game for some time. Don't play pure rogue-like mode if you are beginner and do not wish to waste your nerves... ;)

author: {'steamid': '76561198071814222', 'num_games_owned': 1237, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 414, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 73, 'last_played': 1585692642}
review: Сложная! Но очень интерестная игра! Не смотря на свою графику игра заслужмвает внимания любителей РПГ и Приключений! Мир этой игры наполнен квестами и каварными монстарми которые будут подстеренать вас в тени деревьев и за каждым поворотом! Выбор класов достаточно широк и на сколько я смог понять он будет пополняться! Это класика!

author: {'steamid': '76561198019985262', 'num_games_owned': 424, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 2836, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 849, 'last_played': 1582192540}
review:
One of the best turn-based rogue-like RPG's ever made. Don't let the graphics fool you, the gameplay is incredibly deep with a large amount of races, classes, enemies, quests, skills, items and free choice. ToME is all about gameplay and less about graphics, kind of like Dwarf Fortress. Even the dialogue and lore (there is a lot to read if you so desire) is well-written and the world is interesting to explore and uncover its mysteries.

There are a lot of stats but they are all straightforward and easy to find. You will rarely be confused about what a certain stat does, and you don't even need to know about everything. You can dive in straight for some proper min-maxing or just play and learn as you go. I recommend to start with an easier, straightforward class like the Bulwark. Then later you can try out the more difficult to master classes with interesting names like the Oozemancer, Stone Warden or Paradox Mage. There is enormous build variety. You can unlock the more specialist classes, skill trees and even races just by playing the game. By spending some extra points you can even use skill trees that are not available to your class from the start. 

Battles are very engaging and for the more difficult fights you will have to think about your next turn. With plenty of skills and items available you can really think about your strategy. Or maybe you don't want to fight at all, there is no shame in running to come back later and finish that boss when you're stronger. The game appears to be very well balanced, which is a great achievement if you consider the enormous build variety.

The game is large, there are a lot of places to explore, the only problem i have with the world is that every new character has to pass through the same locations which can get a little boring if you die a lot (which you will). Luckily all maps are randomly generated and there are several game modes (infinite lives, multiple lives, 1 live), so you don't have to go all hardcore.

ToME was made for pure fun. You don't like mindlessly exploring empty maps for a single piece of loot or to find the exit? Just press the auto-explore button and skip all that nonsense. Your character will automatically explore and pick up everything until it sees an enemy. There is very little grinding just to get XP, almost everything you do is part of a quest or will lead to one. Are you overleveled? The game will ask you if you want to skip the whole area! If you manage to get far enough in to the game you will get your own flying fortress with a small shared stash that you can expand by donating more. There's also the (in-game!) Steam Workshop that contains a great many mods to make your life in ToME even more enjoyable. And an in-game chat with plenty of helpful and experienced players.

Do you like Steam Achievements? This game has 1395 of them!

Totally recommended to any true fans of rogue-likes and skill-based RPG's. Pay for the game or donate to support the developers or get the game for free on their website!

author: {'steamid': '76561198067670664', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 35161, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 12845, 'last_played': 1480146608}
review:
When it comes to lore, Tales of Maj'Eyal is a gem. This dark and twisted universe has to be written by someone with keen observations and deep compassion for human condition. This shows especially clear with the DLC contents. The world view is more original and well-constructed than many games, mangas, movies and novels that I have seen.

Gameplay is as solid as other reviewers said. More beginner friendly among the major roguelikes, in my opinion. And it's addictive. For people like me who are not so good at planning one's own character, there are many class guides in the official forum, which is very helpful.

There is only one aspect that is not that great, that's its graphic tile. Oh, and music can grow old after long time of play. But... even with those being just so-so, this game still worth every minute and hour of my time for it. (Maybe it would be too good to be true if it has amazing graphics, heh.) Definitely worth the money.

author: {'steamid': '76561198054994462', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 3256, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2176, 'last_played': 1637881429}
review:
Awesome roguelike! It's not so hard that the average gamer can't play it, and its "dated graphics" are cool! If you're looking to enter into the world of roguelikes and "hardcore" gaming, this is probably the first step you should take.

Player-made plugins also complement the base game, which is good enough on its own.

10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197986748757', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 43830, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 16577, 'last_played': 1697115962}
review: Hands down the single best rogue type game I've ever played. If you are a fan of RPGs that use many different classes, races, talent trees and build options this is for you.  I paid $5. This game is worth $200 easily for all the entertainment I've had from it.

review: One of those types of games I paid a couple dollars for to try out, not thinking I'd get more than a couple hours of play in. I was wrong, It turns out to be an exceedingly fun game with expansive play. I think I've put over 100 hours in it and still enjoy it.

review: My absolute favourite roguelike, not so much because it's a clean design but because it's such a wild, glorious mess. Demons, chronomancers, slime wizards, suplexing brawlers, the class diversity if amazing.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999524813', 'num_games_owned': 406, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 19964, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2061, 'last_played': 1662829852}
review:
Like Rougelikes? You'll like this. It is hard by default and scales to whatever level of insanity you can stomach. Or not stomach and yet still enjoy, I won't judge the things you enjoy.

But you will enjoy the depth and complexity of this gem. It may not quite wow the senses, but it will floor your sense of fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561197984321424', 'num_games_owned': 813, 'num_reviews': 186, 'playtime_forever': 8828, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3558, 'last_played': 1577312267}
review:
I HIGHLY recommend this game!  GREAT way to chill out and kill some time (and a lot of creeps!)
The graphics are weak as Hell, but that's part of its undeniable charm and not the focus of this game, anyway.
The focus of this game is the pen-and-paper style system, and it is great!  If I knew people who were more into this, it'd be a fun module to play table-top.

Also, anything with a decently active Steam Workshop gets bonus points in my book.

author: {'steamid': '76561197960410235', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 63, 'playtime_forever': 487, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 476, 'last_played': 1526526035}
review: I first tried TOME way back when it was free and called Tales of Middle Earth, and it was one of the best roguelikes I had ever played at that time. This new version of TOME is better than ever, with actually quite nice visuals and music to boot! There appear to be more refined elements than ever. It's a blast to play and there is so much to explore!

author: {'steamid': '76561197990535916', 'num_games_owned': 335, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 6005, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5643, 'last_played': 1510944835}
review:
One of the most amazing game I've ever played. I've played a lot more before it was on Steam, and now I'm coming back to it.
If you like roguelikes with huge character customization, try this. The amount of depth is mind blowing. You can easily play this thousands of hours, and always discover new things. Yesterday I tried the doomed class for the first time and I was amazed how original it is, and completly different from the classes I know the most. My favourite roguelike with Dungeon Crawl Stone Soup.

Thank you Darkgod and your team for your work. Merci! (pour mes amis fr, le développeur est fr et accomplit un travail de dingue).

author: {'steamid': '76561198089189498', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 23235, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 20888, 'last_played': 1490455680}
review:
Лучший пошаговый рпг рогалик:
Динамичный захватывающий сюжет
Проработанный и интересный лор
Большая вариативность геймплея - нее, задача то понятно вырезать, выкастовать или забить голыми руками всё что движется и не очень, но способы это сделать сильно отличаются от класса к классу
Весьма дружелюбный интерфейс для игр подобного рода.

Минусы:
Отсутствие локализации, так как есть много текста, который несколько утомительно читать на английском даже при вменяемых знаниях.
Графику всё таки можно было бы сделать несколько внятнее у некоторых монстров

author: {'steamid': '76561198045961135', 'num_games_owned': 129, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 85039, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 14643, 'last_played': 1658093386}
review:
One of the 'true' roguelikes, except it pointedly lacks a food clock, identification mechanics, and collectible resource grinding/management common for the genre.  For the latter, a tactical infinite-use resource is available, with short but highly significant cooldowns.

If you're like myself and have never played any of the 'true' roguelikes because of the mechanics above, ToME is here.  And it's excellent.

On the other hand, if you're an achievement perfectionist, run away.  Run far away.

author: {'steamid': '76561197985179247', 'num_games_owned': 666, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 3677, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1987, 'last_played': 1619626843}
review: Don't let the simplistic graphics deter you. This is one of the best fantasy rogue-likes you'll ever play. author: {'steamid': '76561198117584517', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 52388, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 40581, 'last_played': 1616399485}
review: Roguelike類封頂神作，集眾RL靈感湧泉凝練瓊脂之大成，可玩性極高，即時性回合制，屬於Angband變種整體承繼偏向戰術策略的特點，間單說就是回合制戰棋。由T-Engine4新引擎重寫，種類繁多的武器裝備，豐富的種族職業以及專屬的各種技能，合理的裝備搭配和技能分配，有著無法窮盡的玩法。遊玩本身即是體驗美學於‘第九藝術’的維度呈現，週期形式自律性異化到社會整體的探索嘗試，在‘星叢’般的框架世界內遊蕩，焦慮死跡裏尋找自我救贖。言說精確性時刻上是被拒絕的，關註核心理應自然回歸‘藝術精神’，多說無益，有心者請自行體會。

author: {'steamid': '76561197970314107', 'num_games_owned': 2304, 'num_reviews': 917, 'playtime_forever': 1258, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1258, 'last_played': 1448245892}
review:
Wouldn't it be nice to have an RPG you could just play forever? To have a huge, randomized world to explore, hundreds of enemies to battle, nigh infinite loot to find, and dozens upon dozens of characters to try? There are more attempts at just such perfection now but few have reached the heights of Tales of Maj'Eyal in scope or depth. As long you can get past some balance and aesthetic hangups, you might get your wish in this one.

ToME, as I'm going to abbreviate it from here on, is a roguelike RPG of incredible scale. Right from character creation you have dozens of combinations of races and classes to choose from, with more to unlock as you explore the world. There's plenty of exploring to do across said massive world as well, what with the layout of the continents and dungeons randomized each time. Enemies and loot are even more randomized, scattered throughout in ways that encourage you to explore every nook and cranny of every level of every dungeon. There are towns to visit and NPCs to take quests from, and though the main story quest is the same every time your start and some elements later are determined by your race and your class.

Every time you start a new character you're in for a dramatically different adventure in fact, just as you would expect from a quality roguelike. Right from the basics there's a huge amount of variance between the classes. You have everything from different flavors of warriors and archers to exotic professions like chronomancers and abominations. Leveling up gains you new stat points to spend, skill points in two separate classes of skills, and occasionally the chance to learn entirely new skills. Coupled with the ridiculous amount of loot to find there's a lot of customizing to do, and dozens of skills to use on a single character between their class skills, racial skills learned skills, runes, infusions, and item-granted powers.

If all this sounds overwhelming, it really isn't because of how the game is played. ToME is turn-based at your pace, meaning things only happen when you move or attack. Attacking can be as simple as bumping into enemies to auto attack, or laying out combinations of skills over dozens of turns. And this is where the balance starts to become an issue, because for most fights you'll be doing the former. Most enemies in ToME are little more than filler, assuming you've been diligent in exploring and leveling. Despite the vast array of enemies to battle, many present little challenge. It's the rare unique enemies and ones with certain devastating abilities you have to watch out for, and in stark contrast with the rest of your foes these can end your life in one or two turns. Every single character I have lost has been to an unexpected boss or unique that wrecked me instantly after cleaving effortlessly through their minions.

To its credit, ToME has a wide assortment of difficulty settings, and the default level gives you several lives to experiment with before succumbing to permadeath. But it's a band-aid on a much deeper balance wound. Most of the adventuring in ToME presents so little challenge you can run on autopilot, until suddenly dying to the one thing in the room that poses a threat. This creates a strange whiplash effect between mounting boredom and sudden frustration. And the methods for overcoming a challenging boss won't always be clear thanks to the immense volume of stats and abilities that you normally don't have to keep much track of. Even after a dozen hours it can be hard for me to tell what my character is ready for.

The result is a game that's not too daunting to get into, but presents a real challenge to master. Every attempt is a long and gratifying series of small discoveries and victories before the inevitable end comes. There's plenty of unique items, new classes, and lore to uncover even if beating the game isn't in the cards. I still haven't come close to whatever the end is, but after 20 hours I'm still not tired of the meat grinder. Maybe I really can play this forever, and even if you can't, you'll get a lot of quality adventuring out of it.



Did you enjoy this review? I certainly hope so, and I certainly hope you'll check out more of them at https://goldplatedgames.com/ or on my [url=http://steamcommunity.com/groups/audish#curation]curation page[/url]!

author: {'steamid': '76561197984638483', 'num_games_owned': 1783, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 585, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 585, 'last_played': 1444627779}

author: {'steamid': '76561197970532816', 'num_games_owned': 2086, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 4477, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4477, 'last_played': 1450645642}
review:
Certainly of the best roguelikes available, you can't bypass this game if you like the genre. A quick review of its pros/cons : 

+ amazing choice  of classes, each with a very different gameplay
+ 3 different game modes : story, arena, infinite dungeons (the last 2 are to unlock by playing the 1st)
+ 5 different difficulties, and 3 ways to play : exploration (infinite lives), adventure (finite number of lives), roguelike (1 life)
+ old-school graphics, slightly "enhanced", which usually do a wonderful job
+ nice background music, for the most part
+ very deep and smart system, with tons of modifiers, stats and talents to look after
+ you can play it as slowly or as fast as you want
+ playable with mouse only, keyboard only, or a mix of both, as you wish
+ functional and scalable UI
+ tons of lore if you're into reading ;)

- some graphic tiles are a little messy (thinking of the glittering caves, or whatever they're called, for example), making some dungeons a bit tough to "read"
- the UI, while overall nice, could be better : overalapping texts, annoying popups, and item comparisons which are frequently a mess to analyse
- do NOT buy this game if you're looking for an easy 100% achievements :D There are 1395 achievements, most of them require to play at least 9 times, and they don't fall that easily, most of the time (case in point : I have 91 achievements after 67 hours of game time, lol). These obviously could have be done better, like for example automatically unlock lesser difficulties ones when you achieve one (what's the point of doing the same achievement on normal if you just got it on insane ?)
- a few crashes (mostly when starting a new game or loading one, strangely : I don't remember having a crash while in game)
- it is possible to get stuck : on my last infinite dungeons run, I ended up in a "corner" where the door disappeared (on purpose) and the walls were not diggable. As I had not found any teleportation means yet, my only option was to suicide (target my talents at myself). If it was on "roguelike" mode, it would have been a game over.

You can get hundreds, if not thousands, of hours of playtime with this game, if it appeals to you, without ever being bored. Personnally, I'm a bit burnt out after nearly 70h, but I'll probably come back to it later, if I ever find the time.

Not only recommended, but almost mandatory for every gamer who likes rpgs, dungeon crawlers or roguelikes :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198190947149', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1982, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1711, 'last_played': 1652627285}
review: I've played many rogue like games in the past...including NetHack and Slash'em...and of course the original Rogue when I was a kid.  This game has some of those elements and so much more.  I highly recommend checking this out...it's a great value for the gameplay and story.  The workshop has a lot of fun mods to subscribe to.  The learning curve for the game is not very steep...and it even includes an explore feature with infinite lives so you can learn the ins and outs of gameplay.  5/5

author: {'steamid': '76561198039264390', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 7103, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6989, 'last_played': 1450206519}
review:
There's really only 1 thing that bothers me about this game - unlocking an achievement on a higher difficulty setting doesn't do the same for a lower difficulty. Given that I'll never play on anything but roguelike, that leaves me with a bunch of achievements I'll never get.

Other than that, this is a great roguelike. It is class based so there are some choice moments when you really wish you could use that awesome item you found, but that's true of most of the genre. Most of what I've seen has been that good choices and skill synergy trumps RNG drops.

Starting out, your choices are pretty limited. You need to fulfill certain requirements to unlock additional races and classes. Thankfully, these conditions aren't hard to fulfill and will (mostly) naturally happen as you progress through the game. I was kind of annoyed by that, but it did give me a chance to play around with some of the basic skill trees and get a feel for the combat styles in this game.

If you do pick this up, I'd recommend taking a look at some of the add-ons like the advanced item compare, better escorts and improved sorting. I played my first 70 or so hours without them, but they do improve QoL.
developer_response:
About the lower achievements, the latest version should give them.
If they somehow fail to appear on steam you can go to http://te4.org/user on the Steam tab and (if your profile is linked) force a push to fix that :)

review: 当时是因为王老菊的视频买的。不得不说在对老菊的爱♂中越陷越深。基本上达到了老菊录啥我买啥。但基本不玩全部喜+1（笑）。但这款游戏真的很吸（nue）引（dai）我，超多的职业与种族。无限的搭配可能性。让我深深地爱上了这款游戏。当时我就把dlc买全了。最近创意工坊支持了汉化mod（http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=568329756）。再也不用去官网下了。不过唯一缺点就是高难度下一命制度会造成流程超级长，导致游戏疲劳。这都不是事！就是刷，不要怂。而且良心的是作者一直更新。每几个月就有些好玩的新产物。总体来说只要不是画面党静下心来玩的话就是一款不错的游戏。

author: {'steamid': '76561198017882491', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 1657, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 302, 'last_played': 1686060652}
review:
After hours of trying to launch it on Ubuntu, I failed. The resolution is bugged until I connect laptop to outer display source, thus I can't play it. Not recommend on Ubuntu. On my Windows computer it works, though.

EDIT: Solution worked, I'm able to play now. Couldn't find it on the web though. Benn playing a while now in roguelike mode and after, like 20 deaths by some nasty means, I still find it great fun! Thanks!
developer_response:
Hi, indeed it seems to fail on latest ubuntu (works on my 14.04 though).
I have found the source of the error, trying to erase it now :)
Meanwhile you can remove/move away the file libcef.so from the lib64/ folder of the game install (or lib/ fodler if you're on 32bits version).
This should let it start & run fine :)

EDIT: oh wait, your bug looks different; can you try moving away all of ~/.t-engine/ folder please ? This should reset the resolution (and everything else)

author: {'steamid': '76561197983933062', 'num_games_owned': 212, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 15222, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4173, 'last_played': 1669389058}
review:
A super good roguelike with one of the best if not the best combat system out there. Diverse skill trees, Diablo-style randomized loot system with some uniques thrown in, great graphics, lots of player-made addons and all of this costs next to nothing (or actually nothing if you just download the free base game from te4.org). 

I have 70 hours on record writing this and I just got my first win with skeleton arcane blade and it was amazing. I'm likely starting a new character right after I post this review.

This game can't be recommended enough for anyone who likes roguelikes, especially oldschool ones. Great for beginners as well, since there are various levels of difficulty and even the perma-death can be switched to adventure mode which grants extra lives depending on your level.

author: {'steamid': '76561198079724722', 'num_games_owned': 259, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 1056, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 922, 'last_played': 1469793102}
review:
[h1]ВНИМАНИЕ! Ниже будет мнение казуального шутерофила о первом сыгранном роуглайке.[/h1]

Tales of Maj'Eyal - пошаговая Roguelike-RPG, очень обширная. Очень. Более 1000 ачивментов как бы символизируют.

- Атмосфера. Хорошо проработанный фентезийный мир с тоннами текста. Приготовьте свой английский.
- Разнообразие рас и классов - куча скиллов и их комбинаций.
- Три режима - Роуглайк, Адвенчур и Эксплорейшен. Первый для хардкорных ребят - смерть означает [b]смерть[/b], т.е. потерю всего. Сложив это с рандомной генерируемостью уровней и обширностью игры можно получить зубодробительный хардкор. Адвенчур поснисходительнее, есть несколько жизней - можно 3-5 раз возродиться. И Эксплорейшен - для таких раков как я - бесконечные возрождения. [spoiler]HAAAAAAAAAAAAAAX![/spoiler]
- Графон минималистический. Придется напрячь воображение.
- И да, чуть не забыл. Игру можно бесплатно скачать на сайте разработчика.

Вывод: Замечательный роуглайк для любителей жанра, не для современных детишек, это точно. Очень большой и очень реиграбельный. Покупаем, если раб Габена (как я), или идем на сайт разрабов.

Отдельное спасибо Jason_X за приятный подарок.

author: {'steamid': '76561198010325550', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 149518, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 147622, 'last_played': 1705674284}
review:
I don't remember when I first started with this game, but it has now pretty much become my forever game. Every time I think I'm done, I come back few months later and get completely hooked again. It's a classical roguelike, but one that still innovates to bring the genre into <current year>, with plenty of interesting lore and tactical depth. With almost 40 different classes, many of which can be played in multiple ways, it always manages to fresh.
Took keep it fresh even longer, I would recommend everyone to start using Insane difficulty as soon as possible. It's not about bragging rights, I have over 2000 hours and still only win maybe 1 out of 100 runs, but the way Insane difficulty works is that you will constantly keep running into challenging enemies everywhere you go, rather than hordes of filler enemies you face on normal and nightmare, and the game will always keep you on your toes. With that, I can feel good about every room I clear, even if I end up dying in the next one.

author: {'steamid': '76561198061938080', 'num_games_owned': 152, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 11462, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4387, 'last_played': 1698725328}
review:
TOME is a fun, but somewhat complex game. 

The best part about this game is the huge variety of unlockable races and classes, each with a unique set of talents. 
The worst part about this game is the fact that there are a huge variety of unlockable races and classes, each with a unique set of talents.

If you've enjoyed playing more old-school (and wiki-reliant) roguelikes like Nethack, TOME is a great game. It has a huge amount of depth, and a wide variety of viable playstyles at different difficulty levels. The ability to unlock things as you explore the world makes the game feel more rewarding on death than some of the older games in the genre, but even when you first start playing there's enough going on to keep you occupied. 

There are also some convenient QOL features like autoexplore and everything being on cooldowns instead of consumables means you can focus on combat rather than carefully hoarding mana/stamina/equilibrium/health pots.

If you're looking for a casual roguelite with a quick iteration time, look elsewhere. 

9/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198075786437', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 12022, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7185, 'last_played': 1602096943}
review:
My past week in a nutshell:
Cool, new game! Let's try it!
...5 Hours later...
You Died!
That was fun, let's try the other classes!
...8 Hours later...
You Died!
Well.
You Died!
YOU!
You DIed!
GOTTA!
You Died!
BE!
You Died!
*Rage intensifies*
...70 Hours in...
Okay this run is going well, I may just make it to the-
*<enemy> hits you for 1000000000 damage*
You Mad?
...
*Intensity intensifies*
-------------------------------------------------------

This game is not for everyone. If this isn't your type of game you will find it average at best. However, if you are lucky enough to be this game's target audience, prepare to lose hours of your life everyday, because this game is similiar to Sid Meier's Civilization series but instead of "just one more turn" it's gonna be "just one more playthrough."

author: {'steamid': '76561197968904509', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 11743, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8417, 'last_played': 1582916688}
review:
this might be TL;DR for some people - for raw pro/con just scroll down.

It's a shame this game only has 27 (even if all of them are positive) reviews.

Folks this game is great! The base version of this game is free and may help you to determine wether or not this game is for you.

My first experiences with this game were kinda "meh" not because the game is bad but just because i felt like it was hard to get into (that might be a personal thing tho). I made a big mistake by shoving it to the side for a while thinking this game wasnt for me. In a phase of boredom i picked this game up again and used my time to get into it and hell - I'm fascinated. i litteraly can't stop playing - this game has so much depth and so much to give for such a little price it's just wow.

Darkgod is the prime example for a good game developer - give it for free and let the people choose wether or not to pay for it. I feel bad now for picking this gem up when it was on sale and i only payed about 70c so i donated another 5 Euro for now just because the game is so great (i'll probably donate even more just because i won't stop playing this game aslong as things are beeing developed for it)


Enough for the story telling now lets get to the raw information:


Pro's:

Great story: you got ALOT of texts to read for background information about races , the past events , demons , long lost civilizations etc etc etc. if you realy want to you can get ALOT of information.

Gameplay: AMAZING - the game has so much depth telling you all about it would fill about 100's of sites so just go find out yourself you realy won't be disappointed. trust me on this.
Roguelike typical RNG
tons and tons and tons of randomly generated equipment aswell as our all beloved legendary equipment which stays the same.
Brilliant skills and spells which would also be too much to talk about in detail right here.

Graphics: Lovely oldschoolish graphics (i know it's not for everyone but for me personaly it's great.)

Active developer: Darkgod is always working on this game , hell he even shows up online regulary and starts random events for everyone thats playing in that moment ( this can be Zones , small buffs , useless but funny buffs or even other things which i'm not gonna mention.

Online community ingame: Okay now this one is great and probably my most favorite function in this game - even tho this is a singleplayer game it has an online function which is basicaly just a chat where you can link items , talk to people , see what other people do (deaths,archievements etc). This is especialy helpfull when starting out because the community is great and always helpfull (hey Xlambda , minmay etc :D). When you're more experienced it's still helpfull for lets say Item comparsion or just simple chatting while playing along.


Cons: A little hard to get into but as i said above that might just be me personally and yet it's not that hard just takes a little bit of time and dedication. 

Thats about it.


I give this game a 10/10 on my personal scale - im TOTALY in love with it and 'am planing to play it for a LONG time.


Darkgod you're my hero.

author: {'steamid': '76561197996886109', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 1767, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1767, 'last_played': 1438855011}
review:
Tales of Maj'Eyal is a true Roguelike (i.e. it plays much like [url=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rogue_(video_game)]Rogue[/url]).


The Good:

It is massive.  There's lots of classes, areas, items, and spells, and things to do.  Very little feels redundant or samey.

Unlike most Roguelikes, there is a plot.

As claimed, there is indeed no need to grind.

Permadeath can be turned off with no penalty.  This partially makes up for many of the bad aspects of the game.


The Bad:

Tales of Maj'Eyal is a true Roguelike.  Most of its flaws are common to most members of the genre.

Like most Roguelikes, there are horrendous balance problems.  You will frequently encounter creatures of widely varying levels in the same area.  Some of these enemies move so fast, and hit so hard, just seeing them on your screen almost guarantees death.  If you have permadeath on, and aren't a masochist, you're going to have a bad time.

Turning permadeath off doesn't completely solve the balance problems.  It also just feels bad.  Resurrecting where you were, with full hit points and no negative statuses, with the enemies as you left them, results in you either being deathlocked or overpowered.  I would rather it have saved every 5 minutes, then load the save from 5 minutes ago when I die.  That would both feel fairer, and prevent the deathlock problem.  Being able to willingly back up further (lose more progress) would be even better insurance against being deathlocked.

Like most Roguelikes, there are terrible guidance problems.  In most Roguelikes this is due to there being no guidance at all.  While Tales of Maj'Eyal has problems with [i]insufficient[/i] guidance, it does have some guidance, due to the main quest and side quests directing you to the ‘next’ areas.  However, sometimes you encounter strange interactive widgets and need to decide what, if anything, to do with them.  There is no guidance here, and if you do the wrong thing the results are often lethal.  Tales of Maj'Eyal has somewhat unique problems with [i]malicious[/i] guidance.  The main and side quests will frequently send you to places without any hint that you better purchase some items or allocate points in some abilities to counteract the next boss' game-breaking abilities, or simply lead you to locations full of enemies far beyond your level.  If you're going to play this, save yourself some frustration and just look everything that should have been in the game up on a wiki.

You will occasionally encounter wandering friendly characters.  They always need to be safely escorted out of the area.  There should be more variety in what they want from you.


The Ugly:

A few people are complaining about the graphics.  Traditionally Roguelikes didn't [i]have[/i] graphics (or sound).  Everything was represented with text characters and you had to learn to read the screen (e.g. @ is the player character).  You could usually select a location on the screen for a more detailed explanation.  While many of us enjoyed using our imagination, it did prevent Roguelikes from being popular with the masses.  The few that have graphics now often adopted them due to running out of ASCII characters to represent things with, before Unicode support was widespread and good monospaced Unicode fonts were available.  So it's a matter of perspective whether Tales of Maj'Eyal has good or bad graphics.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999782420', 'num_games_owned': 573, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 13826, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11841, 'last_played': 1625289556}
review:
This is seriously one of the best rogue-likes out there!  It is quite punishing, but not oppressively so like Dungeon Crawl.  There is a steep learning curve, your first adventure, or first few dozen adventures will probably not yield you anything game-wise, but you will learn.  Playing around a little bit, you will start seeing synergies with how the different skills for the classes interact with each other, and then start building yourself a truly powerful character.

For me, nothing feels better than having your ass handed to you by the game repeatedly, and then, figuring out the class you're trying to do, and waltzing through the end-game content like a seasoned veteran...because you are!  You will learn the strategies, understand the tactics, shape your reactions to the situations appropriately, and you will conquer!  You will earn your end-game god-like status not by farming, or investing time at the expense of brainpower, you will earn it through sweat and, sometimes, tears of frustration, but you absolutely will earn it, and when you deal that final blow, you will feel like you truly accomplished something great...

...and then you will start the process over again, learning a new class!

I have had this game for many years now, and the constant updates keep it fresh.  Keep it comin!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198017080543', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 8743, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2156, 'last_played': 1651788039}
review:
Played this game for 60 or so hours around 3 years ago, it was free to download but an option to donate. I actually really dug it so when it went to steam decided it was time to support the creator by purchasing it. It's worth the full price, but if you're cheap like me you can wait for a sale as it seems to go on sale semi-frequently.

Pros-
          Deep class options, a min/maxers dream.
          High replayability due to not all classes being available from the outset (must be unlocked) as well as many different ways to approach situations.
          Story is decent enough, if you're into reading and lore this game has it.
          It has graphics, even spells have decent graphics, no ASCII here!
          Perma death, it's a roguelike folks!
Cons-
          Perma death, it's a roguelike folks..
          The graphics arent great, if you're used to cutting edge stuff, this might be a shock to your system.
          The amount of options for classes can be overwhelming, and there are limited classes available from the outset.

Summary-
          If you like roguelikes, the Avernum series, or the old unforgiving RPG's of yesteryear, this one is a must have.

author: {'steamid': '76561197984827755', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 239902, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 161, 'playtime_at_review': 37044, 'last_played': 1711738770}
review:
In a nutshell, Tales of Maj'Eyal is a turn-based old-school-minded roguelike that's been in development for over a decade (in various incarnations) and which lets you save the world from a horde of orcs, demons, and god-slaying aliens by playing as characters as varied as a hate-fueled skeleton who kills things by flipping them the bird and an albino ewok who likes to punch dragons and get high on nature. Or, if you want to get REALLY crazy, I guess you can play as an elven archer.

If you don't care so much about things like "animation" and you love keeping track of way too many numbers for your character, well, then this game is more for you than for me. And I have over 600 hours in it. This game is ridiculous and it is destroying my life.

author: {'steamid': '76561198067208095', 'num_games_owned': 1472, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 3510, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2265, 'last_played': 1629250972}
review:
[b]Tales of Maj'Eyal[/b] – один з найкращих прикладів сучасних роуг-лайк ігор. Ця гра є переродженням старенької  ToME - Tales Of Middle Earth, яка була створена в старі-бородаті часи автором на ім’я [b]DarkGod[/b]. Вона була досить популярним варіантом Ангбанду у світі Толкієна і принесла автору певну славу та відомість. Користуючись популярністю яку автор встиг заробити завдяки попередній грі, в 2010 році він представив спільноті новий продукт створений на новому рушії - T-Engine 4 зі старою абревіатурою але новим ім'ям - [b]Tales of Maj'Eyal[/b].

Ця гра одразу отримала схвальні відгуки та нагороди як найкраща роуг-лайк гра 2010-2013 років. Вона спромоглася сумістити у собі досить сучасну тайлову графіку (ASCII режим також присутній), зручний інтерфейс, продвинутий генератор предметів (пам’ятаєте тонни різного цікавого луту в Діабло 2? Тут те ж саме) та глибокий світ, про який ми можемо дізнатися збираючи згортки з історичною інформацією по всьому світу. Система рас, класів та талантів залишає великий простір для розвитку свого персонажу. Зібравши все це до купи ми маємо чудовий, сучасний, зручний та різноманітний рогалик, у який буде цікаво грати як і ветеранам жанру так і новачкам. Рекомендую!

[b]P.S.[/b] Тільки-но подивіться скільки тут досягнень!

author: {'steamid': '76561198049790264', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 24167, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9444, 'last_played': 1555979150}
review:
Let me settle something first that sometimes confuses people looking at the tags on Steam. The first tag is "Rogue-like", the second is "RPG". This is not a traditional "learn as you go on a mighty quest" kind of RPG game, it is a rougue-like. You will learn as you die. You have one life (or multiple on Adventure mode) and will thus have to be tactical and smart with the decisions you make.

Now, getting with the review, this is a fantastic game that i highly recommend you try if you are a ROGUE-LIKE fan, not a traditional RPG fan. The game doesn't bring miscellaneous lose conditions to discourage and hinder you like other games in the genre (Damn hunger meters). This is not to say that the game is a cakewalk, rather it is far from it. The game expects you to die and to learn from it, take the time to analyze why you took 30% of your health in one shot, check the game log, inspect enemy monsters before you rush in so you can take them on effectively.

The game has excellent replayability, due to the diversity of races and classes as well as random dungeons and alternate layouts. Different races and classes also start in different areas and have slightly differing dungeons available, allowing for even more content that you may have not known was there in the first place. This, along with random loot that can have a wide variety of effects leads to the player enjoying exploring the world and tackling rare monsters.

Even more content can be unlocked with the Arena and Infinite modes that can be obtained once you get to a certain point in the Campaign (both are fairly early). Arena mode lets you pick a race and class and lets you test your skill against a 30 or 60 wave gauntlet. Infinite places you in an infinite dungeon where you explore and try to survive for as long as you can.

Overall, this game is a fun challenge for anyone who has the patience to see when to run and when to fight as well as the ability to say "I just spent 10 hours on a character and he/she died. That's fine, let's see where we went wrong and try again." And for those who read the negative reviews and saw "i ran into a wall of lvl 20 guys at lvl 1, game is unbalaced", they ran into a event (which you can avoid and come back to later) where you open a locked door and fight high leveled enemies for better loot. It's a high risk high reward area, and if you don't think you can do it, don't.

TLDR: If you have the patience to realise you made a mistake and analyze it, and you enjoy rougue-likes, this is a good game. You will die, a lot. This is part of the game. It is wonderful and has replayability like no other. Also, don't open sealed doors unless you are ready to fight high level guys who will kill you if you don't know what you're doing.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970550187', 'num_games_owned': 773, 'num_reviews': 190, 'playtime_forever': 7821, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1421, 'last_played': 1698885556}
review:
It is as good as folks are saying. Fun, deep, and difficult. Not the type of difficult that enrages or frustrates; ToME is the type of difficult that makes playing interesting but tense. A rich, deep, but accessible, old school RPG world that rewards the time you spend in it. Pretty by today's standards? No, but ToME has it's own aesthetic that harkens back to the golden age of video RPGs and the underpinning design is fresh, but still true to it's roots. This, in itself makes it a unique game here on Steam. Not hip. Not genre-BREAKING, but genre-DEFINING. A BIG game but a welcoming one.

ToME is more a constantly evolving tactical adventure game that has a wealth of randomly generated content, but it is random in a DIRECTED way; random with a purpose and a logic. 

Despite the huge amount of classes, skills, equipment, and creatures, ToME is accessible in ways that many other rogue-like games are not. It's a strange beast that rewards the hardcore and the casual rogue-adventuring fan.

If you enjoy adventuring and the possibilities contained in each new area explored, each new creature slain and each new tentacle tree messed with, then buy this game. It's community-driven labor of love and if you give it a bit of your time it will pay you back in spades.

One of the best games that I have ever played in my 47 years of gaming.

author: {'steamid': '76561198073000949', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 27756, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8282, 'last_played': 1646349579}
review:
My first review on Steam as well. I am going to say this first - if you like roguelikes, you will certainly like ToME. If you don't then you still might like ToME since it has a lower entry barrier than some other mainly ASCII based roguelikes like dungeon crawl, while not losing any of the depth.

The graphics of course do not compare to the AA titles, but I think they are by no means bad looking, and the extremely enjoyable gameplay more than makes up for it. The replay value is amazing as well as the progression (unlocking new classes as you go, so you are not overwhelmed by the choices at first), the UI makes it easy to learn the game mechanics (hovering over the stats etc). And the lead developer listening to and interacting with the people of course adds a nice touch.

Disclaimer: Not much hours played on this account, but I played a previous version of this game 10y ago and am very excited to see how it has developed, and I think I can grasp the magnitude of the game world and the amount of choices already.

Give it a try!

author: {'steamid': '76561197961211685', 'num_games_owned': 1255, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 2053, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2053, 'last_played': 1446083395}
review: Tales of Maj'Eyal is a great roguelike.  I've been playing TOME since it was created (The original free version) and following DarkGod and his work, TOME has evolved into a very beginner friendly game, allowing for the hardcore player to build a character using 'roguelike' mode, or allowing beginners to use exploration or adventure mode to give unlimited lives, or a set number of lives per run.  This gives the player more flexibility to play the game how they want to play it and experience the lore.  The game starts you off with a modest number of Race/Class combos and you can unlock more as you progress by completing dungeons and quests.  I'd recommend this game for anyone that is not phased by turn-based tactical gameplay.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993518428', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 36278, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 16126, 'last_played': 1527818305}

author: {'steamid': '76561198007425197', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 112, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6, 'last_played': 1490197465}
review:
Damn this game, damn it.

Stop concentrating for a moment and you're dead.

Get cocky, you're dead.

Err slightly, you're dead.

One step too far, you're dead :).

Yes, the game is punishing, but that makes the rewards all the richer.

Personally i'd put gameplay above graphics 100% of the time and this game fits that bill for sure, but don't be fooled into thinking that only adequate graphics means poor gameplay. In this case, it does not. Far from it. You really really have to think about how/where to progress otherwise that bright light at the end of the tunnel races forward and envelops you. Again :).

The only tip i'd give to people is to check, upon entering a certain area, what your charactor thinks about it before going even one step further. If your charactor is crapping his/her self then leave! You get a one-liner when you enter that tells you.

I've played quite a few hours offline and keep coming back for more.

Oh, and it'll probably run on that old windows95 era hardware you've got in the loft :).

Have fun and expect your swearing vocabulary to increase drastically!

author: {'steamid': '76561197977330447', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 12820, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10615, 'last_played': 1566112154}
review:
This game is more than just a SOLID roguelike -- it's also a pretty damn close to being a cRPG because of the turn-based combat, immersive story elements, and character-building.  The popular user-defined steam tags for this game are 100% spot on.

Don't let the game title or graphics put you off. I think the title is too silly for a game this good.

Don't listen to people who say this game is too hard -- there's multiple difficulty levels and modes -- one of the modes makes it just like Diablo 1 in terms of difficulty (exploration mode).


Exploration mode -- there's no fail state (think of the Diablo series).  It literally can't be too hard in this mode.
Adventure mode  -- The perfect compromise.  You start with one life, and get a handful more as you level.  Death still sucks, but it's not too bad.  When you die, the game is telling you to Get Good -- It's not just because you didn't pray to RNGesus enough.  I think the game is balance tuned to this mode for normal human beings.
Roguelike -- One life.  It's Ironman mode in a game balanced for multiple lives -- without the ability to grind in increase survivability (think Diablo).  So, you need a _very deep_ understanding of the game mechanics to succeed in this mode.  Like, looking at the code deep -- or at least benefiting from the knowledge of others who have, in some way.  Not that the game is totally unfair.  It's pretty damn fair.  But there are things in this game that will most likely result in your death if you're unprepared, and there's no way to know to prepare for them without having encountered it before.  In many cases, you do get very good hints about this through the ingame Lore/Story bits you find -- but not always.  That's my impression, anyways.  

The above modes are on top of additional difficulty settings, so it's rather fine-tunable (I started playing on Normal-Adventurer, and I'm still playing in that mode at 100 hours /played -- and I haven't beaten the game yet).


High points as I think of them:

Gameplay is amazing.  
Itemization is top-notch.  
Class ability balance is pretty damn good -- most games I feel like I'm beta testing class balance, but not here.
There's an actual story, and there are immersive pieces of lore that you find that are well-written.
Extremely moddable, but not in a "bad" way like some games where you'd need to spend 100's of hours modding before you start playing (I'm looking at you, Fallout 3 and Skyrim.  Morrowind would be in the same boat, but it gets a pass from me because that game has style).
Loving the Z key.
Escort missions are brilliant.
The Devs removed the grind for consumables -- which is one of the major departures from classic rogue games.
The Rogue class is fun as hell for me.
You can tell that the Devs are true gamers -- what is optimal is also often enough the most fun way to play.  I get the impression that this is not merely serendipitous.
After/If you beat the game, you can take your character into a true infinite dungeon to see how far you get.  That sounds pretty awesome, even though I haven't done it yet.
Helpful ingame chat (you can link items into it, and there's an ingame browser).

The only downside is the graphics.  They could be better, and with how moddable the game is, I'm actually pretty surprised it's not already.  There's a certain amount of charm to them, but it's not like Fallout 1 level charm -- but then again the only game that comes close to that (or exceeds in some aspects) is Diablo 2, so I'm being a bit unfair.  There is a DLC for like $1 that does improve the UI graphics some, and I think it's worth getting.

I could improve the graphics substantially and release it as a mod, but I'm too busy playing -- it's that good.  Mayber everyone feels the same way.

Get this game because it's great.  
Get the DLCs to support the Devs

I'd rate this 9.9/10 if the price was irrelevant.  At its current price, it's an honest 11/10 ((before you say anything: YES I know).


TLDR: It's great.  This game deserves to be more popular than it already is.  The Devs deserve your money.

author: {'steamid': '76561197992856964', 'num_games_owned': 1022, 'num_reviews': 232, 'playtime_forever': 2159, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 96, 'last_played': 1697573908}
review:
[Edit 3, 2023]
There's still some constructive criticism to go around, but also a lot of good features.  Each ability tree has a lot of active abilities and not many passive ones, and often refuses to unlock a new ability until you have the previous one on the tree -- and many items have abilities you can activate too.  Your interface quickly gets overwhelmed with dozens of options on various cooldowns.  That said, all of the abilities are pretty cool and effective.  I recommend starting as some variation on fighter, then trying the rogue.  The game's also not completely sure if it wants to be controlled by keyboard or mouse, and both options suffer a bit for it, especially ranged characters.  It plays like an uneasy compromise.

Cool feature two, there's a lot less early-game repetition than most roguelikes.  There's a good handful of different start scenarios, each with two starter dungeons -- then everything comes together for a set of four storyline dungeons (which all have alternate versions) you can do in any order, followed by another set of four, and then what looks like a set of two or three-ish.  It's a good middleground, especially with all of the unrelated side-content that you can find with a little exploration - that varies from game to game, so it's Still exploration.  That said, some events trigger dialogue/cutscenes FAR before you are ready to face the associated quests.  Expect to die a Lot if you don't compulsively grind XP and doublecheck the level ranges on zones on your map.

Three, I really like unlocking new race/class combos, and having some things be gated to certain classes.  The setting is decently unique without falling too far into "My Orcs Are Different" or "Generic fantasy pastiche #2", and takes inspiration from warcraft, elder scrolls, dnd, and others.  Each lore snippet varies quite a bit in length.  I read a lot more of them than I'd entirely meant to, because I kept finding very very short ones right after a long one had tired me out.


[Edit 2, 2023]
Giving this game a third try, and it still seems to be going strong after a few more years!   The interface is still a little bit hectic and hard to parse, but there's a lot of intriguing gameplay in there if you look, and I've successfully made it out of the first few dungeons without getting stuck or frustrated.

I think I'd enjoy less focus on pretty decorative UI, and more focus on instantly-clear info readouts.  But I also swapped it to ascii mode on purpose (which is a thing you can do, that both works and helps) - your mileage may vary.  Also, all of the bugs/complaints from my previous reviews seem to have been corrected, it fits on my screen no problem and I can resize things and turn off online features.

Changing this to a big thumbs up. The game needed a little longer to cook out of the alpha stage, and it's solidly getting there.  The modding community also has some quality of life and interface mods that I'm looking into now.  Very nice!




[Edit 1, late twenty-teens]

Gave this another try after a year or two.  The interface is better, but still rough, and nothing from the previous review has changed.  Highlights this time include..
- You can change the size the quick access buttons display at, but their hitboxes stay at 48x48 so you might want to stick to that setting.
- The online chat window sometimes displays over the ingame message box, and you can't turn one off without turning off the other.  I hope you either have a good memory or like hearing about complete strangers' achievement progress as much as you like knowing whether or not your attack hit.

It still feels like there's something compelling hidden underneath.  I managed to play long enough to beat the first level this time, before getting frustrated.  The playerbase / game devs still seem active and healthy.  Will try again in a few years.



[Original review follows, mid twenty-teens]

The UI / gameplay aren't as crisp and polished as I've come to expect in a roguelike -- an example, changing the "resolution" changes window size and nothing else, including the size of menus larger than your chosen resolution.  I think that once I pierce the learning curve there will be a good turnbased strategy game in here, but with nethack's semirandom difficulty curve, and having to unlock character types.

This game has the potential to become a lot of things, but it feels like early access to me.

If you thought dungeons of dredmore was too mainstream, polished, and silly, you could give this a go?  It seems to have a very active community and mod team.

author: {'steamid': '76561198032577504', 'num_games_owned': 652, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 19454, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 13068, 'last_played': 1617581493}
review: Exelente rogue-like, gran cantidad de clases y builds para cada una. Las horas que se le pueden dedicar a este juego son muchas. El juego tiene mucho contenido y el desarollador implementa actualizaciones y corrige errores constantemente.

author: {'steamid': '76561198094613524', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 27028, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3470, 'last_played': 1708020945}
review:
You make a basic character and class from the limited selection available to you. 2/3rds of the other possibilites are locked, but you hope you will eventually acquire them with time and diligence. You start your playthrough on the easiest difficulty. You die a lot, but you slowly learn the ropes.You start over, this time with a more refined build. You begin to learn the dungeon order. You move faster and die less. The challenge is gone, and you move up to the next difficulty. 

It's a different game. You lose within an hour. You try again. This time you don't even get through the first level. You re-learn the game, and slowly improve. Your build is more refined. You become more cautious, more perceptive, and you start to make real progress. After numerous do overs and deaths, you finally surpass your prior characters. You're in uncharted territory. Your first bout with the final bosses ends in seconds with your champion in pieces with your honor. And so you start again. You progress, you die, you repeat. You start over a lot, but each character gets further than the last. 

Finally, after many gruelling hours, you have beaten the bosses and won! Your palms are sweatng, your knees feel weak, and you feel so elated you could fly. 

You move up to the next difficulty. You lose within moments. You re-learn the game, and you do it all again. 

You beat the bosses on this difficulty. You know the ins and outs of this characer so well you could write an encyclopedia. So you start a totally new character, with some of the new races and classes you have unlocked. You start on the easiest difficulty and lose within seconds. 

So you do it all over again.

author: {'steamid': '76561197990225281', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 3125, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2684, 'last_played': 1672435395}
review: More please.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993405440', 'num_games_owned': 90, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 10254, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5008, 'last_played': 1615482613}
review:
Not a bad game, but the difficulty is all over the place, the sign of a quite poorly balanced game in my opinion. The rng is just out of this world in this game, but I guess that's kinda to be expected from a "roguelike" such as this. It's good fun if you don't mind dying all the time just to "learn" things and then get screwed over by random rare encounters(and bosses can be random as well). I've only played this game on the roguelike setting, so I can't really comment on the easier difficulties but I'm sure they're not too bad since you can afford dying playing them. 

I really haven't played that game that much, not sure what it clocks in on currently. Would I recommend this game? yes and no. I do like the game but the rng and difficulty swings really annoys me. However It's a small game, I love the graphic style, it's quite simplistic and it can be fun to die at times. 

But be warned, it is a hard game and yes it will frustrate the hell out of you at times.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041923062', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 1535, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 432, 'last_played': 1689514257}
review: Too frustrating to be fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561198039020533', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 30040, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1176, 'last_played': 1701284239}
review:
A challenging roguelike with an interesting tactical aspect. Lots of customization options, fun combat mechanics and an excellent replay value. At 7€ it's a steal, considering how much gameplay it has to offer.

ToME may seem daunting at first but it's highly recommended, even to those who aren't that much into the genre.

review: First rogue-like I've actually played (I've bought several off STEAM) since the death of ZAngband Tk. Its a heck of a lot of fun, and a clock eater. I sat down last night and said "I'm gonna play for 1/2 an hour... that was at 9pm... I got up to go to bed at a little after "Was that a rooster I heard" 5:30am... if you're only going to own one rogue-like, this one needs a good long look.

author: {'steamid': '76561198183732898', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1455, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 134, 'last_played': 1624961970}

author: {'steamid': '76561198013374970', 'num_games_owned': 381, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 40458, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 26226, 'last_played': 1685370813}
review:
总在贴吧、其乐上有人问怎么买，先说明一下商店里各项的区别
a. Tales of Maj'Eyal 原价28
即本体一份
b. Tales of Maj'Eyal 4-Pack 原价68
四份本体
c. Tales of Maj'Eyal Volumes I - III 原价52
本体+2个DLC 一份

1.如果是为了喜+1，那么请选择 a 或者和其他3位想喜+1的人合买 b
2.如果想要体验完整内容的，请选择 c
3.如果不确定是否会喜欢这个游戏，想尝试一下后再做决定的，请去 [url=https://te4.org/download]官网[/url] 下载免费版。
相比付费的本体，免费版除了同样没DLC内容外，还少了一个收费职业、共享仓库，和一些自定义外观选项。但是游戏基本核心内容都有了

关于DLC：2个DLC共增加了1个剧情模式、4个种族、5个职业，另外还有一些影响玩法的内容，比如蒸汽系统，这里就不做详细说明了。总而言之，为了体验完整游戏内容，DLC是必须的

最后需要提醒的是，如果已经拥有了本体，再选择购买 Tales of Maj'Eyal Volumes I - III，多出来的本体，是不会作为副本发到你的仓库，也不会在结算的时候去除本体的价格

author: {'steamid': '76561198118046489', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 112, 'playtime_forever': 13497, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1486, 'last_played': 1628426120}

I'd absolutely recommend this game to anyone who like good 'ol rpgs. Though be warned, this is pretty difficult, expect to die a LOT. After 100+ hours, I still haven't beat it yet.

author: {'steamid': '76561198085583923', 'num_games_owned': 499, 'num_reviews': 61, 'playtime_forever': 3203, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 840, 'last_played': 1527754286}
review:
不不不，我不能概括这个游戏，嗯，不能。
这个游戏可能会有很多人向你推荐，他们会细数游戏的各种好的方面，自由的世界，庞大的数据量，随机的地城，可以玩到天荒地老的游戏长度，以及看一眼就很有挑战性的成就数量。
但是请想明白，这些是很好的，可这是不是你想要的？
TOME尝试将roguelike推广到所有人群中，漂亮的界面（似乎有人在高呼ASCII的美妙谁人能懂？），方便的MOD系统，“有限随机性”，和软模式（这个太好了）。这些都是很好的，这是真的好，对每个人都好的方面。
不过实际上这个游戏仍然不会适合每一个人，他需要大量重复的游戏时间，即便你不选择核心模式。每次角色死亡后都给人非常沉重的打击，这种打击在该角色游戏时间越长越是明显，有的人能享受这种不可逆进程带来的快感并且快速投入新的冒险中，有的人却会明显消耗掉游戏热情。所以开始玩时请选择软模式！
还有一点是基于角色死亡这种情况产生的问题，其实是源于上一个问题，游戏的开局角色是有限的（mod？），特别是初期，每一个角色的数据积累过程在初期时是几乎无法选择的，如果新手在初期频繁死亡，就会遇到这样的情况——重复的开局，重复的开局，重复的开局。这种有限随机本来是保护新玩家的措施，可这很可能对新玩家的游戏热情有巨大的杀伤。
我玩free版本有一段时间（大概是很短的时间，嗯），深刻的感受到（非抖M）新玩家的艰难。不希望大家将这样一个优秀的游戏买来只是+1。
在有人对任何游戏发表弃坑宣言的时候可能都有有人这样对他说：静下心来，认真的玩下去，你就会发现它真的是很好的。对于TOME也只能如此。真是无奈啊。

author: {'steamid': '76561198211862387', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 12720, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3252, 'last_played': 1709612014}
review: As a former fan of DCSS and a long time lover of fantasy games, I can say with certainty that this is the best I've ever played. It has incredible depth yet it is highly accessible after a few times playing through characters; it has awesome mods, DLC, and general gameplay. Each class is very much different in playstyle, and the skill trees are both rewarding and varied. I recommend this game to any fan of roguelikes. 10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198052089296', 'num_games_owned': 326, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 1652, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1025, 'last_played': 1699396543}
review: This game is not easy. Not at all. But that's why I love it. A massive range of classes, races, skills, weapons, armour, spells, enemies, landscapes, and dungeons all come together to make an immersive turn-based rougelike experience. Easily one of my favourites in the rougelike genre.

author: {'steamid': '76561198010037064', 'num_games_owned': 462, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 1792, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1470, 'last_played': 1605390727}
review: несомненно великолепнейший рогалик. расписывать все, что уже было сказано обзорщиками - не имеет смысла. всем любителям жанра однозначно стоит в нее поиграть, особенно если учесть, что она по сути распространяется бесплатно на официальном сайте. но разработчики подобных качественных игр, коих не так много в современное время, действительно заслуживают не только уважения, но и материального поощрения. причем на данную игру ценник в стиме целиком и полностью оправдан вкупе с длс.

author: {'steamid': '76561198076156510', 'num_games_owned': 236, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 8717, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1829, 'last_played': 1596858612}
review:
I highly recommend this!

A throw back to the 90s, excellently executed, this game is a real gem.

Pros:
- Excellent character building with interesting stats and skills. 
- Combat is fun.
- The quests are enjoyable, involved, but not overly so.
- Tons of innovative features that remove elements of RPGs that would typically be boring. 
e.g. Autoexplore: Lets you effortlessly find anything you missed in an area.
- Lots of classes and characters to unlock with each playthrough, which keeps things fresh oh and also some special items carry through to your next character.

Cons?
- This game is nothing to look at.
- The tutorial was a tad boring, but only lasts all of 5 mins, it's to the point, well worth getting through to enjoy a great game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198088584155', 'num_games_owned': 126, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 6243, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5187, 'last_played': 1484833628}

author: {'steamid': '76561198080123570', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 197, 'playtime_forever': 2621, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2445, 'last_played': 1445622447}
review:
Not much to say apart from:
I love this game. 
The art is a lot better on my screen than on the teasers from the store page.
The different classes i've seen so far have a very different gameplay, giving a big boost to replayability.
The unlockables are great: from game changer items, to new classes, races and a base. All those are rewarding your different attempts to beat the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198209943355', 'num_games_owned': 378, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 4507, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1607, 'last_played': 1660905001}

author: {'steamid': '76561198111084499', 'num_games_owned': 241, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 26636, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 18116, 'last_played': 1705254356}
review:
[h1]BEST combat/character build system EVER[/h1]

You can never get tired of the various builds TOME4 can offer even if you have limited interest in build types. Watch your hero grow to be the ultimate awesomeness is a great pleasure for me.
Combat in this game is the best I've seen in all games, the more skilled you are, the more fun you'll get(in higher difficulties of course). In many games, when you achieve "mastery" everything just becomes a cakewalk. This is never the case in TOME4. You get cocky and you die. 

TOME4 is so focus on combat that it DOES NOT have many traditional RPG/roguelike elements such as hunger, tireness, thirst, consumables... You can actually feel that every mechanism in it is born for battle(except some aesthetics options). This is good for TOME4 because adding these will only undermine what TOME4 already have.
(Unrelated: Non-combat focused roguelikes can be really good as well, have you tried elona? If you ignore the male chauvinism filled in that game, it is magnificent.)

[h1]Constantly updating[/h1]
It has an ancient history(In the field of computer games) and it is still updating. Major, huge updates including new classes/races/skills/graphics/mechanisms. 

[h1]Online features(can be disabled)[/h1]
It offers in-game chat with other players. if you visit the main website you can also check your many characters' details. You can discard them all if you don't want them and that will not affect your gameplay in any way, the only problem is that you won't be able to exchange items stored online between your characters.

[h1]Friendly to beginners[/h1]
It offers a good tutorial and most of the stuff stay locked until you progress. You won't be overwhelmed by information if you are not prepared. 

[h1]Active player community[/h1]
The forum and wiki are quite useful and TOME4 have tons of mods developed by the players. You can get them easily in the workshops.

[h1]Darkgod is Smart[/h1]
The developer of this game, Darkgod, is extremely smart. The game mechanisms are so well developed that there's no grinding/taking advantage of AI/boredem in late game. Expect a difficult challenge in early game and expect it to be more difficult in late game as well. 

[h1]Darkgod is Kind[/h1]
You can play this game for free if you download it from the official website. 
If you pay for the game and DLC you can get many customizable aesthetic options/exchange items between characters/new classes etc. The price is ridiculously cheap as well. Darkgod also accepts additional donations in the game's official website.

Watch how many hours other reviewers and I spent on this game. It's insane.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007424579', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 4435, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 568, 'last_played': 1628785850}
review: Best roguelike on steam

author: {'steamid': '76561198067664101', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 7620, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5424, 'last_played': 1618414982}
review:
这个游戏的缺点很多。

例如：
画面非常简陋
动作性几乎没有
上手非常迷茫
安利非常艰难
系统过于复杂
后期难度大得吐血
数不胜数

优点却很简单

那就是，它好玩到足以让人无视他的所有缺点。

我更愿意称这游戏为：魔幻踢门战术模拟系统。

如果你喜欢Roguelike RPG，那不用说了，绝对是必入的。

如果你喜欢明知山有虎偏向虎山行，向高难度挑战，甚至认为制作人你不虐我就是我儿子，那这就是你要的菜。

如果你只是个普通RPG玩家，本游戏又名《论我的10000种死法》。看着办吧。

95/100

author: {'steamid': '76561198040908291', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 127, 'playtime_forever': 548, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 548, 'last_played': 1430765340}
review:
Ahhh TOME what a beautiful game! I love it and so should you. It's the best traditional roguelike out there. Yes you heard me right: THE BEST. I played tons of roguelikes, and by that I mean over 50 or so ; D. And still, there is no game that can live up to this gem. It has all you want: 

#Deep and interesting lore
#Tons of races and classes
# Vast and complex skill trees that allow you to personalize your gameplay
#Tons of items
#It’s insanely long (for a roguelike)
#Loads of caves, ruins, forests, other dimensions, and towns to explore
#It's straight up fun

And all that greatness comes packaged in one game. I've spent hours playing this masterpiece (most of them in the non-steam version) and yet I haven't seen everything. If you want to get into roguelikes get this game! And if you already are into roguelikes and you haven't bought it yet... well than you've fucked up. GET THIS MASTERPIECE NOW!!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198025153924', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 84, 'playtime_forever': 2303, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 940, 'last_played': 1704171630}
review:
Holy crap it has live events!

The game is tileset turn base with mouse support. Its looks old but has a lot of modern elements added on. If you like tatical turn base cRPGs and don't mind tilesets then this is seriously a great game. SO MUCH CUSTOMIZATION! So many choices and so many ways you will die... but fear not as there are a few game modes ranging from infinite lives to true roguelike. Easy to play but its got a really robust mechanic system. Also has modding support. Tons of gear, tons of weapons, tons of monsters, tons of areas, tons of lore, and a stupidly high number of race/classes (of which u get to choose how they level and play via skills and perks and the RNG gear)

Oh ya and no grinding. Once u clear a floor or whole dungeon its cleared for good. I think new hostiles can spawn on the overworld map though like hostile patrols, though not 100% sure.

I should mention the game is 100% free (aside from the DLC) at te4.org though its made and maintsianed by 1 dude so worth it to buy it if you like it. And u can connect online to play but you won't see anyone as you are more or less just uploading your data and sometimes u might be playing and recieve a special world event because u were lucky to be logged in when it started :)

4/5 is my personal rating for the game. Its great verging on fantatsic! And I would recomend this to more mature older gamers like myself. People that play D&D or really old games.

author: {'steamid': '76561197963545170', 'num_games_owned': 128, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 1192, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1132, 'last_played': 1467076087}
review:
A long, deep, challenging roguelike that allows you to set the difficulty to how you want it. This game allows you to learn and ease into its difficulty.

Three modes of play allow you to experience this game with one life, multiple lives (awarded at specific levels), or infinite lives.

There are also 4 difficulty levels as well.

There are many racial and class abilities to mess around with and a good selection of both races and classes.

If you like roguelikes, or rpgs and don't mind graphics, this game is worth it. If you think the price is a little too much, wait for a sale.
