author: {'steamid': '76561197992070626', 'num_games_owned': 472, 'num_reviews': 51, 'playtime_forever': 3155, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 851, 'last_played': 1432768969}
review:
If you're going to take this game because of the achievements, take note that you will need to do the game 9 times in the different levels to get them all. 145 achievements per walkthrough.

Good luck.

Otherwise, it's a good roguelike. Nothing amazing but worth the try.
Tons of classes, unlockables and a huge map to explore, you will need a lot of time to beat it.
You can extend your gameplay by adding mods from the workshop to your game.

It's quite hard to get used with the controls. Also, you have the choice of exploring a map manually with the arrows or automaticly with the "Z" button. Anyway, the automatic explore won't follow the quest you are doing. Some quests will tell you to go somewhere but it won't show on the map, it only tells you some hints like go northwest from the forest.
The progress of the game is also too fast, you will sometimes get to a boss when your level is still too low. Your only way to farm is to go to harder dungeons.
Finally, I hope you like to die because you will die really much in this game. Dark Souls in 2D.

As I said, it's worth the try.

author: {'steamid': '76561198009515132', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 29558, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2750, 'last_played': 1680470590}
review: Great game with incredible replay value. Incredibly difficult, though. If you only think you win by defeating the 'final boss', this might not be the game for you. However, if you love a challenging game and feel acomplished when a character does well, you'll keep coming back to this game over and over and have a wonderful experience each time. Full of lore and interesting mechanics as well. Lots of achievements and unlocks.

author: {'steamid': '76561198049186119', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 86, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 74, 'last_played': 1699295311}
review: The best game I have ever played in twenty years of computer gaming, bar none (and I have played a LOT of games). Eight years on I can still recall how profoundly that game gripped me, and I am not an overly emotional person. You will care about the characters, you will be moved, you will make choices that tell you more about yourself. It sounds trite, I know, but it really is that good. If only someone would make more of these...insightful, intelligent, devastatingly creative. Fallout is the only RPG to come close. A word of warning: You MUST read all the text, explore all the dialogue options, if you are to gain the most from the game. A decent intelligence and wisdom score is recommended.....although so is a decent score in everything else....the game does the best job of making usually superflous statistics genuinely useful that I have ever seen. Still very much worth playing.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004695723', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 76316, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 50537, 'last_played': 1676930857}

author: {'steamid': '76561197966449205', 'num_games_owned': 4126, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 23543, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 638, 'last_played': 1586976749}
review:
This is a very well done roguelike.

It's complex, yet doesn't ever leave the player wondering. Every detail has explanations that explain the effects; for example, leveling up primary stats (eg, vitality, strength, etc) will show the effects on secondary stats (eg, crit chance, health, etc).

Players are encouraged to play in order to unlock additional races, classes, game types, etc. In my first run, I stumbled across a zoo -- and died shortly after. However, I unlocked the summoner class because I had come across a zoo.

In another play through, I finished the first quest and headed to the town. In town, I agreed to fight 3 elite warriors in order to prove myself worthy of the arena. I was afraid that I would die again -- after all, I was doing so well in this run. It paid off because winning unlocked the Arena game mode.

I would add that he vast number of achievements also helps replayability, except that there are over 1300 achievements. This will be pretty frustrating for anyone looking for 100% achievement completion.

The only part of the game that is lacking is the graphics; though that comes with the territory in a roguelike. Despite every item, monster, spell icon, and basically the entire game fitting into a square-sized sprite, there is still a lot of variety: Player icons seem to change based on equipment and active spells.

author: {'steamid': '76561198099835008', 'num_games_owned': 1287, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 1359, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 586, 'last_played': 1681136346}
review:
1.30汉化已经出了 大家稍等 正在测试
真的是一款超级棒的游戏 首先是他确实是有汉化的 这点是最开始支持我玩下去的重要因素了  随后游戏内容真的可以说是让我感到非常惊喜了 不管是技能树的设计还是游戏战斗方式 探索方式的设计都让我感觉这是款相当不错的游戏 而且我本身就是个刷子游戏爱好者 这种能刷上几百年的游戏 能不喜欢么？ 如果你喜欢随机装备系统 喜欢无尽的探索 喜欢创造或者实验各种不同流派的技能 喜欢刷刷刷 喜欢大宝 喜欢..... 等等一系列RPG要素 没有错 它全部拥有 除了不是大菠萝那种即时战斗 是一款可能人看上去特别别扭的半即时回合制 类似于战场女武神？ 又有所区别 反正如果喜欢 不介意不是即时战斗 或者想尝试一款真的很棒很耐刷的RPG游戏那就没有错 入吧！ 反正不贵！ 狗宝啥的很便宜的 而且支持在线存档 档案不会因为本地丢失而永久毁灭 这点对于我这种对存档相当珍视的人来说 是相当棒的 好吧 就说这么多 买不买随你..~

author: {'steamid': '76561198099811550', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 4786, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 610, 'last_played': 1710530819}
review:
Un excellent rogue-like, classique à la base mais qui intègre pas mal de mécanismes modernes issus des MMORPG (raccourcis clavier pour les pouvoirs, fonctionnement avec "cooldown", etc.).

Le contexte du jeu est assez riche, ce n'est plus du Tolkien comme dans les versions précédentes, mais un univers propre avec ses originalités et son historique qui se révèle au fur et à mesure des explorations.
Je suis assez fan de la musique et des graphismes, de la 2D enjolivée par des effets sympas.
Les races et les classes sont nombreuses et bien différenciées, certaines étant très originales et bien intégrées dans le contexte.

Le jeu est gratuit, mais avec Steam il est facilement portable entre ordinateurs, et je suis bien content de le financer un peu.

C'est très addictif, méfiez-vous !!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198044267867', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 24029, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7264, 'last_played': 1663858415}
review: Brilliant, the fact that a freeware game developed by one person has more customization and diversity than any multi-million dollar game I have ever played is mind boggling. To reiterate a free roguelike with myriad classes/builds (more being added regularly) and some theory craft for the price tag of 0.00$,

author: {'steamid': '76561197998079940', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 496, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 491, 'last_played': 1669775391}
review:
One of the best roguelikes on the market - easily top 3 alongside Dungeon Crawl Stone Soup and ADOM for me personally. What makes TOME so great is the way it is designed allows it to be incredibly easy to get into for a beginner but still have enough depth and complexity for an advanced player, and unlike traditional Roguelikes where you try to survive through one really big hard dungeon this has you survive through many mini-dungeons with an overworld map you can explore.

Game mechanics are incredibly solid, stuff is for the most part well balanced and you can advance in the game well enough as any class really. It abandons the traditional roguelike mechanic of potion spam to heal and instead replaces it with a heal over time ability you can upgrade. There are no random deaths / mechanics that require you to have played the game already in order to know how to not die in this game either.

Personally I think the game has one of the better loot systems for a roguelike, it's almost Action RPG-esque really.

This is an [b]incredibly[/b] minor con here but the graphics aren't as good as other modern roguelikes like Dungeon Crawl Stone Soup. That said, if you really like roguelikes like I do graphics are probably one of the things you care about the least.

Verdict: EXCEPTIONAL

author: {'steamid': '76561197997093186', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 11159, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9135, 'last_played': 1708717274}
review:
Did you ever play Dungeon Crawl and like it? BUY THIS GAME! Can you play FTL without punching your monitor out? BUY THIS GAME! This is the best rouge like I have ever played by far. First off, all the stupid crap about rouge likes - eating, potions, scrolls - fuck them, don't have to deal with them. It's based on pure enjoyment, not micro management. Second, its not overly cheesy... if you die its usually not a YASD situation (yet another stupid death), it's probably your fault. With multiple difficulty and permadeath modes you choose the level of frustration. The best part is the community and developer. He is dedicated to polishing the game and improving all the time. Best 5 bucks ever spent.

Did I mention 1306 achievements?

author: {'steamid': '76561198040985733', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 41117, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 789, 'last_played': 1700719569}
review:
Great game that differs itself from the other roguelikes. While it may not be a "procedurally generated" map, and there isn't anything that has a chance of being good or bad (ex: quaff potion, turns out to be a fire potion killing you) except for some abilities that teleport you randomly within a certain tile range (which you can get control of later on anyways). Without those, why should I still play it you ask? For one, this game is incredibly hard (which is a good thing). Every mistake adds up, and you have to think about how you approach enemies depending on your character, which brings me to my favorite part. There are tons of classes and races to choose from, each being unique in their own way. Classes are more rpg oriented, each having unique multiple attacks and tactics to use during the battles.

TL;DR:
Great game, you should play it. While there is the free version on their website, this one adds a few more options and an extra class, and helps support the creator, who is a great guy (he actually listens~)

author: {'steamid': '76561198074152026', 'num_games_owned': 269, 'num_reviews': 52, 'playtime_forever': 577, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 409, 'last_played': 1410092851}
review:
Я не говорю что игра плохая, я лишь опишу впечатления от игры со стороны человека, которому она не понравилась.

И так:
  - графика, она в играх такого плана не главное, но все же. Она наляписта, отдельно элементы нормальны, но в сочетании часто получается каша со всего. Также отдельные уровни скучны сами по себе, скучны и однообразны. Некоторые места наоборот - "вырви глаз". Очень часто врагов заметить сложно. Сталкивался даже на отдельных уровнях с тем, что сложно понять где свой персонаж. Также стоить отметить свои правила "игры", например есть два куба земли или стенки в плотную соприкасающиеся углами, визуально, между ними нет прохода, иногда даже стенка наискось, но оказывается вы можете пройти в этом месте, магия, да и только;

  - интерфейс убог, уже вышло сто игр с плохим или хорошим интерфейсом, неужели разработчикам сложно взять лучшее?

  - в игре монстры не привязаны к определенным местностям, например лисицы будут нападать на вас как в лесу, в подземелье, в параллельном мире, в пещере под водой, итд.. То есть мы блуждаем по миру, а на нас тупо сыпят рандомно монстров, некоторая привязка все же есть кое где, но это не спасает общее впечатление;

  - нет нормальной архитектуры, я имею в ввиду что, например здания это или прямоугольник с дверью или абстрактная площадь окруженная стенами. Это относится всего, построения уровней и лакаций. Я понимаю что игра генерирует уровни, но ни кто не мешал продумать отдельные элементы.

  - очень часто, вернее почти каждый раз (после знакомства) игра превращается в истребление мобов уровень за уровнем ради прокачки.  Квесты которые должны разнообразить игру, даются до подземелья или в нем, и по сути предполагают пройти его до конца, то есть ни чего не меняют. Есть некоторые мелочи, как например провести странника до телепорта, которые немного разбавляют мобо-мясорубку, но их мало и они очень часто повторяются, в последствии тоже приедаются.

  - боевка вроде бы и имеет потенциал, но все сводится к определенным стандартным комбинациям, радуют лишь босы, вокруг которых нужно потанцевать.
 
 Вообщем, для меня игра оказалась затянута, бесцельна и скучна. От того, какое подземелье вы выберете или попадете, ничего не изменится, зачищайте стандартным способом независимо - кислотный лес это или подземелье. Более дальние подземелья - более сложны, более близкие - более просты. Все сводится к погоне за лутом и прокачкой.

review:
One of the Better games of this type on Steam. It's not pretty but you can get other tilesets for it and the Steam Workshop is full of good mod's to tweak the gameplay. Speaking of the gameplay,It's deep! the amount of race's,class,skills,item's etc. (some are un-locked after playing game) are just huge, It has a story! Over all I'm happy that I picked this up, I't has more replay to it than AAA games like Skyrim.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030823089', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 31961, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6000, 'last_played': 1693493922}
review: If you've ever been a fan of a Roguelike game, you know just how addicting the genre can be.  Tales of Maj'Eyal strips away the usual esoteric layer over the traditionally deep turn based combat with easy to access tool tips, combined with rudimentary graphics which are a nice attention grabbing upgrade to the ASCII characters of yore.  There's enough visual fidelity and modernizing to be engaging, but still plenty left up to the imagination.  The game has a large pool of classes and races to choose from, with drastically differing play styles.  My only real complaint about ToME is replaying through the same story isn't as fresh an experience as a traditional, more randomly generated Roguelike.  The upside to that is the strong lore and story make for a more engaging experience the first time through.

author: {'steamid': '76561198142622483', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 935, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 776, 'last_played': 1556568762}
review:
로그라이크 중에서 가장 접근성이 좋은 게임입니다.마법 이펙트등 그래픽이 비교적 좋은편이며, 컨트롤을 눌러 아이템을 비교해볼 수 있습니다
처음 하시는 분들은 모험모드(목숨 대여섯개)로 플레이 하시는 것을 권장하며, 로그라이크 특성상 진입장벽이 있기때문에 공략글은 한번 보시고 시작하시면 시행착오를 줄이실 수 있습니다.

author: {'steamid': '76561198109112656', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 1323, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1279, 'last_played': 1408547935}
review:
Juego solo recomendable para los fans del rogue-like más puro. Existe un modo cheat en el que tienes infinitas vidas, pero para disfrutar de este juego debes aceptar al riesgo de morir cada "x" tiempo de una forma posiblemente fustrante que tenga poco que ver con tu habilidad como jugador y mucho que ver con el desconocimiento de donde están o cuales son los bichos que matan ( el resto es un paseo en las dificultades normales ). Algunos bichos chungos ( o incluso "nameds") tienen las mismas imagen que otros normales y te das cuenta de lo que son pq te ha dado por inspeccionarlos o pq te meten una castaña que te revientan media vida. O te puede pasar que te aparezca el típico rogue que te meta un combo backstab/flurry y pa casa. O que antes de ver al super-mago de turno, te meta una castaña que si no te mata la primera, te mata la segunda ( y no has llegado ni a verlo ). O combates exageradamente difíciles (¿"Weirdling Beast"?) para el nivel en la que los encuentras directamente lo úncio que puedes hacer es escapar ( y puede que ni eso ). Es más, seguramente muchos niveles después tampoco tengas nada que hacer y para cuando el bicho te tenga un poco de respeto y no te mate casi sin querer, te habrás pasado medio juego. 
Por todo eso y mucho más el resultado es un juego en el que solo con una inversión más que considerable de tiempo y esfuerzo podrás llegar hasta lo más alto sin morir. Es un grandísimo y divertidísimo juego para el que esté dispuesto a arriesgarse y pagar el precio, a mi personalmente y para mi modesta opinión, no merece la pena y muchísimo menos habiendo las maravillas que empezaron a salir en los últimos 20 años.

author: {'steamid': '76561198109667529', 'num_games_owned': 242, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 20616, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2656, 'last_played': 1709719190}
review:
极其丰富的游戏内容，引人入胜的剧情，各具特色数量繁多的地下城，多种种族、职业玩法各不相同，同一职业也有不同的路线，随机词缀装备使你的冒险充满惊喜。恶心人的随机精英，挑战你应对不同敌人的能力。无尽地城让游戏更具挑战，竞技场模式可以让你体验迅速变强连续战斗的快感。尽管是rougelike游戏，画面也不差，树木的摇摆，雾气的弥漫，相当精细的贴图，使tome4成为同类游戏中最容易令人接受的游戏之一。相当平易近人的操作，不用花相当多的时间记住复杂的快捷键，很快就能上手。一开始可能会一直死，渐渐熟悉了职业性能后，就能体会到用各种技能战胜强大敌人的喜悦。总之tome4是rougelike游戏精品中的精品。
评分9.5/10,无尽地城后期游戏会变得单调无趣是我唯一不满的地方。

author: {'steamid': '76561198041170480', 'num_games_owned': 2490, 'num_reviews': 1219, 'playtime_forever': 1321, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 272, 'last_played': 1456687567}
review:
Вновь пришло время писать хвалебные оды.
На сей раз игре Tales of Maj'Eyal. Господа, смею Вам доложить, что это самая правильная РПГ с настольными корнями. Здесь все по суровому. Ходы, скиллы, статы, умения, прокачка, горы шмота, орды монстров. Как по мне все просто шикарно.

Плюсы:
+ Графика и сам сеттинг игры почти как в настолке, только кубик не кидаешь.
+ Приятная музыка
+ Много локаций, монстров, шмоток.
+ Система статов и умений практически идеальна.
+ Большое число вариантов прокачки, каждый найдет свое
+ Рандомно генерируемые монстры, которые дают незабываемый экшон

Минусы:
- Графону порадуются настолкофаги, но Дивинити Оригинал Син конечно намного круче.
- Нет русского языка (но не критично, я все понял, а это о многом говорит)

Вывод. Играть в эту игру и покупать ее, особенно со скидкой однозначно стоит. Если бы не было Дивинити Оригинал Син, то назвал бы игру чуть ли не лучшей РПГ последних лет = D 

9/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198018301260', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1139, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 477, 'last_played': 1677376905}
review:
Bought this game on a whim. I normally don't enjoy roguelikes too much, but as this was on sale I decided just to go for it. I'm very glad I did. I've enjoyed the short time I've had with this game a ton. Combat is very simple and fun, although there is a ton of strategy in movement and your abilities. There are a lot of classes and races from the get go, and there are probably just as many that you can unlock. Game is also fairly simple to understand.

It also does many small things well that you don't often see. Wearing different equipment actually changes your characters appearance, item variety is quite impressive, so on and so forth.

If you're scared of the difficulty of a roguelike there are also options to give you more/unlimited lives, as well as difficulty settings, so you can ease yourself in if you wish.

Right now it's a 9/10, will update as I get farther into the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198014558274', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 21838, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 14856, 'last_played': 1572031182}
review:
ToME, in my opinion, is what combat-focused turn-based roguelikes ought to aspire to be since it has all the following (and more!):

-intuitive control scheme and ability to solely control the game with a mouse.
-many, many interesting classes, most of which can play very differently depending on how choose to build them.
-easy inventory management (throw all your potions and scrolls away!)
-great enemy variety, further made interesting by rare enemies that have skills seemingly beyond their scope of ability (that bone giant did just smite you with the power of the sun).
-excellent random loot generation system that makes other RPGs jealous.
-different difficulty and lives settings for players of different experience and skill levels.
-very extensive mod support, with some interesting mods that change up the game already in existence.
-a usually helpful in-game chat.
-fairly frequent and very substantial updates that keep classes interesting.
-basically infinite replayability.

I've beaten this game more than ten times and yet I still keep coming back to it every once in a while and get hooked all over again, every time.

In conclusion, buy ToME, enter a dragon's dream and kill it with your mind rays.

author: {'steamid': '76561198046268041', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 129828, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 81494, 'last_played': 1682640014}

author: {'steamid': '76561198064728961', 'num_games_owned': 1259, 'num_reviews': 131, 'playtime_forever': 17008, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5779, 'last_played': 1687783180}
review:
已通关普通剧情和竞技场。

tome4应该是正统roguelike游戏中最容易上手的了（我能说我elona玩了半天没玩懂么），此游戏冷门的原因无非是画面让人无法直视，因为游戏中数据量特别大又是独立制作，所以图形和动画效果都比较简陋……其实习惯了之后完全可以无视因为可玩性相当高，人物可选的特性非常多而且特点非常鲜明，战斗系统自成一派，相对于单纯的刷刷刷，tome更讲究策略和搭配。随机的任务，地图，怪物以及道具使每次进地牢都是一次全新的冒险，因此侦查也变得十分重要。而且各种奇葩的精英怪可以让我免费体验数次在网游中强化装备到非常高级然后失败装备爆掉的感觉，成功治疗了我的玻璃心（我貌似不是玻璃心但是给了我一种玻璃心碎了的感觉）……总之这是一款制作精良的独立游戏，至于好不好玩得看你愿不愿意花时间钻研它了。

最近准备重开档通高难度，之后再做补充。

author: {'steamid': '76561197989896981', 'num_games_owned': 420, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 12982, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9097, 'last_played': 1652023326}
review: Best roguelike game ever. Has tactical depth, lots of unlocks, a modern interface, and tons of replayability. 10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198015134673', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 125732, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 13255, 'last_played': 1709778207}
review:
I grew up on Nethack, matured into Crawl: Stone Soup, and now obsess over ToME. If you are a fan of classic rogue-likes or if you are new to the genre, ToME is a great experience. There are many layers of complexity in content, lore and character progressing that makes for many hours of play.

Just as a side note: the graphics aren't pretty. Try not to let the graphics detract from the excellent depth of the game. Also, the game is fairly difficult. If you are new to rogue-likes, play in 'exploration' mode until you unlock some of the races and classes and get a better feel for the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198040457997', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 79, 'playtime_forever': 36983, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4759, 'last_played': 1622370379}
review:
ToME is an excellent roguelike lite. As in, you shouldn't really count of ToME in the same group as Nethack, ADoM, or even Crawl. ToME is, first of all, much more focused on combat. There is no hunger, very little inventory management, very few ways (none?) to lose your character outside of actual combat.

(for clarity: bump attack means an automatic attack that happens as your character attempts to enter a space occupied by a hostile character. Yeah, autoattack)

The combat doesn't much remind the bump/cast combat of most roguelikes. It's more like WoW, turn based. And I don't mean this in a bad way. Most turns you have to use skills even as a melee character, as opposed to bump attacking like you probably would in most actual roguelikes. There are a lot of skills, considering the game currently has at least 25 classes, many of which have multiple unique skill lines (each containing 4 skills). 

Now, let's get this out of the way: the game is free, unless you really want to buy it on Steam, or otherwise. The game is also easily worth the Steam price, and much more besides. A single playthrough can be easily over 10 hours, and the game has a lot of replayability. It is fun.

Downsides? Having played this a lot (though not nearly as much as some), I'd say: the normal difficulty is way too easy, with some exceptions. The higher difficulties aren't viable on some classes (the higher you go, the less viable melee is, in general), and getting oneshot becomes increasingly an issue. There are ways to deal with getting oneshot, but they usually involve tedious gameplay. Like, using certain spells to check what's behind every corner, always. I personally *hate* playing like that, so currently I can either play on too easy difficulties, or play on challenging difficulties with random oneshotting mobs. Mind, you can easily get several playthroughs (like, 30h+) worth playtime before encountering this issue.

Erm.. so yeah. Good game, worth getting.

author: {'steamid': '76561198010545488', 'num_games_owned': 3539, 'num_reviews': 95, 'playtime_forever': 3851, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 289, 'last_played': 1676113111}
review: 圣光在上，这是到目前为止最最最最靠谱的ROGUELIKE RPG了，简而言之，这是一个拥有不逊于DND职业系统+暴雪词缀道具的RPG，它不像STEAM上其他ROGUELIKE的RPG一样更多只是瞎胡闹，这货是真心在做系统……另外千万不要被1300个成就吓倒，他只是分了6个难度而已……

author: {'steamid': '76561198016098985', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 51, 'playtime_forever': 31311, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9253, 'last_played': 1699789656}
review:
After playing a few hours of this Game i decided to give my opinion.
This game is a very good roguelike. Im still missing stuff like unidentified items blessed/cursed items or a hunger bar.
But his game is still very komplex every character has its own mechanics and skilltrees. not just the basic stats that are higher or lower depending on the class. So everytime you play another class its actually a new experience.
The Worldmap is somewhat fixed  just a few dungeons are placed randomly but the entire dungeons are randomly generated and can even have different themes for example an icy mountain might be an active volcano in a different playthrough.
This game has a lot of content still coming.
If you enjoy oldshool roguelikes that are hard this Game is definitely for you.
You even have the option to not go roguelike with only one life and go adventuremode instead where you get an extra life every few level up or even exploration mode where you have infinite lives, there are multiple dificultys and you have to unlock a lot of classes through quests and events witch never gets boring for me and keeps the game interesting.
Its not your average roguelike where you ahve to go down to floor 10 or 50 or something and defeat someone it has a much more open world where you can decide witch dungeon you want to go to next or if you want a randomized dungeon via farportal. The open world aspect + the diffenret playstiles of the classes for me means this game has a lot moee replayability than most roguelikes and it has earned its place in my favourite games so far.

author: {'steamid': '76561198062674020', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 28055, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2140, 'last_played': 1580561824}
review: Have you heard the saying, 'you cannot judge a book by its cover'? ToME doesn't look pretty, it's true. Far from it, actually. But if you give it a try, you'll soon realize that it's one of the best rogue-like games you have ever played.

author: {'steamid': '76561198013589593', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 7606, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 715, 'last_played': 1661118936}
review:
Apparently 'Rogue-like' has been corrupted to mean "randomly generate unbeatable unexcapable bosses twice or more the dungeon level, until the player has no more resurrects left".

Some have taken issue with my concept of rogue-like because they played a much harder rogue-like and this is easy when compared to 'that game'.  To that I say, if you must use the No True Scotsman fallacy to defend your game from critique, you've already failed.   

Escape options in this game are largely restricted to teleports; due to the level disparity that prompts a need for an escape, nothing less then escape in a single turn is fast enough. Unfortunately, the teleports are random and unreliable until late game, when they are finally targetable.  

If you like a game where drinking a potion could kill you and there is no way to detect it is posion, you may find this game palatable. 
If you like a game where just the act of entering a dungeon or changing a level may cause your character to slip and break their neck (die), you may find this game palatable.

Conversely, if you believe that no matter how hard a game is, the game should provide you the tools to handle risks like these and only punish you for not using those tools, then you will probably find this game to be 'fake hard'.  It randomly hits you with bosses that eyeroll at your escape attempt, giggle at your damage, ignore your debuff attempts and crush you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006444180', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 26675, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 13888, 'last_played': 1694046595}
review: Without doubt, my favourite Roguelike of all them all. Great mechanics, a nice smooth difficulty curve for learning the game, lovely SDL tiles, and it's open source too. What's not to like?

author: {'steamid': '76561198097421013', 'num_games_owned': 669, 'num_reviews': 83, 'playtime_forever': 5132, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5044, 'last_played': 1469911192}
review:
Кладбище мёртвых героев. Невероятно злобный к игроку, почти канонiчный, расово верный, умный тактический рогалик.

[b]Понравилось[/b]: реиграбельность, большое количество рас/классов/навыков, cерьёзная игровая механика, напоминающая AD&D, огромный бестиарий, все каноны рогалика соблюдены
[b]Не понравилось[/b]: достаточно сложно играть, если не знаешь в каком порядке «пылесосить» подземелья, игра туговато идёт даже на мощных компах, автор прямо в два слоя сыпет на игрока текстом

9 рас с разными плюсами/минусами, 26 классов с уникальной схемой прохождения. Здесь есть абсолютно разнообразные классы начиная с обычных Berserker или Archer, заканчивая весьма экзотичными типа Sun Paladin или Paradox Mage. Некоторые из них будут открыты не сразу. Для этого придётся действовать не совсем логично в некоторых ситуациях. Более 60 коварнейших подземелий, где скучать не придется. Предлагаются варианты выполнения квестов, что влияет на дальнейший геймплей. В игре есть намёк на сюжет: магия табу, приходиться выбирать на сторону магии или анти-магии встать. Это всё второстепенно. В рогалике важен геймплей и он здесь отличнейший.

В общем, ToME это такой серьёзный рогалик, тот в который приятно играть, тот который отнимет у тебя сотню часов, если ты в нём разберёшься.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970640688', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 857, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 842, 'last_played': 1585493044}
review: This is a really fun open-world roguelike game with a lot of depth and replayability. Highly recommended to roguelike enthusiasts. My only criticism is that, due to its open world nature, you can tackle areas in a severely non-optimal order (ie, get yourself mercilessly killed before you're ready). See the online guide for recommended area progression, tips/tricks, etc.

author: {'steamid': '76561197961315757', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 11658, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1810, 'last_played': 1709436399}
review: game is amazing and only costs 7 bucks how could you wrong?  throw in the addition of the online chat and you wont feel alone when youre playing plus you can ask the community questions and the devs are even frequently on.  great game and worth every penny.  they could easily get away with charging double for this

author: {'steamid': '76561198001353597', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 34442, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 2030, 'playtime_at_review': 8832, 'last_played': 1712269843}
review:
This has become my favourite roguelike. Deep tactical combat built around activated talents and cooldowns makes this completely different from the traditional "walk towards things until they die" formula. It feels like a turn based action rpg rather than Nethack.

ToME has several gamemodes. Story mode has lots and lots of written original lore but it may get repetitive after several runs. You will die and have to start over many times and it is fuck hard unless you know what you're doing. And that experience comes from dying enough times to learn how not to. Playing story mode is required to unlock other gamemodes and more than the few initial character classes and races.

In Arena you fight a set number of waves of increasingly difficult enemies, and if you win, your player character becomes the new final boss of the arena. It is not balanced for all character classes, some are significantly weaker because there's rarely time to rest your cooldowns, and most of the time there are lots of enemies on the screen.

Infinite Dungeon is just what it says. The challenge in it comes from the randomness. It is somewhat level scaled, but whereas in story mode you know what kind of monsters and bosses are in each area, here you can't really prepare for anything. It is the old school roguelike experience but the modern game mechanics still make it quite original.

Conclusion: Thinking man's roguelike with unique gameplay and diverse content. Tons of mods available. It is also completely free at http://te4.org/ but buying it on Steam gets you some donator benefits.

author: {'steamid': '76561198119459504', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 2503, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 794, 'last_played': 1684486739}
review:
TOME4真的是一款非常值得一玩的游戏。
作为一款rogue-like类游戏，TOME4完美的诠释了游戏性至上的这一理念，它拥有几乎不会让人感到疲倦的地图，无数各式各样的装备，不时就能遇上的各种特别事件以及丰富的隐藏要素。在我几十轮游戏中，从最开始的被虐的很惨，然后到现在的渐入佳境，这款游戏带给我的游戏体验是非常愉快的。
也许有玩家对于游戏的图像并不感冒，但是我想说的是，对于如此恐怖的游戏性，一点点图像上的缺憾是可以接受的。
9.5/10这个分数此游戏受之无愧。

author: {'steamid': '76561198029584890', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1220, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 977, 'last_played': 1405975434}
review:
Grałem w TOME jakiś czas temu i ostatnio widząc, że jest dostępna na Steamie postanowiłem odświeżyć sobie tę pozycję.
Poziom skomplikowania tradycyjnych rouge-like'ów był dla mnie zawsze czymś co mimo wielokrotnych prób mnie od nich odpychało, dlatego nie podejmę się porównania tej gry z jakimiś Nethackami czy ADOMami.
Tym co widoczne jest na pierwszy i drugi rzut oka to duża ilość klas do wyboru, oraz duża dowolność przy wyborze kierunku w jakim ma się rozwijać postać. Każdy wybór musi odzwierciedlać się w stylu gry, co sprawia, że każdy znajdzie tu coś dla siebie.

Przejrzysty interfejs sprawia, że to co było dla mnie koszmarem w wypadku trve kvlt rouge-like'ów okazuje się być czymś prostym i zrozumiałym.

Na koniec uwaga, że jest to gra dla masochistów, czyli tych, którzy nie mają nic przeciwko, aby przez głupi błąd, nieszczęśliwy zbieg okoliczonści(często te dwie kategorie przez wiele osób są mylone) stracić to co wypracowało się przez ostatnich kilka godzin(żeby być uczciwym moje eskapady kończą się dużo wcześniej ;))

Grę można za darmo ściągnąć ze strony autora i spróbować czy jest warta wszystkich tych zachwytów. Jeśli Twoim zdaniem jest to kupuj koniecznie i nie zapomnij o dobrowolnej dotacji dla autora, gdyż cena na Steamie jest tak niska, że woła o pomstę do nieba ;)

author: {'steamid': '76561198026329218', 'num_games_owned': 1183, 'num_reviews': 58, 'playtime_forever': 5347, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3475, 'last_played': 1584665771}
review:
This is an awesome dungeon crawl type game. You can play it as a regular RPG, you can play it as a limited Rogue type RPG, or you can play it as a true Rogue type RPG and die a thousand deaths!

A large and friendly community with active development. A must have for any RPG and or Rogue fan.  I can't help but play it over and over again, considering the dungeons are never quite the same twice. 5 out of 5 Stars!

author: {'steamid': '76561197971365728', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 14565, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5911, 'last_played': 1595828434}
review:
My favourite roguelike so far on Steam.

good:

Action and abilities are fun, good gameplay variation w/ unlocks and classes.  Plot is nice as are the quests and special dungeons.  Enemy variation is a plus.

less good:

UI is a little rough (particularly around the inventory) and it's a bit easy to get jacked by ranged enemies.  More randomization around the world and dungeons/dungeon assortment would go a long way on replays.  I wish item quality and progression power curve was a little more angbandy, it's a little flat.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041834544', 'num_games_owned': 342, 'num_reviews': 66, 'playtime_forever': 13472, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 326, 'last_played': 1410920840}
review:
I may not have many hours logged, but I've been playing the demo for quite some time now. Finally decided it was time to show my thanks.

+ Amazing UI for a roguelike.
+ Extreme diversity of everything, from encounters to items to skills.
+ You get a lot of control over exactly what you do.
+ Many possible playstyles and strategies.
+ Good graphics and SFX for a roguelike. It even has music.
+ Difficulty feels very balanced.
+ Near-infinite replayability.
+ Actually has a plot with a generous amount of lore.
+ There's a demo version available on the official website that has very few restrictions in case you want to make a more informed decision.
+ Steam Workshop.

- Extreme number of options for skills can be overwhelming.
- Sometimes difficult to figure out where to go next.

97 / 100

author: {'steamid': '76561198097918699', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 19221, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4406, 'last_played': 1663399315}
review:
Buy this game. If you are down here reading reviews, it's because you're not 100% sure about getting the game, and figured it would help to see what other people think about it. Let me help you out, friend: Buy this game. 

I had my doubts too, at first. It's hard to tell what the game is like from the trailer, and the graphics ain't Skyrim. It's ok. Just buy the game, and you will be happier then you were in that soon forgotten time where you didn't have the game. 

You want reasons? Ok, I have plenty of those. First off, this is one of the greatest Rouge style RPGs you will ever play. Easy to jump into, but will take many hours till you even begin to figure it all out enough to survive to level 20+. Multiple races and classes, and each class feels different, with multiple ways to develop. No potions to hoard, and death is always around the corner. Hotbar of actions like an MMO, including activated item abilities. Great sense of humor, and frequently updated. All done by one programmer, DarkGod, who randomly pops into the game to turn you into a rabbit. In this game you can eat the heart of a Sandworm, read monster poetry, and get killed by your future self. 

Rouge mode is true Rouge, one death is all you get. Adventure mode gives you a few lives, and more as you level. The 3rd mode lets you keep coming back, but you don't want that mode. That mode is for squares. Try adventure mode, and try not to die before you make it to the Master. 

Seriously, this game is incredible. It is digital crack, and should be sold with a warning label. It's the top down rougelike MMOishRPG you didn't know you were missing. Great replayability, great depth, great community. Check out the forum for help on builds, or figuring out what all the stats/elements/statuses do. The Dev has been known to implement ideas right from the forums into the game. And if you are reading this during the big Steam Summer Sale, this game is selling for under $4. Did I mention that Z is the shortcut for auto-explore? Yep, it will even explore the board for you. ToME is one of those games that you will bond with random strangers over. It's a "Oh crap, is it 4am already?" game. It's a game you need in your library. Do it. Throw down a lil fliff and buy ToME.

author: {'steamid': '76561197984646145', 'num_games_owned': 458, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 903, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 248, 'last_played': 1647896933}
review: Pick a race and a class. It doesn't matter which one: you're going to die and you can start over with a different one. Keep dying until you find a class you like. It's fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044660600', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 8044, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3598, 'last_played': 1626393940}
review: Variety is the spice of life. Customizable talents, classes, and races are there. Random loot, bosses, mini-bosses, random events, random dungeon generation are all there and being improved and added to by the creator. The option to control the difficulty based on your preference allows for the reward of collecting its substancial amount of achievements and challenge yourself to your ability.

author: {'steamid': '76561197988503619', 'num_games_owned': 471, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 12817, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9135, 'last_played': 1579974420}
review:
This game is incredible, disgustingly difficult and even at the best of times nothing short of frustrating but somehow I always find myself coming back for more. If you're a fan of rogue-like games and putting your life in the hands of a fine balance of RNG and clever thinking then you'll love this.

Patience is key to being successful in Maj'Eyal, unfortunately for me that isn't my forte but I'll be damned if I don't keep striving for victory, and in there lies the reason to play this game. You acquire a valuable life skill or die trying, it's more than a game, it's a lesson!

author: {'steamid': '76561198138517624', 'num_games_owned': 187, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 2109, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1457, 'last_played': 1634918153}

author: {'steamid': '76561197967852974', 'num_games_owned': 813, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 397361, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 42286, 'last_played': 1709460221}

author: {'steamid': '76561198049643061', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 5190, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1939, 'last_played': 1556062864}
review: Yes

author: {'steamid': '76561197962243247', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 3579, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3190, 'last_played': 1576384916}
review:
I would call this a modern take on the traditional roguelike.
It features more accessible gameplay mechanics that would not alienate the modern gamer.
It still has an unbelievable amount of unlockables and a daunting difficulty curve that will ensure you get what you paid for.

author: {'steamid': '76561197961095301', 'num_games_owned': 472, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 718, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 364, 'last_played': 1685420011}
review: Traditional roguelike meets modern gaming sensibilities. Perma-death, randomized dungeons and plenty of fully-realized, unique classes to play. At the same time, it does away with painful inventory management, randomized scrolls and potions and the other painfully vestigal bits from the classics.

author: {'steamid': '76561198033462374', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 4062, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4037, 'last_played': 1440214557}
review: Though the game takes a while to really get good, after your first couple of losses you'll have unlocked enough classes and learned how the game works enough to really have some fun. Though the game can be a bit overwhelming to someone new to the genre, it is a worthwhile game to anyone familiar with it. Also the Steam workshop has tons of fun add-ons that really add to the experience. It is an excellent game for it's price.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994545860', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 32205, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3634, 'last_played': 1676311644}
review:
A highly enjoyable, very innovative game for fans of the roguelike genre.
Having played a lot of Dungeon Crawl, ADOM, and Incursion, as well as newer representatives such as SotS:The Pit, I consider Tome to one of the, if not the, most refined and creative games of its type.
The classes are VERY different, the world is highly immersive, the game is challenging, yet with Adventure mode (several lives) or even Exploration mode (no permadeath), it offers a lot of options for players new to the roguelike genre.

author: {'steamid': '76561198001878976', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 402, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 112, 'last_played': 1604075123}
review: This game is weird, but very addictively enjoyable. Don't let the crappy graphics fool you. This is quite a little gem

author: {'steamid': '76561197995112178', 'num_games_owned': 365, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 28300, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 12, 'last_played': 1686348379}
review:
When this game hits v. 1.3.0, I'm getting banned from an item because I did hilarious shenanigans with it.

It has an on-hit proc to destroy projectiles and zap nearby guys for some lightning damage. Only that in doing so, it causes a LUA scripting error. And when that happens, certain steps in a turn get skipped. Like putting skills on cooldown.

Naturally, I exploited this and told the developer that coded it, "Hey, I'm doing completely stupid shit with your weapon."

When 1.3.0 hits, if I equip it, it'll try to murder me dead. This weapon is Shantiz the Stormblade, and it's a dagger. 44 Dex to equip, gives +20 Dex.

Also you can be a murdertrain, infect guys with turboebola, and CHOKESLAM DRAGONS.

author: {'steamid': '76561198003435423', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 113, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 107, 'last_played': 1617773956}
review:
You could spend time playing this game, but ultimately unless you're looking for a rogue-like and have run out of games to play this isn't going to do anything for you. The games controls aren't intuitive, the available options for upgrading give you no reasonable way to determine a proper path without spending an hour reading, the graphics are poorly done, and the game itself is fairly boring. 

Playing as a bulwark and starting off with an ability that just refilled my health continuously to the point where I could be surrounded by monsters on the hardest difficulty setting available wasn't a good sign, even in the beginning. This game may have a lot of depth to it, but it is hidden under a lot of layers of mud.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998874511', 'num_games_owned': 452, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 538, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 429, 'last_played': 1402354050}
review: Neat roguelike with lots of unlockable classes and races. Terrible graphics, but cool indie game worth 5 bones or clams or whatever you call them.

review:
I love rogue like games. This one is very customizable. Lots of options and works on your nerves. It just keeps me coming back for more. The fact that it is now available on Linux makes it even better. 

Once you have linked your Steam account to your TOME account, you can transfer your save games between platforms and devices. Love this feature.

author: {'steamid': '76561198098039140', 'num_games_owned': 1383, 'num_reviews': 123, 'playtime_forever': 52630, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 18782, 'last_played': 1708251551}
review:
静下心来去沉迷——TOME4 
最早接触Roguelike类游戏是一款小巧的手机游戏，中文名译作《独入危牢》。只有魔法师、弓箭手、战士三个传统RPG职业，游戏很简单，就是深入随 机的地下城去冒险，地牢一共十层，打到最底层杀掉boss就算通关，而你的人物只有一条命，一旦死亡，就要重新建立新人物冒险。
这种以前从没见过的游戏类型让我在最初的时候很不适应，因为在地下城中有太多不可预见性的事情发生，人物经常“莫名其妙”的死亡，有时打到一两件趁手的好装备，却因为一个不小心死掉了，那种感觉简直要疯，因为你又要重新再来了！
在一遍又一遍的挂掉，重建，挂掉，重建的过程当中，终于有一次，我的法师打到了最后一层，并且成功的KO掉了boss（法师到哪儿都是亲儿子 啊......），然而通关后的失落感让人有点不知所措，这是我第一次通关游戏之后失落大于喜悦的，我发现，原来真的有些游戏是让你热衷于探索的过程而不是一个结果。
当在网上寻找类似游戏的时候，我才知道原来我玩的这种游戏叫做roguelike类游戏，最明显的特点就是“随即地下城+一条命”。之后接触了比较好接受 的TOME，在最初的时候，基本上都是选择的冒险模式进行的剧情模式，也就是在“有限命”下的游戏模式，因为一命通关对于我这个还不算是骨灰级玩家的人来 说，太难接受了，因为tome不比独入危牢，游戏时间长，我实在是不想让我连续几天甚至几个星期几个月打出来的人物一命呜呼，而探索模式（无限命）又让游戏索然无味，因为你完全不用惧怕死亡带来的威胁。
尽管如此，在有限条命下我的人物还是会经常被KO，我又不想去用那个禁止自动存档的补丁，又不敢去玩永久死亡模式，这种心态就是韩寒《三重门》里说的那种“做人要么大俗，要么大雅，不俗不雅是最痛苦的”吧。
在经历了数个人物的失败之后，我开始渐渐有些浮躁了，甚至用“死亡时2秒内用任务管理器强关游戏”的办法躲过一次次的死亡。尽管人物会苟延残喘一阵，但是却让我总觉得有点缺少什么东西。
激活无尽地下城模式后，偶然间的一次，我用永久死亡模式建了一个矮人狂战士进行了一次游戏，仅仅是那一次游戏，尽管6级的时候在第4层就“扑街"了，尽管 我几乎没打到几件像样的装备，尽管最后死的时候毫无还手之力，我仍然感觉到一种东西流进了身体里，那是一种状态？一种精神？我说不清楚，我只知道，我一下 子便静下心来沉迷到了游戏当中——原来这才是Roguelike类游戏的真谛——在地下城中小心翼翼的前进，一个简简单单的疏忽就能让你陷入无底深渊，成 为下一个冒险者看都不看一眼的路旁白骨；珍惜每一只怪的经验，一定要把那一层的全部地图走完再下楼；一遍又一遍的调整你的属性分配和技能分配，每一次人物 的死亡都是下一个人物的宝贵经验；装备的优劣对于游戏的影响只能排在”玩家水平“和“角色技能培养”之后，再好的装备贸然前进，一个震慑一个“在黑暗中迷失”一样完蛋。在Vault的诱惑当前，是相信自己的水平还是理智的先去下一层呢？这一切的一切都让人无法自拔，当我用5级的人物风筝掉一个21级精英吸血鬼的时候，那种巨大的成就感让人几乎热血沸腾。
在当前单机游戏低迷，网游页游大张旗鼓吸金的时代，一个能让人“静下心来”却又“沉迷”的游戏凤毛麟角，因为在这里，你的虚荣心会被一条龙的吐息瞬间浇灭，你没法花RMB获得任何属性加成或优势，更没有任何值得炫耀的东西，因为只要你玩下去，总会被某一层某只怪杀掉。在这儿，你能做的就只有一件事，那就是活在当下，举起火把，在阴暗危险的地下城中，永无止境的前进。

author: {'steamid': '76561197965126844', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 32141, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10, 'last_played': 1683244031}
review:
(I have just under a hundred hours logged into this game from before it got onto steam.)

It is an interesting roguelike that plays a little differently from others of its' genre.. If you want an idea of what makes it different;

No identification. All items are identified immediately upon picking them up. This wasn't the case in earlier versions of the game, but the large and increasing number of fixed artifacts and no need for identification scrolls made it somewhat pointless.

Potions and scrolls are replaced by infusions and runes, which give on-demand abilities that consume no permanent resources -with a limited number of slots for these abilities. Regeneration infusions are the primary method of healing, replacing healing potions, and runes of teleportation replace scrolls of teleportation as an escape from trouble. Nothing is lost in their use, but they have cooldowns.

A system for "extra lives". Before you crucify the game, extra lives is either a startup option akin to lowering the difficulty("roguelike" mode for one life, "Adventure" for three, "Exploration" for unlimited) or through very rare artifacts or abilities in-game. Also, it doesn't save you if you decided to hug an Elven Corruptor and he blows you up the first turn you revive.

Disable-heavy combat. Simply, being resilient to damage through armor or magical resistance is not as important as being difficult to disable. Stuns and confusion are the leading killers, not high burst damage. This makes it very easy to get chain-disabled and killed if you haven't prepared properly with high saving throws or effect clears(certain runes and infusions will remove a detrimental effect from you on use). 

All of these things combined could make it seem like a somewhat casual roguelike, but in practice it isn't really any easier than similar contemporary roguelikes. The only element that is truly missing is resource management. You still must assess risks, prepare for and pick your battles carefully, and adapt to what the RNG has provided you. The cooldowns-based combat and lack of resource management should be considered an interesting spin, not an intentional dumbing down.

author: {'steamid': '76561198056968967', 'num_games_owned': 513, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 15211, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2233, 'last_played': 1689341068}
review:
Покупая эту игру на "сдачу" с другой игры, я, честно говоря, не ожидал многого.
Через некоторое время, я втянулся в процесс, начал понимать все эти кнопочки и буковки, сотни галлонов информации, льющейся игроку отовсюду.
Потом началось открытие разных классов и рас - я просто упал в колодец, из которого выбраться уже невозможно.
Друзья, покупайте эту игру - в колодце достаточно одиноко :(

author: {'steamid': '76561198013217828', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 2278, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2204, 'last_played': 1677002902}
review:
[i]I'm standing in the Sandworm Lair. The creatures for which this godforsaken hellhole is named are trundling by, providing the only means of passage through the thick, treacherous sand. The worms are not the immediate issue at the moment, though; this cave seems stable enough. My consternation is with the three stone piedestals that stand ominously silent before me. The game is asking me if I want to inspect one of them. I know doing so might be very beneficial in one way or the other, but these random encounters can also be vehemently unforgiving, and I'd like for Arain to make it through his present quest before he keels over.[/i]
[i]My mouse pointer moves towards [/i]"Yes" [i]and then flinches back. What to do?[/i]

Tales of Maj'Eyal is very much the roguelike I'd been waiting for. In a time when every game designer seems obsessed with pushing as many types of gameplay into a game as possible, the creators of ToME instead focus on doing this one type of gameplay really well. As a result, the game combines all the aspects that attracted me to roguelikes in the first place, putting just enough character and originality into the mix to keep it interesting without ruining the experience. If you're anything like me, you will love this.


[b]PROS[/b]
  -- Hours upon hours of varied roguelike gameplay.
  -- Heaps of interesting loot.
  -- An addictingly great mix of casual and involved.
  -- Lots of quirky charm.

[b]CONS[/b]
	-- The random nature of the game will occasionally put you in situations where you really have no chance of survival.
	-- The stat system is in some ways a bit too complex for most.
	-- Pretty it ain't.
	-- The interface and the controls are still a bit glitchy at times, although they have yet to cause me serious trouble.
	

[b]Note:[/b] This game is actually free and open source. By buying it on Steam, you donate to its development -- and you should. You [i]really[/i] should. Just because you can come by something free does not mean you shouldn't support the people who created it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043878646', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 14059, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3377, 'last_played': 1698129648}
review: An Excellent game for people that want an intro to rougelikes. It is pleasing to the eye (by rougelike standards anyway) and is very easy to learn how to play and has muliple difficulty settings but the game is deep and challenging enough to keep you occupied for dozens and dozens of hours . Its alot of fun to figure out things like the correct dungeon order for certain classes or unlocking new races/classes by exploring more and more of the game each playthrough. The game is free online if you really don't wanna fork over the five bucks here but you do get the donator's perks for buying the steam version that include things like a special class, an exploration mode and custom tiles, nothing essential to the game at all but hey, it's there.

author: {'steamid': '76561198014210785', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 8515, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7310, 'last_played': 1546861386}
review:
I have been searching for an old school brutal RPG for so long that I had almost given up, until now.  Everthing about this game speaks of patience, time and careful  development.   The developer/s have clearly played a vast array of games themselves and have created a game that will speak to the sophisticated RPG'er who isn't solely drawn to graphical thrills. The depth of character development and it's importance to your longevity in the game world is something I cannot stress you enough to take your time with.

This turn based RPG is unforgiving and it's game types and difficulties are designed to help you learn to survive.  There is no "Loading a save game"  when you're about to be 2 hit by a unique boss twice your lvl who has just seen you, warped behind you cackling with glee at it's next meal.  Brutal, ingenious and rewarding, this game will challenge you to develop strategies just get out alive more often than being concerned about killing your foe.

You only have so many lives Adventurer.

98 / 100

author: {'steamid': '76561197972483399', 'num_games_owned': 1027, 'num_reviews': 144, 'playtime_forever': 45699, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5044, 'last_played': 1609376915}
review: For those of us who can play a game without needing to be wowed by fancy graphics -- but instead be enamoured by the depth, challenge and gameplay of a rogue-like, this is for you. I LOVE this game. So many different race and class combinations and then you realize there are heaven knows how many builds for the character combos you like the most. Fun loot, detailed story (that you can just as well skip if you just want to hack and slash), and every time you play you can unlock a new game mode or race or class to make things more interesting. This brings me back to my C64 days -- where your game HAD to be good by virtue of substance because it was not technically possible to deliver elegant style. You can play for ten minutes or hours on end -- it's a great palette cleanser for other games as well!

author: {'steamid': '76561198039884114', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 33903, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3123, 'last_played': 1671189388}
review:
Si te gustan los juegos con toques roguelike una de dos, o ya tienes este juego, o te estás perdiendo un juegazo. Y lo mejor de todo, es que la propia desarrolladora ofrece una versión totalmete gratuita para que puedas incluso jugarlo sin dejarte un sólo duro. 

A. Variedad de razas y clases que ir desbloqueando para experimentar distintos modos de juego.

B. Combinación excelente de elementos generados al azar ( enemigos normales/élites/jefes/loot/eventos), con elementos permanentes (mapa del mundo/jefazos de mazmorra/misiones principales)

C. Si te gusta juguetear con las opciones de "dificultad", aquí tienes desde un modo de vidas infinitas a un modo HC en el que te lo juegas a todo o nada, y elige desde una dificultad "amigable", hasta un infierno en vida.

D. Su motor gráfico está claro que no es el de un triple A, ni falta que le hace, porque destila más personalidad que muchos "inserteaquíunnombremolón engine 2.0".

E. Si te gusta cazar logros, este no es tu juego, porque probablemente sea uno de los títulos de steam con más logros a conseguir, puede que necesites dos vidas para conseguirlos todos.

F. No sigas leyendo, vete a probarlo/comprarlo ya, y cómete el continente de Eyal y todo lo que contiene.

 Ahora bien,si por mi fuese, eliminaría la opción gratuita de la faz de la tierra, porque este juego merece todos y cada uno de los euros que pide.

P.D: Si vas a ver un vídeo de su gameplay, intenta mirar uno en el que expliquen lo que están haciendo, porque puede que al principio no te enteres de lo que está pasando en pantalla, pero una vez que le cojas el truco y te "enganche", ya no habrá vuelta atrás.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045280023', 'num_games_owned': 613, 'num_reviews': 93, 'playtime_forever': 3056, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 858, 'last_played': 1447926549}
review:
리얼 턴제? 라고 해야하나요. 뭐 내가 한턴 반응할때 적도 한턴씩 움직이는 방식으로 진행합니다. 스킬이나 직업등등 여러가지로 다양하구요. 아직 초짜라서 자세한 디테일은 설명 못하지만, 한턴 한턴 긴장하게 됩니다.
현재 아쉽게도 한글패치는 더이상 진행이 안되고 있는듯 싶습니다. 그래서 1.15버전까지만 한패가 적용되는데 지금1.22가 나온 상태라 적용자체가 안되더군요. 영어가 많이 딸리다보니 겨우겨우 커뮤니티 팁글 같은걸 보면서 하긴 하는데 어렵습니다.
일단 이건 제 개인적인 문제고 게임자체는 매우 잼있고 영어만 좀되신다면 육성하는 맛이 쏠쏠 할거라 장담하네요. 눈에 보이는 액션을 제외하고 단순히 육성으로 친다면 디아3는.. 글쌔요... 이게임을 반이나 따라올수 있을려나 ㅎㅎ;; 뭐 너무 비하 한걸지도 모르지만 그리느낄정도로 직업 및 셋팅 자체가 다양하다 할수 있네요. 암튼 로그라이크에 거부감 없고 보이는 액션을 매우 중시하지만 않는다면~ 충분히 만족 할거라 장담하네요. ㅎㅎ

author: {'steamid': '76561198073648775', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 138, 'playtime_forever': 1997, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1868, 'last_played': 1414489595}
review:
My first impressions of Tales of Maj'Eyal...

First, I think it is important to point out that although Tales of Maj'Eyal is featured as a roguelike game with perma-death, it can also be played with limited lives as well as unlimited lives. So, even if you do die you can still advance through the entire game with all of your hard earned stats and gear! That's really like 3 versions of the game!  So far, it seems like a very solid and polished game. It's obvious that a lot of love went into the making of this game and it shows through the professionalism of the product. Everything is explained in great detail through text boxes.

It should also be noted that not all of the character races and classes are unlocked at the beginning of the game, and must be unlocked through playing the game. There are sub races and classes branching off of the main choices also.

When you die in Exploration mode, you can teleport back to the battle before you died, but must fight that same battle from the beginning again, or teleport a little further back out of harms way.  You also get the choice to retire your character roguelike style, so be extra careful when making one of these choices after dying!  That is the only penalty for death that I have seen so far, but this is only based on my experience playing on Easier difficulty and Exploration mode (unlimited lives).



Pros:
+3 game modes; Roguelike (perma-death), Adventure (limited lives) & Exploration (unlimited lives).
+5 difficulty settings.  Easier, Normal, Nightmare & 2 more locked settings.
+Generous level cap of 50.
+Extensive character customization with skill trees and infusions.
+No consumables.  You don't have to worry about food or water.
+Ammo is unlimited, but you will have to reload your quiver once in a while.
+Fast movement and strategic turn-based gameplay.
+Save feature. You can have multiple saves for multiple characters!
+Many towns, dungeons and creepy places to explore, and conquer!
+Can use both keyboard & mouse.
+Streamlined to play on many computer systems and configurations.
+Many races & character classes with sub races and classes to choose from.
+Randomly generated tactical battles and dungeons/maps. Both good & bad!
+Easy modding support with Steam Workshop integration.
+User friendly GUI with great explanations of everything!
+Great little tutorial provided.
+Cool sound track and sound FX.
+Smart AI.  Both character and monster AI.  Monsters will hunt you down!
+Options, options and more options!  The game is completely customizable!

Cons:
-Death comes too easy due to free roam exploration and randomly generated tactical battles & dungeons/maps.  You can encounter areas without warning, where you will die instantly.  Beware of dungeons you cannot exit because you activated a battle with monsters 30+ levels above yours!
-Randomly generated tactical battles and dungeons/maps. As I said, both good & bad!
-The game gets a little boring after a while.
-Once you beat Arena mode, your character is useless.
-You cannot play the regular game with Arena characters.
-The price is a little high for an indy game.  I usually get these kinds of games for $1 on my iPad.



You can use keyboard, mouse or a combo of the both. There are many key commands which most can be accessed with the mouse too. The keyboard commands are logical choices and easy to learn, but can be remapped to your liking. You'll be using the mouse most of the time though. I have not seen any In App Purchase (IAP) selections or buttons, so I assume most of the content so far is in the game.

Tales of Maj'Eyal seems like a nice little game that is very stable and polished with love for the genre. It's old school fun with a twist of 21st century ideas. Being able to set up the game with limited and unlimited lives was a very nice touch and gives the game some options to appeal to many other gamers! You even get your own set of achievements and recognition for playing with limited and unlimited lives! I'm happy with my purchase! :D Happy dungeon crawling! :)

My system specs are:
iMac, i5 Quad-Core 3.1GHZ, AMD Radeon 6970M 1GB Video RAM, 4GB System RAM, running OS X version 10.6.8.

I rate this game 4 stars out of 5.

author: {'steamid': '76561198022866997', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 213, 'playtime_forever': 979, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 439, 'last_played': 1480798546}
review: Quite a fun little title so far - does good things with the roguelike genre without sacrificing depth, difficulty, or fun.  Looking forward to digging into it more, as there is a ton of options that adds to the replayability...

author: {'steamid': '76561198043095383', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 339, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 339, 'last_played': 1402008687}
review:
Il y a des jeux pour tous les publics, mais celui la doit s'adresser à une minorité dont je ne fais pas partie. Difficile de recommander le jeu donc, qui s'apparentera plus à un enchaînement de frustrations qu'à du plaisir pour 98% des joueurs. Les 2% restant y trouveront très probablement leur compte, mais être lâché dans une telle jungle qui ne pardonne absolument rien est tout sauf un plaisir pour moi.

Si vous n'aimez pas mourir toutes les 10 minutes, ou tomber sur des ennemis 10 fois plus fort que vous alors que vous en combattiez de votre niveau, oubliez tout de suite l'idée de jouer à Tales of Maj'Eyal, c'est très exactement ce que le jeu propose. Bien que l'exploration et l'évolution du personnage soient prenants (compétences, équipement, donjons...), et que visuellement le jeu ait du charme, il m'est impossible d'y accrocher et d'avoir envie d'y jouer, malgré de multiples tentatives. Même le mode exploration, qui autorise la mort à souhait, en devient lassant, ou plutôt, frustrant. J'en attendais beaucoup, mais je devais être bien mal informé. Je ne remets pas en cause les qualités du jeu, mais bien son fonctionnement qui rebutera la majeure partie des joueurs non avertis. Au travers de cette recommandation, je ne dis pas que le jeu est mauvais, mais que je ne le recommanderai pas, où tout du moins, qu'à un public très très averti.

author: {'steamid': '76561198052851996', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 2335, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 53, 'last_played': 1637890296}
review: I got Tales of Maj'Eyal on sale when I noticed Dungeons of Dredmor wouldn't work on my more portable computer past a certain floor, but I was pleasantly surprised by how much I've enjoyed this little game, there's really a wide selection of power sources in this game, from your typical mages and druids to manipulation of space and time. It took me a little while to get into It but I've really liked this one

author: {'steamid': '76561198009932856', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 16896, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6871, 'last_played': 1673096001}
review:
I bought this along with a few other games. When I did I figured this one was the weakest of the bunch. I was certainly mistaken. This is the game I easily have gotten the most play time out of. I have played quite a number of roguelikes. I even have my own roguelike category tab. This is far and away the best of them. It's not as flashy as something like rogue legacy but, It has incredible depth. When you load up a roguelike if your looking to challenge yourself and find your own way through the game; This is the best there is.

Pros:
. Incredibly in-depth character building
. Tons of classes 
. A huge world uncommon in roguelike games
. Large backstory
. Tons of skills and unique ways to get new skills
. Good in-game community

Cons:
. Near non-existant tutorial
. Some hidden mechanics
. Small imbalances

This game is a learn as you play type of deal. It has in-game chat to help you find your way though. If you see me in the game say hello.

author: {'steamid': '76561198049109315', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 6698, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4513, 'last_played': 1686649591}
review: Amazing game, difficult for beginners to the genre and of course! So damn hard to finish. The possiblities of races and the diversity of classes mean you can try a new build whenever you get bored. Dungeons scale too a point, there are optional ones and even random occurences which in my experience are mainly more dungeons hehe.

author: {'steamid': '76561197967147187', 'num_games_owned': 136, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 61870, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3904, 'last_played': 1704165062}
review: Like Dungeon Crawl Stone Soup, except summoners are OP and you can actually win it. Oh, and instadeaths around every corner. And TL;DR lore. And about 95% of the enemies are popcorn. Doesn't stop me from being addicted to it though!

author: {'steamid': '76561198002339199', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 105, 'playtime_forever': 3193, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 337, 'last_played': 1631463712}
review:
Sehr gutes Roguelike,gefällt mir und kommt sehr nahe an das wirkliche Rogue,und die diversen Ableger heran.
Habe es auf gut Glück gekauft,da mir die anderen Roguelikes die man so auf Steam sieht nicht zusagen,wollte etwas das mehr an das Original heranreicht,nur in schönerem Look (Ascii ist absolut nichts für mich)

Das schöne an Tome ist dass es im Gegensatz zu anderen seines Genres nicht auf ein paar Klassen beschränkt ist,man kann aus einer vielzahl an Rassen und Klassen wählen,je nach wahl startet man auch anderst,als Zwerg zb tief unter der Erde und kämpft sich zu beginn seinen Weg gegen Orks frei.
Zudem beinhaltet es noch ein durchdachtes Skillsystem das sehr unterschiedlich von Klasse zu Klasse ist,viel Raum zum rumspielen.

Wem Roguelike zu hart ist,der kann auch auf abgemilderte Schwierigkeitsgrade ohne Permadeath zurückgreifen.
Levels sind natürlich immer Zufallsgeneriert,wie auch die Gegner die einem über den Weg laufen.
Unvorsichtiges Handeln wird schnell Bestraft (Könnte einen ganzen Charfriedhof anlegen)

Mit über 1300 Steamerfolgen haben natürlich auch die Archievement Jäger was davon.

Aufjedenfall ein Spiel von dem man lange etwas hat,Musik und Sounds sind stimmig.
Hut ab dass da nur ein Mann hinter diesem Spiel sitzt.

Tome gibts übrigens auch kostenlos,der Vorteil der Steam Variante sind ,,nur'' Musik und Charskins.
http://te4.org/news

author: {'steamid': '76561198091587266', 'num_games_owned': 209, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 376, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5, 'last_played': 1550169874}
