author: {'steamid': '76561198040085056', 'num_games_owned': 625, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 5246, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1818, 'last_played': 1578765911}
review: Sehr gutes Roguelike Game, jede menge Unlockables: Klassen, Rassen unterklassen, Game Modes. Grafisch kein Highlight, aber besser als viele andere indie Games. Schwierigkeitzsgrad sehr hoch. Auf jeden Fall empefehlenswert.

author: {'steamid': '76561198119949978', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 2545, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 530, 'last_played': 1691161815}
review: 越玩越好玩的游戏~根本停不下来

author: {'steamid': '76561198019008948', 'num_games_owned': 494, 'num_reviews': 85, 'playtime_forever': 15914, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5762, 'last_played': 1605211650}
review:
Besides the developer taking time out of his life to hear me out, and treating me like a human being, this game is amazing :) Imagine your favorite roguelike.. Now, from that roguelike take out the fact that: Potions can kill you, necklaces can choke you, weapons can weld themselves to your hand, Identify scrolls can be burned to a crisp, and you can be violently killed by eating moldy bread :)

While I love those type of deaths, once you play ToME and notice that those deaths are not there, you realize now that if you die, it truly is your fault. Death comes from combat (or the occasional sandworm burrow collapsing in on you, haha), and the combat is great.. Almost every single build has multiple ways you can grow, almost to the point that they play like different classes altogether when raised in certain ways.. And then the raw variety of classes is amazing as well.. And the random loot generation is some of the best I've dealt with on the MANY, MANY random-loot games I've played :>

Add to all that the Infinite Dungeon (how far can you go?), the Transmogrification Chest (all picked-up items rest weightlessly inside the Transmog Chest, and on changing floors you can auto-sell everything out of the chest for a 10% cash penalty, makes inventory management a breeze), a very active and friendly playerbase with in-game chat (its basically an IRC room tacked to the bottom right of the game), the ability to link items and enemies through chat to share the joy of good loot, or the bitter terror of a hyper-strong unique enemy, semi-random in-game events that can potentially save you from the brink of death, and more.. :>

This game has the most achievements of any game on Steam (over 1000), multiple difficulty levels (some that determine the strength of your foes, others that determine how many lives you get: Roguelike one-life-to-live, Adventure 5-lives-to-live, and Exploration mode, unlimited lives with which you can get comfortable with the game ((or plunge fearlessly into the Infinite Dungeon!)

Anyway.. Try it.. It won't suck out your everlasting human soul, I promise.. It won't.. consume.. you.. GOTTA GO PLAY ToME! (And don't let my hours played through Steam fool you, I've got about twenty times that, from before it was ever on Steam, haha.. I probably don't even want to know how many hours..)

author: {'steamid': '76561197985044488', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 3038, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 58, 'last_played': 1503825106}
review: Well designed GUI and combat system. I'm quite impressed! My past favorite roguelike was Stone Soup Crawl but I got tired of the beginning always feeling the same. It's nice that each race has its own starting game to contend with.

author: {'steamid': '76561198010247076', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 9901, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1539, 'last_played': 1693716837}
review: The game takes a while to get used to but there's just sooooo much to it it's fantastic. Just as i thought i finished everything there was to do in the game, i found out i only finished chapter 1 of what looks to be many more to come.

author: {'steamid': '76561198126360706', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 41037, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1649, 'last_played': 1557750904}
review:
まだまだやり込んではいないが、angband系やelonaのようなローグライク好きなら、間違いなく楽しめるゲーム。
キャラクターメイキングの幅は広く、パラメーター・属性などの種類も豊富。
結構テキスト量が多いので、言語の問題は多少あるかもしれないが、アイテムの効果・パラメータ・スキルなどの意味についてはこのタイプのゲームに慣れた人ならば問題はないだろう。

author: {'steamid': '76561198103521143', 'num_games_owned': 311, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 50727, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2346, 'last_played': 1708694963}
review:
一款类似暗黑2但难度超高的回合制 Roguelike RPG
游戏性、自由度都很高，但上手不易
适合普通~~重度RPG爱好者、roguelike爱好者、非画面党的佳作
个人评分：9/10


优点1：
丰富的种族、职业、技能搭配，能够组合出多种多样的冒险人物

优点2：
随机地形、随机道具、随机怪物生成，具有很高的重玩性

优点3：
严谨的设定、平衡度上佳

优点4：
剧情还不错，自带bgm尚可，不会让人觉得枯燥

缺点1：
最被人吐槽的肯定是画面，虽然这种游戏卖点从来都不是画面，但是这一点还是让很多没有接触过roguelike游戏的玩家望而却步

缺点2：
难度不友好。笔者从遥远的开发版玩到steam平台发售，断断续续大概200h+，虽然已经不少，但还是不能自称入门。
实际上，笔者至今还没有超过LV20过= =
这也从侧面反映了，这款游戏适合有耐心的硬核rpg玩家，而不适合那些喜欢无脑突突突、刷刷刷的玩家。


Nov. 2020 Updated
官中大赞

author: {'steamid': '76561197967451608', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 71393, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2450, 'last_played': 1691034475}
review:
If you like Rogue style games like Nethack, you will love this game. It is rock hard and there are so many unique classes, some of which are very simple and some of which take some real mastery. I had the free version when it was out and now had to buy it to support the developers. It can be a bit tough to learn what areas that you can go to and which you should stay away from in the beginning, but eventually you will get the hang of it. There are also some helpful community guides to get you started. 

Best game I ever spent so little money on.

author: {'steamid': '76561198117305483', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 154046, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 56808, 'last_played': 1709684608}
review:
グラフィカルかつマウス対応で、ローグライク初心者でも気楽に出来るのが良いですね！
インターフェースもある程度自在にいじれるので, 自分に合った環境でプレイが可能です。

システムはローグライクにスキル要素を足したような感じ。ターン制のMMORPGと言えばいいでしょうか。街限定ですがある程度の振り直しも出来るので、うまく活用するといいでしょう。

Steam版の特典として購入者専用のクラスと残機無限モード、オンラインの倉庫等が使用出来ます。
現状オンライン倉庫は公式サイトからの寄付のみで拡張が可能です(2ユーロ/1枠)。
基本的にバージョン毎のセーブデータの互換性はありませんが、バージョンが上がったからといってプレイ出来なくなるということは恐らく無いので、ご安心を。

author: {'steamid': '76561198036160932', 'num_games_owned': 567, 'num_reviews': 107, 'playtime_forever': 6049, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4411, 'last_played': 1604835649}
review:
Очень суровая игра. Совсем не требовательна к железу, в своё время играл в неё взахлёб на ноутбуке. В игре оооочень много контента, квестов, историй, локаций - за одно прохождение всего этого не увидеть. 

Если играете не на Exploring, то ваши смерти ограничены, и вы реально трясетесь за собственную жизнь, в случае смертельной опасности убегая с максимально возможной скоростью. Не раз и не два приходилось мне драться с чрезвычайно серьёзными противниками, в основном с магами и некромантами, и такие бои затягивались на многие десятки ходов. Битва двух магов, если они равны по силам - это то ещё зрелище!

А сознание того, что тебе нельзя умирать, добавляет тонну острых ощущений. В конце, если удается победить, оставшись с 1% здоровья, то дико радуешься. 

- 1200+ ачивментов
- постепенное открытие новых стартовых профессий (изначально доступен только алхимик), который, прямо скажем, слабоват
- несколько режимов игры (Roguelike - смерть завершает игру, Adventure - 10-15 смертей, Exploring - смерти unlimited, но некоторые ачивки недоступны)
- процедурно генерируемые подземелья
- боссы, много-много сильных боссов (в том числе уникальные и квестовые). 

Каждая профессия имеет свои фишки и собственный путь раскачивания навыков, так что освоение игры за нового персонажа может занять несколько десятков часов, а самих таких профессий тоже около десятка. 

Изучая глобальную статистику достижений, можжно сказать, что даже до 10 уровня докачалось лишь несколько процентов игроков (4-6%). Хардкорная игра со множеством тонкостей для хардкорых людей.

[h1]Рекомендации[/h1]
- Не раскачивайте своего персонажа безсистемно. Найдите гайд по своему классу, и качайтесь по гайду. В противном случае у вас может не хватить сил для битвы с серьёзными противниками.
- Не знаю, как сейчас, но в то время, когда играл я, самым сильным и простым классом в игре был стихийный волшебник. У него было много атакующих заклинаний, прокастовка которых наносила огромный урон. Если у противника был иммунитет к определенному виду стихийной магии (например, 100% защита от огня), то это не было проблемой для волшебника, ибо у него в распоряжении есть множество других стихий.
- Отыграйте хотя бы 2 или 3 полных раза на сложности Adventure, не надо сразу прыгать в казуальный Explorer с неограниченными жизнями.

author: {'steamid': '76561198003069608', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 33342, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6636, 'last_played': 1665449296}
review:
Tales OF Maj'Eyal is an incredibly complex and deep Rogue-like game with turn-based combat and a large amount of content.

I've put more then 100 hours into the game and I haven't unlocked even half the classes/races (Maybe I just suck). There is a race and class for any type of player, but with this game you will want to try every one of them. Usually I find some quirks to these type of games, but everything you need is there, with a simple interface and all the information you need, so your never left in the dark on what a skill does or why you just died.

There is a huge amount of content, with randomly generated dungeons for you to go through and many different quests to partake with many easter eggs to be found. I always seem to find something new and exciting every playthrough. There is also many different gamemodes and difficulties to contour to any player.

I think this game is perfect for anyone who loves this genre of game, or even people new to the genre. Graphically its not too complex like ASCII graphics, and once you truly get into the game you will find it hard to stop.

The game also has over 1000 achievements for those who like to collect, and with a current price tag of 7$, theres no reason I can think of to stop you from buying this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197981329854', 'num_games_owned': 555, 'num_reviews': 58, 'playtime_forever': 95882, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2326, 'last_played': 1708049697}
review: Extremely deep and probably one of the few games around that deserves the "rogue-like" tag. The graphics + GUI may look simplistic from the screenshots (and yeah, the tilesets are pretty meh) but the amount of content and unlockables will suck you back in after each death. If you liked Dungeons of Dredmor, you'll most likely enjoy this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198034472469', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 14738, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9500, 'last_played': 1680614862}
review:
フリーゲームのローグライク。Steam版は寄付特典のクラス・キャラ共有倉庫(3枠)・カスタムタイル(自キャラの見た目変更)が最初から開放されている。
現在はワークショップに有志日本語化アドオンが存在する。ありがたや。
長らく継続的に更新されているゲームなので、一応事前に対応アドオンとVerは確認しておこう。

満腹度どころか消耗品自体が殆ど存在せず、種族・クラス・装備品に付属する数多のスキルを駆使し、マナやスタミナなどのリソースやスキルのクールダウンを考慮して立ち回る短期的な戦術を求められる。
一回のプレイ時間が長い上にローグライク特有の初見殺しも多いが、選ぶクラスによってプレイ感がガラリと変わり、アンロック要素も豊富で飽きが来にくい。
実績は別になるが無限復活可能(Exploration)なモードもあるので、初心者はまずそちらから入ってみるといい。

…また、とんでもない数の実績は人によってはネックになるかも。コンプリートは困難を極めるだろう。マジで。

review: One of the cleverest Roguelikes I've played in years. It takes tired mechanics that have been a standard in roguelikes for years and actually updates them to a bit more of a modern style, while still retaining the difficulty that's characteristic of the genre.

author: {'steamid': '76561197990751492', 'num_games_owned': 233, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 30912, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 1694, 'playtime_at_review': 1539, 'last_played': 1712135542}

author: {'steamid': '76561198060769937', 'num_games_owned': 226, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 9055, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4748, 'last_played': 1625663268}
review:
The best rouge-like I've played. The mechanics are great and the number of strategies, damage types, load outs make it fun many many times over. Dungeon Crawl Stone Soup was my favorite until I played ToME, now I'm constantly on this game when I free time.

I would recommend this game to anyone who likes rouge-likes or RPGs, or even just a game with deep mechanics.

Thanks DarkGod!

author: {'steamid': '76561198068057564', 'num_games_owned': 283, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 7246, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3488, 'last_played': 1402795808}
review: ToME combines the depth of the classical RPG, the friendly user interface of the modern cRPGs like Diablo, and the challenge and replayability of a good roguelike game. Unncessary complexities that might otherwise make a turn-based dungeon crawler tedious are streamlined using functionalities like auto-explore, auto-cast, and auto-sell. At the same time, the game retains all the complexities related character customization and strategy. There are 25 classes, and nearly all of them play very differently from the others. Adding to the strategic depth is the amount of effects the environment can have on a character, from vision blocked by fog to getting crushed by collasping walls to suffocated in water. The dungeon design makes great use of these elements. There is always something new to look forward to when you start a new game, which is a great news, because the game is challenging enough that it's only a matter of time before your first character runs out of lives.

author: {'steamid': '76561198077802022', 'num_games_owned': 2786, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 3338, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1137, 'last_played': 1605879879}
review: Great roguelike for roguelike fans out there, though the graphics is a bit old school. The turn based system as well as the skill tree implemented in this game is pretty deep and rewarding for strategy fans out there.

author: {'steamid': '76561197987312082', 'num_games_owned': 891, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 1000, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 303, 'last_played': 1421108333}
review:
Tales Of Maj'Eyal, o su acronimo, TOME, es un roguelike, no un roguelikelite, ni un plataformas con elementos al azar que lo hacen llamarse roguelike, sino el descendiente de directo de Tales Of Middle Earth, que a su vez es un descendiente directo de Angband, uno de los primeros juegos en llamarse asi mismo como roguelike.
Se trata de un RPG sin duda de pinta hardcore, con Permadeath como opcion, y una gran variedad de razas y clases para combinar, ademas de un monton de desbloqueables, que seran jugables luego de completar quests con las razas principales.
El gameplay es por turnos, muy, muy tactico, los heroes tienen actividades activables y el juego se enfoca en hacer que el jugador se prepare asi mismo con tacticas ganadoras, no un simple simulador de cuantas pociones se toman sino del esfuerzo por crear tacticas nuevas con las habilidades que se le presentan al jugador.
La version disponible en Steam es la version premium del juego, la version gratis del mismo se encuentran en www.te4.org, por si quieren jugarlo antes de comprarlo, pero vale la pena el precio que tiene en la actualidad
Lo recomiendo para quienes quieren una experiencia diferente a la mayoria de los RPG's de turnos con su concepto tactico, y para quienes quieren una aventura dificil pero emocionante.

author: {'steamid': '76561198073540985', 'num_games_owned': 2669, 'num_reviews': 134, 'playtime_forever': 584, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 380, 'last_played': 1635686250}
review: Great game.  The UI is terrible however.  If you like roguelike games then it is just what you are looking for.  You have to get used to the dreadful interface, but it is a decent time killer.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006054161', 'num_games_owned': 3480, 'num_reviews': 49, 'playtime_forever': 204, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 204, 'last_played': 1397289088}
review:
As much as I want to enjoy this game, I can't.  I've been playing this game since before it was on steam and had hoped that they would have fixed a lot of things, but they haven't.  Now I find myself hating having put it on my steam collection.

My experience with this game has been singular.  I waste time creating a character and spawn in a room full of monsters, half of which are level 2 while I am level one.  9 times out of 10, it has spawned me right next to these creatures, so within a round or two of starting the game, my character is dead and in a situation that they CANNOT get out of.  Kill the character off, make a new one, continue this cycle ad nauseum.  

The tutorial tells you outright that the character is OP for the tutorial and your character in the game will be 'weaker,' but what they fail to tell you is the monsters in the tutorial are weaker than you'll be facing in the actual game as well.  Inventory management is a pain in the ass and the random dungeon generation frequently makes walls with 'holes' in them (diagonally placed) so trying to take a corner to limit avenues of attack tends to result in getting attacked through the wall by something on the other side you didn't even know was there.

The game is interesting.  It should be fun as it is presented.  It is not.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994662237', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 61, 'playtime_forever': 827, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 825, 'last_played': 1593543708}
review:
I had sort of low expectations for this game due to the cluttered, amateurish look of the screenshots (it honestly reminds me of some of the janky Arcen games), but it blew away those expectations.

This is a roguelike, turned-based RPG with classes, races, stats, and abilities. The loot system is similar to Diablo and other ARPGs, with randomly generated loot of various qualities and special effects, along with unique loot. The art style is similar to old-school western RPGs like the Spiderweb games. An overworld map contains various towns and dungeons, the latter of which unlock gradually as you progress and complete quests.

Now, the part where this game really defied my expectations is that it provides a very streamlined experience, without a lot of the typical drudgery that goes along with games like this.

- First of all, the game itself is very intuitive to pick up and start playing without needing a tutorial. The interface is mouse-driven, no need to memorize keybinds (although it does offer fully customizable keybinds as well).

- The game seem to understand that the appeal of games like this is both the satisfaction of level progression, as well as the hunt for rare loot. Early on, you get an item that can recycle junk loot into gold, as well as a item with unlimited charges that basically provides a Town Portal effect that teleports you out of the current dungeon. This eliminates the trap that Bethesda games, for example, typically fall into, where you want to be a packrat and collect every piece of loot you come across, but are severely limited in the amount of weight you can carry.

- The game offers several difficulty levels, from unlimited lives, to several lives, to permadeath.

- The game has an "auto-explore" button, where your character will automatically move around the current dungeon floor until it finds an item of interest or an enemy. Movement can also be control via clicking on visible locations, and your character will move to the select square.

author: {'steamid': '76561198005357441', 'num_games_owned': 1909, 'num_reviews': 248, 'playtime_forever': 2356, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 479, 'last_played': 1438187896}
review:
I wish this was a lot better than it is. 

Turns out I hate the entire idea of a roguelike game. I tried to look beyond that and give it a shot. Still not for me.

I got into this game only because its the top achievement game on steam and I liked the idea of supporting a one man dev team (because this game is actually free elsewhere). Vast majority of the achievements have never been earned and are basically impossible or luck based. 

Its free for a reason. About the moment I got camped by level 20 mobs in a level 1 zone and couldnt progress I realized the dev has no idea what they are doing. Even as a "hard" game thats just stupid. Literally couldnt get out of the starting zone because of 6-10 mobs chasing me. I'm supposed to do this with one life? Even on infinite play I hated every minute of it.

There is no skill in being stomped at level 1, Im all for challenging boss fights and such. I never made it that far lol.

author: {'steamid': '76561198079877212', 'num_games_owned': 670, 'num_reviews': 132, 'playtime_forever': 108, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 108, 'last_played': 1419373108}
review:
[i]Если скрестить между собой Diablo и автомобиль Ока, а потом покурить одуванчиков, получим эту замечательную игру.[/i]

Если честно, то мое сугобо личное мнение, что выйди игра до Diablo стала бы хитом. Но учитывая, дату выхода, могу лишь сказать, что разработчики просто поленились. Игра ниже уровнем Diablo (имею ввиду первый Дьябло) во всем (от графики, до управления)

Подойдет только тем, кто до сих пор любит играть в Civilization и Civilization II... И всем фанатам олдскул игр, эпохи начала игровой индустрии.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006999418', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 109611, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 69496, 'last_played': 1688206806}
review:
Tales of Maj'Eyal ist ein klassisches Rogue-like mit grafischer Oberfläche, für diejenigen (wie mich) denen ASCII dann doch ein wenig zu puristisch ist. Es bietet eine enorme Vielzahl an Klassen und Fähigkeiten, welche man sich zum Teil erst freispielen muss. Die Fähigkeiten machen dabei einen recht gut ausgewogenen Eindruck. Kaum etwas scheint überflüssig und die verschiedenen Spielkonzepte funktionieren gut. Die Vielzahl an sinnigen und unterschiedlichen Spielweisen sorgen dann auch für einen enormen Wiederspielwert. 
Weiterhin positiv zu erwähnen ist die Ingame-Chatfunktion, welche die Kommunikation mit anderen Mitspielern möglich macht. Kombiniert mit einer fast immer sehr netten und hilfsbereiten Community macht dies vieles einfacher und die Lernkurve flacher.

Angesichts des sehr niedrigen Preises eine absolute Kaufempfehlung für Liebhaber des Genres.

author: {'steamid': '76561198001284456', 'num_games_owned': 826, 'num_reviews': 77, 'playtime_forever': 10200, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2349, 'last_played': 1691340515}
review:
I don't like traditional roguelikes. Dungeons of Dredmor was too much too fast, and nethack is waaaay too much. ToME is the first traditional roguelike I've actually enjoyed! Its tutorial is decent and you start off slow. There's far fewer variables than nethack while still keeping everything complex and interesting. The graphics are alright for its genre.

If you want to try the game, get it from their website for free. It's only missing a few gameplay features that I don't even use, like easy mode and a Double Shield class. Shame that you won't get female beards though.

author: {'steamid': '76561197996382739', 'num_games_owned': 1574, 'num_reviews': 189, 'playtime_forever': 23810, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 132, 'last_played': 1677703426}
review: The only Rogue that holds a candle -in the sanguine night- to Tales of Maj'Eyal is NetHack.  With an open world, seemingly endless class / character combinations, & Workshop, it is perhaps the greatest most ambitious Rogue to date.  The iconic graphics and simplified controls (over Nethack's cornicopia of keyboard commands) the game is more accessible to the new player, while at the same time a very difficult game to learn.  To make a game of this scale and magnitutde in 3D graphics would be cumbersome and HUGE -putting games like Skyrim to shame- with a much wider breadth and scope found within the imagination.  The level of customization is more akin to D&D than any new RPGs, but far more insane, like 3.5 rules on acid.  For love of gods & the sake of humanity, buy this game & play it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198095095230', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 79306, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3686, 'last_played': 1689356934}
review:
This is one of the best and most user-friendly "plot" roguelikes.
It has everything a typical hardcore roguelike should have, except 150+ keymappings for all the actions.
It has nice, fancy graphics and special effects.
It has lots of unlocks and achievements you will be struggling hard to get.
It has TONS of different player classes, each offering unique experience to the gamer.
Finally, it's initially free of charge (check te4.org), and for buying it you get some nice cosmetic stuff, local stash, ability to write in global chat and a badass dwarf hybrid melee + caster class dual-wielding shields.

author: {'steamid': '76561197977919348', 'num_games_owned': 1405, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 13591, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9925, 'last_played': 1656772943}
review: The best roguelike you can buy.  There is an insane amount of depth regarding class choices, race choices, skill choices, optional sidequests, difficulty levels and a deep, engrossing storyline with all sorts of lore.  My favorite feature is the in-game chat where you can ask any questions that you might have during the game which is much simpler than trying to dig through a wiki or forum.  It sacrifices some of the more traditional roguelike features, namely having permadeath disabled by default (there is an option for it) and not requiring the player to eat.  Additionally, the world is mostly static with some of the dungeons being static as well.  Of course, the large majority of dungeons are randomly generated so there is always a changing strategy.  My favorite roguelike, 10/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561197964267969', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 96, 'playtime_forever': 2631, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2338, 'last_played': 1395423295}
review:
Nice beginner-friendly graphical roguelike. It's from the less wackyrandom branch of roguelikes so there's less stuff you have to learn by dying constantly and not so many unfair instadeaths. This can be a good thing if you don't like RNG bullshit deaths, but if you enjoy Nethack-type randomness more you might find this game a bit boring.

The best part of the game is the character development. There's tons of classes and races and while you start with the more usual ones like warriors and rogues, through game events you will unlock dozens more ranging from time-travellers to plague cultists with quite unique gameplay mechanics. There are tons of optional skill trees to unlock through quests so your characters will become quite varied.

Minus points for the completely bland levels, monsters and itemization. There's an ADOM-type overworld map which ensures that not every area is a traditional dungeon, but the levels themselves are just plain boring with no interesting features. Then again the game does have a great auto-explore function so at least you don't have to slog through the dull mazes manually, this is a really good addition, you can fast-forward to the next encounter. Item-wise there are no consumables like the usual potions and scrolls so while it keeps the game less cluttered it also reduces the variety of events and loot a lot. The only items are gear you wear/wield so you can get bigger numbers on your character sheet, sometimes you can get artifacts/runes which grant an extra skill. Simple, but gets grindy and boring. It doesn't help that you mostly have to do the same areas again when you make a new character, they get repetitive.

This game leans a bit more towards traditional RPGs because the lack of random craziness means that you usually die just when you get too cocky and proceed to a situation you can't handle and on the default difficulty you're allowed to make some mistakes. Characters seem to lead much longer lives than usually in roguelikes and a successful run takes something like 20 hours. I just wish it had more memorable and dynamic areas and enemies, but the class and skill system is still better than in most roguelikes.

While there are many things that I don't like and I find the brutal unfair roguelikes more entertaining, I still think ToME is good. It's really fun to try out new character concepts and once you're getting bored with them there's something completely different you've unlocked and you start over.

author: {'steamid': '76561198002990097', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 107, 'playtime_forever': 464, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 464, 'last_played': 1395187396}

author: {'steamid': '76561198020213673', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 15680, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5489, 'last_played': 1705882849}
review: a Rogue like with plot, not as funny as Dredmor, but the calculating of maths is easier than Dredmor, lots of replayability too since theres an arena(wave survival) and infinite dungeon mode, i also highly suggest getting a few workshop mods that help out the ui a bit. all in all a perfect baby's first Roguelike that can still give veterans a chalenge, it is also much more asthetically pleasing than dos symbols of normal roguelikes, a forum and wiki is also provided that helps alot. decent price for a game you can spend a long time on.

author: {'steamid': '76561198000155206', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 14234, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2105, 'last_played': 1676714495}
review:
Tale os Maj'Eyal (w skrócie ToMe) to gra która potrafi wciągnąć człowieka na długi, długi czas. Jeśli spędziliście wiele godzin grając w Adoma, nethacka czy diablo - ta gra łączy wszystkie te elementy, usprawnia je, przeżuwa i wypluwa w formie która przyciągnie was na wiele, wiele tygodni gry.

Gra należy do gatunku turowych cRPGów i ostrzegam lojalnie, jest dość trudna - w końcu to Roguelike.

Twórca oddał nam do dyspozycji trzy tryby rozgrywki, począwszy od najprostszego (exploration mode) w którym mamy do dyspozycji nieskończoną ilość żyć. Możemy swobodnie odkrywać świat, odblokowywać nowe klasy i rasy i uczyć się mechaniki.

Drugim trybem jest Adventure Mode, w którym posiadamy pulę żyć, przystosowany dla tych graczy, którzy poznali już podstawy.

Trzecim trybem, trybem za pomocą którego powinno się grać w tą grę jest Roguelike - jedno życie - bezpardonowy, zmuszający do myślenia, taktycznego planowania ruchów i używania wszystkich umiejętności swojej postaci na 120%.


W skrócie o co chodzi: wybieramy postać (z pośród wielu kombinacji ras oraz klas) i idziemy ratować świat. Natomiast styl w którym to zrobimy zależy już całkowicie od nas - jeśli ktoś lubi 'budować' postać pod swój styl gry, tutaj znajdzie się w prawdziwym raju. Dorzucić do tego jeszcze generowane losowo podziemia (oraz nadziemia, gdyż spora część gry dzieje się na otwartej przestrzeni), tysiące różnych przedmiotów, wiele questów oraz rosnący poziom trudności (który można jeszcze podkręcić, jakby komuś było mało) sprawi, że trudno będzie wam oderwać się od ekranów.

Walka jest, mimo turowej oprawy, jest bardzo dynamiczna. Wrogowie są nie tylko mają przewagę liczebną, ale większość z nich dysponuje tymi samymi trikami co gracze. Co sprawia, że walki z bossami i mini-bossami często zmuszają nas do salwowania się ucieczką - przede wszystkim na poczatku naszej przygody.

Co dostajemy w pakiecie:
* Gra składa się z trzech aktów, każdy (razem z wątkami pobocznymi) zajmuje około 2-6 godzin gry (w zależności od wybranej klasy, trybu gry oraz poziomu trudności).
* Kampanię główną i dwie mini-kampanię.
* Ponad 1200 achivementów (!).
* 25 klas postaci.
* 9 ras postaci.

Jakby komuś było mało, większość gry jest napisana w LUA i posiada bardzo dobry support dla moderów - na steam workshop znajdziecie wiele dodatkowych klas, przedmiotów, podziemi oraz questów.

Jeśli i to was nie przekonuje do spróbowania, możecie ściągnąc całkowicie darmową wersję gry (wersja dla donatorów, którą można zakupić na steamie posiada trzy dodatkowe 'ficzery': 1 dodatkową klasę, możliwość przekazywania przedmiotów między postaciami oraz Exploration mode).

Osobiście sciągnołem wersję darmową, ale po dwóch tygodniach gry stwierdziłem, że 6 euro to nie takie duże pieniądze na grę która przykuła mnie na dużo dłużej niż parę godzin.

Pozdrawiam. :)

author: {'steamid': '76561197993247180', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 62, 'playtime_forever': 8784, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5048, 'last_played': 1588479313}
review:
Roguelike without the heartburn. 
Great interface, fun mechanics, Melee isn't a dull chore, and combat that keeps you on your toes. 
Rewarding exploration and combat expertise with unlocking more races and classes. 
Oh and it has a built in chat engine so you can talk with strangers or directly with your friend. The chat system could be leagues better for friendchat but all in all its a very welcome feature.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041996767', 'num_games_owned': 1363, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 4043, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4002, 'last_played': 1395157555}
review:
로그라이크+턴제rpg 극의 달한 게임.로그라이크처럼 목숨 하나로 플레이할수도있고 여러목숨으로 플레이할수도있다.
여러종족+직업+많은종류의 장비 그리고 기술과주문+자유로운 능력치와 특성 투자+퀘스트+세계관(읽을거리)+개성있는던전

장점은 이루 다 말할 수 없어서 단점을 써보겠다.

단점 - 가끔 진행상 버그가있어서 게임을 다시해야할수도있다.. 그리고 로그라이크형식이라 알아야할 수치들이 많아서 장비선택이나 무기 공격력산출 같은경우 좀 힘들수있다.(진행하다보면 허수아비를 생성해서 실험할수있다.)

이외에는 없는것같다.가장 중요한 언어부분도 유저 한글화까지..으 쩌는게임.

author: {'steamid': '76561198018594172', 'num_games_owned': 249, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 21688, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 17406, 'last_played': 1699874201}
review:
ToME es un juego adictivo y divertido, muy dificil pero sin llegar a ser injusto, un juego donde no te cuesta porque los enemigos te maten de un golpe por capricho del creador, sino porque los enemigos son como otro jugador más, con sus propias habilidades y hechizos, eso hace que el juego acabe siendo como una especie de ajedrez en el que gana el bando que utiliza mejor sus bazas. 

Tiene multiples razas y clases para combinar y hacer mezclas demoledoras, como un esqueleto arquero o un ghoul nigromante (muchas clases y razas hay que desbloquearlas). 

Otra baza a favor es que posee una historia bastante interesante que te la irán contando con pequeñas notas que cogerás de tu enemigos caidos.

Hablando del aspecto monetario, el juego es muy barato, pero aparte en su página oficial se puede descargar gratis, solo que no tendrás pequeñas chorraditas, que tampoco afectan al gameplay, que tenemos los "premium" como yo.
Realmente os lo recomiendo, es muy adictivo y disfrutable.

author: {'steamid': '76561197961093505', 'num_games_owned': 4653, 'num_reviews': 407, 'playtime_forever': 14, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 14, 'last_played': 1394523761}
review:
I died in ten seconds. I died in the first ten seconds of my first run, the first time I ever played this game.

I know, I know, roguelikes, I know. I FUCKIN' KNOW, OKAY? I KNOW i'M NOT CUT OUT FOR THIS. I KNOW YOU ONLY BROUGHT ME THIS FAR BECAUSE I MADE YOU LOOK GOOD AT YOUR FUCKING PARTIES IN FRONT OF YOUR FUCKING HIGH-CLASS GUESTS. BUT I THOUGHT I STILL HAD SOMETHING TO OFFER YOU. I THOUGHT THERE WAS AN US. I'M JUST YOUR TEN-SECOND MAN.

Don't call me anymore, Tales of Maj'Eyal. I want my records back.

author: {'steamid': '76561198012219244', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 47417, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4067, 'last_played': 1665191945}
review: This game is amazingly entertaining for the price. It really does a great job of capturing all of the best parts of Rogue and fixing all of the worst parts. I would highly recommend it as a good value.

author: {'steamid': '76561197997796219', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 19496, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 485, 'last_played': 1695151581}
review:
One of the best rogue-likes out there.  The use of a reliable overworld/quest/progression structure keeps the game more engaging and varied than most, and the fact that most character options are unlocked in a cool way keeps me coming back.  Years of experimentation with game mechanics, item generation, and in-game lore has made a really unique world that streamlines a bunch of the more stressful elements of roguelikes (one-use items, for example) into more fun and friendly systems.

I still have never made it more than halfway through the campaign before using up all my extra lives.

author: {'steamid': '76561197962125207', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 68, 'playtime_forever': 3918, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1080, 'last_played': 1677136135}
review:
Thoroughly enjoying this game so far. First off, if you don't want to pay for it you can download the free, fully-featured version directly from their site te4.org (it's not F2P, it's open-source). 

Basically the game is like Nethack - a ton of randomly generated dungeons and artifacts, with a more complex battle system and better graphics. If you're not into the graphics you can opt for ascii graphics, as I have in past games.

It has in-game chat (so you are instantly linked with everyone else who is playing the game at that moment), an active community, and it is constantly being updated and improved. Try it so we can share stories and advise each other on how to get out of jams! It's turn based so you can pick it up and set it down anytime you want.

author: {'steamid': '76561197991622855', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 13546, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6111, 'last_played': 1607796091}
review:
Amazing roguelike game, challenging but not unfair and easier to get into than many other roguelikes. If you're unfamiliar with then genre, think  turn based Diablo. There is a huge selection of classes to choose from, and you can play the same class multiple ways since you have a limited amout of skill points. The game's tileset looks great, but there is an ASCII mode too if you prefer that. The music is well done, and so are the sound effects.

The game is available free on the developers website if you'd like to try it out, but you wont have access to a lot of features that come with the paid version, mostly an item stash and Steam Workshop mods. Definately worth picking up.

author: {'steamid': '76561197968549943', 'num_games_owned': 1461, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 970, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 550, 'last_played': 1625551694}
review:
Almost 10 hours in and I cannot put this down.

I grew up on Roguelike games and this is one of the best implementations I have played.  Make no mistake!  This game is hard, brutal and you will die.. but you will enjoy it along the way.   

Keeping this short and simple.  If you enjoy roguelike games this is a must buy.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994480308', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 296, 'playtime_forever': 58343, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1043, 'last_played': 1694213328}
review:
This is the best roguelike on steam. Strikes a perfect balance between usability/user friendliness with depth and complexity. I'll review this game by highlighting what I think sets it apart from other games in the genre.

[b]No consumable items[/b] - TOME doesn't have potions, scrolls, or wands. You choose a limited number of abilities that give you the function that consumables play in other games - quick heal, regen, teleport, blink, fireball, etc. This eliminates the issues lots of people have with hoarding consumables, not knowing when to use them, the pain of having them destroyed, etc. Picking and choosing the right abilities adds a layer of depth that doesn't exist in other roguelikes. 

[b]Fast [/b]- this game plays lightning fast and is very streamlined, thanks to the lack of consumables. Of course, it's turn based, so it's only as fast as you want...but I tend to play pretty fast, and lots of roguelikes feel sluggish in comparison.

[b]Broad[/b] - Lots of classes, from your standard mage and warrior to the cool weird things like Chronomancers and Wyrmics (dragon-fighters). 

[b]Deep[/b] - The different classes feel distinct. In addition to the obvious (different skills and equipment), different types of classes have different types of resources (mana/stamina/equilibrium/hate/probably some other ones) that work in different ways.  

[b]Combat Is Fun [/b] - This is the only roguelike I've played where melee combat is actually fun. You get lots of buttons to push that do different things. In most roguelikes, the coolest thing about your melee character is the equipment you find. In TOME, you can actually do cool shit - charge, shout, whirlwinds, cleaves, etc. 

[b]Simple[/b] - This doesn't mean easy and it doesn't mean shallow - it just means simple. Clean, streamlined design. The action bar is great - every option your character has is on it, so you always know what you can and can't do. No navigating labyrinthine menus, no checking your inventory after you died and remembering you could have used your blink, etc.

[b]Overworld[/b] - Like ADOM and not like Crawl, TOME features a static overworld that's always the same and features the same dungeons/locations, which are themselves randomized. This isn't necessarily better or worse, just putting it out there.

This game is an absolute blast. If you liked Dungeons of Dreadmor, you owe it to yourself to take a step up to a more serious and more interesting game. :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198110916310', 'num_games_owned': 376, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 82006, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 37449, 'last_played': 1686799032}
review:
ターンベースのローグライクRPGです。
美麗なグラフィック
多様な難易度調整要素
で、ローグライク初心者でも安心して遊べます。
他のローグライクに漏れず、死んで覚えるゲームですが、難易度調整要素の中には、複数命がある残機制のものもあるので、とっつきやすさは群を抜いてるのではないでしょうか。
また、種族やクラスも豊富で、成長要素はディアブロ等のスキル制を導入しているので、同じ種族・クラスでも様々なビルドを楽しむことが出来ます。
アイテムも勿論多彩で、マジックアイテム・レアアイテム・アーティファクト・ランダムアーティファクト等があります。

実は公式サイトで無料で遊べるので、そちらで遊んでからSteam版を購入する事も可能です。

2014年3月8日
Steam版では、1.1.5現在アイテム倉庫やドワーフのクラスが追加されていますが、これからもっと追加要素は増えると思われます。
公式の無料版は有志による日本語化パッチがあるので、英語が苦手な方はそちらを遊んでからSteam版を遊ぶといいと思います。
もっとも、謎解き要素がほぼないので、英語が苦手でも問題なく遊べるとは思います。私も英語はあまり得意ではありませんが、楽しめていますので。

2017年11月25日追記
現行の最新版は1.5.5で、現在はワークショップに有志の方々による日本語化modがあります。
3年前の購入特典だったドワーフのクラスは無料版でも使えるようになりましたが、代わりにPossesorという職業が購入特典として追加されています。
DLCは、後から買っても問題ないと思いますが、DLCなしなら無料版とほとんど変わらないので、無料版遊んで楽しめたらSteam版をDLC共々買う、というのが一番賢明な購入の流れかなと思います。

2018年3月6日追記
初心者の方向けに実況解説動画を録ってみました。参考になれば幸いです。
※このゲームは他のローグライクよろしく、死んで覚えるゲーム≒死に覚えが楽しいゲームなので、その部分への対策と解説をしている以上、多少なりともプレイ時の楽しみをスポイルしてしまう可能性があります、ご視聴の際はその点ご了承下さい。
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=bytanUePCyw

2019年5月26日追記
ニコ動ですがゆっくり解説動画も作りました。
主に攻略に関する部分の解説です。
（効果音とかでインム要素ちょっとあります、苦手な人は注意）
https://www.nicovideo.jp/watch/sm35128168

author: {'steamid': '76561197991605688', 'num_games_owned': 3402, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 2040, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 1, 'playtime_at_review': 715, 'last_played': 1711507337}
review:
I have been dipping into rougelikes for a few years now and this is probably the most polished traditional rougelike I've seen yet.  Until now my go to has been Dungeon Crawl but this easily beats that in terms of both quality and depth.

I've been wiping charaters left and right but if you are familar at all with the genre you should pick up the basics in less than a hour.  There is a really good interface and tool-tips mostly explain everything you need to know.

author: {'steamid': '76561198002990111', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 2465, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1677, 'last_played': 1460031788}
review: Ce jeu est fantastique !!! Son systeme de jeu m'a vraiment emballé, à la fois ardu et technique  et que dire de toutes ces classes à debloquer au cours des multiples parties. L'univers est coherent et sympathique et les donjons sont foncierement retors. Le loot est particulierement vaste et permet de ne pas mourir betement si l'on sait gerer correctement son personnage et ses caracteristiques. J 'y ai trouvé la profondeur d'un jeu de role papier et ça ce fut genial. A essayer absolument

author: {'steamid': '76561197971938571', 'num_games_owned': 402, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 5959, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1263, 'last_played': 1677292560}
review: Fun, tons of depth, challenging enough in its roguelike aesthetic to make apparent limitations of this type of game instead seem like a terrifically motivating enticement to learn from your last death.  You keep coming back for more.  This is roguelike rpg at its purest.  The whole production seems satisfyingly indie.  Love supporting small but genius little labors of love like this one -- hope you will, too.

author: {'steamid': '76561198018434008', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 7820, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1047, 'last_played': 1507321396}

author: {'steamid': '76561198030213055', 'num_games_owned': 280, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 106635, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6717, 'last_played': 1703556103}
review:
Great rogue-like game with (currently) 5 difficulty settings and 3 death settings (ex. Permadeath, limited lives, or unlimited lives) which allow you to play at the pace you desire.

There are a large number of classes with different playstyles and customizable builds on each, which gives great replayability.

author: {'steamid': '76561198014674341', 'num_games_owned': 543, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 8240, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1903, 'last_played': 1701839548}
review: Tales of Maj'Eyal is an extremely difficult, yet rewarding roguelike. It doesn't matter if you're only a few minutes in, or a few hours in--one misplaced attack or brash move can mean the end of your character, I constantly find myself back at the character creation screen, rolling a new character to try and see how far I can get... it's pretty difficult if you don't understand the mechanics of turn-based roguelikes (I'm fairly new to the genre). What draws me most to this game, honestly, is the depth of customization. Insane amounts of gear, unique skill trees to each talent archetype [20+ different categories (each 5 deep)], and the ultimate consequence of perma-death keep me playing this game. While I'm not really a fan of lore, I can definitely appreciate how much effort the developers put into creating a real atmosphere and background for the game. The tone, to me, is dark, dank... dramatic, and dire; just reading the class descriptions gives one a real sense of purpose for each character. If you're reading this during the weekend deal of March, 2013 - get this game. Even if not, $6.99 is a steal regardless, provided you're a fan of this genre. If you're the action-y type, this game probably isn't for you. If you're a tactician, and like having total control over damn-near every aspect of your character and his fate, then ToME is for you.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998508603', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 16213, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4614, 'last_played': 1582939585}
review: One of the most finely-crafted modern roguelikes around.

author: {'steamid': '76561198000116246', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 29, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 29, 'last_played': 1393950852}
review:
No.

Sorry but this game just doesn't do it for me.

The UI is too busy, making it hard to work out how to do things.

Key concepts on items like "damage" are hard to ascertain.

And I died rather easily, thrice.

I'm sure people who are into these sorts of games will find things to appreciate but for me it just doesn't quite work.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027025046', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1381, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 159, 'last_played': 1663907594}
review: finally something that has my attention. simple gameplay like dredmor, but with higher customization and levelup factor...if that makes any sense.Reminds of of an old colleco vision game i use to play. Anywho 8.5

author: {'steamid': '76561197992850125', 'num_games_owned': 759, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 373, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 278, 'last_played': 1524188113}
review:
Perfect mix of roguelike combat with RPG customization when it comes to items and skills. Each class has an origin story and you unlock further classes in the game as you encounter various events in the world. It's a bit different than traditional roguelikes as you're not descening one specific dungeon for a huge number of levels, but rather you play on an overworld map that has hundreds of different areas to explore.

Definitely recommend it for anyone looking for a turn-based experience custom-tailored to your preferences.

author: {'steamid': '76561197992730942', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 12575, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7829, 'last_played': 1621201657}
review: One of the best dungeon crawler ever.. 9/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198082561250', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 411, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 215, 'last_played': 1413061854}
review:
This is one of the greatest roguelikes I ever played. The story is beautiful with a rich backstory and  there are many classes and races to choose from. There is no grinding and each location has its own flavour and story. Also the game is very replayable and by solving quests you can unlock extra races, classes or features which you can use in other games.

In contrast with other roguelikes I've played, this one provides surprisingly good graphics and controls.

The game is continuously updated, each update bringing new content.  

A must buy for any roguelike fan.

P.S. It reminded me of Valhalla, an old DOS game I used to play. Perhaps alchemy could be included in a future release.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993202287', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 17094, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 16386, 'last_played': 1440466512}
review: So if you have not played this game then you are a fool. The game is a roguelike. it's easy to get into, taking a lot of the confusion and annoyance of having to learn new keys out of the mix. The story line is immense and there is a ton of ingame lore. There's a decent amount of randomized equipment and amount of specilaized awesome equipment. This game eclipsed my addiction to Civ 5 for quite a while and still commands my attention after I finally beat it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197984549125', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 27159, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 20908, 'last_played': 1707851547}
review:
This game is undeniably incredible. I finally "beat it" (Team Dwarven Bulwark!), and yet can't wait to play more. DarkGod has delivered us a truly great experience. If you're not sure if it is "worth your $7" (it's value is far greater), you can play for free! You can download it from TE4.org. Be sure and get the "full" version with music (which is magnificent). I believe all versions come with the wonderful Shockbolt tileset (and of course ASCII mode also).

I strongly encourage everyone to donate to at [u]least[/u] "Gold" status. 
Silver = 6€ and 15€, Gold = 16€ and 30€, Stralite = 31€ and 60€, Voratun = 61€+

author: {'steamid': '76561198067314413', 'num_games_owned': 5744, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 5978, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3326, 'last_played': 1513760347}
review: roguelike神作啊，一个可以玩几年的游戏，灰常耐玩，除了本体的可玩性很高之外还有大量的mod等着你，刚开始人设有点不喜欢，不过玩着玩着就忽略了，大家快来玩

author: {'steamid': '76561198033052330', 'num_games_owned': 964, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 3672, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1944, 'last_played': 1432475841}
review: Proving beyond any doubt, graphics do not make the game. Tales of Maj'Eyal has everything you could want in an RPG or Roguelike: Tons of character options, unlockables, mods, monsters, adjustable settings for when you are feeling hardcore... or you feel like getting a second chance. Oh, yea AND it has a story, with evolving events and characters... and on... and on... Great online features & community is just a bonus. Yea, I like it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198074977819', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 45240, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 41266, 'last_played': 1604874236}
review:
有玩過日系RPG "Elona"的朋友絕對不能錯過的一款史詩巨作! 
相比Elona像是在玩單機的線上遊戲 [重復的元素太多,例如刷怪]，
本作屬於挑戰更高難度的傳統D&D風格 [默認模式為有限次數生命並且大都不能重復刷怪]。

豐富的種族與職業還有變化多端的戰鬥系統(有些許特效)，
以 模擬棋盤類 回合制 的方式表現。
雖然此類遊戲的貼圖和遊戲方式對大多數玩家來說難以接受，
但只要耐心品味一番便能知悉其中妙不可言的滋味！

––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––

ToME 3DM 中文討論區:

http://bbs.3dmgame.com/forum.php?mod=forumdisplay&fid=829&page=1

ToME4貼吧：
http://tieba.baidu.com/f?kw=tome4&ie=utf-8

官方Addon (插件)分享區：
http://te4.org/addons/tome

––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––

中文補丁目前已上傳至官方了，尋找CHN for ToME的名稱便是。

解壓縮至遊戲資料夾>game>addons,之後在遊戲主選單開啟此addon就ok了。

––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––


現在Steam創意工房中有提供中文Addon了，找到CHN標題的內容訂閱便可使用，
要注意的是中文Addon使用時必須關掉其他非預設Addon以免發生衝突BUG。

以下是不會與漢化衝突的Addons：
Improved Combat Text ( 顯示傷害與恢復的浮動文字 )
Opt-in Adventurers Parties ( 在大地圖遇到敵人時可選擇戰鬥或迴避 )
Turn Separators ( 戰鬥訊息自己回合分隔線 )
Das Blinkenlights ( 遠古地城中讓開門寶珠發光辨別順序是否正確 )
Melinda on the Map ( 讓黑暗地窖顯示在大地圖上 )
Faster Run/Rest/Explore ( 用降偵的方式加快探索和休息 )

author: {'steamid': '76561197973044405', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 6063, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 750, 'last_played': 1604273027}
review: ToME is a fun rogue-like with plenty of classes. It's one of those games where you expect to die over and over again, but the more you play the more you learn the better you get!

author: {'steamid': '76561197982989481', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 72, 'playtime_forever': 853, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 266, 'last_played': 1594072287}
review: exellent rogue like game from the old times~~~

author: {'steamid': '76561198021304457', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 9436, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4695, 'last_played': 1626762239}
review: Wonderful, absolutely the best roguelike I've ever played.

author: {'steamid': '76561197960833702', 'num_games_owned': 466, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 5330, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2358, 'last_played': 1626982193}
review:
i hated darksouls. it wasn't hard, it was grinding to me. this is hard, this is the game i wanted darksouls to be.

i don't know what it is about this game that i love. it seems extremely basic on the surface but underneath it there's a depth that seems to go on forever. i have about 34 hours in this game and i've only gotten to level 15 before i end up dying. the deaths are frustrating but at the same time, i learn from it, i get better and to me that's the heart of a roguelike. 

a lot of different classes with different playstyles that you can unlock. the unlocking itself becomes a game, more of a push to get further in the game, to go a little more slowly when you encounter a new enemy and read up on their abilities. 

the one thing i don't like is that it's not really apparent on where to go. you have to do the dungeons in a specific order and that's not really apparent in the game. luckily many people out there have written an order they like and one that seems to work well, so i would check that out first.

the game just feels like a community. people submit lore to be added to it and the creator will surprise people with random events if you happen to be on at the right time. for instance, there was an event the other day where he gave everyone on a flute that turned their character skin into a pirate, with pirate noises. just little touches like that from the creator shows the kind of care and admiration he has for this. 

so yea. i love this game, i reccomend the hell out of it if you like a challenge and don't mind dying a lot. it seems simple on the surface but it's so much more. so much

author: {'steamid': '76561198056005292', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 122350, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 72, 'playtime_at_review': 6519, 'last_played': 1711950520}
review:
[spoiler]Sorry for poor English and tenses in advance,  Just want to be heard.  
When I tried this game for a first time I understood nothing. It seemed to me a lot more complicated  than most of other "casual" rogulikes I played before.
So, after a ten or so runs, I gave it up. Three or four month later (+ after reading some spoilers on wiki) I decided to give it a second chance and just to see if I can earn some classes unlocks.
And I earned them. And I liked the unlocks. And I got addicted to this game. And I've played it around 1000 hours during last 1.5 years. And I regret nothing.
[/spoiler]
tl;dr:
Buy it NOW. You'll start enjoining it sooner or later. Guaranteed.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025682687', 'num_games_owned': 1386, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 43767, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9938, 'last_played': 1578868710}
review: An outstanding game -- easily the best Roguelike on Steam, and a strong competitor to Dungeon Crawl Stone Soup for the title of best roguelike ever.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998472669', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 6338, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 185, 'last_played': 1678676960}
review:
Als großer Roguelike Fan ist ToME eines meiner Lieblingsspiele. Ich habe dieses Spiel bereits vor der Veröffentlichung auf Steam gespielt. Meine Spielzeit dürfte somit bei einigen dutzenden Spielstunden liegen. 

ToME4 ist im Gegensatz zu vielen anderen Spielen, die sich heute "Roguelike" nennen, ein sehr klassisches Roguelike mit ansprechender grafischer Repräsentation (Es gibt auch einen ASCII-Modus, aber der ist imo nichts Halbes und nichts Ganzes).

Das bedeutet, dass man alle Vor- und Nachteile eines Roguelikes erwarten kann:

- Permadeath
- Rundenbasierte Kämpfe
- Hack'n Slash Mentalität
- Randomisierte Gebiete, Gegenstände und Ereignisse

ToME zeichnet sich im Vergleich zu anderen Roguelikes zusätzlich durch folgende Eigenheiten aus:

- Sehr detaillierte Grafik
- Modernes mausgestütztes Interface mit Tooltipps und Fenstern
- Eine persistente Weltkarte mit einer Handlung, mehrstufigen Quests und Überraschungen
- Skillbäume und Charaktertraits
- Komplexes Kampfmodell mit einer Vielzahl von Einflussfaktoren

ToME ist das perfekte Spiel, wenn man das Flair klassischer Roguelikes in einer modernen Präsentation und einem flüssigen Userinterface kennenlernen möchte. Es kann als Einstieg gesehen werden, um sich eventuell später mit Spielen wie ADOM, DC:SS oder Angband zu beschäftigen.

author: {'steamid': '76561198001505481', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 14857, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8112, 'last_played': 1599778948}
review:
TOME is a really entertaining roguelike. If you don't know what Dungeon Crawl Stone Soup, IVAN, or Nethackare then this game might not be for you. TOME's tileset along with all the abilities that can be used via hotkeys will keep you enaged. Also, trying out multiple race and class combinations can lead to tons of replayability.

Currently on steam is the retail version of TOME, but on the game's website you can find the free version. Having played both the only differnces I can find are: an item vault that holds 6 items at a time(donating money increses this amount), a class called Stone Warden, custom tiles(what your ingame avatar looks like), and exploration mode(infinite lives).

If you want to try the game out, head over to the game's website. You will only be missing out on what I stated above.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004740443', 'num_games_owned': 839, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 565, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 557, 'last_played': 1527445000}
review:
If you enjoy dungeon crawlers at all, but want more meat than Nethack, this is the game for you.

Excellent skill trees, fun unlockables, and very challenging game. It's a lot of fun to try different builds, and the turn-based grid-based combat is the best!

author: {'steamid': '76561198117118883', 'num_games_owned': 1794, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 3441, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 284, 'last_played': 1673909122}
review: Graphics? Who needs graphics? With ToME it feels like turning back to the great 90's. A complex rpg with simple rogue like gameplay, easy to learn, hard to master. To become really involved in it you need to play plenty of hours, but on the other side the game won't become boring so far....errr....maybe even never. Many classes mixed with many races, experimental ways to play (conservative 2 handed weapon dwarf with a lot of armor or better cursed elf with some lifesteal and much hate?) within an interesting campaign (to be honest, most rogue like games give a shit on storytelling). The chilled music is rounding down the whole expirience. It is an inconspicuous jewel, a little masterpiece. For that money you won't get more fun spending your 100 or 200 hours.

author: {'steamid': '76561197968814581', 'num_games_owned': 969, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 2433, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1875, 'last_played': 1640563624}
review: This is what happens when you take roguelikes and add some modern UI conveniences, difficulty levels, and an option for a forgiving variety of permadeath. You can get it for free online, but I recommend picking it up on Steam because frankly it's worth more than 7 bucks.

author: {'steamid': '76561198091151268', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 6637, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3097, 'last_played': 1592349214}
review:
A roguelike with a wonderful amount of depth. There are class and race combinations to suit any play style, more of which will be unlocked as you play the game. Don't want to wait before you can play as a Yeek paradox mage? That's fine, you can install a mod to unlock everything from the start, but I think you'd be denying yourself the joy of slowly exploring and discovering more about this world and what it has to offer.

Speaking of modding, there's a whole host of great stuff available, ranging from minor tweaks to full overhauls; the mod catalogue is well worth a browse.

Highly recommended!

author: {'steamid': '76561197991650901', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 1397, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 939, 'last_played': 1529211979}
review: This one is an instant classic. Good for everyone new and old to roguelike games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198059686524', 'num_games_owned': 575, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 8245, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2424, 'last_played': 1677970729}
review:
ToME to standardowy rogue-like. Tworzymy postać, przemierzamy świat, zdobywamy poziomy i ekwipunek jednocześnie próbując nie zginąć. Standardowa śpiewka, którą znają i kochają wszyscy fani. A potem zaczynają się jaja. Po pierwsze ilość ras i klas (po odblokowaniu wszystkich rzecz jasna) jest po prostu SZALONA. Do naszej dyspozycji oddane zostaje 8 raz grywalnych, znacząco różniących się statystykami, oraz kilkanaście klas z których tworzymy naszą postać. Ilość kombinacji jest tak wielka, że naprawdę ciężko jest powiedzieć o braku zróżnicowania. Do tego każda(!) klasa zachowuje się i gra inaczej. I to znacząco inaczej. Pokażcie mi proszę RPG, w którym rozgrywka nekromantą i przywoływaczem jest tak diametralnie różna. Do tego trzeba jeszcze rozróżnić naprawdę zróżnicowane buildy jednej konkretnej klasy (grywalne, rzecz jasna). Dla przykładu berserker budujący się w balans będzie po prostu stał przy potworku i bił go tak długo, aż podłoga i ściany zmienią kolor na czerwony. Ten sam berserker zbudowany pod czystą ofensywę będzie chciał zakończyć walkę jednym ciosem, ponieważ im dłuższa walka, tym gorzej dla niego. A to tylko naprawdę trywialny przykład jednej z wielu klas w grze. Naprawdę bardzo rzadko zdarzą się dwie identyczne rozgrywki, w szczególności, gdy podchodzimy do gry po raz pierwszy. Dodatkowym smaczkiem jest uwielbiany przeze mnie klawisz random. Jeśli nie chce nam się myśleć, czym chcemy grać, po prostu go używamy, i już możemy się cieszyć grą. Oczywiście większość kombinacji będzie brała w tyłek chętniej niż Sasha, ale takie uroki łutu szczęścia.

Rozgrywka jest turowa w przyjemnym tego słowa znaczeniu. Większość naszych zdolności i umiejętności zabiera jedną turę na użycie. Niektóre działają natychmiastowo (bez straty tury), inne jeszcze pasywnie odwalają swoją robotę. Każdy krok, atak czy cokolwiek co wymaga od nas co najmniej trzech sekund (tyle mniej więcej patrząc logicznie zabiera akcja) jest traktowane jako jedna tura. Zrozumiałe, przyjemne i intuicyjne. Większość umiejętności tudzież akcji wszelakich jest przypisana do remapowalnych skrótów klawiszowych, nie musimy więc przekopywać się przez megabajty okienek, by znaleźć i użyć to, czego akurat potrzebujemy. Mało tego, część zdolności możemy podpiąć pod wbudowane makra, na przykład nasza postać może sama odpalać automatycznie pole siłowe, jeśli w jej polu widzenia pojawi się potwór. Dzięki temu, mimo turowości, gra jest dynamiczna i umożliwia granie zarówno fanom automatyki jak i klikaczom manualnym. 

Ok, skończyliśmy tworzyć nasze alter ego, schodzimy do podziemi, zabijamy, jest wesoło. Pada nam w końcu jakiś przedmiot. I tu kolejny raz musiałem przetrzeć oczy ze zdumienia. Ilość statystyk, które wpływają na naszą postać jest tak wielka, że najbardziej skomplikowane MMO na świecie (Ultima Online) wzdycha ze wzruszenia patrząc na te przedmioty. Ok, powiem jak to działa. W grze jest 6 statystyk głównych, które wpływają na naszą postać. Ponadto statystyki te rozgałęziają się na kilka pobocznych. Oprócz tego niektóre ze statystyk pobocznych występują jedynie pod postacią zdolności tudzież ekwipunku. Gdzie tu skomplikowanie? Wyobraźmy sobie przedmiot który ma, lekko licząc, dwadzieścia różnych efektów, z czego jeden jest jeszcze do tego czarem, np. kulą ognia, którą możemy użyć, jeśli mamy odpowiednią ilość ładunków w przedmiocie. Niech padnie drugi przedmiot o podobnych statystykach. W tym momencie mamy pauzę na co najmniej minutę, bo porównanie obu przedmiotów trochę zajmuje. Jest niby wbudowany porównywacz, ten jednak pokazuje nam tylko co stracimy, a co zyskamy. Nie wskaże nam który przedmiot jest lepszy, o nie. Gracz decyduje o tym, który itens jest mocniejszy, a który idzie wek do sprzedania. Jeśli do tego dodamy fakt, że większość klas może nosić co najmniej dziesięć przedmiotów (niektóre więcej) + runy zawierające czary spoza naszej klasy + ogromną wręcz ilość lootu, z czego większość jest generowana randomowo = godziny kopania wśród stert tarcz, mieczy i pancerzy. Niektórych to może odrzucać, owszem, ale moim skromnym zdaniem lepsze to niż "+100 obrażeń, załóż koniecznie" co spotkałem już w wielu tytułach.

Gramy kilka godzin już, coś źle zbudowaliśmy, albo zabił nas boss jakimś wyjątkowo szczęśliwym kombosem. Tworzymy nową postać, tym razem inną i... przechodzimy grę bez większych przeszkód. Niestety, ale ToME nie jest zbalansowana. Niektóre klasy są lepsze, inne są gorsze, to normalne, jednak w ToME jest to wyjątkowo widoczne. Przykładowo taki łucznik. Na początku praktycznie zabija jednym strzałem większość potworów, jednak im dłużej się gra tą klasą, tym jest ciężej. Owszem, ma bardzo dobry head start, jednak już w połowie gry zdarzały się bossy, które zabijały mnie od niechcenia. Z kolei przywoływacz [spoiler](swoją drogą, jest to najmocniejsza klasa w grze jeśli chodzi o end game)[/spoiler] ma problemy z przejściem pierwszego podziemia, podczas gdy pod koniec gry jest w stanie samodzielnie niszczyć pomieszczenia wypełnione po brzegi bossami nawet się przy tym nie pocąc. Brak zrównoważenia widać coraz bardziej z każdą nową grą. Owszem, przejść się da każdym jednym setupem, jednak dobór dungeonów do naszego aktualnego poziomu czy ekwipunku będzie się różnić diametralnie. Ba, pod koniec gry może się okazać, że najbardziej papierowa klasa świata jest niezniszcalna, a nasz dopieszczony do granic możliwości woj z tarczą pada na strzał, bo jedyne co umie, to podbiec i uderzyć.

Fabuła jest prosta jak matura. Zło zagraża światu, idź to zabij. Standard. Grę napędzają liczne sub questy, porozrzucane po całym świecie zapiski odnośnie historii Maj'Eyal oraz niezliczona wręcz ilość easter eggów. Dziwnym trafem większość z nich oscyluje dookoła uniwersum Doctor Who, możliwe jest jednak, że nie tylko, a ja danego uniwersum po prostu nie znam. Wracając jednak do zapisków historycznych, naprawdę warto je czytać. Nie dość, że nadają kolorytu temu czarno białemu światu, to jeszcze umożliwiają odblokowywanie dodatkowych zdolności, co znacząco ułatwia grę. Poza tym czyta się je naprawdę przyjemnie. Tak, zdaję sobie sprawę z tego, że większość graczy nie kupuje gry po to, żeby czytać jakąś książkę, ale choć raz wysilcie szare komórki, bo naprawdę warto!

Czas na aspekty techniczne. Muzyka jest przyjemna dla ucha, jednak nie narzuca się, nie jest też jakoś super epicka. Nie usłyszymy chórów ani orkiestr. Efekty dźwiękowe są na przyzwoitym poziomie, jednak po pewnym czasie mogą zwyczajnie nużyć. Grafika jest prosta, czasami jednak nie jesteśmy w stanie na ekranie zobaczyć nic przez natłok drzew, kamieni czy jakichkolwiek innych udziwnień i wodotrysków. Do tego ToME ma uciążliwy zwyczaj odmawiania współpracy i wypierdalania się do systemu (dosłownie. przekleństwo celowe, bo cholera robi to bez ostrzeżenia!) wprost proporcjonalny do czasu spędzonego przy grze. Jeśli gramy ponad dwie godziny, warto zapisywać co ważniejsze wydarzenie, bo istnieje duże prawdopodobieństwo, że programik się zadławi sam sobą i szlag trafi nasz progres.

Osoby, które kupią grę mają dostęp do kilku bardzo przyjemnych aspektów (tzw. donator privileges). Kosmetyczne zmiany wyglądu, nowy tryb rozgrywki "exploration" (w którym nie możemy zginąć. przydatne przy odblokowywaniu klas czy ras) oraz dzielony ze wszystkimi postaciami item vault. To ostatnie jest ultra przydatne.

Słowem końcowym: gra jest warta każdego grosza na nią wydanego. Grywalność wraz z możliwością ponownego przechodzenia bez zasypiania na klawiaturze i staro szkolna rogue-like za śmieszne pieniądze. Brać w ciemno!

author: {'steamid': '76561197982649177', 'num_games_owned': 1142, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 63755, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 161, 'last_played': 1708897010}
review: I think its one of the best RPG games I ever played. The character class/race gives unique strategy, development + within you have to specialize. One of actually two games, where I wrote some reverse engineering statistical analysis program to help me with decisions, based on factors I choose to optimize gameplay. Great replay value. PC + keyboard is a way for demanding entertainment! Plus the thing I like the best, first 5-10 characters die before you reach lvl 20, next die before lvl 30, eventhough its single player you really go through learning curve to beat/discover the game mechanics, which are really balanced.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995718079', 'num_games_owned': 1067, 'num_reviews': 64, 'playtime_forever': 5656, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4486, 'last_played': 1416178950}
review:
I'm not usually a fan of roguelikes, but ToME has won my heart. 

ToME is superbly written: the storyline, dialogs, lore are all fully fleshed out, and even item descriptions are interesting.
ToME's combat is fun: every class is unique and interesting, and each class completely changes the way you play the game. 
But most important of all, the game is well-balanced. Every class can finish the game, and even if you die you don't feel like it was an impossible situation. Oh, did I mention you are given additional lives at specific levels so you can resurrect yourself if you reeeeeeeaaaallly want? I wish more roguelikes had this option, haha.

ToME is a fantastic roguelike and I would recommend it to any fan of the genre.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971883897', 'num_games_owned': 399, 'num_reviews': 56, 'playtime_forever': 1733, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1120, 'last_played': 1696212196}

author: {'steamid': '76561197985366058', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 2318, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2286, 'last_played': 1574987491}
review:
ToME is still one of my favorites and it should be one of your too.  It can be easy to dismiss the game based of the graphical style alone but do not make this mistake!  It is a delightfully painful experience that is very enjoyable!  If you are on the fence or are a little strapped for cash, you can get it for free at te4.org for Windows, Mac, and Linux.  There are a few little things that you get if you purchase it either from Steam or directly from the author though.  But nothing that will make the game any harder.  I bought it on Steam for the Steam Workshop integration.

I espically love that my characters are recorded on TE4 as I play so I can hit my characters page and see what that 1 handed war axe was statted with when i'm thinking through my build.

TL;DR  Get it.  A perfect combination of WoW and Chess.  Thinking is rewarded over twitch reactions.  VERY replayable.  Great Lore.  What else could you ask for?
