author: {'steamid': '76561198000166244', 'num_games_owned': 216, 'num_reviews': 62, 'playtime_forever': 30966, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 845, 'last_played': 1707623828}
review:
This game is FOR FREE at their website.

If you want a deep but easy to play roguelike with massive replayability due to the unique classes available with profound customization for each class. Then look no further. I've never played a game where you can erase the existence of an enemy through temporal powers, become a dragon wielding a massive two handed sword with various dragon-breathes, murder people in their sleep (literally), and even create a small undead army at your disposal. 

This game has been carefully crafted in various ways, for one the grind that's in some games is gone in this game, where shops restock only by your progress into the main campaign and you later get a item that separates what you find from your inventory until you decide to put it in your inventory, then, there's the fact that enemies you face have various tactics. For example, a corruptor can conjure bone sheild that negates all damage for 3 attacks! So if you never invested in a way to deal multiple hits with one attack, you'll have a more difficult time! Then the UI and interface is fully customizable, you can even auto cast spells, such as buffs and take them off your UI!

There are various items that have unique prefix-suffixs stats and effects attached to them, much like diablo or torchlight for example. Many powerful items are guarantied to drop from a boss, (aka a yellow artifact item) and if the item doesn't suite your need, you can store it away for the next character you make to use! If you don't even want to use that item, then you can convert into not just gold, but into energy for a special building you acquire. The progression of this game is really solid and at times depend on your race, as some races level up more slowly, but are innately stronger then others. There are plenty of random events and quests that you can undertake, yet they aren't completely random to the point of unfairness.

The skills and abilities you can acquire are amazing and unique! You can create a gravity mage, or a invincible sword and board user that utilizes deadly counterattacks, or even a summoner where you can sacrifice creatures for various effects or control creatures to make one powerful creature! Then you have player races with unique abilities as well, for example a dwarf can eventually phase through walls, and a ghoul that can basically throw up on the ground that damages enemies and heals you! Last you have prodigies that are power and unique feats you acquire later on in the game, for example you can have a effect where an attack will kill you, but you'll save yourself from death, while slowly losing life to the point where if you don't heal you'll actually die!

The main story is quite interesting and there's a ton of lore that you'll find and is quite deep. Some of this lore can help you find secrets through-out the world and clear up some of the strangest things you'll encounter... There are various difficulties available, so you can have a more casual experience by not losing your hero after he dies, or a more hardcore one where you have one life to live with stronger enemies! There are also various other adventures you can have, without downloading anything extra, for example you can enter into a arena if you just want some good old action, or if you want to have the old experience where it's just you and a dungeon, then you can enter into the infinite dungeon and never look back!

In fact, I never looked back after playing this game, and never regretted it. There are plenty of games that are not worth your money or time, and this not one of them due to the quality of the mechanics and diversity of character crafting.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025468901', 'num_games_owned': 2460, 'num_reviews': 532, 'playtime_forever': 68325, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 481, 'last_played': 1710982352}
review:
What do you dream of being?
A master of magic? A ruler of undead? A scholar of alchemy? Protector of the weak?
A pugilist? A tricksy sneaksy type?
A time lord?

All this and much much more is possible in Tales of Maj'Eyal.
It does not disappoint.
Get the game.

Update:
My kid is now 8 years old.
I was explaining some of the prodigies in this game to him.
Now my 8 year old runs around grabbing imaginary bad guys, and shrieks "YOU SHALL BE MY WEAPON".
I love this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197968127224', 'num_games_owned': 933, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 560, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 174, 'last_played': 1668134563}

author: {'steamid': '76561197964043562', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 398588, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1558, 'last_played': 1673666966}
review: YES!  ToME is finally on steam!  If you have never played this game, you can download a copy to try at te4.org.  If you enjoy tactical RPGs and rogue-likes, forget trying it, just go buy it, now.  I have been playing this game since about halfway through its beta, and its truly an amazing game.  Punishingly hard if you are careless, but rewards those who learn to really use the abilities of their character.  And oh, the abilities.  Pick one of the 24 (!) classes (fewer at first--you have to unlock the advanced classes through gameplay; this is a good thing, as you would get slaughtered playing these classes as a new player!) and pick one of the 9 races (again, some require unlocks).  These combine to determine which ability groups you get to put points into.  And points can be scarce--pretty much all character classes can be played 2 or 3 different ways, and some can be done 4 or more different ways, depending upon how you spread your points around.  Add in a mostly-fixed overland map with mostly-procedurally generated dungeons and some tough boss and miniboss fights and an amazingly varied loot system...and you've got a game with frightening levels of replayability.  And for good measure, add a developer (All hail DarkGod!) who listens to feedback, talks with his players on the forums, and seems to spend more time than is physically posible working on the game.  (Maybe he is a Chronomancer?)  What are you waiting for?

author: {'steamid': '76561198080646214', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 2644, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 131, 'last_played': 1571284483}
review: Greatest roguelike in a big time! Lot of options to build your character even inside only one of its classes! Nice places to explore and unlock new skills, races, classes...T.O.M.E. is awesome! A have to play game for sure!

author: {'steamid': '76561197998648643', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 161, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 155, 'last_played': 1387684803}
review: A great roguelike. It's easily the most accessible "classic" roguelike, with features like no hunger system, Diablo-esque prefix/suffix focused loot, auto-loot-selling, persistent unlockables, etc. It's free on the official ToME website but considering how big the game is, the developer certainly deserves a few bucks.

author: {'steamid': '76561198008878974', 'num_games_owned': 565, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 2361, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 482, 'last_played': 1572721658}
review: Get Dungeons of Dredmor instead, much more fun

author: {'steamid': '76561198065933198', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 2544, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 519, 'last_played': 1567967784}
review:
Best Roguelike since Dungeon Crawl: Stone Soup.
Stone Soup set the bar and Tales of Maj'Eyal has been the ONLY one to surpass it in my opinion.

I am extremely impressed with the level of character customization. Most RPG's give you "choice," but if you don't "choose" one of three builds, you die. In Maj'Eyal I feel like I can actually build a unique and powerful character.

So yes, as someone who is very disappointed in the state of today's Roguelikes, I am happy to think of all the hours I'll be putting into this one.

author: {'steamid': '76561197982121255', 'num_games_owned': 946, 'num_reviews': 60, 'playtime_forever': 173, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 153, 'last_played': 1616783826}
review:
One of the finest roguelikes ever created; I'm really happy to see this on Steam, and more than happy to support it by buying a copy having been a freebie player for years.

Massive depth in character creation and customization, a huge amount of variety and a vast campaign to work through will keep you busy for years -- yet at the same time excellent tutorials and helpful on-screen feedback mean you'll never feel like the game is withholding information from you. And with Steam Workshop support, adding mods to the game and tweaking it to your own tastes is easier than ever.

If you've only recently come to the genre through stuff like Dungeons of Dredmor, FTL and Rogue Legacy, do yourself a favour and check this out -- you won't regret it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198072074106', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1765, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 591, 'last_played': 1640479331}
review: I love this game!  ToME is probably my most-played game of the last year or so, and for good reason.  It is challenging and rewards sound strategy.  The mythology is rich and ever-growing, and the community that has sprung up around the game is the sort of environment that fosters cooperation and creativity.  Thank you, DarkGod, for making this game so rewarding!

author: {'steamid': '76561198027889509', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 87, 'playtime_forever': 15173, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2407, 'last_played': 1672440813}
review: Tales of Maj'Eyal is a fantastic roguelike. As a roguelike its simple to learn and also have complexity. A skill system akin to Diablo 2 allows unique character builds within classes. Skills have cooldowns, this works very well in the turn based structure especially combined with effects that effect cooldown time. Inventory management is simple to use and relatively limited item slots create thoughtful decisions. As a long term player of roguelikes I highly recommend Tales of Maj'Eyal to beginners and roguelike veterans alike.

author: {'steamid': '76561198095815247', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 815, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 756, 'last_played': 1416337142}
review: The difficulty should be fixed a bit for balanced.  gets super harder around lvl 10, but im still a nub so its gunna take some time.  I like this dungeon exploraction, worth the value.   Variety of Classes tooo.

author: {'steamid': '76561198028151484', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 9345, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 391, 'last_played': 1699232592}
review:
Tales of Maj'Eyal is for those of us who cannot say no to a challenge. The combat mechanics is very intricate and there are thousands of combinations. There are many classes and races to choose from. Each class is sculpted in such a way that no one class will feel the same as the other. There's also an amazing and rich lore behind the game that you find as you explore its many dungeons. 

If you are into roguelikes or just want a challenge, then this is definitely one game you won't want to miss!

author: {'steamid': '76561197996608410', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 8769, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 705, 'last_played': 1672666038}
review: Awesome rogue-like game with incredible replayability with different characters!

author: {'steamid': '76561198013394335', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 591, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 17, 'last_played': 1704617746}
review: im sooo bad at thiz game vbut i love it!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198022720658', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 4382, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1013, 'last_played': 1518230014}
review: The thing about this game, apart from the fact that it's awesome, is that it can appeal to any skill level and ease you into its depth, unlike many other rogue-likes out there.  Perhaps it's just me, but I barely had to look anything up.  Everything is well laid out and there are plenty of tool tips to explain everything.  The UI is fantastic and the game even runs on my netbook.  There are also difficulty settings to grant either permadeath or a more forgiving "lives" system that you gain extra lives as you level up, or even no death at all (but no achievements either).  Overall, I'm blown away so far and can easily see myself spending dozens if not hundreds of hours playing every single class... And the fact that you slowly unlock classes as you play is brilliant.  Now I know why this won rogue-like of the year a few times in a row.  Buy it because these games need the support!

author: {'steamid': '76561198003532218', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 8735, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 951, 'last_played': 1586255413}
review: I'm playing this game 1.5 year. And i can say: this game best that can give you roguelike genre.

author: {'steamid': '76561198050955580', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 2230, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 409, 'last_played': 1702826651}
review: Amazing rogue like game recommend to everyone who like rpg rogue like.

author: {'steamid': '76561197996115673', 'num_games_owned': 800, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 7546, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1595, 'last_played': 1660603822}
review:
The sheer amount of builds and possible outcomes of each game is ridiculous, and far more expansive than I had imagined.

If you're a fan of roguelikes and are in need of something to kill time, this is THE game. It's hard to fight at a $6 price tag as well.

author: {'steamid': '76561197966984155', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 7740, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2075, 'last_played': 1418949682}
review:
I'm a big fan of Roguelkes, but I was always put off by some of the obscure concepts of the core gameplay. This game takes all the good of the roguelike, the difficulty, the random levels, the classes and all that- And combines it with a solid interface, good music, and an astoundingly fleshed out world.

If you like roguelikes, if you're curious about them, or if you just want a good strategy game/RPG, you'd be a fool not to get this.

author: {'steamid': '76561197978895588', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 2017, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1503, 'last_played': 1506437386}
review:
If you're a fan of old-school, roguelike RPG's then you can't go wrong with this. Maddeningly addictive, brutally difficult and with a whole host of unlockable and interesting 'DnD' style classes, each greatly varying in playstyle.

By the looks of it, there's potentially a lot of gameplay here too outside of the typical “die, replay new game” flow common with roguelikes. So far I’ve not managed to get a character past level 14 without having them killed and then auto-deleted, and that’s after sinking a good 19 hours into the game. Each time a character has died however, I’ve usually found myself instantly firing up a new game, stubbornly adamant that I’ll get further this time or with a different class (I say “instantly”, there’s always that brief period of time spent just staring at the screen after a death thinking “Shiiiit! I knew I should have been more careful….Shiiiiiiiit!”).

Classes, game modes and special perks can be earned and unlocked for current and future playthroughs by completing quests or accessing certain areas, helping keep your interest in the game after a heavy loss.

All in all, totally worth £6 I’d say, provided you’re prepared from some serious jimmy rustling somewhere down the line (to the likes Dark Souls has never seen)!

author: {'steamid': '76561198019889233', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 13576, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 507, 'last_played': 1693758166}
review:
this is the great hidden gem of PC gaming, the best game i have played in years... in a world of pick up and put down mediocrity this is a true classic that can remind each and everyone of us why we love video games. It clearly demonstrates the level of quality and depth that is possible in a game release when a game is given the ongoing development attention it truly deserves.

You know that feeling you get when you look at the list of your steam games and feel 'meh, been there done that, what shall i play?' - with TOME in the list you have one title that will always scream 'PLAY ME, THERE IS MORE TO SEE, MORE TO LEARN, MORE TO LOVE'.

after over 350 hours with TOME (almost all before the steam release) I still keep going back once i get bored with everything else i try..... it's the game that keeps on giving! (and keeps on growing thanks to DarkGod - the dev - and the community's amazing dedication).

author: {'steamid': '76561198028096441', 'num_games_owned': 550, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 3824, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 824, 'last_played': 1676841307}
review: Probably one of the best (graphically and depth wise) roguelikes out today, and is unbeatable at a price of either free from te4.org or for $5.99. Seriously, at least try it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998401960', 'num_games_owned': 333, 'num_reviews': 62, 'playtime_forever': 8112, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2734, 'last_played': 1626655842}
review: Great roguelike with modern sensibilities!

author: {'steamid': '76561197993367516', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 293, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 144, 'last_played': 1414440786}
review: The roguelike that plays more like an RPG. Great, deep class building and turn based combat.  I dont normally like roguelikes, they seem sadisitic and needlessly opaque.  TOME avoids these issues by being complex, but fair.  It also builds a world with interesting missions and situations, plus a grognard charm in tweaking complex builds and classes.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998935093', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 412, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 320, 'last_played': 1454139890}
review:
One of the best Rougue-like games. It's very beginner friendly, and is a great example of the genre as a whole. It has a lot of depth without being overly complicated. You can actually play this game for FREE if you download it from their website. The code is publically available and will be free forever. Steam is mearly allowing people to purchase a donator version of the game. The game is easily worth the cost. And admittidly I may have accidently bought this game twice-- once on the website and once on steam.

(This game has given a full wage to the game creators by donations before it went onto steam. It's that good.)

author: {'steamid': '76561198045926331', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 65, 'playtime_forever': 7182, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6105, 'last_played': 1597214521}
review: Super addictive awesome roguelike. By far the best roguelike I have played in a long time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030845622', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 128876, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 563, 'playtime_at_review': 6165, 'last_played': 1712184408}
review: So many skill combinations to mix and enjoy. My favourite roguelike.

author: {'steamid': '76561197996697965', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 3515, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2729, 'last_played': 1402002180}
review:
This game is fantastic.  For the price you can't beat what the game offers.  Tons of races and classes.  Incredibly indepth RPG elements.  Fantastic difficulty that punishes you for your mistakes and is otherwise balanced.  A nice soundtrack with immersive audio like birds chirping or dogs barking in the distance.  The game is also entirely randomized so no playthrough is the same as the one previous, except for story events.

Tales of Maj'Eyal is singleplayer but with a built in chat so you can talk to other people who are currently playing.

For the price no one should write this gem off.

For anyone wanting to see this game in action you can catch my stream at Twitch.tv/Kojinto :)

author: {'steamid': '76561197993052244', 'num_games_owned': 1602, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 55460, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1166, 'last_played': 1701425233}
review: This is absolutely one of my favorite games of all time. Message me if you want to know more, but basically it's one of the best RPG / roguelike experiences you can get today.

author: {'steamid': '76561198019046323', 'num_games_owned': 958, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 1038, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 626, 'last_played': 1704424563}
review:
I have played ToME off and on for years.. and would like to tell you how great it is to see this on Steam finally.  This game is an RPG players dream, so so complex and sort of complicated.  Has three settings, Adventure which is limited lives, Rogue which is true one life play, and then some other setting I really hope you don't play on which has unlimited lives. 

 The world is pretty massive, with towns and dungeons and random events, some based on your stats I beleive. The fact that races and classes, which are plentiful, are unlocked by completeing quests and achievments is MORE then enough to make you want to play this all night.

 I can't think of a single rpg that offers anywhere near the amount of content and playtime for the price.  Playing every race and class and getting to the end game would take months or years.. 

 Anyone who loves old school RPGs will be very pleased. 9 / 10  (not counting graphical fidelity)  This is pure gameplay my friends.

author: {'steamid': '76561197973018598', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 16684, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 549, 'last_played': 1690936624}
review:
Wow. If you have any love whatsoever for old-school roguelikes, Tales of Maj'Eyal cleans up lots of the muck and interface insanity and delivers one of the most polished, fun and narrative takes on the genre. 

Unlock wonderfully awesome classes like the chronomancer, and as you accomplish feats in the game, you earn persistant loot, characters, and modes that will be with you every time you roll a new char. 

Play it on "roguelike" difficulty to stick with one life (unless you find a way to cheat death in-game) to get a difficult but fair challenge. 

Steam workshop is enabled for the game, and there are several community mods and enhancements already available, so you can add scenarios, classes and more should you want. 

Also, on sale!! <brain explode>

author: {'steamid': '76561197992626204', 'num_games_owned': 292, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 6611, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1216, 'last_played': 1594580349}
review:
Hot diggity dang, the best roguelike out there.
Also available for free from te4.org

author: {'steamid': '76561197990042335', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 825, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 77, 'last_played': 1489892836}

author: {'steamid': '76561197977719891', 'num_games_owned': 1315, 'num_reviews': 190, 'playtime_forever': 509, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 257, 'last_played': 1690313985}
review: One of my all time favorite roguelikes, which finally made its appearance on steam! The crazy amount of deep character progression, classes, items, lore and overall mechanics will make you play this game not only for hours, but for month!

author: {'steamid': '76561197989931461', 'num_games_owned': 3023, 'num_reviews': 66, 'playtime_forever': 23086, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1394, 'last_played': 1474529088}
review: my favorite rougelike since dungeons of dredmor. this is a more "traditional" RL, with tons of depth and character customization. be warned, the interface is absolutely painful to operate, but if you can struggle through the UI youll find a game that will suck you in and keep you coming back for just one more turn. this is the first RL since i guess DAngband that has captivated me to this degree. HIGHLY RECOMMENDED.

author: {'steamid': '76561197980003202', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 6292, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1972, 'last_played': 1707958679}
review: I played this game a few years ago and when I saw it pop up on steam, I had to get it. It successfully mixes roguelike gameplay with old style CRPG gameplay. There are tons of unique items all with there own descriptions and graphics. Combat is turnbased and the skill/magic system actually works kind of like World of Warcraft. Things are on a cooldown system and combat is very stragetic. The one down side to this game is it takes a while to learn. When you start out, you only have 3 or 4 classes you can use. As you progress through the game, more classes will unlock when you complete certain quests or achievements. I would recommend this game for any fans of RPGS or roguelikes.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998049795', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 621, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 111, 'last_played': 1678477021}
review:
You will die. You will probably die a lot. With that said, the game is honestly quite fun and almost entirely fair. Fairness in a Roguelike is, of course, a bit subjective, but you will very rarely run into dead before you know what hit you situations. For those of you who aren't into the "One Life to Live" concept of Roguelikes, there is a mode that lets you have extra lives at set points so that dire badger isn't the end of your career.

The classes are varied and each have their unique flair, transparency in mobs is pretty great even though there'll still be a learning curve here or there and it has a ridiculous amount of achievements for those who thrive on that.

author: {'steamid': '76561197992052736', 'num_games_owned': 2354, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 13106, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 887, 'last_played': 1696006538}
review:
One of the best Roguelike's ever made.I have played it off and on for over a year and it just keeps getting better with every version.  I am very happy that it made it onto Steam because it gives a lot of people who do not keep up with the Roguelike's a chance to find and enjoy it.

If you like turn-based rpg's  ,Roguelike's ,or just plan good games you need to give this one a try.  It is easy to play and you can learn the basics in an hour but you will still be learning new things after hundreds of hours.

author: {'steamid': '76561198000618498', 'num_games_owned': 333, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 61671, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1409, 'last_played': 1695155432}
review:
One of the most entertaining and well done rogue-likes I've played in a long time. The UI is understandable, there's tooltips for pretty much everything - In essence everything missing from a lot of rogue-likes. And that is just the shinies - The game itself is very deep as well. 

There's a very well made 'story' mode (it is HARD the first 100 times you try :)) and you will quickly unlock the regular rogue-like endless dungeon (which can also be accessed by a story-mode character once you've completed the story).

There's tons of races and classes, a lot of which needs to be unlocked from playing the story - They classes play very differently, with huge scope for customization, so almost endless replayability.

I could go on - This is probably one of my most played games of all time - If you have ANY love for rogue-likes - Or looking to try one that is easy to get into - this is the game for you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198023822431', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 6993, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 707, 'last_played': 1680540194}
review:
A very fun, old-style roguelike with lots of places to explore, quests to find and do and things to unlock.  It has a good amount of felxibility in the permadeath department as well, ranging from Eploration (unlimited lives) to Roguelike (when they die, they die for good) with a bit of a middle ground which lets you earn extra lives at various levels.

The ability bar and cooldown system, which does away with consumables like potions in favor of reusable abilities which grant regeneration, bonuses to defense, mana restoration or a number of other things, is a very welcome addition and streamlines things nicely, so you can easily activate your special abilities and know where you stand on how long until it can be used again at a glance.

I'm very impressed with it and looking forward to exploring the secrets of Maj'Eyal.

author: {'steamid': '76561198017555105', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 1174, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 518, 'last_played': 1677299412}
review: "It's not all about the graphics." We've all heard it before. Well this game is a true testament to that. I was not expecting what I got out of this. Plenty of class options and with unlocks, more class options than I even know what to do with. More than enough race options. TONS of skills to choose from. Loot galore that even changes how your character looks (I know this is important to some, myself included). You can play traditional roguelike with permadeath, semi-roguelike with limited revives, and adventure mode with as many revives as you want. With the character progression, large world, varied quests, and enemies everywhere, I can't stop playing. This game is easily worth the money.

author: {'steamid': '76561197978579802', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 1497, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 770, 'last_played': 1624989001}
review: I've played quite a few roguelikes, and ToME sets a new standard.  There's a tremendous amount of depth, both in character/skill customization and equipment buildouts. Custom tileset support, modding, and access to the underlying game engine just happen to be gravy.  Plus, Linux!

author: {'steamid': '76561197967232347', 'num_games_owned': 348, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 5740, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 972, 'last_played': 1588761618}
review: Quite possibly the greatest Rogue-like ever made, a necessary purchase for fan's of the genre.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042890140', 'num_games_owned': 2486, 'num_reviews': 85, 'playtime_forever': 3150, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 66, 'last_played': 1562435415}
review: One of the best Roguelikes I've ever played.  Great story, wonderful customization, beautiful graphics, and deep, powerful lore.  You can be anything from a greatsword swining Berserker, to a Wrymling who can summon the power of Dragons, a psychic, a time mage, and much more.  There is so much customization and attention to detail, that Maj'Eyal is truly one of those games where words don't do it justice.  You have to experience its majesty for yourself.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998625067', 'num_games_owned': 807, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 2720, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 230, 'last_played': 1552508991}
review: A brilliant roguelike if you're not quite ready to go balls deep into something like Nethack but still want that hardcore feel. Make no mistake - tome is hardcore, but still retains enough elements for beginners to ease into. Be prepared to take your time and learn all the keybindings, though.

author: {'steamid': '76561197969743933', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 87704, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3319, 'last_played': 1648097449}
review:
One of the greatest rogue-like games of all.
And the first rogue-like with a complex combat system.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995946862', 'num_games_owned': 563, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 72, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 35, 'last_played': 1465771743}
review:
Great Roguelike.  Tons of variety in the classes and races really keeps multiple playthroughs fresh.  The overarching progress of unlocking classes and mid/end game bonuses gives a good sense of progress even if you never beat it.

Bit easier then Dungeon Crawl Stone Soup and plays quite a bit differently.

Of course, this is free so no need to buy on steam unless you just want to support or get those steam cheevos.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993213814', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 85252, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3675, 'last_played': 1526600628}
review:
I have been playing Tales of Maj'Eyal (TOME4) for years and I have quite enjoyed it.  Very few games have staying power for me anymore even to the point of completing them before moving on.  I have played through TOME4 several times now completely and have in excess of 200+ attempts :)

I highly recommend it for Roguelike players and for more casual players as there are quite a few configurations that will allow you to decide at what difficulty level you wish to play.

The truly amazing thing, in my mind, about this game is that it deviates from the commercial (fighter/caster/cleric) mindset.  Each class is a very different experience and interesting experience with a wide variety of powers and options.

This is one of the very few games that I see myself still playing in the years to come.  For this price and the amount of content, this game is a steal.

review: My absolute favorite roguelike. And thats saying a lot, because i've played just about all of them. ToME is deep and completely packed with content, and without some of the typical roguelike mechanics such as hunger, has a much more fast paced and exciting form of tactical gameplay. I've probably logged hundreds of hours into this game over the past two years or so; at the price requested, it's a steal.

author: {'steamid': '76561197965082220', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1307, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1284, 'last_played': 1582725852}

author: {'steamid': '76561198039662270', 'num_games_owned': 945, 'num_reviews': 124, 'playtime_forever': 60318, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 16922, 'last_played': 1697003945}
review:
(09/10) - Near Perfection

I struggled guys.... i struggled.

Not inside the game, but on this rating.
The game is just perfect. It has such a depth that it can easily hold up against modern tripple A RPG´s.
I wish some other games took some advise from thisone, heck even civilisation has less depth than this game.
So, why only 9 points you ask? Well... i wish i could give 10. And i honestly would for myself, but some people may argue this:
It´s the same stuff you play through all the time.
And it is. The dungeons don´t change (at least their names and their bosses. The dungeons themselfes are still randomly generated) and it is always the same order of stuff you have to do.

I spend nearly 300 hours in this game and never got tired of it. But still: 9 points for being the best RPG i know, thus being the best roguelike i know thus being one of the best games on steam.
For this rediculous price (it´s actually free if you want to play it on it´s homepage) i have no fucking clue why anyone would not pick up this game, other than being scared by it´s graphics.

review:

Also, I'm not sure how much longer the release sale will be but even then, it's still worth the price of admission!

President Skroob - Leader of Spaceballs

author: {'steamid': '76561198045197278', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 88, 'playtime_forever': 8633, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 507, 'last_played': 1479613490}
review:
I'm totally blown away by how fun and how well made this game is.  Small price, small download size, but BIG fun!  It's a nice looking tile set roguelike RPG with a tactical turn-based combat system.  I suggest not using the 'auto-explore' feature so you can get the sense of actually lurking around and wondering what's around the corner, or behind the next door.  Surprisingly enough, you'll come face to face with rare mobs on a fairly regular basis with nice loot, but they're not just going to hand them over to you.  No Siry Bob....you'll have to take it from his/her/it's cold-dead, clawing/oozing/hairy or whatever type of hand.
Lots of choices on the type of character you want to play, and you actually unlock more options of all kinds to make your next play characters even better or to try something completely different.  Don't worry, you'll be playing more characters you can count on it.  You can only die so many times, if at all, before your character goes bye-bye to the beyond.  Just use his death as a great excuse to try out that new unlocked race/class/gear or whatever.
Anyways, try it out, I'm sure some of you will be caught off-guard by how fun and good the game is for it's download size and price as I mentioned.
Oh and forgot to say something for achievement fans.  There's slightly over 1,200 achievements in the game, so I'm sure that will tickle your fancy.

author: {'steamid': '76561198008431653', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 4380, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1628, 'last_played': 1554952278}
review: A traditional turn-based dungeon crawler, without all of the traditional dungeon crawler inconveniences and inherent shortcomings. No consumable hoarding, no grinding, no unmanagable interfaces, tons of hotkeys available for you to bind, a mouse gesture binding feature, tons of races and classes to start and even more to unlock, the list goes on. Definitely worth the modest price if you're an existing roguelike fan or are interested in the genre.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007989951', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 58, 'playtime_forever': 3149, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 384, 'last_played': 1670326168}
review:
This is a really good game, with tons and tons of content. I didn't know that you could get a lite (basically full) version of this for free, but i was super happy to pay for this, its cheap as chips anyway.

Right, so I love roguelikes. This is a more hardcore roguelike. My favorite roguelike is Dungeons of Dredmor which is a little less hardcore than average, but is still worthy of praise. 

The only hurdle you need to get over is the visual style. Look at the screenshots. What you see is what you get; and i LOVE it!!!

Sounds, music, sound effects, visual styles, ui, all sweet.

It's a challenging, strategic and super super deep game.

If you like roguelikes and you like the screenshots. Buy it. You will not be disappointed.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970583085', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 732, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 732, 'last_played': 1387115007}
review: OMG, that game came out of nowhere and hit me hard. This is addictive as hell, challenging, unforgiving and so well designed. Really cant find anything negative to say about it right now. Reminds me of my youth when I was playing all these classic SSI RPGs - a shame today everything turns out being so vanilla so this one here really shines...

author: {'steamid': '76561198017660848', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 83, 'playtime_forever': 529, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 312, 'last_played': 1565093533}
review: Highly recommend this to ANY roguelike fan, or someone looking for a grand adventure they can fully customize. Tales of Maj'Eyal is a game brimming with content, depth, and hard work. In the character creation screen alone you will see how many races and classes are offered to you from the start, let alone unlockable through various quests and gameplay. Speaking of gameplay, it's everything you could ask for in a roguelike. Plays super easily, and one quick tutorial will get you ready to take on the world. There's so much to discover and try out, you will get an enormous value out of this game. Definitely give it a shot!

author: {'steamid': '76561198045354604', 'num_games_owned': 220, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1067, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 186, 'last_played': 1425735269}
review:
This is such a deep, challenging, engrossing and replayable game. There really aren't enough games like this in the world! A really excellent roguelike, with a great UI and a lot of the chaff cut out. It's very combat centric, but with a believable world and a lot of great gameplay options. Rather importantly the designer has not been afraid to throw out poor features - potions are replaced by limited cooldowns, hunger clock doesn't exist, no item identification, etc. It's so focussed, and because it's so focussed it goes into extreme depth in producing a complex and interesting experience.

There's a good reason this has won Roguelike of the Year for many years running - it's simply the best there is, in a class of its own. There are lots of other great roguelikes of course, but there's only one ToME.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004053899', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 154, 'playtime_forever': 6603, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 451, 'last_played': 1631986740}
review:
Take a roguelike and a modern game, put them together in a blender, and what do you get? ToME: Classic turn-based fantasy mixed with modern features such as highly impressive graphical effects, achievements, content unlocking, etc.

While it doesn't go beyond the usual set of boring fantasy races, it DOES have a massive selection of classes that act in extremely different ways to each other. Even the default fighter (called a Bulwark) isn't even close to the usual "bump until it dies" fighter of other roguelikes.

Even if you're new to the genre, ToME can be a good way to get yourself in with optional lower difficulties. If you're an old hand, the variety of classes and the optional higher difficulties can still give you a challenge.

Even though the game is free on te4.org, $8 is a complete steal for a game with this much replay value.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970644409', 'num_games_owned': 6457, 'num_reviews': 130, 'playtime_forever': 282, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 87, 'last_played': 1418982874}
review:
[b]Tales of Maj'Eyal[/b]
Rating: 6 / 10

Dived into this for about 2 hours, and it drops you in a rogue-like sprite-based fantasy world with quests, monsters, loot and a huge amount of achievements to be scored. Got through the first few screens and solved a few quests but still no achievement. It plays and feels like a standard game, nothing really special but I suppose I only scratched the surface because the potential is there. Expect no quick rewards but a lot of depth and width in options and the rewards you get from digging in.

For this price you can have a lot of hours full of exploration and fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041158407', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 63614, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 164, 'last_played': 1665451949}

author: {'steamid': '76561197971484038', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 76, 'playtime_forever': 1016, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 231, 'last_played': 1500914120}
review: A roguelike that's actually fun and where you get to do cool things and find cool treasures and beat up cool monsters instead of constantly wondering "oh i guess I died because I didn't raw blink the Hara-Kiri Rock with the flap-jaw space tuning fork?"

author: {'steamid': '76561198019126252', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 2277, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 111, 'last_played': 1708573821}
review:
Tales of Maj'Eyal is a roguelike with modern design.  Rather than being a simple dungeon crawler, it's a full-fledged RPG that plays like a roguelike - with more options for character building and more things to do.  Playing the game unlocks new races and classes to play, so permadeath isn't just a penalty, but a feature that lets you play something new and exciting.  Every race and class plays differently, so you will rarely lack for new things to do.

Bottom line: beneath the seemingly simple veneer is a great game that's more than worth your time and money.

author: {'steamid': '76561198009516676', 'num_games_owned': 1622, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 13218, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 479, 'last_played': 1639891212}
review: ToME is what roguelikes should aspire to be. It's enormously complete, with tons of content, creative and an absolute bundle of fun. Although the graphics may seem primitive, the enormous, randomly generated gameworld and quests are easily going to give you a run for your money. The progression system is fair, and allows you to learn the game before giving you access to more complex, tactically challenging classes. Easily one of my favorite releases this year.

author: {'steamid': '76561198002511695', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 4691, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 313, 'last_played': 1698722422}
review: first of all, if you are interested in this go to the main site and download it for FREE! the difference between this paid version and the free is miniscule and let me tell you why. You get custom tiles that look cool but really nothing more then just a cosmetic thing. Exploration mode which just gives you infinate lives while nice! it sorta (in my opinion) takes away what makes a roguelike fun and thats perma death. The items vault that lets you share a small amount of items between character, i wont lie is nice but again isnt game breaking what so ever You also get ONE class a stone warden defensive class that only dwarves can use, while pretty nice is just but one class compared to the 26 classes you can already unlock and use in the free versin.  Now about the game itself! This game has a beautiful UI with custom nice looking icons for every thing, a DETAILED and easy to understand leveling system with talent points you can spend on a mix of features unique to EVERY(26) CLASS, a more common tree avalible to other classes, and stat points which you gain every level and distribute as you see fit. There is also a large amount of magical equipment drops with a balenced but wide variety of stats and effects to keep things interesting with your lewt! The best thing i love about ToME is that unlike most other roguelikes there is a variety of places to explore from dungeons to sand caves or  crystal caverns and theives dens! There are many other locations spread throughout the game world for you to find and explore. Some of the places you explore may unlock additional classes/races! did i mention the unlocks? yeah theres a lot and there nice. So i hope you read and this and found something you like from my review and decide to give this wonderful game a try.

author: {'steamid': '76561198046102786', 'num_games_owned': 599, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 19850, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 1240, 'playtime_at_review': 10, 'last_played': 1711752338}

author: {'steamid': '76561198034199687', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 332, 'playtime_forever': 1788, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 89, 'last_played': 1557530421}
review:
-Nice graphical (beginner-friendly) roguelike RPG with a lot of playing value-

I already loved the old version which was based in Tolkien's middle-earth and played like angband. The story has since been moved to a new campaign world. Also the classic scroll/potion-mechanic was traded in for a different system of cooldown abilities. Combat was overhauled for a faster streamlined experience -no farming, mobs don't respawn. Good for beginners although hardcore roguelike-veterans might miss typical roguelike chaos. Unlike other roguelikes the number of realistic interactions is low so you will not dip a rod in a potion or throw a ring in a sink here. No need to memorize 10000 key binds. Everything is already identified. The focus clearly lies on fighting monsters and straight action. Complexity is achieved by balancing your equipment, stats, and abilities + tactical fighting + knowing when to fight or run. 

Some features:
The game is as deadly as most roguelikes however permadeath can be switched off, too. Many advanced races and classes can be unlocked by actions in the game so there is always a reason to start the game anew and try a different combination. There is a built-in chat/news flash so you can read if another player gets wasted, hehe. High-Scores, Mods. Procedurally generated dungeons, static over-world with some dungeons/events randomly placed.

So:
I can recommend the game for most roguelike RPG fans - you can still download the full game for free and play it, then decide to donate or buy on steam if you liked it so you can't lose really.

author: {'steamid': '76561197981902876', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 12380, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4782, 'last_played': 1632776206}
review:
Don't be fooled by its looks, this game is great, deep and has a lot of content to offer.

This was the first roguelike I've dived into. It has a good tutorial mode to get into the game and the genre itself. 
Thanks to its visuals it's a lot more accessible than other good roguelikes. This was one of the major advantages for choosing this title over other roguelikes. 

The fact that this game is also really fun and rewarding also helps. :)

Of course you'll start out like any other RPG. You'll receive your quest and do what you want. Once you stand on the world map for the first time though it's up to you what you want to do.

You can unlock so much different classes, races and other things like an underground fortress to call as your home, trying out new classes, builds, racial combinations, you name it. Permadeath is no punishment, it's an opportunity to change your game once again.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994104846', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 946, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 250, 'last_played': 1648552507}
review: Das wichtigste zu erst, das Spiel ist jeden Cent wert. Ihr habt die Möglichkeit es umsonst zu spielen indem ihr es auf der Webseite runterladet. Die heruntergeladene Version ist eine Vollversion (Ihr könnt das komplette Spiel durchspielen) bei der einige nice features fehlen wie z.b der Tresor mit dem ihr Items zwischen Charakteren hin und her bringen könnt, Custom Skins, der Unendlich Modus (wie der name schon sagt ein Modus mit unendlich viel leben, dient hauptsächlich dem zusammentragen von story logs ohne angst haben zu müssen das man stirbt) und natürlich die Stone Warden Klasse die mit zwei Schilden kämpft (sehr geil). Diese features erhält man indem man auf der Seite eine Donation an DarkGod macht oder indem man hier auf Steam kauft was einem zusätzlich das Steamtech UI und die wunderbaren 1225 Errungenschaften bringt :)) die ihr alle liebt. Jetzt zum Spiel Rogue Like wie mans gern hat viel strategie in den kämpfen tolle charakter klassen von Alchemist (hat Golem dabei) bis Guardian (Schild Schlag Baby) ist alles dabei was man erwartet mit unterschiedlichen Rassen und Klassen abhängigen Talentbäumen und Geschichten. Es gibt jede Menge zu entdecken und jede menge Monster zu töten. Nicht zu vergessen die andern Spielmodi |Arena *was man in der Arena so macht*|,| Roguelike *ein Leben*| und der Adventure Modus *hier gibt es bei bestimmten Charakterleveln ein leben zum vergeuden hinzu.Für 6 Euro grenzt es an Diebstahl :)) Wenn ihr unschlüssig seid kann ich euch nur empfehlen die Gratis Version auf der Tome4 Webseite runterzuladen das Spiel anzutesten und danach zuzuschlagen,auf Steam, ihr werdet es nicht bereuen, viel Spass beim sterben. Ich werde darüber ja im Chat informiert (achja ihr könnt mit andern Spielern online chatten unn euch daran erfreuen wenn wieder jemand seinen char über die Klinge springen gelassen hat, oder mit euren Items prahlen ) so ich muss weitermachen und DarkGod Heldenleichen gegen den Thron schmeissen.

author: {'steamid': '76561198016555066', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 33843, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5, 'last_played': 1674532789}
review:
Insanely deep tactical roguelike. Each class feels unique and interesting. A complete experience, yet still receiving updates & support.

Single-player game but in-game IRC allows you to talk to and share with the other players. Fun community, too. 

Oh! And mods! So many mods. I've got a few published, even. Kinda proud of 'em.

author: {'steamid': '76561198016521665', 'num_games_owned': 406, 'num_reviews': 72, 'playtime_forever': 22478, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 55, 'last_played': 1630224103}
review:
디아블로3가 가야했어야할 진정한방향을 제시하는게임

핵앤슬래시/아이템수집/캐릭터 성장에 완벽히 집중하는데 성공한 게임

다양한 아이템의 활용은 적지만 전장을 넓게사용하는 반턴제의 전투는 전략적인 플레이를 가능케하며 
또한 각 클래스는 일반적인 rpg에서는 보기힘든 굉장히 개성있는 스킬을 가지고 있어서 매플레이 새로운맛을 느낄수잇음.

디아블로에서 포션꿍쳐놓고 미친듯이 마셔가며 하는 플레이를 해소하기위한 inscription/rune 시스템은
쓸데없는 귀찮음을 해소함과 동시에 전략성과 긴장감을 동시에 잡았다.

또한 요즘 은근히 이런거많지만 싱글게임이면서 현재 플레이하고있는 다른사람과 채팅하고 아이템자랑하며 노는것도 쏠쏠한재미
게다가 서버에 굉장히 많은 통계를 저장해주어서 다른플레이어에게 자랑 및 자기기록보면서 흐뭇해하기 딱좋다. 
제작자인 DarkGod이 가끔 특수던전을 열어주기도함.

허나 반복적인 플레이를 요구하는 로그라이크치고 (죽지않는다는 하에) 한플레이가 너무 길고 쓸데없이 몹이 너무많은거는 호불호가 갈릴듯.
그리고 마지막으로 서버가 늘 좀 불안한데 DarkGod이 이걸로 돈많이벌어서 서버좀 좋은데로 옮겼으면 좋겟음.

쓸데없는 얼리억세스 게임사서 울지마시고 5년넘게 업데이트되서 컨텐츠 풍부한 Tome4를 해보시라.

스팀시스템때문에 플레이시간 얼마안되면서 이렇게 평가하는거처럼 보이겟지만 2년전부터 공식홈페이지에 donate해서 100시간넘게 플레이하고쓴글임

author: {'steamid': '76561197989871037', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 22333, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 19686, 'last_played': 1700309878}
review:
If you like roguelikes - rogue, nethack, slash'em, stone soup, or even things that are similar-to-but-not-quite-roguelike - such as dark souls, rogue legacy, DiD playthroughs of games like skyrim, etc.. then this is almost a must have.  

Fantasy, turn based, w/the key roguelike elements of permadeath (no re-loading to your last save if you die, have to re-roll a new character and start over from scratch instead) and great difficulty (but not insurmountable).  Through your many deaths, however (and there will be many) - you will learn how to survive to the deeper reaches of the game.  

Great unique classes too.  Many of which are unlike any I have seen in any other game.  If u just enjoy speccing out characters in rpg's and mmo's then this game will scratch that itch too.  Though many of the classes need to be unlocked through achieving things in game in order to play them.

The game has a free version too, so you can try before you buy.  Buying makes you like a 'donator' and you get extra features like a class and a game-mode that free players can't get.  But you can play for free and still unlock the majority of things.  

I'm buying even though I already have the game and have been playing it for years, just because Darkgod and contributors have put so much good work into the game that if anyone deserves some of my game $, they do.  So if you're not sure about the game, give the free version a try, then come back and buy it if ya like it.

Purely single player, but has an in game text chat feature so ya can talk to others who are also playing at the moment (if you wish).  Lots of helpful people in the chat, and can link things into the chat from your current game.  

Has a couple expansions, and in spite of how long its been around it is still being developed and added to even today.  Edit - Still true in 2020.

If you're not a patient person, or don't like difficult games, or you need your rpg's to be 3d or real time, then ya might wanna pass.  But otherwise, worth checking out.  One of my favourite games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198073371258', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 69, 'playtime_forever': 717, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 717, 'last_played': 1686749601}
review: One of those games I tried very hard to like. Gave it many chances over the years but always left with the same impression: way too grindy, at least early on, and too few interesting decisions per minute. Once I understand/remember the basic systems, death comes not as a result of an interesting emergent situation that I didn't account for (which is a great basis for learning) but because I started playing so zoned out that I stopped paying attention to the game state, which eventually got me. Learning to maintain focus in a tedious situation, especially when a mistake can be costly, is definitely an important life skill. I just wouldn't prefer to learn/improve it with the help of a game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993465658', 'num_games_owned': 772, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 16637, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 65, 'last_played': 1685998168}
review:
До выхода в стиме наиграл в этот рогалик больше сотни часов и могу сказать что это отличный рогалик/рпг, от собратьевт по жанру таких как ADOM, Dungeon Crawl Stone Soup, dungeon of dredmor отличает хороший сюжет а главное ОГРОМНОЕ количество открываемого контента.
 В самом начале игры открыты вполне обычные класы типа воин, маг, алхимик, рога, но по мере прохождения можно открыть например мастера рукопашного боя дерущегося захватами в ближнем бою или мага парадоксов который может упровлять временем и пространством и это не просто заклинания по типу кинул замедление, а например можно призвать себя из будущего себе на помощь и если вы победите то когданибудь в дальнейшем вас внезапно может телепортировать к себе прошлому на помощь!! И конечно же в игре у каждого класа есть свой набор уникальных навыков.
Вся эта тона контента позволяет играть и играть в этот рогалик пока не откроешь весь контент.

author: {'steamid': '76561197968303736', 'num_games_owned': 593, 'num_reviews': 128, 'playtime_forever': 27858, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 400, 'last_played': 1650973569}
review:
넷핵사랑넷에 열풍을 몰고 왔던 토메. 오랜기간 그린라이트에서 잠자다 이제서야 출시.
로그라이크 게임으로 던전크롤 같은 게임처럼 심오한 전략적 선택을 요구함. 게임 처음엔 단순한 게임 같이 느껴지지만 파면 팔수록 팔게 많은 게임.

author: {'steamid': '76561197984009151', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 4941, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 279, 'last_played': 1677448367}
review:
I bought tales of Maj'Eyal way WAY back when it was still in beta, long before Greenlight was around. It was worth my $10 then, and it was absolutely worth another $6 now. There's tons of depth, lots of great classes, a great campaign - I've sunk probably hundreds of hours on it already, most of it outside of Steam.

Despite this amount of playtime, I still haven't even come *close* to experiencing everything the game has to offer. It's unreal that this is a solo effort, and darkgod manages to get me excited for the game over and over again as more time passes and he adds more and more content to the thing. It's well worth your time, money, and support.

author: {'steamid': '76561197980969381', 'num_games_owned': 636, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 678, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 163, 'last_played': 1680757592}
review: It's about time that Steam had an authentic roguelike on here. It's a bit more advanced compared to your standard fare of traditional roguelikes but it's a must play none the less. Try out the free version to make sure, this version includes an extra game mode which is not even necessary for the real roguelike effect but it's worth donating to the dev either way. Play this game!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198000206086', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 827, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 55, 'last_played': 1490246410}
review: Amazing rogue like game. There are tons of classes and race options that make for countless adventures in Maj'Eyal. The customazation and decision making allow for highly customized characters. I'm so glad to see this game make it to steam, and can't wait to see what they do in the future with planned expansion campaigns and areas. If you like rogue like games at all, this one is a treasure.

author: {'steamid': '76561198028939105', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 9179, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 74, 'last_played': 1687135852}
review:
A traditional roguelike for the modern age. Amazing design, great class customization, extensive opportunities for theory-craft, huge replayability.

I've been transfixed by this game for a long, long time. I can't recommend it enough!
